item.description: SUMMARYTalented artists bring Green Lantern constructs to life, making them even more impressive than they already are. Green Lanterns can use their Power Rings to create anything they imagine, from vehicles to entire cities. Artwork by skilled artists effectively conveys the emotions behind the constructs, whether it’s grief, determination, or creativity. Literature ReviewDiscover 10 amazing constructs from Green Lantern history and the amazing DC Comics artists who helped visualize the Corps’ best ideas.

item.title: 10 Gruesome Deadpool Injuries Readers Cant Unsee
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeadpool’s healing factor is unparalleled, allowing him to recover from gruesome injuries like decapitation and dismemberment. Deadpool suffers from the injuries themselves before his healing process kicks in, exposing readers to every vivid detail of his violence-induced wounds. From being cut in half by Captain America’s shield to having his head crushed by an anvil, Deadpool has endured some truly horrific injuries throughout the Marvel Universe. Literature ReviewDeadpool has one of the most impressive healing factors in comic book fiction, which means his injuries can be the most gruesome.

item.title: 10 Hilarious Far Side Comics That Make Fun of Artists
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThese Far Side comics hilariously highlight the strip’s irreverent treatment of art and artists, showing their flaws and shortcomings. Far Side creator Gary Larson playfully mock the concept of artistic value and subjective interpretation, suggesting that art should not be taken too seriously. Several of these Far Side comics creatively reimagine historical art and famous artists, providing whimsical and exaggerated origin stories for their works. Literature ReviewSome say that art can be divided into highbrow and lowbrow, but in the Far Side, it’s all just a joke.

item.title: 10 Hilarious Far Side Comics Where Astronauts Make a Disturbing Discovery
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAstronauts in Gary Larson’s Far Side comics often make surprising and disturbing discoveries in space, showcasing Larson’s imaginative and comedic storytelling. The comic strips demonstrate Larson’s love for visual gags and his ability to use small details to enhance comedic delivery. Despite how funny they are, some of Larson’s comics use genuinely smart sci-fi concepts that went on to appear in serious works. Literature ReviewIn these hilarious Far Side comics, Gary Larson uses some genuinely smart sci-fi ideas to confront astronauts with disturbing cosmic truths.

item.title: 10 Huge DC Mysteries That Need to Be Solved in 2024
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFirestorm’s alter ego is aging due to an unknown phenomenon. The Firestorm Matrix is stealing time from secondary users. #DCmysteries The true secret behind the existence of three Jokers remains unknown, as hinted by Riddler. What’s the full story? #Batman #TheJoker Perry White, Lois and Clark’s boss, covered up the truth about Lex Luthor’s heroic past. Superman should uncover why. #journalism #DCsecrets Literature ReviewIt’s a new year and the perfect opportunity to finally resolve several lingering mysteries in the DC Universe that fans need a resolution for.

item.title: 10 Iceman Moments That Prove Hes the Coolest Original X-Men Member
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOne of Bobby Drake’s coolest moments as the original X-Men member was when he saved a crowd of people from a deadly Sentinel. Iceman’s turn to villainy in the Age of Apocalypse was incredibly cool to see, as was his ultimate downfall. Bobby Drake’s most inspirational moment was when he came out as gay, overcoming his fears and accepting himself. Literature ReviewIceman’s one of the original five members of the X-Men, but not only that, he’s also the coolest original member of the X-Men - here’s 10 reasons why!

item.title: 10 Indigenous Marvel Characters Perfect To Join The MCU After Echo
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYEcho marks a change in Indigenous representation in Marvel, with Native American folklore and history incorporated into the show. Marvel can subvert inaccurate representations of Indigenous characters by utilizing their comic book mythology with sensitivity and nuance. Characters like Danielle Moonstar, Warpath, and Wyatt Wingfoot have the potential for future appearances in Marvel projects. Literature ReviewEcho has opened the doors for Indigenous representation in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Here are more iconic characters for future MCU projects.

item.title: 10 Invincible Villains Fans Wish Could Have Died Twice
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDavid Hiles: A teacher turned villain who kidnapped and killed innocent high school students with explosives. Battle Beast: Fierce warrior who only lived for battle, but fans weren’t sad to see him meet his end. The Sequids: Parasitic hive-mind that tried to destroy the universe by taking control of Earth. Literature ReviewThere are plenty of antagonists in Invincible, but only 10 are so particularly vile that fans wish the worst possible fates would come to them.

item.title: 10 Justice League Kids in Continuity Who Could Lead DC s Next Generation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne has undergone remarkable character growth, making him the top choice to lead DC’s next Justice League. Trinity, Wonder Woman’s daughter, possesses the essential qualities for an outstanding leader and could surpass Damian if solidified within continuity. Despite his leadership potential, Jon Kent often defers to Damian Wayne, showing his character as a follower rather than a leader. Literature ReviewThe Justice League has been busy saving the world and making babies!

item.title: 10 Longest Manga Hiatuses That Left Fans on the Edge of Their Seats
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVagabond has been on hiatus for almost 9 years, testing the devotion of fans who eagerly await its continuation. Dogs: Bullets & Carnage has left fans hanging since 2015, with a major cliffhanger that needs closure. X by Clamp has been on hiatus for over 21 years, leaving fans wondering how the story will conclude. Literature ReviewLong hiatuses are an unfortunate part of the grueling manga industry, but these 10 series tested their readers’ patience like no others.

item.title: 10 Manga With The Best Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYManga relies heavily on visually appealing artwork to capture readers’ attention and appreciation. The top-ranked manga series are known for their stunning and captivating artwork. Each manga mentioned in the article showcases unique and impressive art styles that enhance the storytelling experience. Literature ReviewThese ten manga stand out for their dazzling and gorgeous art. From breathtaking landscapes to intricately designed characters, manga is a canvas where talented artists bring their visions to life.

item.title: 10 Marvel Heroes the Predator Should Fight Next (After Taking On Wolverine)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Predator is familiar with fighting Wolverine from the limited series Predator vs Wolverine, but there are plenty other Marvel heroes for the Predator to fight. Iron Man would challenge a Predator’s tech, Captain America would challenge its tactics, and Black Panther would be almost a perfectly even match. Out of every hero, Deadpool would be the most valuable. Not because he’d put up the best fight, but because Predators could hunt him again and again due to his healing factor.

item.title: 10 Marvel Villains Introduced in 2023 That Could Be Major Threats In the Future
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel has introduced some incredibly powerful and intriguing villains this year, setting the stage for epic conflicts in the future. Villains like Mother of Horrors, Cubisk Core, and General Strange pose major threats to the Marvel Universe and its heroes. The expansion of Marvel’s cosmic landscape gives these villains the opportunity to become even more significant antagonists, operating at unimaginable levels, going forward. Literature ReviewThis year introduced a host of dangerous new villains to the Marvel Universe; here’s a look at who could be the biggest threats of the next year.

item.title: 10 Marvel Villains the Predator Would Absolutely Hunt
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel villains with high levels of insanity, such as the Green Goblin, would attract the attention of Predators due to their unpredictable behavior and potential for mayhem. Predators would be drawn to hunting villains like Sabretooth, who possess similar attributes to Wolverine, such as animalistic tendencies and a healing factor. Above all else, Predators would want to hunt the seemingly unkillable villains like Juggernaut and Thanos, even if they would likely lose.

item.title: 10 Most Brutal 1 vs 1 Fights in Avengers History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAvengers face god-tier villains in intense one-on-one battles, like Captain America defeating the villainous Kleiser. Captain Marvel and Thor engage in a bloody and rage-filled battle across the entire planet. Iron Man and Captain America’s iconic conflict in Civil War leads to a brutal and destructive confrontation between the two heroes - and that’s just a few of the many brutal one-v-one battles in Avengers lore. Literature ReviewThe Avengers aren’t known as Earth’s Mightiest Heroes for no reason, & their reputation extends to those around them.

item.title: 10 Most Brutal 1 vs 1 Fights in Justice League History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperheroes don’t make names for themselves by fighting off faceless goons all the time. Rather, their most iconic moments come from memorable one-on-one fights, both against major villains, and at times, other heroes. The Justice League’s members prove time and time again why they are the premiere superheroes in the DC Universe by displaying their power in epic fight scenes. With DC’s endless Multiverse, there are always opportunities for Justice League teammates to find themselves in brutal physical confrontations with one another, as several entries on this list depict.

item.title: 10 Most Brutal 1 vs 1 Fights in X-Men History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe X-Men fight against super-villains in brutal combat, with intense one-on-one fights being arguably the most intense. Wolverine’s fights with Deadpool and Sabretooth are particularly gruesome and filled with relentless violence. Magneto’s fights, including his brutal killing of Tarn and ripping Apocalypse in half, showcase his ruthless power. Literature ReviewThere is no shortage of epic fights in X-Men, and a great many of them are one-v-one. Here are the 10 best single combat battles in X-Men history!

item.title: 10 Most Brutal Acts From Mark Millars Evil Anti-Batman Nemesis (So Far)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNemesis escapes prison by brutally killing seven prison guards, leaving a trail of death and chaos in his wake. Seeking revenge, Nemesis buries his archnemesis alive with his own parents’ corpses, ensuring a slow and terrifying death. Nemesis kidnaps the President of the United States, causing havoc and destruction in Washington, ultimately crashing Air Force One into a petrol truck, engulfing the city in flames. Literature ReviewWhat if Batman were a complete monster?

item.title: 10 Most Brutal Large-Scale Battles in Justice League History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJustice League has engaged in massive battles with powerful individuals like Prometheus and the Joker, facing near-defeat but managing to overcome the odds. Their wars have extended beyond individual villains, with conflicts against forces like Starro the Conqueror and Darkseid, showcasing the League’s commitment to protecting the Earth. They’ve also faced apocalyptic scenarios, combating undead armies and vampire threats, demonstrating the League’s resilience and determination in the face of overwhelming odds.

item.title: 10 Most Creative Ideas Fantastic Four Introduced to Marvel Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Fantastic Four introduced iconic characters like The Skrulls, Adam Warlock, and The Inhumans, who have become major players in the Marvel Universe. The Negative Zone and Galactus, two significant elements of the Marvel mythos, were first introduced in Fantastic Four comics, showcasing the team’s ability to create epic storylines. The Fantastic Four pioneered the concept of a shared universe, where events in one character’s comic could impact others, setting the stage for interconnected storytelling in the Marvel Universe.

item.title: 10 Most Dangerous Creations From Wolverine s WEAPON PLUS Program
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCaptain America’s existence helped create the villainous Weapon Plus Program, and his ‘Weapon I’ codename serves as a reminder. Luke Cage’s invincibility is a result of Weapon Plus experimentation, making him a potential threat if his good nature were to change. Typhoid Mary’s deadliness is owed to Project Psych, which twisted her into a vicious villain who can cause extensive carnage with her powers - and that’s only a few of the many living weapons created by Weapon Plus!

item.title: 10 Most Devastating Green Lantern Corps Failures in DC History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Guardians’ creation of the Manhunters resulted in the slaughter of an entire sector, proving emotionally detached policing was a mistake. John Stewart’s controversial decision to kill fellow Green Lantern Mogo caused widespread criticism among his peers. Kyle Rayner’s decision to hide the death of his son from his love interest Soranik Natu permanently ended their relationship and broke her trust. Literature ReviewThe Green Lantern Corps is an organization with a lot of mistakes in its history.

item.title: 10 Most Effective Defensive Powers in Justice League History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAquaman’s ability to attack people’s minds makes him a formidable threat, even to advanced beings. Plastic Man’s stretchy physiology makes him virtually indestructible and able to protect others. Animal Man has access to the powers of any creature, giving him near-limitless defensive abilities. Literature ReviewWhen it comes to the Justice League’s members keeping themselves or others safe, these 10 special abilities are the best in the team’s history. The Justice League is one of the best superhero teams ever created and not just because of their ability to play offense.

item.title: 10 Most Heartbreaking Invincible Deaths (That Were Never Reversed)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRus Livingston was a victim, not a villain, and paid the ultimate price when Invincible ended his life to stop the spread of the Sequids. Angstrom Levy could have found redemption, but his life was tragically ended when he was decapitated by Robot during a sudden betrayal. The Guardians of the Globe, the world’s greatest defenses, were brutally slaughtered by Omni-Man, leaving only the Immortal as the sole survivor of the shocking and violent betrayal.

item.title: 10 Most Important Darkseid Moments That Defined DC History & Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarkseid’s debut in Superman’s Pal Jimmy Olsen #134 establishes him as an intimidating presence and top-tier villain. The introduction of the Anti-Life Equation in Forever People #5 drives Darkseid’s motivations and desires throughout his existence. Darkseid’s tragic love story with Suli shapes his cold heart and fuels his anger, hate, and bitterness. Literature ReviewOne of the DC Universe’s most powerful villains, Darkseid has played a role in several major stories.

item.title: 10 Most Powerful Gen 9 Pokémon In Scarlet & Violet (According To Lore)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGen 9 creatures in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet possess immense power, capable of wiping out entire portions of the land. Individual Pokemon entries reveal fascinating details, such as Baxcalibur’s breath instantly freezing lava and Chien-Pao’s ability to control avalanches. Legendary Pokemon like Terapagos and Miraidon showcase extraordinary abilities, including controlling the Terastal Phenomenon and turning land to ash with lightning powers. Literature ReviewSome of the most powerful Pokémon from Generation 9’s Scarlet and Violet games have their lore strength translated into gameplay value.

item.title: 10 Most Powerful Time Travelers in Marvel Continuity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel Comics characters embrace time travel, with iconic figures like Cable, Kitty Pryde, and Doctor Doom showcasing their time-traveling abilities. Characters like Cosmic Ghost Rider and Ravonna Renslayer possess powerful time-traveling devices and abilities, granting them control over elements, energy, and the ability to weave through time and space. Reed Richards, also known as Mr. Fantastic, and Kang the Conqueror are highly knowledgeable in time travel, using advanced technology and their intellect to manipulate the timeline and conquer the universe.

item.title: 10 Most Powerful Version of Doomsday in Superman Canon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDoomsday is the one of the few characters in the DC Universe, who can instill fear in Superman and has pushed him to the brink, including killing the Man of Steel in the famous “Death of Superman” storyline, which introduced the villain. Different versions of Doomsday have appeared over the years, each one more dangerous than the last. Some surprising versions of Doomsday, like Jimmy Olsen and Alfred Pennyworth, have proven to be even stronger and more capable than the original.

item.title: 10 Most R-Rated Invincible Injuries That Characters Somehow Survived
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYInvincible’s arm is nearly destroyed when he punches Allen, but with 11 surgeries, it is fixed and healed properly. Bulletproof is heavily scarred and in serious pain after surviving an explosion, but chooses not to fix his appearance. Invincible is ripped in half and Eve’s face is punched in, but they are restored to full health thanks to Eve’s powers. Literature ReviewThere’s plenty of violence to be found in Invincible, but only a few jaw-dropping injuries stand out as the most horrifying in the entire series.

item.title: 10 Most Surprising Batcaves in Batman History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s first Batcave was a simple garage for vehicles, not the high-tech hideout it is now. Batman has Batcaves all over the world to support him and his team during his global adventures. Batman has a secret second Batcave hidden within his main Batcave, where he keeps dangerous secrets and has even held the Joker. Literature ReviewOne of the most iconic locations in the DC Universe is the Batcave, and Batman has had so many different versions of it over the years.

item.title: 10 Most Surreal Calvin and Hobbes Comics About Dinosaurs
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCalvin’s whimsical imagination brings dinosaurs to life in detention, showcasing Watterson’s surreal storytelling brilliance. Watterson’s art speaks volumes in a dialogue-free comic, capturing the humor and charm of Calvin’s dinosaur daydreams. Calvin’s mischievous antics and his mother’s patient parenting collide in a humorous comic where a candy-eating dinosaur becomes part of the daily routine. Literature ReviewPrepare for a trip to the wild world of Calvin and Hobbes, where dinosaurs take center stage in ten of the most fantastically surreal comic strips.

item.title: 10 New York Based Marvel Heroes Who Should Run Against Luke Cage For Mayor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Cage’s tenure as mayor or New York City, following Kingpin Wilson Fisk’s time in office, has been controversial, with the hero not living up to his potential as the city’s leader. With another election coming up, this could prompt one or more of the city’s other heroes to enter the race. New York is in many ways the epicenter of hero activity in the Marvel Universe – but Fisk’s laws making superhero activity illegal have majorly impacted the city’s vigilante population.

item.title: 10 Nightwing Quotes That Prove He s Already Earned His Own Movie
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNightwing’s way with words sets him apart as a hero and connects with readers, making him a natural fit for DC’s next cinematic venture. Dick Grayson’s rhetorical skills have saved his life many times, as well as frequently highlighting what makes him a distinct, unique hero, apart from his original mentor and adopted father, Batman. Over time, Nightwing has come to acknowledge his similarities to Batman, actualizing own potential to be a formidable and respected hero.

item.title: 10 of Jim Lees Most Exceptional DC Comics Covers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJim Lee’s cover artwork for New 52’s Justice League #1 ushered in a new era for DC Comics, capturing the essence of the classic Justice League while giving it a more modernized style. All Star Batman and Robin, The Boy Wonder #9, part of DC’s ‘All Star’ initiative, showcases Batman and Robin together in a brilliant and contrasting manner, drenched in shadow and facing an unseen opponent. Jim Lee depicts the true power and terrifying presence of Darkseid in Justice League Vol.

item.title: 10 of the Most Badass One Sith From Star Wars Legacy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe One Sith is a new Sith regime that rejects the Rule of Two and allows for the introduction of multiple Sith at once. Darth Krayt founded the One Sith and is both powerful and ruthless, making him a truly badass Sith Lord. Darth Talon, Darth Nihil, Darth Stryfe, and other members of the One Sith demonstrate their badass nature through their power, loyalty, and violent escapades. Literature ReviewThe One Sith rejected the Sith Rule of Two in the Star Wars: Legacy era, meaning there were a lot featured Sith Lords.

item.title: 10 Outrageous Far Side Comics Featuring Anthropomorphized Animals
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Far Side stands out from other comics by featuring anthropomorphized animals in unexpected and ridiculous situations. The comic strips use familiar animals in mundane settings to add humor and showcase Gary Larson’s outrageous style. The strips cleverly twist everyday scenarios, like a slug running through a house with salt or a porcupine receiving a balloon as a gift, to make them truly ridiculous. Literature ReviewFrom dogs on a date to porcupines opening presents on Christmas, these Far Side comics anthropomorphize animals in the most hilarious ways possible.

item.title: 10 Outrageous Quotes From Cable & Deadpool
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeadpool’s gloriously random quote about not going to France during a fictional war perfectly captures his outrageous personality. Deadpool’s reference to Normandy and Bridgette Nielsen while attacking German guards is the epitome of outrageousness. Cable’s meta quote about taking the easy way out with a ridiculously large gun showcases the hilarious contrast to his characterization in Cable & Deadpool and that’s just some of the many outrageous quotes in this series!

item.title: 10 Pieces of Art That Show How Disturbing New Ultimate X-Men Franchise Will Be
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPeach Momoko’s art style combines cuteness and gore, using elegant watercolor brushstrokes. Her artwork for Ultimate X-Men is disturbing yet captivating, showcasing visceral and gory imagery. She has a knack for merging Japanese folklore with Marvel characters, creating unforgettable and grotesque scenes. Literature ReviewPeach Momoko has become an A-list artist, and her most disturbing images show why her Ultimate X-Men will be like nothing else we’ve seen before. Writer/artist Peach Momoko is a full-fledged star at Marvel Comics and her incredible work will be on full display in the new Ultimate X-Men series.

item.title: 10 Pieces of Darwyn Cooke Art That Prove He Was Born to Draw the Justice League
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarwyn Cooke’s art captured the spirit and bond of the Teen Titans in a variant cover for Teen Titans #5, showcasing their energy and teamwork. Cooke’s playful sense of humor shines through in his cover for Ambush Bug: Year None #7, where the hero leaves Batman slipping on a banana peel. Cooke’s artwork in DC: The New Frontier #1 beautifully depicts the dynamic battle between Batman and Superman, showing off the amazing energy and intensity of their timeless conflict.

item.title: 10 Punisher Quotes That Proved Marvel s Hero is Completely Unhinged
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Punisher’s bloodthirsty nature is evident in his chilling quotes and battle cries, like when he screamed, “Spider-Man deserves to die!” The Punisher’s duality is revealed when he admits to finding release and pleasure in killing, despite claiming to be apathetic. The Punisher’s unhinged and violent nature is demonstrated when he immediately jumps to violence, even towards someone who saves his life, like Batman. Literature ReviewPunisher is one of the most unhinged characters in Marvel Comics - obvious by his actions, but also by his words.

item.title: 10 Robin Fates That Are Just as Tragic as Jason Todd s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNightwing’s identity was revealed and he was forced to abandon his costumed life. Batman rejected his first partner and warped her mind, leading her to become an evil villain. Nightwing became a vampire and turned on his friends, even punching Batman through the chest. Literature ReviewJason Todd might be the Robin who had the worst fate possible, but he’s not the only one of Batman’s partners who met an extremely tragic fate.

item.title: 10 Savage Dragon Stories That Prove He s Image Comics Most Underrated Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSavage Dragon is an underrated series with wide recognition and a lasting impact on the comic book community. The series features a cohesive storyline that spans decades and includes exciting story arcs and cameos from other iconic characters. Savage Dragon has had memorable crossovers with Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles , Spawn , The Maxx , and even Superman , proving its status as an A-list series. Literature ReviewSavage Dragon has been one of Image Comics’ coolest titles since the ’90s, despite being shamefully underrated.

item.title: 10 Scariest Jojo s Bizarre Adventure Stands That Are an Absolute Nightmare in Battle
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPurple Haze is known to be one of the most dangerous Stands in the series, producing a virus so deadly that even its user refrains from using it. Wonder of U is a terrifying, sentient Stand that can manipulate Calamity, which is a negative force of energy related to fate. C-Moon evolves into Made in Heaven, which has the horrifying ability to accelerate time by manipulating gravity; it’s the main force that causes the main universe to be rebooted multiple times.

item.title: 10 Scariest Versions of Spider-Man in Marvel Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTraditionally known as Marvel’s “Friendly Neighborhood Spider-Man,” over the years the Multiverse has allowed for versions of Spider-Man that are not just less-than-friendly, but are in fact terrifying. From Ghost-Spider, to Man-Spider, to Spiders-Man, there are some truly wild version of the Webslinger scattered throughout Marvel’s Multiverse. While even some of the scarier Spider-Men remain heroic, some have become villains, turning away from the values instilled in Earth-616 Peter Parker early in his superhero career.

item.title: 10 Shocking Moments From the Original Ultimate Marvel Universe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Ultimate Universe pushed the boundaries of what happened to iconic Marvel Comics characters in every conceivable way. From a cannibalistic Hulk and Blob to a predatory Wolverine and incestuous Scarlet Witch and Quicksilver, the Ultimate Universe had no shortage of shocking moments. Among the most shocking, however, were the more gruesome moments, like Hulk ripping Wolverine in half, the Thing crushing Doctor Doom’s skull, and Spider-Man dying. Literature ReviewMarvel Comics Ultimate Universe pushed the boundaries of what fans could handle, from horrific gore to character changes.

item.title: 10 Smartest DC Comics Characters Right Now
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGotham remains the home of some of DC’s most intelligent players, including Batman, Tim Drake’s Robin, and the increasingly deadly Penguin. Other heroes like Steel and Mister Terrific continue to shape the DC Universe. The most prominent genius villains are Amanda Waller, Brainiac, and Failsafe - major threats who are rising to power over 2024 as DC’s new ‘Trinity of Evil.’ Literature ReviewThe DC Universe has a huge roster of genius heroes and villains, but which of them are actually the smartest RIGHT NOW?

item.title: 10 Spider-Man Quotes That Prove He s Hiding a MAJOR Dark Side
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY“I want to hear you SCREAM!!!” - Spider-Man’s dark side emerges when wearing the black symbiote suit, manifesting in extreme rage and a desire for violence. “The men with the guns aren’t the predators. I am.” - Spider-Man takes a menacing turn in the ‘Back in Black’ storyline, taunting and terrifying a criminal before showing his true predator nature. “Now you know what it feels like. To be wounded, hunted… slaughtered.

item.title: 10 Strongest Digimon So Powerful They Broke The Anime Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSome of Digimon’s strongest creatures, like Piedmon and Alphamon, possess awe-inspiring powers that can warp reality. Digimon franchise has introduced over 1,000 types of digital monsters, but ten stand out for their unrivaled raw power. From Piedmon’s unpredictable tactics to Omnimon’s unbeatable fusion, these Digimon are virtually unstoppable in battle. Literature ReviewWith each new story, the Digimon universe adds more powerful digital monsters to help or hinder the DigiDestined, but who are the most powerful?

item.title: 10 Superman Weaknesses That Aren t Kryptonite
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman is often considered to have only one vulnerability, Kryptonite, but over the years, DC has revealed the Man of Steel to have several exploitable weaknesses. Clark Kent draws his superpowers from the energy of the yellow sun, meaning depriving him of sunlight will diminish his strength and abilities, making him more susceptible to attack; of all his various abilities, Clark’s super-hearing is the most easily overwhelmed by savvy opponents; most notably, Superman has shown a perennial weakness to the forces of magic in the DC Universe.

item.title: 10 Thanos Quotes That Prove He ll Always Be Marvel s Greatest Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThanos’s philosophical rhetoric is as poetic as it is devastating, with the character’s impressive way with words often leaving a lasting impression on readers. Thanos’s words have the power to leave everyone, including Marvel’s greatest cosmic entities, in awe of his oratory skills. Thanos’s iconic quotes showcase his cold core and his ability to instill fear and awe in his enemies, solidifying his status as Marvel’s greatest villain. Literature ReviewThanos knows how to give speeches and memorable quotes just as well as he knows how to wipe out universes.

item.title: 10 Things Only Invincible Comic Fans Know About Damien Darkblood
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamien Darkblood has a power called “heat resistance” that matches his ‘demonic’ nickname. Unlike the TV version, comic Damien Darkblood is a terrible detective and is laughed at for his failed investigation. Darkblood’s outfit and speech pattern are inspired by Watchmen’s Rorschach, and his appearance is influenced by Hellboy. Literature ReviewInvincible’s Damien Darkblood has quickly become a fan-favorite character from the Amazon series, but only comics fans know his full story.

item.title: 10 Times Batman Broke His One Rule For Joker
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman has come close to killing or allowing the Joker to die multiple times, going against his no-kill rule. Batman has abandoned the Joker to dangerous situations, potentially leading to his death. Killing the Joker can have serious consequences, such as Batman himself becoming infected with Joker Venom. Literature ReviewBatman has always adhered to a no-killing rule, even for villains like the Joker. But several times in DC Comics stories, he has broken that one rule.

item.title: 10 Times Franklin Thought the Other Peanuts Kids Were Out of Their Minds
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFranklin brings a grounded quality and level-headedness to the strip, offering a contrast to the more outlandish Peanuts characters. Franklin often finds himself bewildered by the bizarre antics of the other Peanuts kids, showcasing his logical and practical nature. Franklin’s introduction in 1968 fixed a glaring mistake in the strip, and he has since become an iconic member of the Peanuts gang. Literature ReviewFranklin’s rational thinking and level-headedness (as well as his patience) were put to the test in these hilarious Peanuts comic strips.

item.title: 10 Truly Epic Brian Azzarello Hellblazer Moments
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn turns the tables on animal-torturing children, showing his unyielding righteousness and dark sense of justice. John’s shower scene in prison reveals his cunning and ability to strike fear into the hearts of his fellow inmates. John’s hitchhiking adventure leads to a twist, saving a kidnapped woman and showing that he can be a reluctant hero. Literature ReviewBrian Azzarello’s run on Hellblazer broke new ground for John Constantine, and here are the top 10 best moments from it.

item.title: 10 Ultimate Spider-Man Moments That Helped Marvel Websling Into the New Millennium
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man’s origin in the Ultimate Universe was tied to two major villains - Norman Osborn (Green Goblin) and Otto Octavius (Doc Ock). Ultimate Spider-Man featured cover art that tried to be “new” and “cutting-edge” but ended up looking weird. The early 2000s lingo used in Ultimate Spider-Man, like “wigged out” and “busted,” helped modernize the story but doesn’t hold up well today - and those were just some of the ways the Ultimate Universe brought Spider-Man into the new millennium.

item.title: 10 Unforgettable Covers From Image Comics Pioneering YOUNGBLOOD Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYoungblood #1: The very first comic published by Image Comics in 1992, this issue’s cover art is classic Liefeld and surges with explosive hardcore aesthetic. Youngblood #2: Lightning strikes twice with this cover, as it not only grabs fans’ attention, but keeps it with a new face and a tease of what’s to come. Youngblood #5: This issue changes the tone from fun adventure to intense action with its dark and intense artwork, making it memorable and iconic - and these are just the first 3 of the 10 most memorable covers!

item.title: 10 Unforgettable Garth Ennis Hellblazer Moments
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGarth Ennis’s run on Hellblaze r masterfully blended John Constantine’s natural life with his supernatural adventures, highlighting his struggles with cancer, failed romances, guilt, and trauma, alongside his battles against the most powerful demons in the DC Universe. Constantine’s battle with cancer was a driving force for Ennis’s run, as John set out to find a cure for his terminal condition. John Constantine proved himself as one of DC’s greatest con men during Ennis’ pivotal run on Hellblazer , orchestrating the fall of the Archangel Gabriel and outsmarting the First of the Fallen multiple times.

item.title: 10 Unforgettable Moments From Garth Ennis Original Punisher Run
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGarth Ennis saved the Punisher from a supernatural fate and gave him a hard reset, bringing back the street-level vigilantism that fans love. The opening kill in Ennis’ run sets the tone for the series, with the Punisher twisting a man’s head around 180 degrees. Ennis wrote the scene that inspired the memorable rooftop chain-gun dilemma in the MCU’s Daredevil series, showcasing his influence and impact on the character - and these are just some of the greatest moments from Punisher Vol.

item.title: 10 Unforgettable Spider-Man Comic Covers From the 1980s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe 1980s saw Spider-Man take control of his life, including proposing to Mary Jane, getting married, and debuting a new suit. The work of artists like John Romita Sr. and Todd MacFarlane introduced twisted and frightening new villains into Spider-Man’s life like Venom and Hobgoblin. The Amazing Spider-Man #252 showcases Spider-Man’s iconic black suit, a result of a symbiotic alien attachment, and sets the stage for future storylines involving the suit.

item.title: 10 Villains Who Know Batman s Secret Identity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s secret identity isn’t as secret as he thinks it is – many of his villains know that he is Bruce Wayne. Some villains, like Hush and Two-Face, have personal connections to Bruce Wayne, making their knowledge of his secret identity even more dangerous. Even Lex Luthor and Joker know Batman’s true identity, but it doesn’t really matter to them, as their focus is on Batman, not Bruce Wayne.

item.title: 10 Ways Apocalypse Changed X-Men Lore Forever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYApocalypse’s influence on the Marvel Universe goes beyond being a mere villain, as he has made lasting impacts on X-Men lore. He created alternate realities and influenced characters like X-Man and Dark Beast, who had lasting impacts on Earth-616. Apocalypse’s actions led to the creation of characters like Mister Sinister, Dracula, Cable, and Archangel, permanently altering the X-Men’s world. Literature ReviewApocalypse is as influential as he is powerful, and his impact can be felt throughout the entirety of X-Men canon.

item.title: 10 Ways Boom! Studios Power Rangers Reinvented Classic TV Characters
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBOOM! Studios has reinvented various Power Rangers characters with their comic ongoing comic book series, adding layers and complexity to their stories. The comics cater to an older audience, allowing for darker, more adult-oriented stories that recontextualize classic characters. The series introduces new teams, such as the Solar Rangers, and explores new dynamics, like Trini becoming the Red Ranger, giving longtime fans of the show many things to be excited about.

item.title: 10 Ways Power Rangers Comics Have Expanded Tommy Oliver s Legacy As the 1990s Team s Greatest Member
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe BOOM! Studios comics validate why Tommy Oliver is seen as the greatest Power Ranger in history, showcasing his abilities and leadership. Tommy holds his own against Scorpina, proving himself as a capable fighter even when he is new to being a Ranger. Tommy’s selflessness and resourcefulness shine through as he shares his powers with his teammates and destroys the Black Dragon from the inside. Literature ReviewTommy Oliver has a reputation as the Power Rangers’ greatest leader and BOOM!

item.title: 10 Weakest Supervillain Origin Stories in Justice League History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSome Justice League villains have absurd or ridiculous origins, like a hyper-intelligent gorilla from space or a janitor who became obsessed with litter. Black Adam died in his first appearance and remained dead for years, despite being a major antagonist to Shazam. Amanda Waller, the biggest villain in the DC Universe, came from mundane beginnings and has a simple background. Literature ReviewThe Justice League is DC’s strongest team and often goes up against their strongest villains, but there are plenty of lame villains they’ve faced too.

item.title: 10 Weakest Supervillain Origin Stories in Spider-Man History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSome of Spider-Man’s villains have some pretty goofy origin stories, such a man who becomes a kangaroo and a regular hippo who was turned into humanoid villain for…reasons. Some villains, like Electro and Boomerang, had pretty uninspiring beginnings before becoming super-criminals and perennial adversaries for Spider-Man. Spider-Man has faced off against some truly bizarre villains, including a living wall and a vampire with a questionable transformation story. Literature ReviewSpider-Man has many iconic villains, in part because he has had so many villains throughout the years, some with weaker origin stories than others.

item.title: 10 Wildest Characters Howard the Duck Introduced to Official Marvel Continuity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHoward the Duck introduced a wide variety of kooky characters, like Heathcliff Rochester, a Regency-era cosplaying real estate agent. SUDD, the Scrubbing Bubble That Walks Like a Man, was a wild character who spread the puritanical SOOFI agenda before Howard stopped him. Howard the Duck faced bizarre foes like the Spanker, a pointed commentary on corporal punishment, and Doctor Bong, the weirdest villain he ever encountered. Literature ReviewHoward the Duck was not short on oddball characters such as Winky-Man and the Kidney Lady, and here are the top 10, ranked.

item.title: 10 Wildest Moments From Star Wars Legacy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Wars: Legacy introduced the gritty tone and cult following the series lacked, with a more intense look at the iconic world of Star Wars. The Imperial Knights challenged the notion of Jedi and Sith, as elite Force-wielders loyal to their Emperor who exclusively use the light side of the Force. The series redefined Force healing, revealing that it can be used to turn minor injuries fatal, and showcased the potential impact of Darth Krayt on the original and prequel trilogies - and these are just some of the wild moments/ideas introduced in Star Wars: Legacy.

item.title: 11 Beast Boy Moments That Perfectly Honor the Titans Fallen Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBeast Boy’s tragic death and transformation into a mindless threat to the DC Universe kickstarts the gamechanging Beast World crossover storyline. Beast Boy has long been one of the Titans most beloved members, both by readers and other members of the team; however, his time as a DC hero has not been without its struggles, which he has always managed to overcome. Beast Boy’s first appearance with the Teen Titans solidified his role as a definitive member of the team, with overwhelming approval from readers for the new character, something that has only grown in the years since.

item.title: 11 Greatest Power Rangers Who Never Appeared on TV
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBOOM! Studios continues to introduce new Power Rangers characters in the comic books with grace and respect for the lore. The new Green Rangers, Olivia Hart and Matthew Cook, bring fresh and modern approaches to the franchise. The comics also expand the Power Rangers universe with the addition of the Psycho Green Ranger, the 1969 Power Rangers, the Omega Rangers, the Solar Rangers, Cyra Drake, Bulk and Skull as Rangers, Lord Zedd’s Dark Rangers, the Death Ranger, and the iconic villain Lord Drakkon.

item.title: 11 Ways The POWER RANGERS Comics Have Redefined Franchise Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBoom! Studios introduced the concept of the multiverse to the Power Rangers franchise, allowing for the biggest Ranger team-up ever in the Shattered Grid event. Boom!’s comics have revealed what the Morphin Grid looks like and introduced the Emissaries Three, bringing a new cosmological element to the Power Rangers universe. The series has explored the backstories of characters like Lord Zedd and Mistress Vile, the former Rita Repulsa. Literature ReviewBOOM!

item.title: 12 Best Justice League Vehicles That Rival the Batmobile
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s Kryptonian rocket saved him during his journey to Earth, making it comparable to the Batmobile in its significance. Barry Allen’s Cosmic Motorcycle can time travel and senses temporal disruptions, rivaling the Batmobile’s abilities. The Justice League’s Javelin Ship, developed by Batman, can carry the entire team and is capable of various types of transportation. Literature ReviewThe Batmobile is a versatile car well-known in DC Comics, with some members of the Justice League having vehicles that match it in more ways than one.

item.title: 12 Best Supervillain Origin Stories in Spider-Man History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man villains have intriguing and complex origin stories that mix tragedy and corruption, making them some of the greatest in comics. Some villains, like Mysterio and Scorpion, started out with personal goals but were driven to villainy due to unfortunate circumstances and revenge. Characters like Venom and Black Cat have had complicated relationships with Spider-Man, sometimes serving as foes and other times as allies or love interests. Literature ReviewFrom Doc Ock to Kraven the Hunter, these iconic Spider-Man adversaries have origin stories that are impossible to not get engrossed in.

item.title: 12 Funniest Far Side Comics That Prove It s Obsessed with Clowns
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Far Side’s clowns blur the line between tragedy and humor, which is what The Far Side is all about. The Far Side’s clowns are depicted as a separate species, mischievous and unpredictable, adding to the dark humor of the comic strip. However, they also slot into movie references like Godzilla and The Wizard of Oz , adding humor because they’re so inherently ridiculous. Literature ReviewThe Far Side’s mix of surreal and morbid humor makes clowns its perfect ‘heroes’ - and Gary Larson proves it in these 10 comic strips.

item.title: 12 Ways Power Rangers Comics Completely Redefined The Original Pink Ranger
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKimberly Ann Hart’s legacy as the greatest Pink Ranger extends beyond the original show, with spin-off material and upcoming comics written by the original actress. The Power Rangers comics have recontextualized Kimberly’s character, adding new layers to her and showcasing her leadership skills. Future Kim, known as the Ranger Slayer, leads the resistance against an evil Tommy Oliver, proving her adept fighting skills and intelligence. She later breaks free from mind control and becomes a hero.

item.title: 15 Avengers Who Could Beat Thor In A Fight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThor can be temporarily weakened by Scarlet Witch’s magic, making him vulnerable without Mjolnir’s power. The Wasp can exploit Thor’s human vulnerabilities by shrinking and attacking him in his inner ear. Captain America, if able to wield Mjolnir, could use it against Thor or rely on his tactical genius to find a weakness. Literature ReviewWhen it comes to kicking ass, few do it better than Thor. But that doesn’t mean he’s unbeatable.

item.title: 15 Best Marvel Comics Series You Can Finish in a Day
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHouse of X/Powers of X reinvents the X-Men with dense storytelling and stunning art, shaping the franchise for years to come. The 2015 Secret Wars event brings the Marvel Universe to an end, allowing for new beginnings and the integration of characters like Miles Morales. Black Panther: Panther’s Rage fleshes out Wakanda and introduces the iconic villain Killmonger, setting the stage for the 2018 film. Literature ReviewWith more than 80 years of classic stories to draw from, here are 15 great Marvel Comics storylines that you can finish in just one day.

item.title: 15 Biggest Jerks to Ever Join the Avengers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYEach of the Avengers was a solo hero first, and many of them aren’t great team players. Spider-Man neglected his responsibilities, while U.S. Agent mistreated his allies. Others have turned on their fellow heroes in big ways - Captain Marvel and Iron Man’s Civil War crimes were truly despicable. Then there are those who simply never belonged on the team, like Hulk and the Irredeemable Ant-Man. Literature ReviewWhile the Avengers may be Earth’s Mightiest Heroes, that doesn’t necessarily make them nice people - here are the 15 biggest jerks to join the team.

item.title: 15 Darkest Garfield Minus Garfield Strips (So Far)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe “Garfield Minus Garfield” webcomic, created by Dan Walsh takes the famous strip, and subtracts its star feline. The result is a nightmare starring Jon Arbuckle, trapped in a desperate search for his imaginary cat to justify his fantasy. In its most famous strips, Jon’s darkest thoughts voiced to nobody reaches depths of darkness rarely found anywhere in fiction. Literature ReviewGarfield Minus Garfield removes the iconic cat from the cartoon, turning Jon Arbuckle’s life into a nightmare.

item.title: 15 Funniest Far Side Comics That Are Also Incredibly Gross
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Far Side often traded in gross humor, pushing the boundaries of what a syndicated newspaper comic strip could get away with. Larson’s comics often deconstruct familiar social ideas, including conceptions of what readers consider gross, and why. Even when they’re at their grossest, or their darkest, Far Side comics tend to stay insightful about the human condition, remaining relevant for contemporary readers in a variety of ways, beyond just their enduring humor.

item.title: 15 Funniest Far Side Comics That Perfectly Capture Gary Larson s Sense of Humor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGary Larson’s The Far Side comics are marked by some characteristic obsessions. Larson often uses cavemen and cows in his work, believing they blur the line between humor and tragedy. Aliens, evil ducks, and sad-sack scientists also appear often. Larson has a command of language and a love of storytelling, however he’s not afraid to go for outright slapstick humor. Literature ReviewThe Far Side’s Gary Larson has a truly unique sense of humor - with each of these 15 comics embodying one of his funniest obsessions.

item.title: 20 Strongest Female Marvel Characters
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel Comics features a diverse range of strong and powerful female characters with a combination of physical, intellectual, and emotional strengths. While the Marvel Cinematic Universe showcases some female superheroes, it is in the comics where the strongest female Marvel characters truly shine. These female characters, such as Black Widow, Jessica Jones, and Spider-Woman, have impressive skill sets, including enhanced abilities, fighting prowess, and unique powers, making them formidable allies and dangerous enemies.

item.title: 2023 Challenged Red Hood More Than Ever Before - Including His Resurrection
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed Hood is finally set to get his own slice of Gotham in the upcoming series “The Hill”, allowing him to fight crime his way and build his own supporting cast. In 2023, Red Hood sought revenge on the Joker, but Batman intervened and tried to strip away his ability to be a hero. “The Hill” represents Jason Todd’s next step as a hero, providing him with a chance to finally find his place in the DC Universe.

item.title: 2023 Changed Predator Lore Forever, Transforming the Original Trilogy s Meaning
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Predators have a horrifying secret - they actually visit Earth to abduct huge groups of people for their hunting reserves, keeping them in stasis for decades. The revelation of the Predators’ mass abductions makes them more clinical and cruel, adding a less honorable element to their society. The twist opens up potential for the franchise’s future, allowing for ancient enemies and characters from different time periods to return and bring new dynamics to the story.

item.title: 2023 Officially Crowned the Titans as the Justice League s Equals
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Titans have stepped up to fill the Justice League’s shoes as DC Comics’ primary superhero team, giving them a chance to shine individually and as a unit. The Titans face increased pressure and scrutiny as they take on global threats and try to live up to their mentors’ expectations. The Titans, who were once sidekicks, have now earned their status as A-List heroes and are the ones responsible for protecting the world in the absence of the Justice League.

item.title: 2023 Officially Made Juggernaut a Hero, as He Beat Thanos & Was Voted onto the X-Men
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn 2023, the Juggernaut was redeemed by being officially voted onto the X-Men and killing Thanos, but his victories came with heavy losses and pain. The Juggernaut’s victory over Thanos showcased his unstoppable power on a cosmic scale, but it also left him trapped. Despite suffering setbacks, the Juggernaut has reunited with the X-Men and is poised for a brighter future in 2024. Literature ReviewThe Juggernaut’s 2023 was chock-full of extreme highs and lows, especially when he killed Thanos and joined the X-Men, both of which had heavy costs.

item.title: 2023 Put Green Lantern Back in the A-List by Upgrading & Updating His Powers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHal Jordan’s new Power Ring has unique abilities, including the capacity to project constructs in any color and emit radiation frequencies similar to Kryptonite. His new ring makes him one of the most distinct Green Lanterns, separating him from the rest of the pack in terms of versatility and making him a threat to heavy hitters like Superman and Wonder Woman. The new abilities showcased in the past year recontextualize Hal Jordan’s place among DC’s other heroes and elevate him back to A-List status.

item.title: 2023 Re-Established the Penguin as One of Batman s Biggest Threats
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC villain the Penguin has proven to be absurdly dangerous despite his physical limitations, as shown in his recent solo series. After faking his death earlier in the year, Penguin left Gotham City and tried to live a normal life, only to be pulled back into the world of crime. Penguin’s actions at the start of 2023 had a significant impact; the villain framed Batman for his death, causing chaos for the Caped Crusader, as well as within the Bat-Family, the fallout of which they’re still dealing with.

item.title: 2023 Redefined the Alien Franchise by Giving Xenomorphs a Worthy Enemy (Without Relying on Predator)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s introduction of the white Xenomorph in its Alien comics from 2023 raised the horror possibilities of the franchise to the next level. The white Xenomorph is a massive, brutal, and deadly incarnation of the extraterrestrial monster, surpassing previous versions with its strength, as well as its lack of critical weaknesses. Marvel’s depiction of the white Xenomorph showcases the company’s ambition to redefine Alien storytelling and sets high expectations for future volumes.

item.title: 2023 Reinvented Nightcrawler with a Permanent New Origin & Powers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn 2023, Nightcrawler underwent major changes, forging a new independent identity in Uncanny Spider-Man and learning the definitive truth about his origin. X-Men Blue: Origins confirmed that Nightcrawler’s father is Mystique, and his mother is her wife Destiny, establishing a unique form of LGBTQIA+ representation. Uncanny Spider-Man explores Nightcrawler’s growth as a hero within the context of his newly revealed lineage, offering a chance for a reset and a fresh start for the character.

item.title: 2023 s Best Batman Fanart Challenged DC to Get More Creative
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman fanart in 2023 showcased a high level of creativity and talent, surpassing DC’s own artwork. Artists like Tom Hoskisson, Mike Becker, and Jaxson Derr brought new and unique designs to Batman, inspiring the comic industry. Batman fanart demonstrated the versatility of the character, proving that he can be reimagined in various styles and alternate universes. Literature ReviewBatman is a hugely popular superhero and 2023 was a banner year for fanart of the character, consisting of pieces that rival even DC’s official art!

item.title: 2023 Unleashed TMNT s Next Generation, as 4 New Turtles Got Names & Weapons
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe next generation of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Yi, Uno, Odyn, and Moja, have been introduced and will take over the roles of their fallen ancestors in the futuristic sequel to The Last Ronin. In the upcoming Last Ronin II - Re-Evolution series, the new Turtles will continue their adventures in a borderline post-apocalyptic world, wielding the same weapons as the original TMNT, including katana, sai, nunchucks, and bo staffs.

item.title: 2023 Upgraded Joker Like Never Before - Across ALL DC Media
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn 2023, DC gave the Joker a multiversal-level upgrade, bringing him back stronger than ever. The Joker’s true origin was revealed as a by-product of a man named Darwin Halliday, who revived every dead Joker and empowered them. The presence of Darwin Halliday in alternate universes causes dead Jokers to return, living Jokers to become more violent, and some Jokers to gain powers, potentially posing a threat to multiple Earths.

item.title: 35 Most Powerful Naruto Characters, Ranked
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNeji Hyūga is a powerful ninja with incredible vision and precise combat skills, making him a formidable opponent. Kimimaro’s unique abilities and hand-to-hand combat skills made him strong, but his illness weakened him in battle. Sasori’s puppetry skills and ability to control puppets, including turning victims into puppets, made him a powerful fighter in the Naruto franchise. Literature ReviewBy using franchise lore and head-to-head battles, we have constructed a definitive ranking to find the strongest Naruto character.

item.title: A Brief History of Marvel Comics Multiverse
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Multiverse has a rich history that dates back roughly fifty years, with the storytelling mechanic allowing for fresh and exciting takes on with different versions of iconic characters. The Marvel Cinematic Universe is expanding to embrace the possibilities of the Multiverse, as seen in recent films and Disney+ shows, integrating classic stories and characters from different dimensions, as well as taking the concept in new directions. The Multiverse concept was formally introduced through the groundbreaking series “What If…?

item.title: A Forgotten Batman Villain Just Returned (& Its Terrible News For the DC Universe)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDr. Simon Hurt, a villain who previously broke Batman’s mind, is back to potentially push him over the edge again. Batman has fled Gotham City, and in preview pages for Detective Comics #1081, encounters Simon Hurt in the desert, while trying to rid himself of an Azmer demon. Simon Hurt, once a cultist seeking immortality, may want to release the Bat-God Barbatos, and will certainly seek to once more manipulate Batman to fulfill his sinister plans.

item.title: A Low-Powered MCU Hero Just Proved They re Immune to Ghost Rider s Powers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlack Widow proves her immunity to Ghost Rider’s Penance Stare, surviving an equivalent attack without any pain or impact. This showcases Black Widow’s growth and forgiveness of her past sins, making her a strong and worthy member of the Avengers. Black Widow’s mental strength is god-tier, as she not only survives but also counters an attack as powerful as the Penance Stare, solidifying her as a formidable Avenger. Literature ReviewGhost Rider is one of the strongest characters in Marvel, but one low-powered MCU Avenger is actually immune to his scariest power: the Penance Stare.

item.title: A Major Change to Shazam s Powers Is Setting Him Up as a Villain - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYInternal schism in Shazam causes Billy Batson to struggle with his heroic alter ego. Upgrade to divine gift may intensify inner conflict. Shazam Family fights to save Billy from becoming gods’ servant. Solomon warns that wisdom boost may worsen divide between Billy and the Captain. Captain may decide to permanently stay in transformed form, leaving Billy powerless. Champion of Shazam’s wisdom could lead to betrayal of mortal self. Literature ReviewShazam gets a boost in one of his six god-given powers, but this latest upgrade could be driving a wedge between Billy Batson and the Captain.

item.title: A Major Disadvantage - Deku Lost One of His Greatest Powers in My Hero Academia s Last Battle
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShigaraki successfully steals the Fourth User’s Danger Sense, making Deku vulnerable and himself harder to hit. Losing one Quirk makes it easier for Shigaraki to steal the entire One for All Quirk, putting Deku’s life and the heroes’ hopes in danger. Despite the loss, Deku improvises a new means of defense, but the battle is far from over. Literature ReviewOne quick touch has radically turned the tables in My Hero Academia’s final battle, costing Deku a powerful ability that’s now in Shigaraki’s hands.

item.title: A Major MCU Character s New Power is Retconning Thor s Backstory
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLoki’s power as the Teller of Tales allows them to rewrite real-world Marvel history, changing the outcome of a classic Thor comic from 1978. Thor seeks answers from Loki about his true mother and his predicted death, but Loki responds by telling a story from 1978 instead of giving a direct answer. Roxxon CEO Dario Agger and Enchantress are using the power of stories to destroy Thor’s legacy, with Loki altering Thor’s backstory and possibly teaching him a lesson for a future battle.

item.title: A New African Fantasy Launches in AKOGUN BRUTALIZER OF GODS (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOni Press is releasing an African dark fantasy series called Akogun: Brutalizer of Gods, inspired by folklore and Yoruba mythology. The series will consist of three bi-monthly issues, starting in April, and each issue will be 40 pages long. Akogun: Brutalizer of Gods will feature variant covers from Dotun Akande, Ramon Villalobos, and Grey Williamson. Literature ReviewAkogun: Brutalizer of Gods from Oni Press brings comic fans an African dark fantasy story by two Nigerian creators, inspired by Yoruba mythology.

item.title: A New Codename Catapults Justice League s Most Underrated Hero into the A-List
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBooster Gold takes on the role of Santa Claus in a festive and hilarious holiday tale in DC’s ‘Twas the Mite Before Christmas #1. The adoption of the Santa Claus codename temporarily elevates Booster Gold to the same recognition as Batman and Superman, adding a whimsical twist to his superhero identity. The success of The Santa Copies story highlights the need for more Booster Gold-centric storylines, allowing DC to explore the character’s full potential and entertain fans with memorable tales.

item.title: A One Piece Character Now Holds More Power Than The Five Elders
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBonney gains the power to command the Pacifista, making her the most wanted individual on Egghead. Vegapunk suggests Bonney can command any unit made with Kuma’s likeness, including S-Bear and the original Kuma. Bonney’s new ability makes her a crucial character going forward and a potential ally for the Straw Hats or even a member of the crew. Literature ReviewOne Piece’s latest chapter gives Bonney a terrifying new power that could completely change the situation on Egghead and Bonney’s future forever.

item.title: A Shock Justice League Traitor Just Became the Face of Amanda Waller s Anti-Hero Regime
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Arrow’s nemesis Onomatopoeia kills him, but he later reveals that he is alive and impersonating the assassin to investigate why Brick sent him. Brick confesses that Arsenal is working for Amanda Waller and is helping her take down superheroes, a shocking revelation for Green Arrow. Green Arrow is determined to save Arsenal and stop Waller, possibly striking a deal with her to free his teammate and exact revenge for keeping him separated from his family.

item.title: A Small-Time Sonic Villain Just Became a Bigger Threat Than Dr. Eggman
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSonic faces a major threat from Clutch, an unlikely villain whose complex plan dwarfs even Dr. Eggman’s schemes. Clutch employs deception and infiltration to undermine Sonic’s team and prevent the distribution of stolen Egg-Tech for free. Unlike Dr. Eggman, Clutch proves to be a more devious and subtle operator, surpassing him in destructive potential. Literature ReviewAn inconsequential Sonic the Hedgehog villain has usurped Dr. Eggman’s place as the franchise’s mastermind, infiltrating Sonic’s Restoration.

item.title: A Spiritual Vivisection Magneto Faces His Own Personal Hell Before His Resurrection
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStorm is on a quest to bring Magneto back to life in Resurrection of Magneto, but as she learns, he has found no peace in the afterlife, instead suffering greatly since his death. Magneto’s afterlife experience involved the AI deity known as the Dominion studying and cataloging his pain, causing Storm to wonder if he willingly accepted the spiritual vivisection. If Magneto is resurrected, he will return to a mutant world that has faced more tragedy and death than even he ever knew, and he may return a very different version of the Master of Magnetism, as his afterlife experience may have changed and possibly broken him.

item.title: A Twisted Luke Skywalker - How Star Wars Hero Looked In Palpatine s Propaganda
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOrder 66 and Palpatine’s propaganda reshaped the public’s perception of the Jedi, turning them into boogeymen. The Empire imagines Luke Skywalker as an ancient and powerful Jedi knight, drawing on the imagery and history of the High Republic. This portrayal of Luke reinforces the Empire’s narrative of the Jedi as terrifying figures of control, rather than the underdogs fighting against unjust power. Literature ReviewLuke Skywalker becomes a terrifying presence as Star Wars reveals how Palpatine’s propaganda transformed how the galaxy imagined Jedi.

item.title: A24 Releases an Iron Claw Tie-In Comic from Acclaimed Cartoonist Jim Rugg
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAcclaimed cartoonist Jim Rugg has created a comic-book tie-in for A24’s movie The Iron Claw about the Von Erich family. The comic retells the 1982 Christmas Cage Match between Kerry Von Erich and Ric Flair, a defining moment in pro-wrestling history. A24’s zine publication, curated by different filmmakers, now includes this special issue featuring Rugg’s comic and is a must-have for fans. Literature ReviewAs a tie-in to the 2023 movie THE IRON CLAW, a new zine from A24’s includes a one-of-a-kind comic book story from acclaimed cartoonist Jim Rugg.

item.title: Absolutely Haunting Lovecraft Manga Return Along With A Gorgeous New Deluxe Edition
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDark Horse Comics will release Gou Tanabe’s adaptations of H.P. Lovecraft’s stories in 2024, with a deluxe edition of At the Mountains of Madness and a paperback volume of The Call of Cthulhu. Gou Tanabe’s richly detailed black-and-white art brings Lovecraft’s stories to life, and these new editions include additional treats for fans. Tanabe’s faithful recreations of Lovecraft’s original stories capture the idea that humans are seeing things they were not designed to experience, and his work has been recognized with awards and upcoming projects.

item.title: Acclaimed THE WALKING DEAD Artist Takes on Batman in New Black & White Story
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCharlie Adlard, best known for his work on The Walking Dead, will draw a black-and-white Batman story for Batman: The Brave and the Bold #12. Adlard’s variant cover for the issue impressively showcases Batman’s shadow, giving the impression that the Dark Knight is everywhere at once. This collaboration could lead to future projects with DC Comics for Adlard, and fans of all DC characters should be excited for the opportunity.

item.title: Adam West s Batman Is Finally Defeated, By The 1 Dark Knight With Even Better Gadgets
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman defeats his 1966 doppelganger with a specialized weapon: Anti-Bat-Shield Razors. The Batman of Zur-En-Arrh pushes Bruce to track down and kill the Joker, leaving him trapped in his mind. Batman uses Adam West’s specific gadgetry against him, giving him a victory over his Adam West variant. Literature ReviewThe Adam West version of Batman may be the most prepared Caped Crusader, but he meets his match when facing one Batman with an outrageous gadget.

item.title: After 20 Years, John Constantine s Forgotten Daughter Will Finally Return - DC Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn Constantine has multiple children, including one with a demon named Rosacarnis. Maria Constantine, John’s daughter with Rosacarnis, has been missing since a climactic event in which she showed no desire to survive. With John’s current decay and the focus on his past in the new series, it is highly likely that Maria will make a return. Literature ReviewJohn Constantine is dying - which means his demonic daughter Maria is under threat, and likely to make an explosive return to meet her half-brother.

item.title: After 25 Years, DC s Forgotten Batgirl Finally Gets the Shout Out She Deserves
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC Comics finally acknowledges that Huntress was the Batgirl who followed Barbara Gordon. Huntress’ time as Batgirl is largely forgotten, but this Titans story gives her the respect she deserves. This recognition of Huntress as Batgirl could lead to her return as a prominent character in DC Comics. Literature ReviewJust in time for the anniversary of No Man’s Land, DC finally acknowledges the short-lived career of the Batgirl between Barbara Gordon and Cass Cain.

item.title: After 27 Years, DC Admits the Dark Origin of Its Kingdom Come Reality
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe rise of anti-heroes in the world of Kingdom Come might have been influenced by Gog, a literal god who commands the full Justice League. Boy Thunder, Superman’s former sidekick, has grown into an adult and now harbors hatred for Superman, possibly due to Gog’s influence. Gog’s presence on Earth is a major problem because if he leaves, the Earth will die without him, making him a massive threat to the twisted world of Kingdom Come.

item.title: After 28 Years, DC Reveals the Meaning of a Major Superman Rival s Codename
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMagog, the former sidekick of Superman and key figure in Kingdom Come, is revealed to be a “Gateway” needed for a summoning. The prequel story to Kingdom Come in Batman/Superman: World’s Finest triggers Magog’s ultimate fate and redemption arc. Magog’s downfall was necessary for the return of Superman and the salvation of Earth-22 in the Kingdom Come series. Literature ReviewOne fan-favorite Superman enemy has a secret meaning behind his unorthodox codename — and it totally changes his relationship to Kal-El.

item.title: After 30 Years, DC Fixes Its Most Significant Magical Plot Hole
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn Constantine’s lie about being unable to open Dream’s pouch of sand, from Sandman #3, is finally addressed and resolved in Hellblazer: Dead in America #1, fixing a decades-old plot hole. Despite being a skilled magic user, Constantine deceived Dream of the Endless, leading to a major discrepancy in the storyline. Constantine’s new journey in America involves saving the country from the consequences of someone else opening the pouch, providing a fresh threat for the character to face.

item.title: After 32 Years, Marvel Fans Finally Know How Predator Lore Changed Wolverine Forever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe latest issue of Predator vs. Wolverine reveals that the Predator’s helmet served as the template for Wolverine’s iconic Weapon X visor, adding a new layer to Wolverine’s complex backstory. The use of the Predator’s helmet by the devious minds behind the Weapon X Program highlights the predatory nature of the program and adds to Wolverine’s tormentors’ legacy. The revelation that the technology for Wolverine’s iconic visor was stolen from the Yautja adds more trauma and baggage to Wolverine’s history, and sets the stage for the next chapter in the deadly confrontation between Predator and Wolverine.

item.title: After 34 Years, Joker s Most Nightmare-Inducing Story May Finally Have a Worthy Successor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChip Zdarsky’s upcoming “The Joker: Year One” will be a thrilling new exploration of the Joker’s early days, while also telling a mystery story set in the future. The artwork in the teaser image shared by Zdarsky is haunting, showcasing the Joker’s eerie smile and vacant eyes. The new storyline has the potential to be the scariest Joker arc in 34 years, living up to the legacy of “Arkham Asylum: A Serious House on Serious Earth.

item.title: After 35 Years, DC Finally Confirms Robin s Fate If Jason Todd Had Lived
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman #428 reveals an alternate version where Robin survived, but his fate as Robin was sealed regardless of his survival. Bruce Wayne swore off working with anyone else, indicating he was never going to let Jason resume his role as Robin. Batman recognized his failure in protecting Jason and vowed to prevent a similar tragedy from happening again. #Batman428 #RobinLives Literature ReviewWhen Robin died, it was the end of Jason Todd’s hero career.

item.title: After 39 Years, John Constantine Ditches His Iconic Coat for a New Outfit (and Job)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn Constantine becomes a Catholic priest and trades in his iconic look for a temporary undercover mission in Texas. John’s impersonating of a Catholic priest is poised to deliver comedic moments that showcase his irreverent charm. The cover art of Dead in America #4 draws inspiration from the cult-classic comic series Preacher, creating a nostalgic connection for fans and potentially hiding more hidden tributes to Preacher within the upcoming installment.

item.title: After 39 Years, Marvel Explains a Plot Hole In Its Original Blockbuster Crossover
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel Super Heroes: Secret Wars: Battleworld #1 finally explains a plot hole from the original Secret Wars event. The inclusion of the Hobgoblin in Secret Wars enhances the story and avoids a simple retread of the original event. This comic addresses one of the biggest plot holes from the original Secret Wars, making it a must-read for fans. Literature ReviewAfter 39 long years, Marvel has finally explained one of the biggest plot holes from the original Secret Wars crossover.

item.title: After 39 Years, Marvel Finally Recognizes Spider-Man as a Cosmic Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man proves he is more than just a street-level hero, showcasing his skills in outer space in Wolverine #40. Marvel gives Spider-Man the recognition he deserves as a cosmic hero, highlighting his expertise in space missions. Spider-Man aids Wolverine on a mission to destroy an Orchis space station, using his webs and resourcefulness to save the day. Literature ReviewDespite his reputation as a street-level superhero, Spider-Man has been to space tons of times.

item.title: After 44 Years, DC Finally Gives 1 Hero The Closure She s Always Deserved
