item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStarfire finally gets revenge against Xand’r for murdering her parents, delivering a cathartic punch that symbolizes her long-overdue closure. Starfire’s closure regarding Xand’r’s crimes against her family reaches its peak when Raven banishes him to the Phantom Zone. Nightwing and Starfire’s shared trauma of witnessing their parents’ murders comes full circle as Kori finally attains the closure that has eluded her. Literature ReviewThe DC Universe is no stranger to heroes born from tragedy, but after 44 years, Starfire is finally getting the closure and revenge she deserves.

item.title: After 46 Years, DC Is Upgrading a Christopher Reeve Superman Villain Like Never Before
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGeneral Zod is facing challenges in his quest to revive the Kryptonian race, and his lack of ambition for war is causing his wife Ursa to take charge. Ursa’s leadership may rekindle Zod’s thirst for war and help him regain his former military legend status. The dynamic between Zod and Ursa as conquerors and leaders may either strengthen their goals or lead to destruction. Literature ReviewWith General Zod cracking under the pressure, another villain from Superman II is taking over his mission to lead a new Kryptonian society.

item.title: After 48 Years, Punisher s Nemesis Jigsaw Gets the Upgrade He Deserves
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJigsaw returns with a massive upgrade to avenge himself against the new Punisher and his handler. The new Jigsaw is now the head of a massive criminal empire with trained assassins at his disposal. Jigsaw’s upgrade could potentially push him into the big leagues as one of Marvel’s deadliest villains. Literature ReviewJigsaw was a constant thorn in Frank Castle’s side, and now the villain has received a major upgrade, one 48 years in the making.

item.title: After 51 Years, Ghost Rider Final Vengeance Marks the Last Ride of Johnny Blaze
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohnny Blaze’s 51-year tenure as Ghost Rider comes to an end in “Final Vengeance,” making way for a new and darker version of the character. Marvel remains tight-lipped about the identity of the new Ghost Rider, guaranteeing fans will be taken by surprise. Benjamin Percy’s writing has brought a graphic and intense edge to Ghost Rider, delving into the toll it takes on Johnny Blaze and introducing terrifying monsters.

item.title: After 58 Years, DC Kills Off Teen Titans Beast Boy with Heartbreaking Last Words
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBeast Boy is officially dead, with his mind erased by Doctor Hate. Doctor Hate, empowered by Amanda Waller, successfully removes Garfield Logan’s identity and turns his former body into a threat against his friends and allies. Titans: Beast World #1 is available now from DC Comics. Literature ReviewAs Titans: Beast World begins, Beast Boy meets a horrific end - not just killed, but turned into a weapon against his friends and allies.

item.title: After 59 Years, a Classic Spider-Man Villain Is Finally as Scary as Venom
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBeetle is returning to The Amazing Spider-Man in a scarier and more menacing version than before. Janice Lincoln, daughter of Tombstone, is a key character in the “Gang War” story arc. Janice Lincoln’s Beetle suit has undergone a drastic makeover, indicating a significant event involving her father and Spider-Man. Literature ReviewSeveral different villains have held the mantle of the Beetle, but the latest gets a terrifying update as she faces off against Spider-Man.

item.title: After 61 Years, It s Time for Marvel to Kill Spider-Man s Most Toxic Trait
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man’s struggle to maintain a social life goes beyond his superhero career, and has become a core part of Peter Parker’s character, something should be addressed by Marvel. Miles Morales recently accused Peter Parker of ghosting him, and called out the older hero for not being there when he needed him. Marvel should eliminate Peter Parker’s perennial flaw of being a bad friend, in order to make him a stronger and healthier character who has overcome this adversity and become better off for it.

item.title: After 63 Years, DC Reveals the Game-Changing Backstory of Justice League s First Ever Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTitans: Beast World #1 reveals the true backstory of the Justice League’s first villain, Starro the Conqueror. Starfire discovers that the monster terrorizing the DC Universe, the Necrostar, can only be defeated by Starro. Despite being a parasite, Starro serves a crucial role in maintaining balance in the DC Universe and prevents the Necrostar from wiping out civilizations. Literature ReviewStarro the Conqueror, the first villain ever encountered by the Justice League, was actually safeguarding the world from a much more serious threat.

item.title: After 8 Years, Batman Arkham Knight s Hidden Supervillain Is Finally Official Canon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Batman #140, the Arkhamverse’s Batman of Zur-En-Arrh is officially introduced into DC’s comics, confirming the villain’s existence and significance in the game series’ reality. The Zur-En-Arrh persona, originally introduced in 1958 as an alien hero, was retconned by Grant Morrison to be an emergency persona created by Bruce Wayne to combat mental attacks. This revelation means that the Zur-En-Arrh costume, which is wearable in Batman: Arkham Knight, is not just a fun comic reference but an actual villain who exists in the game’s storyline, hidden in plain sight.

item.title: After 83 Years, Gotham Finally Unleashes an Iconic Villain s Full Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Batman: City of Madness #2, Clayface reveals his true horrifying powers, making him more dangerous than ever before. Gotham City has been driven mad due to the influence of the Gotham Below, leading citizens to new heights of depravity. In the issue, Nightwing barely survives a deadly encounter with Clayface, showcasing the villain’s unpredictable and terrifying nature at its most fully uninhibited for the first time in the character’s eighty-three year history.

item.title: After 83 Years, Superman is Finally Going to Kill Lex Luthor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s breaking point: Lex Luthor’s threat to Lois Lane pushes Superman to a major breaking point, crossing a line he never thought he would. Lois Lane’s struggle: Lois is weakened by the cancer that Lex Luthor gave her, making her considerably weaker by the second. Superman’s worst side: Losing Lois to Lex’s actions brings out Superman’s anger and desire for revenge, willing to kill his archenemy for the harm he caused.

item.title: After 83 Years, Superman s Pal Jimmy Olsen Gets a Major Promotion
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJimmy Olsen unexpectedly becomes Editor-in-Chief of the Daily Planet as a crisis hits Metropolis and Lois Lane can’t fulfill her journalistic duties. Despite being known as Superman’s goofy friend, Jimmy is a talented investigator and journalist who values the integrity of the paper. This temporary promotion may be a test for Jimmy to see if he is ready for bigger responsibilities and a chance to permanently run the Daily Planet.

item.title: After 84 Years, DC Finally Confirms Joker s One True Origin Story
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC is finally providing a definitive backstory for the Joker, confirming that his origins as presented in The Killing Joke are canon. The twist of Red Mask creating three Joker copies is finally being resolved, adding resolution to a plot point that has been waiting for years. While there is always the possibility of another twist, for now the mystery of the Joker’s origin can rest. Batman #142 is available on February 6th.

item.title: After 85 Years, DC Exposes the Lie at the Heart of Batman & Commissioner Gordon s Friendship
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s adventures might be an act he created to cope with the loss of his parents with others playing along. Commissioner Gordon is aware of Batman’s antics and pretends to be surprised; he indulges in Bruce’s vigilante fantasy to help him heal. Gordon allows Batman to have small victories to make up for his losses, and their partnership and friendship flourish because of it. Literature ReviewBatman and Commissioner Gordon have a long history together — but their iconic friendship may be based on one truly sad lie from Gordon.

item.title: After All the Memes, Thanos Finally Replaces the Thanos-Copter with Something Even Wilder
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThanos replaces his infamous Thanos-Copter with an even sillier vehicle: a ‘Thanos-Convertible.’ The Thanos-Convertible is a regular truck that is way too small for Thanos, making it absurdly hilarious. While the Thanos-Copter was more famous because of its memes, the ‘Thanos-Convertible’ is a way sillier vehicle. Literature ReviewThe Thanos-Copter has a more significant chapter in the history of memes than it does in Marvel Comics, and now, Thanos found its perfect replacement!

item.title: After Disbanding the Bat-Family, DC Finally Reunites Green Arrow s Family for Good
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Arrow has finally reunited with his family, including Black Canary, Connor Hawke, and Lian Harper, showing his progress as a better family man. In contrast, Batman has isolated himself and disbanded the Bat-Family, spiraling further into darkness. The differences in how Green Arrow and Batman treat their families highlight their opposite paths, with Green Arrow thriving while Batman continues to push his loved ones away. Literature ReviewAs the DC Universe’s Bat-Family begins to crumble, Green Arrow and his family are now doing better than ever before after being reunited.

item.title: After Obi-Wan & Yoda, Luke Skywalker Needed 1 Last Mentor to Understand the Sith
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Skywalker’s journey to becoming a Jedi Knight is still being told in Star Wars canon. Auntie Feez helps Luke understand the Sith better than Obi-Wan or Yoda, as she helps him enter the metaphysical realm within a red kyber crystal. Auntie Feez is the last mentor Luke needed before becoming a true Jedi Knight, helping him get true insight into the mind of a Sith, and how to redeem them.

item.title: Alfred Pennyworth Once Fought Superman - and WON
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAlfred shows his lethality in the world of Injustice, being entrusted with technology capable of granting Kryptonian superpowers. With Batman creating a diversion, Alfred gets the power-up, headbutting and beating Superman, proving even the Man of Steel can be brought down. Alfred’s role as Batman’s trusted ally and protector is highlighted, showcasing his importance in the world of superheroes. Literature ReviewWhen Superman breaks Batman’s back in the Injustice series, Alfred defends his Master Bruce - and gives Superman a beating he’ll never forget.

item.title: Alien 10 of the Most Brutal Kills From Marvels Xenomorphs (So Far)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYXenomorphs have always been deadly creatures, and they haven’t changed in Marvel Comics. Throughout the current canon, Xenomorphs have been shown killing their victims in increasingly horrific ways. From Chestbursters exploding out of a host’s head, to the revelation that Xenomorphs are the living embodiment of a cosmic cleansing cycle, there are plenty of brutal kills in Marvel’s Alien. Literature ReviewEver since Marvel took over publishing Alien comics, there has been no shortage of epic kills pulled off by Xenomorphs.

item.title: Alien Just Rewrote the Relationship Between Xenomorphs & Synths, Changing Everything We Assumed Was True
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAlien #3 rewrites the established relationship between Synthetics and Xenomorphs, suggesting that the Xenomorphs’ indifference to them may not be inherent. The issue introduces a scene where a Synthetic is attacked by a Xenomorph without provocation, contradicting previous instances where Synthetics were unharmed when existing around Xenomorphs. This could indicate that Xenomorphs needed to learn to recognize the usefulness of Synthetics, which - if true - changes the dynamic between the two species in the wider Alien mythos.

item.title: Alien s Horrific New Kaiju Gets Official Name in Franchise Canon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe latest addition to the Alien mythos introduces a terrifying alien Kaiju named the Winterbeast. In Alien Vol. 4 #4, Zasha and Dayton successfully defeat the Weyland-Yutani operative and prevent them from obtaining sensitive information about the Xenomorph. Winterbeast, the monstrous kaiju introduced in the series, is revealed to be a host for a white Xenomorph variant, indicating the birth of a massive and formidable new threat. Literature ReviewThe latest addition to Alien lore introduced a horrific kaiju arguably even deadly than the Xenomorphs themselves, and it has officially been named!

item.title: Alien Unleashes the Biggest Xenomorph in Franchise History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe more recent Alien comics introduced a new variant of Xenomorphs called White Xenomorphs that challenge the established power structure within the hive. A Xenomorph civil war breaks out on the ice moon of LV-695, resulting in both subspecies going dormant in the ice until their recent resurgence. A giant beast, mutated after exposure to Xenomorph DNA, is unleashed on LV-695, making it the largest ‘Xenomorph’ in the franchise.

item.title: All 10 Volumes of Brian K. Vaughn & Pia Guerra s Y THE LAST MAN, Ranked
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYY: The Last Man is a landmark comic that follows the story of Yorick, the last man alive after a mysterious plague. The arcs of the comic take readers on a global journey, exploring different countries and the impact of the plague. Each arc presents new challenges and revelations while maintaining an engaging and compelling story. Literature ReviewBrian K. Vaughan and Pia Guerra’s Y the Last Man was a landmark comic of the 2000s, and here are all ten volumes ranked.

item.title: All 11 Jim Lee X-Men Covers, Ranked
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLee’s X-Men #1 cover is iconic and played a significant role in making it the best-selling comic of all time. Some of Lee’s X-Men covers lack dynamism and can be considered boring or basic. Lee’s attention to detail and ability to create compelling compositions are evident in his X-Men covers, particularly in his depiction of Wolverine and Omega Red. Literature ReviewJim Lee may be the President of DC Comics now, but he’s also one of the great X-Men artists.

item.title: All 25 Versions of Ghost Rider, Ranked From Weakest To Most Powerful
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGhost Rider is a unique antihero with a rich history and legacy that spans across multiple characters and storylines. There are 25 versions of Ghost Rider in Marvel Comics, including mashup characters and those with similar powers. While some Ghost Riders are fun and powerful, the true legacy Ghost Riders have a deeper connection to the Spirit of Vengeance and exhibit immense power. Literature ReviewFrom ‘mashup’ variants and Spirit of Vengeance-adjacent characters to lore-heavy mainstays, here are the 25 versions of Ghost Rider, ranked by power!

item.title: All 35 Versions of Batman, Ranked From Weakest To Most Powerful
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman Who Laughs: The scariest Batman from the Dark Multiverse, he combines Batman’s strength and intelligence with the Joker’s homicidal drive, making him a major threat. God of Knowledge: When Bruce Wayne sat on the Mobius Chair, he became a literal god with access to all knowledge in the universe, making him incredibly powerful. Red Rain Batman: In the Batman & Dracula trilogy, Bruce became a vampire with enhanced senses, super strength, and functional immortality, making him a formidable Dark Knight.

item.title: All 35 Versions of Superman, Ranked From Weakest To Most Powerful
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThere have been dozens of Superman variants, but how do they compare to one another? See how 35 versions of the Man of Steel rank in power. With so many powerful figures in DC canon, the question must be asked: How many Supermen are there, and how do they compare to one another? Read on to discover 30 versions of Superman, ranked from weakest to the most powerful.

item.title: All 40 Versions Of Spider-Man, Ranked From Weakest To Most Powerful
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Marvel multiverse is filled with an almost infinite number of versions of Spider-Men, Spider-Woman, and Spider-villains. While Peter Parker variants explore alternate fates for the most well-known version, he has passed the mantle to dozens of men and women from around the globe. No matter how many variants of Spider-characters unlock awesome, horrifying powers, the “Cosmic” version of Spider-Man makes Peter the most powerful to ever live. Literature ReviewMarvel has created dozens of different versions of Spider-Man over the years, but which variant, successor, or clone is the most powerful?

item.title: All 6 New Layers of DC Reality Flash s Powers Just Unlocked - Everything We Know So Far
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWally West’s new dimensional shift powers allow him to see hidden realms within the DC Universe, revealing hidden horrors and oddities. Flash is discovering how each layer of reality impacts the others, and small actions can have significant consequences. Wally is the only speedster who can access these dimensions, and it’s his duty to protect them and learn how they connect to his own reality. Literature ReviewThe Flash’s new powers are keying him into the strangest, unseen parts of the DC Universe.

item.title: All 9 JoJo s Bizarre Adventure Parts Ranked From Worst to Best
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe JoJoLands , the newest installment, is ranked last due to its lack of content and unknown characters and story. However, it shows potential. Phantom Blood , the first part, is considered one of the weakest due to its one-dimensional conflict and lack of Stand abilities. Stardust Crusaders , the third part, is a fan favorite and a game-changer for the series with its introduction of Stand abilities and memorable villains.

item.title: An Absolute Game Changer - Chainsaw Man Hints One of its Most Beloved Characters is Alive
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChainsaw Man hints that Pochita is actually somehow alive in its latest chapter. Pochita’s return prompts Denji to question his contentment and realize that being Chainsaw Man is his true dream. Pochita’s reappearance signifies a turning point for Denji, leading him to retaliate against the Chainsaw Man Church. Literature ReviewAfter 150 chapters of the Chainsaw Man manga, Denji is finally reunited with a long-lost friend. One that he thought had been killed long ago.

item.title: An Iconic MCU Hero Officially Turns Villain, as Marvel Debuts Horrifying New Weapons & Mission
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe preview for Ultimate Black Panther #1 introduces a new, darker version of Moon Knight who invades Wakanda with a horrifying new weapon. The new Moon Knight is a genocidal maniac, lacking Marc Spector’s humanity and fully embracing the missions of Ra and Khonshu. This risky transformation of a beloved character sets the stage for compelling, bloodshed-filled stories in the new Ultimate Universe. Literature ReviewIn a preview for Ultimate Black Panther #1, an iconic MCU hero goes full villain mode, with a terrifying new mission and weapon!

item.title: An Interview With Peach Momoko Ultimate X-Men, Adolescence, And The Impact Of Social Media (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPeach Momoko’s Ultimate X-Men offers a fresh and exciting vision of Marvel’s mutants with beautiful watercolor art and interpretations of lesser-known heroes. Momoko’s transition from cover work to sequential interior work has allowed her to showcase her storytelling abilities and prove her talent beyond just covers. Ultimate X-Men explores real-world social issues faced by modern-day kids, showcasing the impacts of things like social media, both good and bad. Literature ReviewIn a new interview with Peach Momoko, the Ultimate X-Men creator explains the new series’ Armor, the use of body horror, and the power of adolescence.

item.title: An Isekai With an Isekai New Manga Pushes Isekai to Its Breaking Point in the Best Way
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYI Got Reincarnated as a Cat, but Since I’m Bored, I Play VRMMOs With Gamer Girls is an isekai manga where the protagonist is reborn as a cat and escapes into a gaming world. The series goes beyond the title’s premise, exploring the protagonist’s need to communicate with his friend in the real world, which is why he is reborn in his original world. The unique goal of reaching his friend justifies the series’ subversive and trendy setup, creating a fun “isekai within an isekai” dynamic.

item.title: An Underrated X-Man Proves Her Avengers Potential by Taking On Black Panther
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMonet St. Croix, aka M or Penance, has an impressive fight against Black Panther in the latest issue of his series, potentially elevating herself into the picture for Avengers membership consideration. The fight between Monet and Black Panther raises Monet’s status in the Marvel Universe and shows that she can hold her own against an Avenger. Monet’s performance in the fight significantly boosts her reputation, increasing her chances of catching the attention of the Avengers.

item.title: Anti-Venom Fanart Turns Venom s Opposite into Marvel s Scariest Symbiote
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAnti-Venom, a version of Marvel’s Lethal Protector, is showcased in a terrifying fanart that highlights his rarely seen scare factor. The artist, Bosslogic, known for his stunning fanart featuring characters from various comics, continues his creative tradition with this scary Anti-Venom piece. While not as prevalent in comics as before, Anti-Venom deserves more recognition for his formidable and frightening presence, which is captured perfectly in Bosslogic’s depiction. Literature ReviewThere are more than a few symbiotes running around Marvel continuity, with Eddie Brock’s Anti-Venom getting a fanart treatment that truly terrifies.

item.title: Anyone in Your Orbit is Collateral Damage” Captain Americas New Wife Calls Out His Biggest Flaw - The One That Caused Civil War
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCaptain America’s commitment to his beliefs has far-reaching consequences, causing collateral damage to those in his orbit. In his pursuit of justice, Captain America often overlooks the impact his actions have on his loved ones and friends. Despite his willingness to make amends, Captain America’s actions have caused great pain to those affected by his fight for what he believes. Literature ReviewOne of Captain America’s most heroic traits leads him to hurt the people he cares about, casting doubt on just how “right” some of his actions are.

item.title: APEX AVA Beast Boy s Death Just Created a Deadly New Nightwing Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNightwing will face a new villain named Apex Ava following Beast Boy’s death, which will have significant consequences for the DC Universe. Apex Ava’s first appearance will be in Nightwing #109, with her full debut in Nightwing #110. The relationship between Beast Boy and Apex Ava, including their shared green skin and affinity for animals, suggests a possible connection and motive for revenge or answers regarding Gar’s death. Literature ReviewBeast Boy’s new Villain era has been hyped up, but another new DC Comics villain is looming in the distance.

item.title: Apocalypse s Powerful Upgrade Becomes the Biggest Curse for 1 Original X-Man
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAngel’s failed resurrection by Madelyn Pryor has horrifying consequences in Dark X-Men #3, made possible by the character’s iconic metal wings. The original X-Men member’s transformation into Archangel by Apocalypse continues to have long-lasting repercussions. Gambit’s desperate move using Angel’s metallic wings results in his immediate disintegration, one final indignity as a result of his decision to receive metal wings to replace his lost organic wings. Literature ReviewThe powerful upgrade given to one member of the original X-Men line-up by Apocalypse has recently been highlighted as the character’s biggest problem.

item.title: Aquaman & The Lost Kingdom Begins with Orm Desperate for Redemption
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAquaman and the Lost Kingdom will explore Orm’s redemption arc, which will be part of his evolving complex relationship with his half-brother, Arthur Curry. Orm is shown imprisoned and facing inner turmoil in the prelude comic to the film, eventually leading him to a realization that there is no hope for his escape. The prelude comic sets the stage for Orm and Arthur’s team-up, promising an emotionally charged quest for redemption in the upcoming film.

item.title: Aquaman Cosplay Showcases His Rarest Power in Jaw-Dropping Detail
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAn Aquaman cosplay showcases his hydrokinetic powers with stunning detail, capturing the essence of the beloved character. The collaboration between cosplayer Khal of Atlantis and digital artist Ryan Sims results in a cinematic showcase of Aquaman’s dominion over the oceans. It would be well within Khal and Sims’ creative abilities to create a cosplay that depicts Aquaman piercing Superman through the heart with his trident. Literature ReviewThis Aquaman cosplay dives deep into the seas of creativity, surfacing with a splash-tacular showcase of his rarest and most envied power.

item.title: Archie Andrews Becomes a Supernatural Demon Hunter in JUDGMENT DAY #1
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYArchie Andrews must save Riverdale from demonic forces that have corrupted his loved ones in the most epic and intense story ever. Archie Comics: Judgment Day #1 is a part of the popular and violent Archie Horror brand, delivering twisted tales with disturbing elements. This upcoming series will not only showcase gore, but also delve into Archie’s character as he faces supernatural evil and the darkest story in the Archie franchise.

item.title: Arkham Asylum s Updated History Includes a Break Out Even Batman Would Support
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Alan Scott: The Green Lantern #2, it is revealed that Arkham Asylum was once a mental health facility that provided help to patients, but treated queer people as prisoners and subjected them to torture. Alan Scott, a queer hero, orchestrates a breakout from Arkham Asylum after experiencing electroshock therapy and witnessing his trans friend undergo violent conversion therapy. This reinterpretation of Arkham Asylum’s history sheds light on the homophobia and mistreatment queer people faced, and presents a unique breakout that readers root for, challenging the traditional portrayal of villains escaping from the facility.

item.title: Arkham Knight Cosplay Proves the Controversial Gotham Villain Deserves More Respect
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSupermanFitt’s remarkable Arkham Knight cosplay is so realistic that it impresses fans, regardless of their previous opinions on the character. The carefully crafted suit and captivating pictures bring the Arkham Knight to life, with the addition of digital edits enhancing the realism and dynamic nature of the portrayal. SupermanFitt’s cosplay embodies Jason Todd’s version of the Arkham Knight, redeeming the character in the eyes of many fans and showcasing the intricate detail and authenticity of the costume.

item.title: Army of Darkness Forever Reveals the Final Fate of the Necronomicon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Necronomicon, the Book of the Dead, is nearly destroyed in the dark future of Army of Darkness, leaving only a few pages remaining. The Army of Darknes Forever comic continuation explores the consequences of the alternate ending of the movie, where Ash wakes up in a post-apocalyptic future. The fate of the Necronomicon is bittersweet for horror fans, as it is a significant and iconic artifact in the Evil Dead franchise, and beyond.

item.title: As Batman Becomes a Villain, a Shock Gotham Hero Rises to Protect the City
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman has been defeated by the Orgham family, leaving Gotham without protection. Mr. Freeze steps up to save Batman and teams up with Catwoman. The Orghams have taken over Gotham using hypnosis and Azmer demons. Their control over the villains has created discontent among them. Mr. Freeze’s motivation to save Batman stems from his desire to preserve his own experiments and ultimately save his wife. Batman’s rogues unite to rescue their worst enemy.

item.title: Atom Eve s Hidden Superpower Is Essential to Invincible s Ending
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAtom Eve’s secret power is revealed - she has the ability to regenerate her body and essentially be immortal. The reveal confirms her immense power and solidifies a happy ending for Mark, despite his father’s doubts. Atom Eve’s immortality means that Mark can potentially be immortal too, allowing them to live a long and happy life together. Literature ReviewAtom Eve reveals the true strength of her superpowers, proving Omni-Man’s prophecy wrong in Invincible’s finale issue.

item.title: Attack on Titan Creator s Statement on the Ending is Heartbreaking
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAttack on Titan’s controversial ending sparked fan division and criticism of series creator Hajime Isayama for abandoning a heroic interpretation of the characters. Isayama expressed anxiety over fan reactions and asked for kindness and honest opinions at Anime NYC convention. The anime adaptation made pivotal changes to the original ending, with Eren’s actions being more harshly judged by his friend Armin. Fan response to the ending turned nasty, prompting the creator to remind fans to be respectful.

item.title: Avengers Iconic MCU Moment Recreated with the Justice League in Genius Fanart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKerry Callen’s art replaces the MCU Avengers with a comic-accurate Justice League. The art includes fun details, like Green Arrow replacing Hawkeye and Martian Manhunter standing in for the mean, green Hulk. The new Battle of New York pose offers a glimpse into a world where DC’s shared universe hit the movies first. Literature ReviewIn genius art, the Justice League take over the Avengers’ iconic MCU pose, offering a glimpse into a world where DC got to the movies first.

item.title: Avengers Confirms 2 MCU Heroes Are Destined to Be Together
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark and Janet Van Dyne’s love resulted in the birth of their son, James Stark, who becomes a major antagonist with a negative opinion on superheroes. James Stark, the CEO of Stark Technology, tarnishes his parents’ legacy by labeling former superheroes as terrorists and creating a new Avengers team, all while a corrupt S.H.I.E.L.D. Task Force watches over New York City. Despite his public persona, James still holds a deep connection to his parents and has big plans for their technology, which could potentially shape the future of the Avengers.

item.title: Avengers Confirms Its New Hero Is as Strong as Thor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVic Shade’s ability to alter his own molecular density gives him strength that puts him in the same category as Marvel’s heaviest hitters, making him a formidable opponent for Thor. As Janet’s partner, Vic Shade’s immense power presents a potential danger that is currently being kept in check, though his true origins and loyalties remain uncertain. Whether Vic Shade will end up battling Thor and the Avengers, or remain their strongest new recruit, will depend on the unfolding truth of his existence, as Avengers Inc.

item.title: Avengers Confirms One MCU Hero Is Destined to Become Sorcerer Supreme
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDoctor Strange lost the title of Sorcerer Supreme in the MCU, and it’s likely that Clea will claim the title in the future. Doom Supreme maqkes Clea’s case, having killed multiple variants of Sorcerer Supremes, including Stranges, Agamottos, and Cleas. Clea is not only a standard and fitting choice for the next Sorcerer Supreme, but is officially a multiversal constant in comic canon. Literature ReviewDoctor Strange is the most recognizable Sorcerer Supreme, but the comics have confirmed which Marvel character should take the title in the MCU.

item.title: Avengers Officially Debuts Marvel s New Hawkeye, as Captain America s Team Face the Ultimate Hero vs Hero Battle
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAvengers: Twilight is introducing a new Hawkeye - likely a recruit for Captain America’s new Avengers roster. While their identity is hidden, the new Hawkeye’s costume includes clues to their identity - are they the child of killer marksman Bullseye? Avengers: Twilight #5 is coming from Marvel Comics April 17. Literature ReviewAs Captain America assembles a new version of the Avengers, Marvel is debuting a new Hawkeye hinted to have connections to a deadly supervillain.

item.title: Avengers Reveals Official Origin of New Hawkeye (& Shock Tie to a Deadly MCU Villain)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAvengers: Twilight introduces a new Bullseye who may become this world’s Hawkeye, as she is inspired by Captain America and starts questioning the Thunderbolts’ heroism. Ramona, the new Bullseye, believes that taking down Steve Rogers makes her a hero and him a villain, but she now seems uncertain about the Thunderbolts’ true intentions. Ramona’s skills and potential connection to the original Bullseye make her a powerful addition to Captain America’s new team of Avengers in their fight against James and Jarvis.

item.title: Avengers Reveals Shock Hero Is Officially an MCU Icon s Son
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Avengers have a new member who is the “son” of the original Ant-Man, with a legacy that goes beyond his father. Mark Twelve was built by a future Hank Pym to stop Ultron and combines positive traits from other AIs but is his own person. The extended Ant-Man family accepts Mark as his own person, despite his AI status, showing that the Avengers and Ant-Family don’t judge based on origin.

item.title: Avengers vs Iron Man Civil War Gets the Darkest Possible Reimagining
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Avengers are facing off against the deadly Stark Sentinel program controlled by Orchis. The Sentinels have stronger armor than Iron Man and are programmed to destroy mutants and any other target. The Avengers must use all their might to stand against the metal onslaught, but it may not be enough to defeat the Stark Sentinels. Literature ReviewWhen Iron Man lost his company, Orchis stepped in and created Stark Sentinels.

item.title: Badass Red Hood Cosplay Proves DC Needs To Give Jason Katanas Immediately
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed Hood is known for his brutal tactics as a vigilante, but he has been trying to be less lethal in his crime-fighting recently. A collaboration between a Red Hood cosplayer and a photographer has resulted in impressive cosplay images that fans will love. The cosplayer expertly captures Red Hood’s comic-accurate design and wields katanas, which are portrayed as a deadly and badass weapon upgrade for the character. Literature ReviewRed Hood has a lot of weapons at his disposal that he uses to fight crime, and now in a new DC cosplay, Jason gets a set of swords that suit him well.

item.title: Baldurs Gate 3 Every Adamantine Forge Item (& How to Get Them)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThe Adamantine Forge provides some of the best pieces of equipment in Act 1 of Baldur’s Gate 3. Here’s how to unlock each of the weapons and armor. Once you have beat Grym in Baldur’s Gate 3, you will have unlocked access to the Adamantine Forge, a special location allowing you to forge limited items. The Adamantine Forge items are rare pieces of gear that can offer a significant bump to builds and are some of the best equipment you can obtain early in the game.

item.title: Bane s Time as The Dark Knight Turned His Symbol Into an Absolutely Brutal Weapon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBane’s version of Batman in Forever Evil: Arkham War was one of the most brutal versions of the character the DC Universe has ever seen. Bane used the Bat symbol to instill fear and control criminals in Gotham City. While Bane was only Batman for a short time, he showed a brutal determination to protect the citizens of Gotham, while furthering his goal of taking over the city for himself.

item.title: Bardock s Super Saiyan 3 Form Proves He Could Have Been Stronger Than Goku
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBardock, Goku’s father, proves his talent by holding his own against Goku in Super Dragon Ball Heroes, even with a weaker transformation. Bardock’s ability to maintain Super Saiyan 3 suggests he has tremendous energy reserves and potential for higher-level transformations. While Bardock may never achieve Goku’s top-tier transformations, Goku acknowledges Bardock’s superior power at the same level, indicating that Bardock may have the greatest potential of any Saiyan. Literature ReviewBardock’s Super Saiyan 3 battle in Super Dragon Ball Heroes suggests that Goku’s father may have had even greater potential than his son.

item.title: Barry Allen Just Proved He s the Best Flash by Inventing a Better Version of the Bat-Signal
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBarry Allen proves that being the best Flash doesn’t require being the fastest speedster. His ingenuity unites his family and helps save the world. Wally may be faster, but Barry’s cleverness and quick thinking make him a valuable Flash. Speed alone doesn’t make a great hero. Barry’s creation of the Flash Phone shows that there’s more to being the Flash than just speed. His ability to think fast and come up with a plan is what sets him apart.

item.title: Bat-Bro Code Batman Broke 1 Justice League Friend s Heart on Valentine s Day
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman breaks Bro Code by pursuing Plastic Man’s girlfriend, sparking speculation about his motives. Plastic Man rebounds from heartbreak and redirects his affections toward Catwoman. This hints at a potential rivalry within the Justice League, with Plastic Man and Batman vying for the affections of the same women. Literature ReviewBatman has done a lot of questionable things during his time in the Justice League, but has The Dark Knight finally gone too far by breaking Bro Code?

item.title: Batgirl s Best Love Interests in DC History Go Way Beyond Nightwing
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatgirl has had a varied love life, with different romantic interactions and relationships with various characters. Barbara Gordon and Dick Grayson (Nightwing) have a long-standing relationship and are considered DC’s power couple. Each Batgirl has had their own triumphs and failures in love, but their love lives are often complicated by their superhero careers. Literature ReviewBetween DC’s three main Batgirls — Stephanie, Cassandra, and Barbara — each has experienced all kinds of romances, from the super to the sweet.

item.title: Batman & Daredevil Writer Celebrates the R-Rated Comic That Changed His Career
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChip Zdarsky celebrates the tenth anniversary of the comic series Sex Criminals, which launched his mainstream comics career and won an Eisner award. The origins of Sex Criminals were surprisingly ordinary, with Zdarsky reaching out to collaborate with Matt Fraction after feeling creatively stuck in his newspaper job. Despite skepticism, Sex Criminals became a success, being named the #1 Comic Series of 2013 by Time Magazine. It also led to Zdarsky’s subsequent work on major Marvel and DC titles.

item.title: Batman & Superman Are Proving They re the Strongest Justice League Members - By Fighting the Entire Team
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman and Superman face their most difficult battle yet: fighting the entire Justice League. The heroes are transported to the world of Kingdom Come, where they are out of their depth. Batman’s contingency plans and Superman’s strength may not be enough to defeat the Justice League on their own. Literature ReviewBatman and Superman are two of the most popular characters in comic books, and now they’re going to prove they’re the strongest characters too.

item.title: Batman 89 s Harley Quinn Will Be Corrupted by Scarecrow, Not Joker - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Scarecrow, not the Joker, will likely be responsible for corrupting Harley Quinn in the Batman ‘89 universe. Harley Quinn’s transformation into a villain will likely be planned and involve Scarecrow’s toxins. Scarecrow and Harley Quinn already have a connection, and he may potentially kidnap her to use as a test subject. Literature ReviewWith the Joker dead in the Burtonverse, theories abound sbouy who will corrupt Harley Quinn to villainy, and all signs are pointing to the Scarecrow.

item.title: Batman Admits He ll Die in Costume - & Why He Can t Stop
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman will never retire, because fighting crime is the only way he can keep his parents’ deaths from becoming meaningless, in his trauma-induced conception of things. Batman can never stop being a hero, because it is through saving people that he remains connected to his parents and avoids facing the reality of their deaths. Bruce Wayne’s entire life is an act of mourning his parents, and he will always strive to save them, even though they are already gone.

item.title: Batman Admits One of His Villains is a Superman-Level Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman confirms that the Riddler could be a serious challenge for Superman, as his manipulation in a recent event threw off the villain’s game. While Batman’s villains may not be as powerful as Superman’s, the Riddler’s intelligence and ability to create mind games and traps make him a formidable opponent. Riddler’s goal of proving his intelligence could lead him to take on Superman in a battle of wits, and Superman should be prepared in case the Prince of Puzzlers ever comes knocking.

item.title: Batman Admits There s One Villain He Doesn t Mind Killing
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s no-kill rule was put to the test in a major way during the Batman: Death and the Maidens limited series, when it was revealed he was indirectly taking measures to end Ra’s al Ghul’s life. Seemingly immortal thanks to the use of DC’s Lazarus Pits, Ra’s al Ghul has been alive for over a thousand years, something Batman considers unnatural. Batman uses his resources as Bruce Wayne to destroy Ra’s al Ghul’s Lazarus Pits, which the villain needs to stay alive, with the belief that it’s not technically murder.

item.title: Batman Already Named the Hero Who s Most Like Him (& It s Not One of His Sons )
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHuntress’ resemblance to Batman in her early days as a vigilante is why the rest of the Bat-Family hasn’t fully accepted her. Huntress’ violent and reckless nature is a reminder of Batman’s early crime-fighting years, when he cared less for the criminals he took off the streets. Despite their differences, Huntress and Batman share similarities in their beginnings, their vendettas against crime, and dedication to taking villains off the streets of Gotham.

item.title: Batman and Captain America Bonded Over This Shared Tragedy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman and Captain America bond over the shared trauma of losing their sidekicks, Jason Todd and Bucky Barnes. Both heroes carried the weight of their sidekicks’ deaths for decades, understanding each other’s pain. The meeting between Batman and Captain America occurs during a major battle between the Justice League and the Avengers. Literature ReviewAt first glance, Marvel’s Captain America and DC’s Batman could not be more different, but it turns out that they share one specific trauma.

item.title: Batman Argues He Has a Better Version of an Iconic Superman Power (& He s Right)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s powers make him a living lie detector, but Batman is even better at identifying deception. Faced with his and Superman’s Earth-0 counterparts in the Kingdom Come timeline, Batman deduces the truth by observing small details of what Earth-0 Superman says. Batman is always looking for the truth, making him a better detective than Superman. Literature ReviewSuperman’s Kryptonian supersenses give him the ability to function as a human lie detector; Batman says he’s still better at catching deceptions.

item.title: Batman Battles Boba Fett in God-Tier Alex Ross Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman and Boba Fett engage in a visually stunning and enigmatic battle, prompting fans to speculate on the outcome of this clash between iconic characters. Ross’s artwork brilliantly captures the essence of both Batman and Boba Fett, showcasing their unique gear, combat skills, and enigmatic personas. The crossover between Star Wars and DC demonstrates the brilliance of pitting Batman against Boba Fett, as they are recognized as counterparts with similar traits and tactics in their respective universes.

item.title: Batman Battles Twisted New Villains in Animated Fight Trailer for Gargoyle of Gotham
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC Comics brings Batman: Gargoyle of Gotham to life in an intense animated trailer, showcasing the brutal new villains in the series. The fully animated trailer features Batman battling Crytoon, a cartoon-obsessed murderer, and briefly introduces Moth-er and the Virgin as new foes. Batman: Gargoyle of Gotham takes place in a bleak version of Gotham with its own twisted antagonists, offering a refreshing change from the standard supervillains. Literature ReviewDC Comics goes all out in promoting Batman: Gargoyle of Gotham with a new trailer that animates a fight scene between Bruce and his new rogues.

item.title: Batman Beat Darkseid s Deadliest Power With a Genius Contingency Plan Invention
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman defeats Darkseid with just a pair of goggles, which completely depower Darkseid. Batman plans to go back in time by controlling Darkseid using a baby version of him and the Omega Effect. The Godwave Goggles negate Darkseid’s Omega Effect, making him significantly less powerful. Literature ReviewBatman is famous for his many contingency plans and inventions, and the biggest one he has happens to completely disable Darkseid’s greatest power.

item.title: Batman Becomes The Ultimate Jedi In New Star Wars x DC Cosplay
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman steps into the Star Wars universe in a new crossover cosplay, wielding his own lightsaber as a Jedi Knight. Cosplayer @batmanteo specializes in bringing Batman to life through various creative designs and cosplay, impressing with their attention to detail. While an official Batman x Star Wars crossover may be extremely unlikely, this cosplay design allows fans to witness what the Caped Crusader might look like in a galaxy far, far away.

item.title: Batman Cosplay Gives Fans A Live-Action Killer Croc Fight DC Shouldn t Ignore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s villain, Killer Croc, gets a terrifying and powerful portrayal in a new cosplay image. The cosplay showcases Brad Johnson’s creativity and attention to detail in bringing iconic characters to life. The intense battle between Batman and Killer Croc hints at the potential for an epic showdown in future DC films. Literature ReviewBatman and Killer Croc have been battling for years, with a new set of cosplay photos showing off how a real live-action fight between them should go.

item.title: Batman Cosplay Makes Frank Miller s Impossible Dark Knight a Reality
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCosplayer Karver_FX brings Frank Miller’s Dark Knight to life with an impressive sculpted mask and muscle suit. Pure nightmare fuel. Frank Miller’s The Dark Knight Returns revolutionized Batman stories and brought superhero comics into the modern age. The Dark Knight Returns continues to live on through adaptations, including a two-part animated feature. Thanks to cosplay like Karrver_FX’s, the grim and gritty Batman endures. Literature ReviewA new cosplay from Karrver_FX brings the version of Batman from Frank Miller’s The Dark Knight Returns to life in a frightening creation.

item.title: Batman Cosplay Proves He Should ve Always Worn a Full Mask
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s new cosplay includes a full-faced bat-cowl, adding to his already badass appearance. @calebweekss, a talented cosplayer, has created multiple versions of Batman’s costume, showcasing his creativity. Batman’s traditional costume lacks a full mask, but this cosplay proves that he should reconsider and add it for better protection. Literature ReviewBatman’s cape and cowl are an iconic part of his persona, with a new cosplay giving him a full face mask that his comic counterpart needs to wear!

item.title: Batman Cosplay Recreates His Shocking Final Crisis Death to Darkseid
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAll Star Cosplay recreates Batman’s death from the Final Crisis event, faithfully bringing the tragic moment from the comic book to life. The cosplay is visually stunning and includes photo-editing help from Pixelens to enhance the three-dimensional portrayal. The moment still holds significance years later, as the death of Batman in Final Crisis had major consequences for the DC Universe. Literature ReviewAn amazing new cosplay from All Star Cosplay perfectly recreates Batman’s death at the hands of Darkseid from the epic crossover Final Crisis.

item.title: Batman Cosplay Redesigns the Batsuit to Match His Most Powerful Mentor, Santa Claus
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA Batman cosplayer has designed a festive Batsuit inspired by Santa Claus, blending crime-fighting abilities with holiday cheer. The imaginative fusion of Batman and Santa Claus has received positive reception, bringing holiday joy and laughter to fans. Surprisingly, the Batman and Santa mashup aligns with niche aspects of Batman canon, adding an authentic layer to the playful cosplay. Literature ReviewA dedicated Batman cosplayer unveils a legendary Batsuit redesign, skillfully incorporating the essence of Batman’s powerful mentor into every detail.

item.title: Batman Cosplay Reunites Bruce with the Superhero Who Taught Him How to Fight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman and Wildcat’s joint cosplay is a rare and extraordinary team-up that has fans on social media buzzing with excitement. The cosplayers have meticulously crafted their high-quality suits, capturing the essence of their iconic characters. The cosplay pays tribute to the enduring legacy between Batman and Wildcat, showcasing their artistic prowess and celebrating their canonical ties. Literature ReviewTwo talented cosplayers have joined forces to unite Bruce Wayne with the superhero who taught Batman how to fight in an ultra-rare cosplay.

item.title: BATMAN DARK AGE to Redefine the Dark Knights Role as a Cultural Icon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman: Dark Age, a successor to Superman: Space Age, explores Batman’s role in contemporary culture through an origin story set against historical events. This six-issue miniseries by Mark Russell and Mike Allred delves into Gotham’s turmoil and the iconic characters who have loved and hated Batman, all while examining his place in American history. Like its sister series, Dark Age will provide a unique and pensive examination of Batman, delving deep into his character and paralleling the growth of America and world culture.

item.title: Batman Didn t Even Invent One Of His Most Iconic Gadgets
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s iconic Batarangs, which he uses for various purposes, were not originally invented by him, but rather gifted to him by a circus Boomerang performer, whom he teamed with to catch a criminal Detective Comics #244 reveals the surprising origins of the Batarang, which most fans would understandably expect to have been designed by Bruce Wayne himself. While Batman has often relied on others for gadget building, recent comics have emphasized Bruce Wayne as a visionary inventor; still, it’s important to remember that even his most iconic gadget was not of his own design.

item.title: Batman Exposes How He Truly Sees Nightwing with 1 Sentence
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman trusts Nightwing more than anyone else to keep him from hurting others if he loses control and turns into a monster. The world is in danger as animal hybrids are created from Beast Boy’s spores, and Nightwing assists Batman in Gotham. Batman sees Nightwing as his best contingency plan, knowing that Nightwing has the skills and spirit to stop him if necessary. Literature ReviewAs the events of “Beast World” change Batman into something truly terrifying, the Dark Knight admits how he really feels about his partner Nightwing.

item.title: Batman Finally Admits The Bat-Signal Does the Exact Opposite of What He Wanted
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman realizes that the Bat-Signal is counter-intuitive as it reveals his location to criminals, giving them time to commit crimes elsewhere. The Bat-Signal, while iconic, has a major flaw - it lets criminals know where Batman is heading, allowing them to act with impunity elsewhere. Batman acknowledges that the Bat-Signal doesn’t make much sense, as it goes against his ninja-like stealth and reliance on fear. Literature ReviewThe Bat-Signal is one of the most iconic symbols in Batman’s entire mythos, but only recently has he realized how it might backfire on him.

item.title: Batman Gets a Militaristic Twist as Bruce Wayne Joins the Real-World Vietnam War
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman goes to prison and enlists in the army during the Vietnam War, leading to a different version of Batman. Ra’s al Ghul is the sergeant Bruce serves under, potentially leading to a dark storyline. This new origin could give fans a darker version of Batman. Literature ReviewDC Comics is officially taking Batman to the Vietnam War under Ra’s al Ghul thanks to a new series dropping this spring: Batman: Dark Age.

item.title: Batman Gets Official Redesign from Gorillaz Co-Creator Jamie Hewlett
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJamie Hewlett’s stunning variant cover for DC’s Black Label Batman series showcases his iconic art style. Hewlett’s artistic touch was personally requested by Rafael Grampá, uniting two artistic icons on the acclaimed Batman series. The overwhelmingly positive response to Hewlett’s variant cover highlights fans’ excitement for his return to the comic arena and the possibility of future contributions from him. Literature ReviewEver wonder what Batman would look like if he were a member of the Gorillaz band?

item.title: Batman Has Lost Faith in Nightwing, as the Titans Fail Like Never Before
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman may no longer trust Nightwing to lead the DC Universe, putting Nightwing’s future in jeopardy. The Beast World event has thrown the world into chaos, causing Batman to question Nightwing’s ability to handle the new role. If Nightwing fails to regain Batman’s trust, Batman might want to reclaim his position as the leader of the DC Universe. Literature ReviewAfter gifting Nightwing with the keys to the DC kingdom following the dissolution of the Justice League, Batman may be ready to take them back.

item.title: Batman Has Officially Been Mastered by Jorge Jiménez, And This Art Proves It
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJimenez’s art brilliantly captures Batman’s terrifying presence, even with just a glimpse of his bloody cape. The return of Batman of Zur-En-Arrh showcases Jimenez’s talent in depicting an unhinged and determined Dark Knight. Jimenez excels in showcasing Batman’s power and force of nature, as he effortlessly takes on his own Bat-Family. Literature ReviewJorge Jiménez has had an impressive run on Batman and elevated the Dark Knight. Discover 10 pieces of art that show Jiménez’s mastery of the hero.

item.title: Batman Is Calling Out Robin s Biggest Flaw - & It s Pretty Unforgivable
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne’s immaturity and lack of understanding about the value of life pose a challenge for his growth as Batman’s successor. Batman tries to guide Damian by indicating that his joking in inappropriate, resembling a parent teaching a child not to swear. Damian’s skills as an assassin do not equate to maturity, and he needs his father’s guidance and some Christmas magic to improve his attitude. Literature ReviewDamian Wayne has been trained to be an assassin his entire life, but now Batman really needs to train the young Robin how to be a human being.

item.title: Batman Is Officially Copying the Spider-Verse, As DC Gets Its Own Spider Society
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman has his own version of Marvel’s Spider-Verse concept with the introduction of the Bat Dimension. In the Bat Dimension, Batman’s subconscious meets with other versions of himself to train and share ideas. While Batman is not the first superhero to use this concept, it showcases the popularity and appeal of multiple versions of iconic characters. Literature ReviewIn recent years, Spider-Man has been playing a huge role in Marvel’s multiverse.

item.title: Batman Just Silenced Every Hater Who Ever Accused Him of Having Plot Armor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman: Off-World #1 provides a satisfying explanation for Batman’s adeptness at handling extraterrestrial threats. The issue explores a fresh side of Bruce Wayne’s journey, showcasing a vulnerable and complex superhero. It offers an engaging narrative that delves into Batman’s character and challenges his established reputation. Literature ReviewBatman has been accused of having a ridiculous amount of plot armor, but this new comic release just silenced all the haters in one fell swoop.

item.title: Batman Knows Only 1 Bat-Family Hero Can Replace Him - & He Just Proved It s Not Nightwing
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed Hood’s appearance as Wingman in Dimension Batman suggests he is Batman’s true successor. Jason Todd’s pain and trauma make him more defined by it than Batman, further solidifying his claim to the cowl. Red Hood’s presence in Dimension Batman speaks volumes, as no other Bat-Family sidekick makes an appearance. Literature ReviewBatman has many choices for who could take up his mantle, but DC just confirmed that the least likely candidate might be his true heir.

item.title: Batman Lore Changes Forever, as DC Reveals a Classic Gotham Villain Was His First Sidekick
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBefore becoming enemies, Penguin helped Batman take down the Falcone crime family and clean up Gotham City. Penguin’s assistance was crucial for Batman’s early success in apprehending Falcone and making improvements in Gotham. Although Penguin’s help ultimately led to his rise as a crime boss, Batman needed his inside information to gain an advantage and achieve one of his first big wins. Literature ReviewForget about Robin and Batgirl, Batman once worked with a surprising member of his rogues’ gallery to help him bring order to Gotham City.

item.title: Batman Names the 1 Gotham Villain He ll Probably Never Beat (& It s Not Joker)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman admits he may never defeat the Court of Owls, the oldest villain group in Gotham City. The Court of Owls’ corruption runs deep, making it difficult for Batman to bring them down. Batman must team up with the Court of Owls to contain the chaos caused by a new threat in Batman: City of Madness, showing the extent of his respect for their power. Literature ReviewBatman has been protecting Gotham City for years, but it seems there’s one group of villains that even the Dark Knight knows he can’t beat.

item.title: Batman Officially Survived Arkham Knight s Ending, DC Confirms
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Arkham franchise version of Batman appears in Batman #135, confirming his survival after the events of Batman: Arkham Knight. This Batman has experienced immense tragedy, including the loss of Jason Todd, Talia al Ghul, and his secret identity and fortune. Despite fan confusion, Arkham Knight’s ending and the appearance of the Arkham Batman in the comics definitively confirm his survival. Literature ReviewBatman has been through plenty of life-threatening situations, but the ending of Arkham Knight left some gamers unsure of Batman’s fate, until now.

item.title: Batman Only Agreed to Mentor Robin Because His First Sidekick Turned Evil
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman wanted to reveal his secret identity to Harvey Dent, but couldn’t when he became Two-Face. Without many allies, Batman initially worked with Gordon and Dent to fight crime in Gotham. Revealing his identity to Dick Grayson changed Batman’s life and led to the creation of the enduring Bat Family DC readers know today. Literature ReviewRobin is one of the most iconic parts of Batman’s mythos, but Batman only ever took Robin in because his first choice turned evil.

item.title: Batman Only Scares Criminals Because Santa Claus Did It First (Yes, Really)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s scare tactics were influenced by Santa Claus and Krampus, who used similar techniques to scare naughty children into behaving. Santa Claus and Krampus have a centuries-old tag-team approach to rehabilitating bad children, which predates Batman’s fear-based techniques. The connection between Batman, Santa Claus, and Krampus shows that their tactics in fighting evil are universal and effective. Literature ReviewBatman, Santa Claus, and Krampus are currently crossing over in DC Comics, with Batman learning he has far more in common with them than he thinks.

item.title: Batman Proved He Belongs on the Justice League by Destroying a Huge Avengers Villain (Yes, Really)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s strategic thinking proves invaluable as he helps bring down an Avengers villain without lifting a finger. Batman’s skills as an inventor, detective, and tactician make him an essential member of the Justice League. Despite being just a human, Batman’s brilliance and resourcefulness make him a crucial asset in taking on powerful adversaries. Literature ReviewPeople often question how Batman could be of any help to the Justice League, but he proves how useful he is by defeating one major Avengers villain.

item.title: Batman Reveals the 1 Gadget as Essential as the Batmobile - That Fans Have Never Seen Before
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s ultimate gadget is revealed in Batman: Off-World #2, and it’s the Punch Bot that helps him train to fight alien threats. The Punch Bot, a training machine for alien warriors, replicates fighting styles and vulnerabilities of countless species, making Batman the galaxy’s most capable hand-to-hand fighter. Batman: Off-World #2 is on sale from DC Comics now! Literature ReviewAs DC reveals one of Batman’s defining adventures, the Dark Knight showcases a gadget that shaped him more definitively than the Batmobile.

item.title: Batman s Anti-Green Lantern Contingency Has a 0% Chance of Success
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s plan to defeat Green Lantern using a Sinestro Corps ring is a terrible idea considering he has zero experience with the weapon. Batman’s contingency plan fails against the evil Power Ring and would have been even worse if he was fighting the actual Hal Jordan. The fact that Batman summons Sinestro to Earth by accident shows that not only can he not beat Green Lantern, but he also brings forth a powerful villain.

item.title: Batman s Batcycle Has a Hidden Contingency That Makes It Essential - No Matter How Many Batmobiles He Builds
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s steam-powered Batcycle is his most dependable vehicle, proven in two separate disasters where his other vehicles failed. The Batcycle’s ability to continue operating during a global blackout makes it more useful than the famous Batmobile. In situations where the Batmobile’s size is a drawback, the Batcycle allows Batman to quickly navigate tight areas and diverse terrain. Literature ReviewBatman has an entire arsenal of vehicles at his disposal, but his motorcycle is even better than his iconic Batmobile for one major reason.

item.title: Batman s Batsuit Gets the Ultimate Intergalactic Upgrade In Official DC Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s new Space Batsuit in Batman: Off-World is a remarkable and distinctive addition to his arsenal, boasting a monochrome sleekness with steampunk aesthetics. The suit takes form in issue #3 after Bruce’s previous suit is destroyed, but its stunning visual appeal is best showcased in artist Alan Quah’s variant cover for issue #5. Batman’s intergalactic suit upgrade aligns with his imminent battle against the formidable Blakksun Twins. Literature ReviewBatman’s Batsuit gets an intergalactic upgrade, and the timing couldn’t be more perfect since alien battles are on the horizon for The Dark Knight.

item.title: Batman s Best Contingency Gadget Can Beat 2 Completely Different Justice League Heroes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s contingency plans for the Justice League can be repurposed and used against other members of the Crime Syndicate. Lex Luthor proves to be more imaginative than Batman by repurposing a lightning rod to potentially take down an evil version of Shazam. While Batman’s plan doesn’t work on Alexander Luthor, it could work on Shazam, showing that sometimes a plan designed for one person will be effective against another.

item.title: Batman s Brutal New Look Is Hush-Worthy in Official Cover Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman #145’s cover art reveals a striking Hush-inspired transformation for Batman, raising questions about the storyline and potential return of the villain. The bandaged appearance may be metaphorical, representing Batman’s fractured mental state as he faces challenges from Zur-En-Arrh. Bruce’s new look also may be a reference to Gotham’s new villain, Shush, who is featured in the ongoing Batman and Robin run. Literature ReviewBatman’s brutal new look is hauntingly reminiscent of his notorious adversary, Hush, leaving fans to ask, “What happened to The Caped Crusader?

item.title: Batman s Daughter Just Proved She s as Powerful as Superman s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s daughter, Janan al Ghul, is a formidable nemesis for Superman and his family, possessing mastery over magic and the ability to travel through hell itself. Janan claims to have already killed countless gods and has outsmarted and manipulated the Super-Family at every turn so far in their conflict. While her goal is to turn Otho-Ra to her side, Janan is prepared to destroy her, along with Superman and his family if necessary.

item.title: Batman s Ex Is Officially Dating the Superhero He Hates Most in the World
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVicki Vale writes an article about why dating a superhero is awful, with Green Lantern Guy Gardner as her subject. Batman and Green Lantern Guy Gardner have a long-standing rivalry. Batman and Guy Gardner could come into conflict over Vale’s article. Literature ReviewBatman and his former flame Vicki Vale haven’t been together in a long time, but how’s he going to react when she dates a hero he absolutely despises?

item.title: Batman s Latest Fight Proves His Bruce Wayne Identity Is NOT Just a Mask
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman battles Zur-En-Arrh, a pure mechanical version of Batman without Bruce Wayne’s humanity. The fight between Batman and Zur-En-Arrh will settle the debate of whether Bruce Wayne or Batman is the true mask. Bruce Wayne’s true self, a traumatized child who wants to protect others, must overcome the pure version of Batman to prove his identity. Literature ReviewAn age-old fan debate about whether Bruce Wayne or Batman is the true mask has just been definitively answers by DC Comics in Batman #140.

item.title: Batman s Most Dangerous Multi-Dimensional Villain Is About to Be Revealed - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC’s Fifth Dimensional Imps look silly, but they can warp reality on a whim, making it shocking that so many just died. A new Imp version of the Injustice League are preparing to attack Earth. The story implies the existence of a Bat-Mite Who Laughs - a godlike Imp who worships Batman’s darkest alternate reality. Literature ReviewBatman has faced an army of obsessed villains over his years fighting crime, but now that obsession is playing out on a cosmic scale.

item.title: Batman s Most Impressive Gadget Exists Thanks to 1 Surprising Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman nearly defeats the Batman of Zur-En-Arrh with a new gadget made from Killer Moth’s formula. The fire suppressant created by Batman is harder than steel and can trap enemies in foam. The new gadget is not effective against powerful enemies like Zur-En-Arrh, but it can aid Batman against other villains. Literature ReviewThanks to one unexpected Batman villain, the Dark Knight has a new gadget that could mean the difference between life and death in his latest fight.

item.title: Batman s New Barbed Alpha Wolf Is DC s Deadliest Pet Sidekick Yet
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman forms an unlikely alliance with a barbed alpha wolf on the desolate planet Akkari. The alpha wolf becomes the exception to Batman’s “No-Kill” rule, as he seemingly allows it to hunt and kill his adversaries in upcoming issues. The evolving relationship between Batman and his formidable super-pet adds an intriguing layer to the narrative, leaving fans eager to witness their deeper bond. Literature ReviewBatman’s new barbed alpha wolf may be the only member of the Bat-Family to whom the “No-Kill” rule doesn’t apply, and Red Hood is definitely jealous.

item.title: Batman s New Gadget Finally Makes Him Daredevil s Equal
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman has a new gadget in Batman: Gargoyle of Gotham that amplifies his hearing, giving him the ability to follow criminals and use a hearing ability similar to Marvel’s Daredevil. By using this gadget, Batman increases his hearing by 35% and can track down criminals even if they manage to escape. This new gadget is a game-changer for Batman, as it finally gives him the sonar ability that is synonymous with bats and enhances his street-level hero status.

item.title: Batman s New Laser Gauntlets Are the Power Upgrade He s Always Needed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s new laser gauntlets give him a fighting chance against his toughest opponent, but they’re not enough to defeat him. The gauntlets can cut through tree trunks like tissue paper, making them a formidable weapon against Batman’s enemies. While they may be overkill for most of Batman’s rogues gallery, the gauntlets would be a great asset when facing more powerful opponents, like those he faces with the Justice League.

item.title: Batman s New Nickname Confirms His Alien Girlfriend Is a Great Love Interest
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s new love interest, Ione, playfully nicknames him “Bird Boy,” adding to their connection. Ione’s nickname comes from the aliens’ misconception of Batman as a flightless bird due to his costume. Batman’s romance with Ione mirrors the dynamic between Starfire and Nightwing, adding intrigue to the story. Literature ReviewBatman’s Tamaranean girlfriend gives him an unexpected nickname that proves she’s going to be one of the Dark Knight’s best love interests.

item.title: Batman s New Origin Shows His Official First Battle with 1 Iconic Rogue
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe precise details Batman and Poison Ivy’s first meeting have been uncertain for some time, due to the constant universe resets in DC, but now DC is giving them a new origin story. The Origin of the Species storyline will conclude in Poison Ivy #21, with the climax to the arc exploring the dynamic between Ivy and the Caped Crusader, who have been perennial enemies, but also allies at times, over the years.

item.title: Batman s New Villain Is the First to Take Him Out with Just Three Punches
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCaptain Syyn, a new Batman villain, incapacitates the Dark Knight with just three punches, leaving readers eagerly anticipating their high-stakes showdown. Batman’s encounter with Captain Syyn highlights the need for him to learn how to combat extraterrestrial adversaries. The promised rematch between Batman and Captain Syyn will be a huge milestone for Bruce and reflects his evolving journey as Batman. Literature ReviewBatman’s new villain, Captain Syyn, the commander of the alien spacecraft the War Storm, is his most brutal yet and takes him out with three punches!

item.title: Batman s New Weapon Makes It Clear His No Kill Rule Is More of a Guideline
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman breaks his “no-kill” rule by using a high-tech chainsaw to eliminate a group of aliens. This exception to his moral code highlights Batman’s ethical boundary as a “don’t-kill-humans” rule. The hypocrisy of Batman’s stance is revealed, as he criticizes Red Hood for his lethal approach while making exceptions himself. Literature ReviewBatman gets his very own “Texas Chainsaw Massacre” moment, proving his no-kill rule is more of a guideline when it comes to his new weapon.

item.title: Batman s Origin Gets a Sick Twist That Makes Bruce the Bad Guy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman: Gargoyle of Gotham #2 reveals a dark twist that Bruce Wayne is the villain in his own origin story. Gotham City in this version lacks colorful villains but is plagued by brutal crimes, leading Batman to take extreme measures. This update to Batman’s origin shows a darker side of Bruce Wayne, where he gives in to his worst instincts and causes irreparable harm. Literature ReviewBatman’s tragic beginnings become darker than ever before with a twist that sees Bruce hunt down his parents’ killer and get violent revenge.

item.title: Batman s Superman-Beating Villain FAILSAFE Gets the Perfect Showcase in Ultra-Real Fanart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYArtist Kode Abdo has created an incredibly lifelike depiction of Failsafe, a lesser-known DC villain who nearly killed Batman and Superman. Abdo’s artwork sheds new light on Failsafe and sparks renewed interest for both new and old fans of the character. Fans can expect more detailed artwork of Failsafe from Abdo in the future. Literature ReviewA highly skilled artist has creatively reimagined Failsafe, Batman’s ultimate contingency plan turned villain, in a jaw-dropping piece of artwork.

item.title: Batman s Utility Belt Is Totally Useless Compared to Batgirl s Best Weapon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatgirl’s boots are her best weapon, as they can’t be easily stolen. Losing her utility belt doesn’t make Batgirl less dangerous; in fact, she becomes even more powerful without it. Batgirl is better at thinking on her feet and is more agile than Batman, making her a formidable opponent. Literature ReviewBatgirl literally puts her foot down when her utility belt is snatched, forcing her to reveal the one weapon greater than anything in Batman’s belt.
