Selina Kyle’s space adventure marks a significant phase of character growth for Catwoman, as she embarks on a perilous heist and undergoes a visual transformation in her pursuit of answers. The vibrant purple hue prominently featured in Selina’s space suit serves as a deliberate callback Catwoman’s rebranding in the 50s.

item.title: Chainsaw Man s Most Breathtaking Moment Has an Incredibly Dark Origin
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChainsaw Man uses the image of praying astronauts to evoke the fear of space and darkness, drawing a connection to real-life tragedies like the Apollo 1 incident. The bisected astronauts represent humanity’s lack of control over the unknown darkness of space, emphasizing the theme of fear in the manga. The image of fallen astronauts serves as a warning about the horrors of space and the importance of taking them seriously, aligning with Chainsaw Man’s overall thematic exploration of fear.

item.title: Charlie Brown Art Fixes How Every Movie Misunderstands His Design
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCharlie Brown’s iconic (and puzzling) hairstyle finally makes sense, thanks to a charming piece of fan art showing a more accurate depiction. The original Peanuts strips and Peanuts Movie misinterpret Charlie’s hair as one long strand, leading to assumptions about him being bald. Jokeb0i’s fan art clarifies Charlie’s hair, giving him a more average haircut (while still maintaining his familiar and beloved appearance). Literature ReviewCharlie Brown’s luck is turning around, as one amazing piece of fan art finally gives him a haircut that explains how the character should look.

item.title: Christopher Reeve s Superman 78 Canon Just Introduced Green Lantern
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman ‘78 introduces Green Lantern, expanding the Richard Donner Superman franchise and potentially setting the stage for a future Justice League. The pilot in the story strongly resembles Hal Jordan, leading to speculation that he could become the Green Lantern in this continuity. The addition of Green Lantern to Superman ‘78 suggests that more heroes may debut in the series, potentially forming their own Justice League. Literature ReviewThe ground is set for Green Lantern to join Superman’s film canon after Christopher Reeves’ Clark rescues a pilot that remarkably favors Hal Jordan.

item.title: Chrome Lantern Marvel & DC s Crossover Created a Totally New Kind of Green Lantern
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn the DC/Marvel crossover series JLA/Avengers, Kyle Rayner became DC’s first and only Chrome Lantern, thanks to the Cosmic Cube, making him possibly the strongest Lantern ever. The Cosmic Cube is one of the most powerful artifacts in the Marvel Universe, granting reality manipulation abilities. Kyle Rayner’s Chrome form made him the most powerful Lantern in the DC Universe, surpassing even his White Lantern form. Literature ReviewThe Lanterns are some of the most powerful groups that DC has to offer and they come in almost every color, but there was only one Chrome Lantern.

item.title: Clark Kent Owes His Career To His Biggest Source Lex Luthor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s career as a reporter was jumpstarted by information he received from his nemesis Lex Luthor, showcasing the ironic dynamic between the two characters. Clark Kent’s reporting plays a vital role in bringing down corrupt individuals, highlighting the importance of his journalistic identity alongside his superhero persona. Lex Luthor manipulates Clark’s reporting to further his own agenda, using it as a weapon to eliminate his competitors and gain control over Metropolis.

item.title: Classic Magical Girl Manga Returns With Special New Arc
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCardcaptor Sakura: Clear Card released its last chapter in Nakayoshi magazine on December 1. The manga will receive a “Special Arc” in the magazine’s April 2024 issue, which comes out on March 1. Cardcaptor Sakura: Clear Card has been serialized since 2016 and and is a follow-up series to CLAMP’s other work, Cardcaptor Sakura. IT received an anime adaptation in 2018. Literature ReviewKodansha’s Nakayoshi magazine announced that it will publish a “Special Arc” for Cardcaptor Sakura: Clear Card in its April 2024 issue.

item.title: Cobra Commander Debuts His Own Transformers, as G.I. Joe & Transformers Shared Continuity Pays Off
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCobra Commander #1 reveals that the future terrorist leader is using weapons derived from Transformers technology. The miniseries establishes that Cobra Commander hails from the underground civilization of Cobra-La, and has been conducting experiments on a captive Megatron. The introduction of Transformers tech into G.I. Joe lore cleverly ties the two franchises together and sets up exciting possibilities for future storylines. Literature ReviewCobra Commander has his own transforming weaponry in his new series, which the future Cobra leader uses to make a bloody mess of his enemies.

item.title: Cobra Commander Finally Kills a Beloved G.I. Joe Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYG.I. Joe: A Real American Hero #301 marks the start of a new era with a major character death at the hands of Cobra Commander. The decision to kill off Wade Collins fits with the poignancy of his story arc, according to writer Larry Hama. Hama admits to not planning out plots in advance and lets the characters write themselves, prioritizing consistent character development over specific plotlines. Literature ReviewIn Skybound’s G.

item.title: Cobra Commander Just Brought a Classic G.I. Joe Villain into New Continuity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCobra Commander will encounter various factions and villains in his search for Energon, including the Dreadnoks, who will pose a particular challenge. Zarana, the younger sister of Zartan and a master of disguise, will face off against Cobra Commander, adding an interesting dynamic to the story. It is likely that Cobra Commander will also come into conflict with other organizations, such as the M.A.R.S weapons manufacturing company and its leader, Destro, as he continues his quest for Energon.

item.title: Cobra Commander s New Origin Brings Back a Controversial 80s Twist on G.I. Joe Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCobra Commander #1 brings Cobra-La, a controversial element from G.I. Joe: The Movie, into the Energon Universe. The origins of Cobra Commander in the new continuity reveal that he is a wayward human adopted by the serpent-people of Cobra-La. Cobra Commander’s experiments on Megatron, and desire to find more Energon, lead him to leave Cobra-La in search of the power to create even greater weapons. Literature ReviewCobra Commander #1 reveals the G.

item.title: Cobra Commander vs Nemesis Enforcer Sets Up G.I. Joe s Ultimate Villain Fight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCobra Commander #4, set to be released in April, continues the story of Cobra Commander’s search for Energon and his encounter with classic G.I. Joe characters. The cover of Cobra Commander #4 teases the return of the controversial villain, the Nemesis Enforcer, but it is unclear whether he will be an ally or enemy to Cobra Commander. The Energon Universe series continues to surprise fans with shocking revelations and introduces new elements to the G.

item.title: Colossus Deserves Way More Credit for Being Worthy of Mjolnir
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYColossus’ ability to wield Mjolnir shows that he is pure of heart and ultimately good, despite recent actions calling into question his integrity. Colossus’ heroic nature is evident in his willingness to sacrifice himself for others, as seen in the Legacy Virus storyline. Although Colossus has recently fallen from grace, his kind-hearted warrior nature makes him one of Marvel’s most worthy heroes. Literature ReviewColossus just spent four years being puppeted and manipulated by his brother, but beneath that experience is a heart of a hero worthy of Mjolnir.

item.title: Colossus Is Redeemed & Cyclops Faces Death in First Look at X-Men s Last Stand
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Krakoan Era of X-Men, which began with House of X and Powers of X, is coming to an end after five years. Fall of the House of X and Rise of the Powers of X are interconnected series that will close out the Krakoan Era with a bang. The preview for Fall #1 reveals that Cyclops will face a trial by Orchis, while Colossus will make a heroic return after killing his brother.

item.title: Colossus vs Captain America Just Proved His Mutant Powers Are Way Too Underrated
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Wolverine #42, Colossus demonstrates his incredible strength and mutant abilities, surviving an assault from several Sabretooth variants, including one with the powers of Captain America. Colossus’s victory in the fight against Sabretooth’s army showcases that he is still a formidable hero, despite the manipulations and betrayals he has experienced. Colossus’s strength and resilience make him one of the few who may be able to help Wolverine defeat Victor Creed and bring an end to the “Sabretooth War.

item.title: Constantine Calls Out the Member of Sandman s Endless Who s Actually Scariest
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn Constantine finds the successor of Dream, Daniel Hall, even scarier than the original Dream due to his willingness to use people as pawns. Daniel is terrifying because he is not as ancient as the original Dream and still finds manipulating mortals thrilling. Constantine considers a “new” Endless with human memories and powers to be inherently terrifying due to the potential consequences of their passions. Literature ReviewConstantine has been involved with all manner of gods and monsters, but now he admits that one member of the Endless truly scares him.

item.title: Constantine s Answer to the Batmobile Is Absolutely Perfect (& Needs to Be in Any Movie Reboot)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn Constantine’s new ride reflects the negative impact he has on the people close to him, including his own son. Constantine’s choice of a Double-Decker bus is an attempt to keep a piece of his home with his son as he navigates through America. The gesture of using the bus as a means of transportation is an attempt to set things right and make amends for the harm Constantine has caused.

item.title: Cowboy Ghost Rider Cosplay Resurrects Marvel s Most Tragic Spirit of Vengeance
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThis remarkable Ghost Rider cosplay brings the iconic Trail of Tears iteration of the character to life, showcasing the potential for a cowboy Ghost Rider on the big screen in the process. The visual editing artistry and attention to detail in this cosplay elevate it to a true masterpiece, resembling a movie still. This cosplay pays tribute to the Ghost Rider: Trail of Tears comic series, highlighting a lesser-known Ghost Rider and encouraging fans to explore the many iconic Spirit of Vengeance storylines from throughout the history of the Marvel Universe.

item.title: Cowboy Superman Gives A New Explanation For His Red Underwear Uniform
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY“Cowboy Superman” is a refreshing and visually exciting concept that perfectly combines Old West fashion with the iconic Superman costume. Superman #10 serves as a bridge story, providing a stand-alone Old West adventure while also advancing the series arc and leading into the next crisis for the hero and his allies. The concept of Cowboy Superman should be further explored, as it offers a unique and invigorating aesthetic for the character, as shown most vividly in Jamal Campbell’s cover art.

item.title: Creepy Harley Quinn Cover Art Turns the Goofy Hero Into a Nightmarish Demon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHarley Quinn’s classic jester look makes a dark and unsettling comeback in the variant cover for Harley Quinn #37. This new variant cover showcases Harley wielding her iconic oversized mallet and wearing a creepy patchwork jester hat. The cover captures a more intimidating and terrifying side of Harley Quinn, proving that she can be just as unsettling as the Joker. Literature ReviewHarley Quinn has had some brave looks before, but a new variant cover gives her a frightening appearance that’s unsettling, but damn hardcore.

item.title: Cyberpunk Edgerunners Creator Gets Manga Serialized On Shonen Jump
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNo\Name, a manga by the writer of Cyberpunk: Edgerunners, won the first-ever Gold Award for MANGA Plus Creators, earning a monetary prize and the opportunity to be published by Shueisha. The manga is set in a world where the government chooses people’s names at birth, and follows the investigation of a mother and son’s mysterious disappearance. It has a suspenseful plot and a unique power system. The popularity of No\Name with over 2 million readers, led to its victory in the competition.

item.title: Cyborg s New Power Gives the Titans an Edge Even the Justice League Can t Match
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVictor is immune to the Star Conqueror spores because he is more machine than man, lacking the essential parts that the spore needs to latch onto and control him. Cyborg’s unique immunity to the spores makes him a valuable asset in the Beast World Crisis. Cyborg’s ability to create Boom Tubes also makes him an exceptionally unique hero. Literature ReviewCyborg is known for having capabilities that other heroes could only dream of, and his latest ability is sure to make some Justice Leaguers jealous.

item.title: Cyclops Son Is Defined by 1 Heartbreaking Phrase (According to Marvel)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCable’s tragic origin story, beginning with his early years as Nathan Summers, the son of X-Men leader Cyclops, have made him one of Marvel’s most complex figures. The decision to merge the characters of Nathan Summers and Cable created a unique dynamic with his father, Scott Summers; years later, the Kid Cable variant of the character offers the opportunity for the older Cable to guide and shape his younger self.

item.title: Cyclops Son Just Recruited Another Summers Family Member As His Official Sidekick
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCable recruits his younger self, Nate, as his sidekick, marking a major shift in their tumultuous relationship. Nate had previously killed Cable, believing he was damaging the timeline, but now they’ve reconciled and are working together. Cable saves Nate’s life as a way of returning the favor for Nate’s earlier efforts to resurrect him, allowing them to start anew on an adventure. Literature ReviewCyclops’ son, Cable, just got a new sidekick, and based on their Marvel Comics history, his choice is a shocking fellow member of the Summers family.

item.title: Cyclops is About To Be Replaced By [SPOILER] as X-Men s Ultimate Hero - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCypher’s power of omnilingualism may be crucial in Krakoa’s battle against the Enigma Dominion. Cypher’s ability to communicate with anything that uses language has only grown stronger over time. Cypher is confirmed to be part of Xavier’s newest squad and may play a key role in deciphering and understanding the Dominion’s plans. Literature ReviewThe hero Cypher, missing since Krakoa kidnapped him in Immortal X-Men #13, could prove crucial to the X-Men’s defeat of the coming Enigma Dominion.

item.title: Damian Wayne s Extreme Loyalty ALWAYS Leads to Batman s Downfall - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne’s intense loyalty to Batman often leads him down a dark path, causing more harm than good. Damian willingly joins the evil Batman Who Laughs, showing his unthinking loyalty to his father. Damian’s loyalty to Batman has been proven to lead him back into darkness, emphasizing the importance of him finding his own identity. Literature ReviewDamian Wayne is inarguably one of Batman’s most loyal Robins — and children — but Damian’s loyalty might just end up destroying them both.

item.title: Danny Rand Doesn t Need the Iron Fist to be a Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDanny Rand’s latest appearance in Luke Cage: Gang War proves he doesn’t need the Iron Fist to be a hero, showcasing his martial arts skills as a central part of the crossover event. As CEO of Rand Corporation, Danny has been a background character, but joining Luke Cage’s team allows him to shine again. The loss of his mystical powers opens up new storytelling possibilities for Danny Rand, highlighting his badass martial arts skills and hero’s heart, independent of the Iron Fist.

item.title: Daredevil Admits The One Reason He Really Shouldn t Be On The Avengers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil’s radar sense doesn’t work well in large-scale battles, as he finds himself in with the Avengers in Daredevil #5, making him question his place in the team. Chaotic environments heavily interfere with Daredevil’s radar sense, making it difficult for him to use his powers effectively. Daredevil operates best as a hero when working alone, as his powers are sensitive and work best under specific circumstances. Literature ReviewDaredevil is a major hero in the Marvel Universe, and like most major heroes, he eventually joined the Avengers, even if he admits he shouldn’t have.

item.title: Daredevil Cosplay Proves Simpler Is Better for the Man Without Fear
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA Daredevil cosplayer shows that simplicity is better when it comes to translating the classic costume into live-action. The iconic red costume with distinctive shading captures the essence of Daredevil’s design. Filmmakers should take inspiration from the cosplay and bring the classic red Daredevil to life on-screen. Literature ReviewA new cosplay brings Daredevil’s all-red costume from the comics to life brilliantly, beating out all previous live-action adaptations. There’s no question that Daredevil has one of the greatest superhero costumes of all time.

item.title: Daredevil Lives By One Famous Batman Quote
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil’s scheme to save his secret identity involves his fake twin brother confessing to being Daredevil on camera. Daredevil lives by Batman’s iconic line that criminals are a “superstitious, cowardly lot.” Criminals in New York fear Daredevil, showing that his use of fear as a symbol works just like Batman’s approach. Literature ReviewDaredevil is one of the greatest street-level heroes that Marvel has to offer, and part of that might just be because he follows one Batman rule.

item.title: Daredevil Proved His Radar Sense is Stronger Than Spider-Man s Spider-Sense
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil’s radar sense is stronger than Spider-Man’s spider-sense, providing him with a more specific and detailed understanding of threats. Daredevil’s radar sense allows him to quickly determine the exact threat, giving him an edge over Spider-Man in certain situations. While Spider-Man has more “super” powers, Daredevil’s radar sense ensures he is always aware of his surroundings and can avoid danger. Literature ReviewSpider-Man and Daredevil may be two of the greatest street-level Marvel heroes, but Daredevil has one slight advantage over Spider-Man.

item.title: Daredevil s Dog Pack Fight Can Give the MCU Its Most Brutal Fight Yet
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil faces a unique and dangerous fight against a group of rabid dogs who have been given the same powers as him. The fight showcases Daredevil’s ability to overcome his weaknesses and use his training to defeat the dogs without causing them harm. The twisted joke behind the fight is revealed, with Daredevil’s nemesis, Bullseye, using the dogs as a sick mockery of seeing-eye dogs to taunt him. Literature ReviewDaredevil has been in plenty of intense fights, but one particular brawl from an older comic took things to an absolutely absurd level.

item.title: Daredevil s Extreme 90s Armor Has a Secret Power That Protects His Identity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil’s black armor completely transforms his appearance, making him unrecognizable even to his closest nemesis, Kingpin. Matt Murdock’s acting skills and ninja training help him mislead others and further protect his secret identity. The black armor not only provides protection but also gives Daredevil a fresh start and a chance to reclaim his past. Literature ReviewDaredevil’s classic 90s black armor is back, and has just been revealed to have a secret power that any superhero would kill to possess.

item.title: Daredevil s New Identity Officially Makes Him Marvel s Best Exorcist
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil becomes the best exorcist in the Marvel Universe after successfully exorcising demons from both Elektra and Ben Urich. Daredevil’s newfound ability to see demons and cast them out follows his death and resurrection as a Catholic priest. Despite the promise of more demons to come, Daredevil is prepared and ready to face any challenges as Marvel’s go-to exorcist. Literature ReviewFollowing his death and resurrection, Daredevil’s latest series has officially becoming the best exorcist that the Marvel Universe has to offer.

item.title: Daredevil s Version of Kryptonite Is So Common, It s Surprising He Can Ever Fight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDaredevil’s biggest weakness, rain, severely reduces his powers by 95 percent, nullifying his sense of smell and hearing. In a fight with the villain Ikari, Daredevil attempts to trap him by luring him into a sporting goods store and activating the sprinkler system. Unfortunately, Ikari is not affected by the rain and is able to defeat Daredevil mercilessly, showcasing his abilities. Literature ReviewDaredevil is one of Marvel’s most powerful street-level heroes, but he has a weakness that is so common it’s surprising he can function at all.

item.title: Daredevil vs She-Hulk Is Rewriting Their MCU Romance as a Rivalry
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn the MCU, She-Hulk and Daredevil have a budding romance, but in the comics, their relationship is rewritten as a rivalry. Matt Murdock, now a priest, encounters She-Hulk at a store, which is awkward for him due to his different memories of his reborn life. Although Daredevil and She-Hulk may become rivals in the comics, their past indicates that their relationship, romantic or otherwise, is strong, meaning they will likely recover from this upcoming rivalry.

item.title: Dark Horse Examines Comics Most Notorious Figure in DR. WERTHLESS (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDr. Werthless: The Man Who Studied Murder delves into the controversial figure Dr. Fredric Wertham, exploring both his negative impact on the comic book industry and his desire to understand the causes of violence. The graphic novel provides a balanced portrayal of Wertham, highlighting his regressive views on comics while also acknowledging his progressive work in other areas and his attempts to improve the lives of disadvantaged individuals. Schechter and Powell’s collaboration aims to offer readers a better understanding of Wertham and the significant influence he had on the comic book world, showcasing his complex and multifaceted nature.

item.title: Dark Horses Creepy Urban Legend Series Returns with BLUE BOOK 1947 (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlue Book: 1947 returns to explore real accounts of people’s experiences with inexplicable phenomena, shedding light on the world’s mysteries. The first volume focused on Betty and Barney Hill’s alleged abduction, while also showcasing other urban legends and odd stories. While some may dismiss Kenneth Arnold’s sighting as a weather pattern, Blue Book: 1947 presents his account and lets readers decide for themselves. Highly entertaining and new-reader friendly. Literature ReviewScreen Rant has an exclusive preview of Blue Book: 1947, which digs into pilot Kenneth Arnold’s encounter with an unidentified flying object.

item.title: Dark Robin Hood Re-Imagining NOTTINGHAM Reaches Finale (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRobin Hood is portrayed as a murderer, looking out for himself and King Richard in Nottingham from Mad Cave Studios. The third and final volume of Nottingham will serve as the finale to the series, pitting the Sheriff against Robin as they battle for Nottingham. The creative team, including acclaimed letterer Justin Birch, has put in years of work to complete the series, promising action, twists, and new revelations in the concluding arc.

item.title: Darkest Hour, Day of Blood, Energon 2023 Proved Marvel & DC s Ambitious Storytelling Is Great For the Comic Book Industry
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel and DC have made major changes to their superhero titles in the past year, relaunching and rebooting many of their books, while overall focusing on telling stories of an increasingly grand scope. In 2023, Skybound Entertainment’s acquisition of Transformers and G.I. Joe led to a successful reboot of both franchises in the new Energon Universe. Boom! Studios’ Power Rangers comics have redefined the series by telling more mature stories, including the year-long event called “Darkest Hour,” which promises to have a franchise-altering impact.

item.title: Darkhawk & Night Thrasher Cosplay Resurrects the Ultimate 90s Heroes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKnightmage100 brings 90s heroes Darkhawk and Night Thrasher to life in stunning cosplays. Darkhawk and Night Thrasher embody the spirit of Marvel in the 1990s, still relevant today. Knightmage100’s cosplays introduce these characters to a new generation of fans, keeping them alive. Literature ReviewIt may be tempting to write Darkhawk and Night Thrasher off as dated relics, but a new cosplay shows these character’s potential. New cosplays of Darhawk and Night Thrasher have resurrected the ultimate 90s heroes.

item.title: Darkseid vs Gog DC s Ultimate Gods of Evil Just Went to War
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC villain Gog wants a glorious end, in order to earn his place in Heaven, and plans to fight Darkseid to achieve it, even if this has disasterous consequences for the rest of the DC Universe. Darkseid is willing to fight Gog because he possesses the Anti-Life Equation, something Darkseid desires. Batman/Superman: World’s Finest #23 finally reaches the long-awaited intense confrontation between Gog and Darkseid, with high stakes for both characters.

item.title: Darkseid vs Mister Mxyzptlk Fanart Settles Which of DC s Cosmic Gods Would Win
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKerry Callen’s artwork hilariously portrays Mister Mxyzptlk defeating Darkseid by turning him into a giant baby. Callen’s interpretation is supported by canonical comic storylines, such as the Emperor Joker storyline, where Darkseid surrenders to Mxyzptlk’s powers. However, a notable exception in the canon shows Darkseid defeating Mister Mxyzptlk in DCeased: War of the Undead Gods, highlighting the weakness in Mxyzptlk’s character. Literature ReviewA hilarious fanart emerges to finally settle the age-old debate of who would emerge victorious in a battle between DC’s Darkseid and Mister Mxyzptlk.

item.title: Darkwing Ducks Justice Ducks Assemble in Preview of New Disney Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarkwing Duck’s hero team, the Justice Ducks, will be getting their own spin-off comic series in 2024. The Justice Ducks have had rare appearances, making this series highly anticipated for Disney fans. The team will be facing a new threat from a team of aliens. Literature ReviewThe Disney Afternoon superhero team, the Justice Ducks will finally get a chance to shine in comics, with their own series from Dynamite Comics.

item.title: Darth Vader & Grand Admiral Thrawn Unite in First Look at THRAWN ALLIANCES Adaptation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGrand Admiral Thrawn and Darth Vader team up to confront a threat to the Empire in Thrawn: Alliances, which also explores their first encounter during the Clone Wars. The Thrawn: Alliances comic adaptation, written by Timothy Zahn and Jody Houser, provides fans with parallel stories set before the original Star Wars trilogy. The preview reveals the contrasting personalities of Thrawn and Vader, as well as their different approaches to leadership, adding new depth to these iconic Star Wars villains.

item.title: Darth Vader & Thrawn s Shared Backstory Makes Galaxy s Edge Way Cooler
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThrawn and Vader have visited Black Spire Outpost before, as depicted in Star Wars: Thrawn Alliances. The evidence of their battle can be seen in Oga’s Cantina at Disneyland’s Galaxy’s Edge, adding a realistic touch to the Star Wars-themed land. Thrawn and Vader’s mission to protect the Empire from the Grysk Hegemony has only just begun in Thrawn Alliances. Literature ReviewGrand Admiral Thrawn’s shared history with Darth Vader during the Dark Times of the Star Wars canon makes Disneyland’s Galaxy’s Edge even cooler.

item.title: Darth Vader Finally Has His Own Chewbacca, As the M.A.R. Corps Join the Empire
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarth Vader introduces his own team of cyborg warriors, the Machine Augmented Rebel Corps (M.A.R Corps), to aid him in his dark agenda. The M.A.R. Corps are unique in that they possess different skills and capabilities, making them less predictable than the Empire’s identical forces. Vader now has complete control over the M.A.R. Corps, combining their total obedience with their formidable combat skills, making them potentially his ultimate weapon.

item.title: Darth Vader Is Replacing His Death Troopers With [SPOILER]
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Darth Vader comic series reveals the Dark Lord’s intention to replace his Death Troopers with superior agents he can fully control. Vader plans to corrupt Rebellion cyborg warriors and reprogram their mechanical components to ensure their compliance. The new soldiers will be more deadly and dangerous than Death Troopers, and they will be under Vader’s complete command, incapable of betrayal. Literature ReviewDarth Vader is making a change following a massive Death Trooper betrayal in the Star Wars canon, replacing them with brand new agents.

item.title: Darth Vader Is Upgrading His Death Troopers... By Removing Their Free Will
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarth Vader plans to remove the free will of his Death Troopers to ensure they never betray him again. Vader’s Death Troopers were carefully chosen and created by him, but their loyalty was ultimately to Palpatine. If successful, Vader will have more intimidating and loyal Death Troopers that are solely his tools alone. Literature ReviewDarth Vader is planning to correct a major mistake with his fearsome Death Troopers in the Star Wars canon, and the solution is extremely dark.

item.title: Darth Vader Puts a Dark Twist on Superman s Most Iconic Comic Cover in Inspired Fanart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNew fanart remixes Superman’s iconic comic cover with Darth Vader, giving fans a humorous twist on the characters. @starwarsphotoshop on Instagram creates clever and amusing images that combine Star Wars with meme culture, garnering a large following. The fanart replaces Superman on the Action Comics #1 cover with Darth Vader, highlighting the Force abilities of the Dark Lord and creating a fun crossover for fans to enjoy. Literature ReviewAction Comics #1 introduced Superman to the nerd culture, with new cover fanart replacing Big Blue with Darth Vader in a dark twist fans need to see.

item.title: Darth Vader s Forgotten Force Power Is Even More Powerful Than the Original Trilogy Showed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarth Vader’s Force-choking abilities were showcased in Star Wars: Episode V, but they received a major upgrade in the recent Star Wars: Darth Vader #41 comic. In the comic, Vader uses a viral AI hivemind called the Scourge to control nearby infected droids. He attacks Storm Troopers using their eyes as his visual connection, eliminating a whole strike team effortlessly with remote Force attacks. This highlights the extent of Vader’s ability to use the Force from a distance, revealing that in his hands, a camera can be the deadliest weapon in all of Star Wars.

item.title: Darth Vader s Forgotten Green Lightsaber Almost Redeemed Him, Long Before Luke
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarth Vader’s struggle with the Dark Side was a constant battle, and he considered striking down Palpatine and begging Obi-Wan for forgiveness. Bleeding Jedi Master Kirak Infil’a’s green lightsaber gave Vader a glimpse of an alternate path. In the end, Vader fought against choosing the path of light, and it was only through the return of his son that he found the strength to embrace redemption. Literature ReviewWhile Darth Vader was eventually saved by Luke Skywalker, he actually considered betraying Palpatine while wielding a green lightsaber.

item.title: Darth Vader s New Sith Science Proves He d Have Been a More Terrifying Emperor Than Palpatine
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarth Vader’s Sith science experiments on living organisms reveal how he would handle ruling the galaxy, making him a more terrifying Emperor than Palpatine. Vader’s mastery over the Scourge virus allows him to assimilate droids and cyborgs, granting him control over their actions and thoughts, which inspires him to create his own version of assimilation. By blending technology and the dark side of the Force, Vader seeks to infect the minds of the living to eliminate individualism and assert his dominance over everyone, making him a Sith heretic and a worse option for Emperor than Palpatine.

item.title: Darth Vader Turned His Armor from Junk to Superweapon After Empire Strikes Back
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarth Vader’s suit was destroyed by Emperor Palpatine after Star Wars: Episode V - The Empire Strikes Back. Vader had to rebuild his suit with outdated droid parts that amounted to little more than junk. Darth Vader has made so many upgrades to his suit since then that he can now remotely control droids and cyborgs through it - and all of this happened between the events of Empire Strikes Back and Return of the Jedi.

item.title: DC & Marvel s Two Best New Characters of the Year Were BORN to Cross Over
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC and Marvel fans are already hyped over the idea of a crossover between recently introduced characters City Boy and the Impossible City, as both characters have unique powers that complement each other. City Boy has already interacted with famous DC characters and cities, showcasing his dynamic powers in his own ongoing series. The Impossible City, a sentient city and the Avengers’ new base, joined Earth’s Mightiest Heroes in the latest Avengers issue, and offers rich storytelling potential as a unique type of Marvel hero.

item.title: DC Artist Admits Where Fans Can Find Hidden Doctor Who Reference
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAcclaimed artist Bruno Redondo reveals a hidden Doctor Who Easter egg in the Injustice comic series, delighting fans with its subtle brilliance. Redondo artfully depicts the Tower of Fate in Injustice to mirror a scene from Doctor Who, showcasing his love for both fandoms. With his attention to detail and commitment to storytelling, Redondo’s clever homage is sure to be appreciated by fans of both DC and Doctor Who.

item.title: DC Calls Out the Justice League s Biggest Failure, Going Back to 1985
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBizarro returns and is furious over the continuous crises in the multiverse. Bizarro invades the Sorcerer’s World and gains a powerful magical upgrade. Bizarro reveals that Bizarro World has gone missing due to the ongoing crises, and other DC realities are at risk of disappearing too. Literature ReviewSuperman discovers he Justice League’s inability to stop multiverse-wide calamities is having serious consequences when one world suddenly disappears. Warning! Spoilers ahead for Action Comics #1061!

item.title: DC Calls Out the Titans Biggest Weakness - Why They Can t Actually Replace the Justice League
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Titans’ compassion and emotional ties make them vulnerable and compromise their ability to prioritize the greater good over individual lives. Sargent Steel criticizes the Titans for prioritizing the safety of Gar over the potential fate of the entire world. Batman’s leadership would prioritize civilians and containing Beast Boy, highlighting the differences between the Titans and the Justice League. Literature ReviewThe Titans have a HUGE weakness that’s preventing them from being on the same level as the Justice League and could lead to disaster in the DCU.

item.title: DC Confirms a Major Arkhamverse Villain Died Before KILL THE JUSTICE LEAGUE
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOne of the rumored playable characters in Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League , Victor Zsasz, is confirmed to have been killed off in Suicide Squad: Kill Arkham Asylum #1. Fans have sparked heated debates over the demise of Victor Zsasz, with some expressing satisfaction while others find it trivial and undeserving for such an iconic Gotham villain. Despite his death, players can still acquire the Victor Zsasz Weapon Doll as a tribute to the character in Suicide Squad: Kill the Justice League .

item.title: DC Confirms an Iconic Titan Is Powerful Enough to Destroy Earth (& It s Not Raven)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTitans’ member Cyborg’s “boom tubes” have the potential to cause catastrophic global damage, making him a much bigger threat than imagined. In Titans: Beast World #1, Cyborg reveals the extent of his boom tubes’ power-level, capable of destroying planets in moments. Despite his immense power, Cyborg’s altruistic choices keep him on the side of heroes, making him one of DC’s most powerful Titans. Literature ReviewThe Titans have an incredible line-up of capable, powerful members, yet one among their ranks has the ability to throw whole planets out of alignment.

item.title: DC Confirms Batman s Definitive Love Interest (& It s Not Catwoman)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s true love is not a person but the ideal of Gotham City, which he is committed to saving. Batman’s difficulty in maintaining relationships is due to his unwavering devotion to Gotham, which takes precedence over everything else. Batman’s extreme actions, such as willingly enduring brutalization by alien mercenaries, demonstrate his single-minded dedication to protecting Gotham at any cost. Literature ReviewDC confirms Batman’s one true love is an ideal, not a person, and factoring this in makes Bruce Wayne’s many failed romances make much more sense.

item.title: DC Confirms Every Green Lantern Could Easily Be Replaced by ONE Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Lantern Corps faces dramatic changes as United Planets takes over; Corps leaders believe Superman can replace all of them. Earth’s Lanterns uncomfortable with being reassigned, while Sector 2814 is quarantined; Corps’ new leaders question the need for Earth’s Lanterns. United Planets’ decision raises questions about their intentions; Green Lanterns determined to uncover the truth and protect their home sector. Literature ReviewThe Green Lanterns get new bosses who reveal the Corps’ greatest officers are nothing compared to one particularly mighty DC Universe icon.

item.title: DC Confirms How John Constantine s Story Will End - & It s the Tragedy He Deserves
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn Constantine’s heart has stopped beating, and his body is decaying. If he dies, there won’t be an afterlife waiting for him. Constantine has been banned from both Heaven and Hell, so his soul will be obliterated if he dies. Constantine must solve the mystery of his decaying body and gather allies to avoid being found dead in America. Literature ReviewJohn Constantine is a man who’s spent his life constantly one step from death, and part of that is because of what is waiting for him when he dies.

item.title: DC Confirms Red Hood Is Batman s 1 True Successor... By Making Them Both Werewolves
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman and Red Hood both transform into werewolves in the Beast World event, highlighting their similarities as characters, and showcasing why Jason Todd is at the top of the list of potential successors to the Batman mantle. Beast World exposes the true nature and core traits of characters in the DC Universe, with unpredictable transformations and uncontrollable animalistic changes making for a thrilling crossover event. Red Hood has frequently been at odds with Batman, as they share similar core traits, passionate determination, and drive, making Red Hood Batman’s closest parallel and potential successor.

item.title: DC Confirms the Official Origin of Superman s Symbol - & It s a Win for DCEU Fans
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe iconic Superman shield is inspired by a river on Krypton, symbolizing hope and resilience. The river analogy reflects Superman’s unwavering hope and perseverance throughout his life. The crest’s history, both in the DCEU and comics, adds depth and power to Superman’s symbol. Literature ReviewSuperman’s iconic shield is one of the most popular images in the world, but the crest for the House of El had a history long before it came to Earth.

item.title: DC Confirms the Scariest Justice League Member (And No, It s Not Batman)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman is revealed to be the scariest member of the Justice League, with no exploitable weaknesses and the ability to become unstoppable when enraged. Despite being known as a warrior princess, Wonder Woman is an agent of peace who prefers to avoid violence if possible. The Birds of Prey’s confrontation with Wonder Woman on Themyscira is bound to be terrifying for them, as she has every right to be angry with them for infiltrating her home.

item.title: DC Confirms Why the Teen Titans Historic Name Change Was So Essential
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Teen Titans are still struggling to work as a team, and their immaturity gets in the way of their success. A rejected Teen Titan, Haywire, takes advantage of the team’s internal conflicts and takes them down. The Titans: Beast World event will showcase the growth of the Titans as they take on Justice League-level threats. Literature ReviewWhile the Titans deal with gross transformations, intergalactic issues, and adult drama, the original Teen Titans are busy acting like kids.

item.title: DC Debuts the Son of an Iconic Gotham Villain - As a Major Threat to Robin
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne faces a new challenge as he deals with a bully who is connected to the notorious killer Victor Zsasz. Damian suspects his new principal, who is also the school’s soccer coach, to be the villain Shush and investigates further. The son of Victor Zsasz, Zach, reveals plans to reunite with his father and unleash havoc on Gotham, making Robin’s job even more difficult. Literature ReviewA new villainous legacy is revealed as Robin discovers one of his new schoolmates is the son of one of the biggest psychopaths in Gotham.

item.title: DC Finally Admits It Doesn t Know What It s Doing with Harley Quinn
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHarley Quinn questions her purpose in the DC Universe, feeling uncertain about her ultimate role. The lack of consistency in Harley’s characterization compared to other DC characters is acknowledged. DC needs to define and establish what Harley Quinn truly represents and stands for in order to bring clarity to the character. Literature ReviewHarley Quinn might be outrageously popular, but she’s taking a pause to ask herself what is is that truly defines her in the DC Universe.

item.title: DC Finally Admits the Truth About Flash s Speed Force - Now Fans Can Stop Fighting
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Flash #3 confirms that there is still more to the Speed Force, even for experienced speedsters like Wally West. The Speed Force, introduced in the mid-1990s, has evolved over time and has become a fundamental force in the DC Universe. The Speed Force is constantly changing and moving, reflecting the nature of the Flash himself and keeping the DC Universe dynamic. Literature ReviewThe Speed Force is the source of the Flash’s powers, but even he and other speedsters like Max Mercury are not sure how it works.

item.title: DC Finally Brings Back Its Most Underrated Sci-Fi Team (Who Debuted in 1957)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC is bringing back the underrated sci-fi team, Challengers of the Unknown, in the new Outsiders book. The Challengers of the Unknown, created by Jack Kirby, have a long and influential history in DC Comics. The Challengers will play a role in protecting and assisting the Outsiders in their mission to study the secret history of the DC Universe. Literature ReviewIn a preview for Outsiders #2, Batwoman and her new colleagues encounter one of DC’s oldest, and most underrated, teams.

item.title: DC Is Finally Done Treating Wonder Woman s Scariest Villain as a Joke
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman faces a new threat from the secret king of America, the Sovereign, who is turning the public against her. Amanda Waller plans to assemble a team of Wonder Woman’s greatest villains to take her down, including Doctor Psycho, a powerful psychic with misogynistic beliefs. Wonder Woman may be able to defeat Doctor Psycho in a one-on-one battle, but his mental attacks combined with the other villains may prove to be a challenge for her.

item.title: DC Is Quietly Rebalancing the Justice League to Make Them Equals
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Justice League’s staple members are experiencing massive power shifts, putting them on a more even playing field with Superman. The Flash can access reality from every angle and potentially break the natural laws of the universe. Batman’s upgrades include a superpowered cyborg hand and defeating an android enemy even Superman couldn’t defeat. Literature ReviewWith the Justice League currently restructuring, its heroes are all leveling up — meaning the hierarchy within the League is about to change.

item.title: DC Is Revisiting a Pivotal Green Arrow Story (With the Perfect Twist)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOnomatopoeia, one of the most brutal villains Green Arrow has ever faced, has returned in the most recent Green Arrow, in a storyline that directly parallels his initial appearance. The return of Onomatopoeia marks a major shift in the trajectory of Green Arrow’s storyline, and appears set to push Connor Hawke, Oliver Queen’s son, to the next evolution in his hero career. The connections betweenOnomatopoeia’s appearance in Green Arrow #8 and the villains debut in Kevin Smith’s influential Green Arrow run from the early 2000s brings an iconic story full circle.

item.title: DC Just Crowned the Most Unexpected Robin in Gotham History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVelma Dinkley’s detective skills and intelligence make her a worthy addition to Batman’s Family, as one of the many characters to fill the role of Robin. Velma’s abilities, including her quick learning in hand-to-hand combat, would make her an invaluable asset to Batman if given access to his tech as Robin. The Batman & Scooby-Doo Mysteries comic series offers both wacky and nuanced character moments, with Velma’s potential as Robin being a stroke of genius that should lead to its own spin-off.

item.title: DC Just Killed Off a Beloved Green Lantern (& It s Hal Jordan s Fault)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHal Jordan’s actions have resulted in the death of Kilowog, the Green Lantern Corps’ drill sergeant. Sinestro’s transformation into a Red Lantern has made him more aggressive and dangerous than ever before. The death of Kilowog has had a significant impact on the Green Lantern Corps, as he was a valuable resource and trainer for new recruits. Literature ReviewAfter months of mystery, events from Green Lantern’s past come to light as Hal Jordan reveals he played a part in the death of his friend Kilowog.

item.title: DC Just Turned Flash s Most Underrated Villain into One of His Best Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Flash’s old enemy, the Folded Man, returns with a powerful upgrade, making him a legitimate threat. The Folded Man has the ability to fold realities around his opponents and trap them in terrifying dimensions. With his new powers, the Folded Man could potentially eliminate DC Universe heroes like Wonder Woman and Superman, posing a significant danger. Literature ReviewFlash’s old nemesis the Folded Man returns with a surprisingly powerful upgrade that could turn him into the next Justice League-level threat.

item.title: DC Just Turned Santa Claus into Its Answer to Thor... And It Actually Works
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSanta Claus in the DC Universe is depicted as a mythical craftsman who rode alongside the Norse gods during the Wild Hunt. DC’s version of Santa Claus has a strong connection to Odin, similar to Marvel’s Thor, and has a mischievous associate in the Krampus. The introduction of Santa Claus as a Thor-like character with a rich backstory filled with gods and battles is an inspired idea that adds depth to the character in the DC Universe.

item.title: DC Officially Admits Michael Keaton s Batsuit Has an Unforgivable Flaw
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman #140 calls out the flaw in Michael Keaton’s Batman ‘89 Batsuit for its stiff neck, which limited head movement. The Batsuit’s lack of mobility puts Batman at a major disadvantage in combat, as shown when Bruce easily kicks the ‘89 Zur-En-Arrh in the back of the head. This comic serves as a reminder that Batman’s costume design should prioritize mobility and reduce limitations to maximize his abilities. Literature ReviewAs Batman takes on an army of twisted variants, he points out the greatest disadvantage found in Michael Keaton’s Batsuit from the 1989 film.

item.title: DC Officially Closes the Lore Gap Between the Arkham Games & Suicide Squad Kill the Justice League
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman continues to operate as normal in the Arkhamverse, even after his secret identity is exposed. Batman has joined the Arkhamverse’s version of the Justice League. The tie-in comic may explore the fate of the rest of the Bat-Family after Batman’s identity is revealed. Literature ReviewAfter the ending of Arkham Knight there were a ton of questions that players still had, and now it seems DC has finally answered most of them.

item.title: DC Officially Debuts the Codename of Its Next Generation of Heroes (Batman, Superman & Wonder Woman s Kids)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman’s daughter Trinity comes up with the name “Gen-S” for their team, inspired by the Kryptonian symbol for hope. The new generation of DC heroes, including Elizabeth, Damian, and Jon, want to build on their parents’ legacy and become symbols of hope. The name “Gen-S” reflects the idea that these heroes can make the DC Universe a better place through their unique qualities and shared mission. Literature ReviewSuperman, Wonder Woman, and Batman’s kids finally decide on the perfect team name that eloquently sums up what the future heroes are all about.

item.title: DC Officially Names the Titans 2 Most Powerful Members
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTitans Starfire and Donna Troy are the most powerful members of the team. They are at the greatest risk of being infected by Beast Boy’s spores. If they are turned, the Titans will have to focus on stopping their friends instead of ending the chaos. Literature ReviewAs “Beast World” rages on, two Titans are recognized for their strengths. But a new development in the unfolding chaos hints at the danger they’re in.

item.title: DC Officially Unveils Commissioner Gordon s Replacement in Huge Change to Gotham
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVandal Savage aims to become Gotham’s new police commissioner, with the backing of a secret society interested in controlling the city. Savage’s act of murder impresses Leonid Kull, who offers funding and support to ensure Savage gets the position. The Court of Owls, a secret order dedicated to controlling Gotham, is likely behind Savage’s rise to power, making him a dangerous threat to Batman and the city. Literature ReviewThe DC Universe is about to get a lot darker now that Vandal Savage is stuck in Gotham and gaining allies that want to make him the new Commissioner.

item.title: DC Promises to Banish Batman from Gotham City with 1 Heartbreaking Move
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Orgham family, tied to the founding of Gotham, is attempting to erase Batman from the city’s history using a Reality Engine and a public execution to destroy his legacy forever. The Orghams view Batman as a problem and believe he shouldn’t have existed, targeting his legacy within Gotham’s history. If the Orgham family succeeds, Batman will be alone without his family or legacy, and it is uncertain how he will recover from this defeat.

item.title: DC Revealed The Real Reason Superman Will Never Outrace Flash
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFlash’s power comes from the Speedforce, giving him the ability to run forever, while Superman’s power comes from the sun, and therefore are limited in a way Flash’s are not. Superman will eventually lose his powers if he uses them too much, while Flash will always have access to his super speed, as long as he’s connected to the Speedforce. In a race between Superman and Flash, Flash will always have the edge due to his higher top speed and endurance provided by the Speedforce.

item.title: DC Revealed Which Marvel Character Would Make the Perfect Green Lantern
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC’s Green Lanterns derive their power from imagination and will, and Marvel s Tony Stark has proven that his creativity would make him an incredibly powerful Green Lantern. Tony Stark’s genius inventiveness is unparalleled in the Marvel Universe, making him capable of creating astounding constructs with a power ring, as the JLA/Avengers crossover proved. If Tony Stark had a power ring of his own, he would surpass all other Green Lanterns in power, potentially becoming DC’s most powerful hero.

item.title: DC Reveals How a Beloved Green Lantern Died - & Whether Hal Jordan Is Responsible
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHal Jordan takes responsibility for Kilowog’s death, but it is revealed that he is not actually responsible. Hal is suffering from survivor’s guilt over Kilowog’s death and is struggling to forgive himself. Green Lantern may seek closure by investigating the cause of the explosion and seeking justice for his friend. #GreenLantern Literature ReviewAfter months of speculation, the events behind Kilowog’s death are revealed and shed light on how culpable Green Lantern Hal Jordan really is.

item.title: DC Reveals the Return of Green Arrow s Most Underused and Mysterious Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOnomatopoeia, a notorious and murderous DC villain, returns in Green Arrow #7, promising a thrilling and explosive resurgence. The return of Onomatopoeia raises intriguing questions about his role in the narrative, inviting speculation about potential connections to Amanda Waller or whether he operates independently. Onomatopoeia’s emergence as a central antagonist sparks anticipation for long-awaited answers to lingering questions surrounding his deep-seated hatred for the Arrow-Family. Literature ReviewDC unveils the return of one of Green Arrow’s most murderous adversaries, a character who has long held a cryptic vendetta against the Arrow-Family.

item.title: DC Reveals Wonder Woman s Past and a Timely Blue Beetle Story in New YA Titles
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJaime Reyes makes his YA graphic novel debut as Blue Beetle, tackling contemporary issues that resonate with the Latinx community, set in his hometown of El Paso, Texas. Wonder Woman’s graphic novel explores her younger self’s quest for truth and justice as she uncovers hidden history in Themyscira. DC Comics continues its trend of introducing classic characters to young readers with original stories, expanding its youth offerings. Literature ReviewDC has announced two titles — one starring a young Diana and another starring Jaime Reyes — in its massively popular Young Adult graphic novel line.

item.title: DC s 90s Wonder Girl Gets the Perfect New Street-Wear Costume for a New Era
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Girl Cassie Sandsmark returns with a new costume that combines street-wear vibes with a ’90s aesthetic. The ensemble features a jean jacket adorned with patches, a turtleneck crop top, and black leggings. Young Justice fans may recognize the turtleneck, reminiscent of Cassie’s signature look in the final arc of the animated TV series. Literature ReviewWonder Girl Cassie Sandsmark returns to her ’90s roots with the perfect new costume, bringing back the spunk that defined her character.

item.title: DC s 10 Most Terrifying Knight Terrors Variant Covers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKnight Terrors delivered some of DC’s most intense variant covers yet, showcasing iconic heroes and villains in horrifying scenarios. Variant covers for issues throughout the crossover captured the surreal nature of the event, paving the way for some of the scariest variant covers in DC’s history. From Harley Quinn covered in spiders to Batman’s darkest fears, the Knight Terrors event offered haunting and unsettling images that will leave a lasting impression.

item.title: DC s Black Adam vs Shazam Rivalry Is Changed Forever by 1 Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlack Adam’s rivalry with Shazam has changed forever after a bone-chilling threat, altering their dynamic. Black Adam has evolved into more of an anti-hero, willing to use lethal force, creating tension between him and the Captain. Black Adam’s threat implies a sense of finality, suggesting that their next fight will be their last and introducing a darker dynamic between them. Literature ReviewThe rivalry between Black Adam and Shazam may have cooled in recent years, but now DC has flipped the script on it, making it even darker.

item.title: DC s Dark Future Revealed How to Beat Joker Without Killing Him (But It s Incredibly Bleak)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKilling the Joker isn’t the only solution to stopping him; the Justice Lords in an alternate universe solve the problem by lobotomizing him. Superheroes struggle with dealing with unrepentant criminals like the Joker; while killing them may seem like an option, it can lead to slippery slopes and former heroes turning to villainy. The Joker remains a major problem in the DCU, and while lobotomizing him may be effective, true heroes like Batman would unlikely go that far to stop him.

item.title: DC s Deadliest Green Lantern Is the Protégé of a Major Gotham Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCuraré, a deadly assassin trained by Ra’s al Ghul, becomes a Green Lantern unlike any seen before. Curaré’s ability to steal her brother’s power ring and wield it with her willpower makes her extremely dangerous. As DC’s deadliest Green Lantern, Curaré could become the most dangerous woman in the entire DC universe. Literature ReviewThe Green Lantern Corps is made up of thousands of sentient beings from different backgrounds, but one surprise Corps member has a very lethal origin.

item.title: DC s Loneliest Hero 1 Justice League Member Admits They Regret Never Having a Sidekick
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Lantern confesses his regret over never having a child or sidekick, adding emotional depth to his character. Hal Jordan’s desire for a child could lead to a narrative shift and redefine his role as a parent or mentor. The exploration of parenthood or mentorship for Green Lantern would bring fresh challenges and complexities to his storyline. Literature ReviewThe Justice League’s loneliest hero admits their regret of never having kids or a sidekick, revealing an extremely rare show of vulnerability.

item.title: DC s Misunderstood Wonder Woman Is the Perfect High Fantasy Anti-Hero in New Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC Comics unveils epic high-fantasy variant cover for upcoming Batman: The Brave and the Bold comic featuring Artemis of Bana-Mighdall. The artistic masterpiece by Francesco Mattina promises a visual feast for fans, offering a glimpse into the action-packed adventure of Batman and Artemis. Mattina’s high-fantasy rendition of Artemis draws an uncanny parallel to the captivating concept art featured in the expansive realm of the popular open-world game, World of Warcraft.

item.title: DC s Most Fashionable Justice League Member Officially Joins the Birds of Prey
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVixen joins the Birds of Prey to help the team tackle a mysterious villain attacking them through time. Vixen’s versatile powers make her a valuable addition to the team and she has been a key member of other superhero groups in the past. The new Birds of Prey lineup has been bringing attention to lesser-known characters, and Vixen is set to shine in the upcoming issue. Literature ReviewThe Birds of Prey are being hunted through time by a mysterious villain, and in order to solve the mystery, they must turn to none other than Vixen.

item.title: DC s Most Powerful Team Make the Justice League Look Like Understudies
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCaptain Atom Brigade is a team composed entirely of variants of Captain Atom, making them far stronger than the Justice League. Monarch struggles against the team of Captain Atoms, needing to use almost his full power to defeat them. Captain Atom’s massive list of powers makes him incredibly powerful, and the potential of an entire team of Captain Atoms surpasses the Justice League. Literature ReviewThe Justice League is full of the strongest heroes DC has to offer, but one virtually unheard-of team easily puts the Justice League to shame.

item.title: DC s Most Underrated Batgirl Is Movie Ready - & This Stephanie Brown Cosplay Proves It
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStephanie Brown’s portrayal as Batgirl is often overlooked, but cosplayer pixiequinncosplay brings her to life beautifully. Stephanie Brown’s time as Batgirl was cut short and erased from continuity, but she remains a fan-favorite character. Although it’s uncertain if Batgirl will appear in James Gunn’s DCU, having Stephanie Brown in the role would be a bold and exciting choice. Literature ReviewStephanie Brown is the most underrated Batgirl, and pixiequinncosplay has crafted a movie-quality cosplay.

item.title: DC s Most Underrated Green Lantern Gets the Godlike Redesign He Always Deserved
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKyle Rayner, the most underrated Green Lantern, returns with a God-like redesign, bringing his journey full-circle. A multiversal version of Kyle emerges as he communicates with John through an ominous voice, indicating a different universe origin. Kyle’s tragedy of apparent blindness is repurposed as he becomes a powerful blind prophet, solidifying his status as the most powerful Green Lantern. Literature ReviewThe most underrated human to hold a Green Lantern ring just returned with the perfect Godlike redesign that brings his journey full circle.

item.title: DC s Most Underrated Green Lantern Shines in a Tribute to His 90s Debut
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVariant cover for Green Lantern #8 pays tribute to beloved Green Lantern Kyle Rayner, showcasing his amazing past and confident future. Current Green Lantern books have focused on Hal Jordan and John Stewart, leaving Kyle Rayner fans wanting more. This cover gives him the spotlight he deserves. Shaner’s artwork serves as a wonderful tribute to the underrated Green Lantern, reminding fans of his significant contributions to the franchise. Literature ReviewBeloved Green Lantern Kyle Rayner finally gets his chance to shine on an amazing new variant cover that pays tribute to the hero’s beginnings.

item.title: DC s Multiverse Is Too Dangerous to Exist According to 1 VERY Convincing Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC villain Gog argues that the existence of the Multiverse brings about more harm than good, considering the destruction and heartache it causes. The Multiverse in DC Comics is often portrayed as a place where villains and evil versions of heroes emerge, rather than a source of infinite heroes and utopian worlds. Characters like The Batman Who Laughs and Superboy-Prime, who come from the Multiverse, have only brought destruction, and become threats to the mainstream DC Universe because of their knowledge of it.

item.title: DC s New Batman Reveals His Identity, In a Twist No-One Saw Coming
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA shocking twist in Batman: The Brave and the Bold #7 reveals that the amnesiac Batman is actually Frank Freeman, not Bruce Wayne. Frank Freeman’s true identity as Batman comes as a surprise to both the characters and the readers, as readers typically know the identity of new characters who take on the cowl. Despite initially treating Frank as a criminal, the real Batman teams up with him to save Frank’s newfound family, showing that Frank’s identity as Batman is a surprising and transformative twist.

item.title: DC s New Blue Lantern Is a Major Nod to Green Lantern The Animated Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRazer’s debut in Green Lantern #7 confirms that his history as a Blue Lantern from the animated series has been preserved. The inclusion of Razer in the comic canon is a major nod to fans of the Green Lantern animated series and a triumph that has been over a decade in the making. Razer’s presence as a Blue Lantern in the comics hints at the existence of Aya, a character integral to his redemption arc in the animated series, which is an exciting prospect for readers.

item.title: DC s New Dark Knight Returns Reference Makes Frank Miller s Batman Darker than Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Batman #140, the Dark Knight’s struggle for control over his mind is depicted as a battle against Zur-En-Arrh clones from different Batman franchises. Frank Miller’s Batman from The Dark Knight Returns stands out as the leader of the Zur-infected Batman copies, embodying Batman’s worst aspects. The Dark Knight Returns’ Batman serves as the precursor to Zur-En-Arrh, both advocating for extreme measures and the creation of armies to combat crime.

item.title: DC s New Evil God Is So Powerful, Even Sandman s Endless Are Scared
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA new malicious god has shaken up the deity hierarchy in John Constantine’s Hellblazer series, evoking fear even in Dream of the Endless. Constantine’s confrontation with the “girl scout” reveals her unsettling knowledge and powers, and Dream tasks him with defeating her and her kin. If Constantine eliminates these entities, he will ascend to god-killer status and will surpass the power of the Endless, having achieved a feat they didn’t dare attempt.

item.title: DC s New Red Lantern Is Born - & It s Green Lantern s Fault
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHal Jordan’s actions have inadvertently given his enemy Sinestro access to the Red Light of Rage, making him even more powerful and dangerous. Sinestro, who previously harnessed the Yellow Light of Fear, is now able to tap into the power of the Red Lanterns due to his intense hatred of Hal Jordan. Sinestro’s new power source, the Red Light, is one of the most devastating forces in the Emotional Spectrum, making him a formidable and destructive villain for Hal Jordan to face.

item.title: DC s Newest God-Blessed Hero Takes Shazam s Powers to the Next Level
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlack Canary’s sister, Sin Lance, becomes a super-powered hero by sharing her body with a god. Sin gets a cool new green-and-black costume and full control of their actions while sharing powers with the god. Sin’s power upgrade takes the concept of “godhood” to a new level in the DC Universe. Literature ReviewThe Shazam Family have all borrowed from the gods for their powers, but the newest DC superhero gets to literally share a body with a god.

item.title: DC s Official Justice League Drag Show Reveals the True Cultural Power of Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC Comics showcases the power of comics by featuring a Justice League-themed drag show in Fire & Ice: Welcome to Smallville #4. The comic addresses the controversy surrounding drag shows and demonstrates how comics can make statements about real-life current events. The publication of this comic highlights how far comics have come since the days of heavy censorship and shows the ability of creative teams to use their voices to speak truths.

item.title: DC s Outsiders Prepare For Their Darkest Adventure Yet, As They Enter Batman s Mind
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Outsiders, a team that handles mysteries outside the Justice League’s jurisdiction, find themselves trapped in Batman’s mind. Being in Batman’s mind is dangerous, as it is filled with his past trauma and darkness that shaped him into a hero. The Outsiders must confront Batman’s fears and find out why they were led to this twisted version of Wayne Manor to escape. Literature ReviewIn a new preview for Outsiders #3, the team is investigating a major mystery, and things only get weirder when it leads them inside Batman’s mind.

item.title: DC s Ridiculous Version of Krakoa Returns to Destroy Superman s Hometown
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFire and Ice face their biggest crisis yet as Kooey Kooey Kooey Island returns to Smallville to take over Superman’s hometown. The sentient island, previously home to Booster Gold and Blue Beetle’s casino, is infecting the residents of Smallville. Embracing the island’s origins could lead to a new future for the Justice League and Smallville. Literature ReviewThe iconic Justice League duo Fire and Ice are set to take on DC’s answer to the X-Men’s island Krakoa: a long-forgotten foe from the team’s past.

item.title: DC s Strongest Anti-Vampire Team Includes 1 Underrated Teen Titan
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMiss Martian, Black Canary, and Green Arrow team up to creatively defeat vampires using their powers in Batman/Santa Claus: Silent Knight #2. The trio’s strategy involves Miss Martian shapeshifting, Green Arrow shooting wooden arrows, and Black Canary using her sonic scream. This showcases how superheroes can use their existing powers in unique ways to fight vampires, and suggests Miss Martian has the potential to lead her own supernatural team.

item.title: DC vs Vampires Every Hero Who Transformed in Nightwing s Vampire Army (Ranked Weakest to Strongest)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNightrider and B’wana Beast prove to be the weakest and most pathetic vampires in the DC vs. Vampires series. James Gordon and Looker also have disappointing vampire tenures, meeting swift and embarrassing ends. Mister Terrific, Doctor Mid-Nite, and Zatanna make critical mistakes that have significant consequences for the vampire regime. Literature ReviewPrepare to dive into Armageddon as every hero enlisted in Nightwing’s vampire army from DC vs. Vampires is ranked weakest to strongest.

item.title: DC Waited Until December to Debut the Best New Costume of the Year
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC Comics introduces a new and stylish hero in Batman/Superman: World’s Finest #22, with a Spider-Man-like costume that adds an edge to the original design. The hero, whose name and powers are unknown, appears briefly and may have spider-powers, but their role in the story is unclear. It remains uncertain if this hero will reappear in future issues, but their unique costume adds excitement and showcases the differences between Earth-0 and Earth-22.

item.title: DCeased Kickstarter Hits Over 3 Times Goal for Zombie Superhero Game
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDCeased fans can now experience the popular comic series in the form of a new board game, currently being funded on Kickstarter, based on the Zombicide engine. The cooperative game has already unlocked many stretch goals, but fans should pledge before the Kickstarter is complete, in order to secure exclusive figures and rule-sets. The game allows players to navigate through a zombified Earth, controlling uninfected DC characters and facing off against zombie heroes, villains, and hordes alike.

item.title: DCs First Openly Gay Hero Returns as the DCUs Version of Doctor Strange
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC Comics’ first openly gay hero, Extraño, makes a comeback in a holiday anthology, reemphasizing his place in the DCU. Extraño’s appearance in the anthology resembles Marvel’s Doctor Strange, signaling a potential relaunch and redemption for the character. DC Comics recognizes the importance of Extraño as a LGBTQIA+ hero and is actively working to give him the attention he deserves. Literature ReviewDC Comics has more than a few queer heroes, but the DCU’s first openly gay hero has made a long overdue comeback — with a somewhat familiar look.

item.title: DCs New Indiana Jones Rewrites a Beloved Justice League Heros Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMetamorpho’s backstory is expanded with the introduction of his father, Montana, an archaeologist who strongly differs from his son in terms of motivations and values. Rex’s father attempted to instill his own values in him, but Rex succumbed to the desire for fame and fortune by working for Simon Stagg. Metamorpho reflects on his tragic origin story and tries to make amends by ensuring relics end up in the hands of archaeologists like his father.

item.title: DCs Strongest Green Lantern Names the Hero Who Should Have His Ring Instead
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn Stewart admires his mother so much that he believes she deserves his Green Lantern ring more than he does. John Stewart’s mother, Shirley Stewart, is a Civil Rights leader in the DC Universe, making her a prime candidate for a power ring. John Stewart’s opinion carries great weight in the Green Lantern Corps, and if he looks up to his mother, she must be worthy of respect and would make an ideal Green Lantern.

item.title: DCs Strongest Green Lantern Reveals the 1 Major Weakness in Other Corps Members
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOverdependence on a Power Ring is a Green Lantern’s worst flaw; they need to have faith in their team. Teamwork is crucial for Green Lanterns to be effective in stopping threats and protecting the DC Universe. The most powerful Green Lantern, John Stewart, learned the value of teamwork and is now the Corps’ most powerful hero. Literature ReviewA Green Lantern Power Ring might enable its user to conjure up anything, but as John Stewart reveals, novice Lanterns all share one crucial flaw.

item.title: Deadpool Finally Has Redemption for His Most Unforgivable Mistake
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDeadpool finally gets a chance to redeem in Uncanny Avengers #5, by facing down “Stevil” alongside the real Steve Rogers himself after years of guilt and regret for his actions under Hydra’s Captain America. Deadpool saves the real Captain America’s life in a critical moment, earning even more of Cap’s respect. This is the best step yet in Deadpool’s journey towards further redemption, and in the future, he could potentially be the Marvel hero to take down Stevil for good.

item.title: Deadpool Gets EXPLOSIVE InHyuk Lee Variant Cover for New Comic Run
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
