item.description: SUMMARYMarvel has introduced evil counterparts of its most recognizable characters, creating a potential villainous version of the Avengers. Characters like Toranos, General Strange, and Hydra-Cap are direct correlations to Thor, Doctor Strange, and Captain America. Feilong’s takeover of Stark Industries and use of Iron Man tech represents the malformation of everything Iron Man stands for, and to this point he has done everything short of suiting up in his own armor.

item.title: In the Era of the Multiverse, Marvel Shouldn t Forget About Parallel Dimensions
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Multiverse offers endless storytelling potential, but the company shouldn’t neglect the possibilities of exploring other dimensions, as a way of introducing unique, fresh entities into the main Marvel Universe. Pre-Multiverse depictions of alternate dimensions, like the Human Torch’s adventure in Strange Tales #103, showcase parallel dimensions that operate distinctively from the Multiverse concept. Marvel has recently shown willingness to embrace weirder and wilder storytelling; its current roster of creative talents should draw inspiration from classic stories, like the Human Torch’s interdimensional tale, to create dynamic narratives that go beyond the Multiverse.

item.title: Incredible New Jujutsu Kaisen Art Brings Gojo s Prison Realm to Life With a Surprising Twist
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCosplayer and streamer @ChuRuuna created a fan art cake based on the infamous Prison Realm from Jujutsu Kaisen, capturing its unique cube-like shape and worn texture. The artist added a special touch by replacing the cube’s red eyes with Gojo’s blue pupils, giving the impression that he is trapped inside the cake. Kenjaku’s plan to trap Gojo in the Prison Realm required years of work and preparation, but he could have easily lured him with ChuRuuna’s cake due to Gojo’s love for sweets.

item.title: Indiana Jones and the League of Assassins Fan Project Reunites the Franchise s Most Beloved Heroes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFan artist Adam Murphy reunites the classic Indiana Jones cast for an exciting new adventure set in the 1980s, with his series of images reminiscent of pulp adventure novel covers. Murphy’s attention to detail in his Indy art is commendable, as is his commitment to staying true to the franchise’s established timeline, something fans will appreciate. On particularly exciting element of Murphy’s latest post is inclusion of older Short Round, fulfilling the fan desire to catch up with an adult version of the character, which Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny did not fulfil.

item.title: Infinity Stone Sites - Marvel s Most Obscure Lore Reveals How to Use the Infinity Gauntlet s Power with 0 Stones
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY“Infinity Stone Sites” hold immense power and can grant a single wish, making them just as valuable as the Stones themselves. The power of the Infinity Stones can be harnessed even after they are gone, with traces of their magic left behind in the paths they’ve traveled. While Doctor Doom successfully uses an Infinity Stone Site, others could potentially track the paths of the stones and claim the power for themselves, leading to potential villainous agendas.

item.title: Inhumans Fanart Makes Marvel s Most Unique Superpower Look Real
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMedusa’s unique ability to use her long and luxurious hair as a weapon is brilliantly showcased in BossLogic’s fan art. The Inhumans, a society of superhumans with diverse powers, were given a big push by Marvel in the 2010s but their live-action adaptation fell short. BossLogic’s artwork honors the creative brilliance of Jack Kirby and Stan Lee by beautifully highlighting Medusa’s dangerous and cool abilities. Literature ReviewThe Inhumans’ Medusa has one of Marvel’s most unique powers, and now artist BossLogic has brought it to spectacular life.

item.title: Injustice 3 Gets the Perfect Villain, as Joker Returns to Life with New Powers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFans finally get their wish as the Joker returns to the Injustice universe, setting the stage for a potential Injustice 3. The resurrection of the Joker is a significant event, considering his death played a pivotal role in tearing apart the Injustice world. The return of the Joker hints at a future Injustice project, as the franchise needs a major villain to continue its dark and chaotic narrative. Literature ReviewThe Injustice franchise is one of DC’s best alternate universes, and Joker’s return just gave it the new lease on life it needs.

item.title: Injustice Every Hero Who Sided with Batman s Resistance (& Why)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn the Injustice unvierse, the Insurgency, led by Batman, fights against Superman’s Regime in an epic battle for freedom. Heroes like Alfred Pennyworth, Nightwing, and Aquaman join Batman’s cause to protect the world. Lex Luthor becomes a secret ally to the Insurgency, ultimately leading to Batman’s victory over Superman. Literature ReviewBatman’s Insurgency in the Injustice comics and video games inspired many heroes to join the fight against Evil Superman.

item.title: Injustice Why the Justice League Sided with Superman When He Turned Evil
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s success in the Injustice Universe was largely due to the support of his Justice League allies, who each had their own unique reasons for joining him. Wonder Woman’s character in the Injustice Universe was drastically changed after her discovery that Steve Trevor was a Nazi agent, leading her to embrace Superman’s dark methods. The Flash initially supported Superman but eventually had a crisis of conscience and decided to betray him, realizing that Superman’s brutality needed to be stopped.

item.title: Invincible s Apocalyptic THE INVINCIBLE WAR Is Impossible to Adapt Without Huge Changes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY“The Invincible War” in Invincible #60 features an army of alternate Invincibles and a lineup of Image Comics guest stars. The TV adaptation will likely have to make significant changes since the guest stars are owned by their respective creators. Despite the absence of guest stars, the story still delivers dramatic moments and a strong narrative. Literature ReviewThe Invincible War was a huge event in the original Invincible comics, but it will be almost impossible to adapt for the Amazon TV series.

item.title: Invincible s Ownership Lawsuit Is Over - What the Result Means for the Franchise s Future
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA settlement has been reached in the lawsuit between Robert Kirkman and former Invincible colorist William Crabtree, avoiding a potentially damaging trial for Kirkman, and the Invincible franchise. Crabtree’s lawsuit against Kirkman stemmed from colorist’s claim of being “tricked” into giving up ownership rights to Invincible around the time of the comic’s debut, in 2005. The out-of-court settlement allows Kirkman to focus on Amazon’s Invincible adaptaion without the production delays a trial might have resulted in.

item.title: Invincible vs the Hulk Invincible s Creators Agreed 1 Power Settles the Winner
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYInvincible’s ability to fly gives him a crucial advantage over the Hulk in a fight. The Hulk’s inability to fly leaves him vulnerable to attacks that Invincible can easily evade. While fans may have differing opinions, from a creator’s perspective, Invincible would defeat the Hulk due to his gift of flight. Literature ReviewInvincible and the Hulk have each fought some of the most intense battles in comics. But how do they stack up against each other?

item.title: Invincible Why Viltrumites Have Mustaches But Mark Doesn t (& Won t)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYViltrumites have a tradition of sporting mustaches, which represent their cultural identity and allegiance to Viltrum. Mark, despite being a Viltrumite, chooses not to grow a mustache as he sees it as a symbol of the violent past and wants to move forward. Mark’s decision to remain clean-shaven reflects his commitment to breaking the cycle of the Viltrumites’ old ways and leading them towards change and a better future.

item.title: Iron Fist s Powers Are Fully Unleashed in Fan Art Redeeming the Hero Netflix Failed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Iron Fist is honored with beautiful fan artwork, reminding readers why they want to see the hero on-screen. The image showcases Iron Fist’s full power and the depth of his character, making it clear that he is a force to be reckoned with in the Marvel Universe. Netflix’s portrayal of Iron Fist did not do justice to the character’s full potential, and Marvel should bring a new version of the hero into the MCU with more vocal supporters like Kode Abdo cheering him on.

item.title: Iron Lad, Illuminati, and The Parkers Every Promise Marvel Needs To Keep From 2023s Ultimate Universe Reboot
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s New Ultimate Universe, with Jonathan Hickman at the helm, has built up a lot of anticipation, with the Ultimate Invasion miniseries making a lot of promises that the new slate of ongoing Ultimate titles should strive to keep. The new Ultimate Universe is irrevocably tied to the memory of the original incarnation of the imprint (2000-2015) – as a result, it should consciously work to be its own, distinct version of the Marvel Universe.

item.title: Iron Man Cosplay Showcases the Coolest Armor the MCU Didn t Use
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCosplayer CarnageCosplay unveils an extraordinary Iron Man suit, known as the Model-Prime Armor AKA Model 51, showcasing the suit’s stealth mode design. The remarkable quality of this Iron Man cosplay serves as a reminder that Marvel missed an opportunity by not featuring this suit in its cinematic universe. While the chances of seeing this suit in the MCU are slim, there is hope that it might make a comeback in the pages of Iron Man comics.

item.title: Iron Man Debuts His Ultimate Suit - Immune to Magic & Captain Marvel-Level Strength
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark has designed a new Iron Man suit made from mysterium, an anti-magic mutant metal, to defeat his archenemy Feilong and Orchis. The mysterium suit is radiation-proof, allowing Iron Man to safely face Feilong and his radioactive abilities. Iron Man and Emma Frost are ready for a final showdown, using the new suit to take the battle directly to Feilong and regain their power. Literature ReviewThe cover for Invincible Iron Man #16, from artist Kael Ngu, reveals Tony’s much anticipated new mysterium armor, designed by artist Pepe Larraz.

item.title: Iron Man Is Recruiting the 1 Mutant Who Can Turn Him into a God
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark teams up with mutant innovator Forge to create new technology and battle his enemies. Iron Man plans to use the mutant metal mysterium to create a new set of armor with the help of Forge, Ironheart, and the blacksmith Eitri. Forge’s innovation and mutant gift, along with Ironheart’s genius, could help Tony achieve a godlike state and fight against an army of Stark Sentinels. Literature ReviewThe cover for The Invincible Iron Man #14 reveals that Tony will be teaming up with the powerful mutant innovator Forge to create an epic new armor.

item.title: Iron Man Mark 72 Armor Marvel Artist Reveals BTS Secrets of Tony Stark s New Suit
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark’s newest iteration of the Iron Man suit, designed by Pepe Larraz, has a sleek black mysterium plating with red and gold accents, inspired by luxury sports cars. The Mark 72 armor is made with mysterium, a cosmic fictional metal with anti-magical properties, making it a significant upgrade for Iron Man and his weakness against mystical attacks. While the Mark 72 armor is powerful, it may not be enough to take on Orchis, an international anti-mutant fascist organization.

item.title: Iron Man s Wolverine-Buster Armor Is His Deadliest Anti-Hero Contingency Suit
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man’s Argonaut suit, made of Antarctic Vibranium, is a deadly counter to Wolverine’s adamantium-laced body. Antarctic Vibranium destabilizes adamantium, potentially beyond what Wolverine’s healing factor can handle. Tony Stark is aware of the suit’s capabilities and would use it against Wolverine if necessary. Literature ReviewIron Man has a history of building armor to contend with heroes gone rogue, but his anti-adamantium suit is a particularly brutal countermeasure. Iron Man and Wolverine are two of the most prolific heroes in the Marvel Universe, having saved the world, and their respective teams, countless times.

item.title: Iron Man s Ex Just Became Marvel s New Most Dangerous Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMadame Masque is revealed to be alive and is the mastermind behind the gang war in New York City. She manipulates the crime families and plans to take over their territories. The Gang War event will transform New York City and shake up the criminal landscape for Marvel’s heroes. Spider-Man is building his own team to fight in the war. Madame Masque may have the best odds in the gang war, as she is a skilled manipulator and knows how to play the crime families against each other.

item.title: Iron Man s First Addiction Wasn t Alcohol, & It Explains Why He Hates His New Enemy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man’s biggest addiction is not alcohol, but war, as revealed in Avengers #7. This provides a new perspective on his character’s current arc, as well as his actions throughout his history. Iron Man’s ongoing feud with the villain Feilong is driven by his addiction to war, as highlighted by Nightmare in Avengers #7. This new insight changes the way readers view their conflict. Tony Stark’s addiction to war is resurfacing and becoming more intense, as seen in Invincible Iron Man #8.

item.title: Iron Man s New Armor is So Impressive Villains Don t Want to Fight Him
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark’s new Iron Man suit, the Mark Nil, is not only a practical upgrade but also a distraction to supervillains. In a fight with Twilight Court member Bedivere, Tony’s opponent is impressed by the Mark Nil and would even call off the fight if his team agreed. The Mark Nil is considered Tony’s best Iron Man suit yet, with impressive physical feats and the ability to earn kudos even from his enemies.

item.title: Iron Man s New Codename Proves His Armor Is Evolving Like Never Before
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark’s newest era as Iron Man begins with the ultimate new Mark 72 armor and the codename “Mysterium Man.” Tony’s secret war against his archenemy Feilong reaches a bombastic conclusion as he plans to use his advanced mutant metal armor to take down the Stark Sentinels. Tony’s marriage to Emma Frost has been fruitful, as their partnership has allowed him to access mysterium and create a fleet of mysterium ships to battle against Orchis.

item.title: Iron Man s Son Has an Even Worse Take on Marvel s Civil War Than His Dad
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man’s son, James Stark, has a shocking take on heroes and villains, defending Red Skull and questioning Captain America’s status as a hero. Despite his morally wrong views, James Stark becomes one of Marvel’s best antagonists in years, adding an interesting twist to the narrative. The return of the Avengers will likely be met with fanfare as they face a new kind of Civil War caused by Iron Man’s misinformed son.

item.title: Iron Man s Son Has the Perfect Insulting Nickname for Captain America
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCaptain America continues to embody the values of compassion and selflessness, even in a bleak future where he long since retired from his superhero career. He volunteers, protects others, and is a true champion of the people, much like Mister Rogers. Iron Man’s son, James, labels Steve as “Mr. Rogers” in an attempt to portray him as old and outdated, when really, the comparison between the two is apt. The nickname “Mr.

item.title: Iron Man s Son Makes His Official Debut - Named After Tony Stark s Favorite Avengers Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man’s son is named after War Machine, showing Tony’s admiration and love for his fellow armored Avenger. James Stark, Tony’s son with the Wasp, wants nothing to do with the Avengers legacy and is involved in sinister activities - seemingly keeping Tony prisoner. Despite James’ current villainous actions, there is still a chance for redemption as Captain America seeks him out. Literature ReviewIron Man finally has a son, named to honor another Avengers icon.

item.title: Iron Man s X-Men Era Will Be Defined By His Team-Up With 1 Mutant (Who Hates Him)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Invincible Iron Man #14 will feature Tony Stark and Emma Frost seeking help from mutant inventor Forge to defeat the villainous Feilong. Forge “loathes"Tony Stark, but also respects him as a genius, creating a dynamic that will be exciting to see explored more fully in Invincible Iron Man #14 If Tony can earn Forge’s respect, it could lead to a major character shift, and potentially make Iron Man a true ally to the X-Men and all mutants.

item.title: Iron Man vs Sentry How Tony Stark Beat Marvel s Strongest Man Alive
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man outsmarted the powerful Sentry by hacking into “Cloc” and overwhelming him with cries for help, exploiting the Sentry’s fragile mental state. As is often the case, Tony Stark’s intellect was his greatest strength in the fight. Despite not having the raw power to physically defeat superpowered opponents such as the Sentry, Iron Man’s ability to out-think his opponents has consistently proven to be his best asset. Tony Stark is one of Earth’s mightiest heroes for a reason.

item.title: Ironheart Has Already Lost The Mandarin s Rings Without Ever Properly Using Them
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIronheart’s acquisition of the Mandarin’s Rings was underutilized and ended without any real development for the iconic character. Riri’s journey with the Rings was originally meant to be a central part of the delayed or canceled The Invincible Ironheart solo series. After fearing corruption by the Ring’s power, Riri Williams let the mutant inventor Forge send the Makluan Rings into space, where she wouldn’t be tempted to use them.

item.title: Isekai Meets Old-School Shonen is Exciting New Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Magician Who Rose From Failure is a refreshing isekai manga that follows a protagonist who has to work hard to catch up to others. The manga breaks the typical isekai trope by featuring a weak hero who needs to study for two years before showing any progress. The story combines elements of shonen manga and isekai, allowing the protagonist’s past life to influence events in the new world.

item.title: It s a Very Sci-Fi Christmas in Exclusive Preview for Top Cow s ANTARCTICA #6
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAntarctica #6 delves deeper into Hannah Curtis’ past and her complicated family dynamic. The series combines time- and dimension-traveling elements with familial struggles. The new preview sets the stage for a new story arc, making it a perfect jumping on point for new readers. Literature ReviewDespite the hot chocolate and Christmas movies, all is not as it seems in this preview for ANTARCTICA #6, as exclusively shared by Screen Rant.

item.title: It s Not Batman s Fault! - DC Explains the Real Reason Its Darkest Villains Flock to Gotham
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGotham City is a unique and dangerous place that attracts villains, who view it as the ultimate proving ground for crime and corruption. The presence of Batman is not the sole reason why villains flock to Gotham; it is the city itself that draws them in. The Penguin seeks to conquer Gotham City, and his alliance with a former love interest reveals the true nature of the city and its appeal to villains.

item.title: It s Official Loki is Worthy of Lifting Thor s Mjolnir
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLoki is confirmed to be worthy of lifting Thor’s hammer, Mjolnir, for the first time in official Marvel canon. In The Immortal Thor #5, Loki confidently catches and wields the hammer, showcasing his growth and heroism. Previously, there were doubts about Loki’s worthiness, but now he has the opportunity to embrace his new adventures with confidence and be the hero he’s meant to be. Literature ReviewMarvel finally confirms that Loki is actually worthy enough to wield his brother’s hammer Mjolnir, and this time, there’s no confusion about it.

item.title: It s Official Marvel s Shocking Team of Avenger Sidekicks Are Actually Joining Its Universe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s New Champions Variant Cover series designs are officially becoming canon, bringing creative and stunning new sidekicks for Marvel heroes to life. Timeless (2023) #1 reveals that some of the New Champions will enter the main Earth-616 universe, but their exact role and connection to other heroes remains uncertain. Maystorm, a powerful mutant high schooler inspired by Storm, will play a major role in Marvel’s Ultimate X-Men series, confirming the first canon New Champion.

item.title: It s Time for DC to Bring Back Superman s Green Lantern Son
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC’s Elseworlds imprint is making a comeback, presenting the opportunity to revisit the concept of Superman’s Green Lantern son from Superman: Distant Fires. The story of Superman: Distant Fires was set in a post-apocalyptic world, and featured Superman and Wonder Woman becoming romantically involved, resulting in a son named Bruce. Fans have been waiting for a follow-up to Superman: Distant Fires for 25 years; the new Elseworlds series presents the ideal opportunity to explore the development of Bruce Kent as a Green Lantern.

item.title: It s Time for Galactus Venom Form to Return (Fulfilling a Broken Promise from the 90s)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel should follow up on Galactus-Venom, a combination of the two iconic villains that it teased back in 1992. Venom, as well as Galactus, have become more heroic characters over the years, evolving away from their antagonistic origins. Combining the two would be a great way to further their respective journies while fulfilling the promise of Galactus-Venom. Galactus-Venom could be the only one capable of stopping the dangerous and powerful god-level Carnage, making his resurrection crucial for the sake of salvation.

item.title: James Bond Is a True Killing Machine in Blood-Soaked Look at New Adaptation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJames Bond becomes a deadly killing machine in Dynamite’s new series, highlighting his ruthless efficiency. Garth Ennis returns Bond to his original literary roots, emphasizing the brutal violence found in Ian Fleming’s books. Dynamite celebrates 10 years of publishing Bond comics, keeping the famous spy consistently on comic book store shelves. Literature ReviewA preview for the new James Bond series sees 007 going full John Wick, dispatching enemies with ruthless efficiency in a way the movies never showed.

item.title: James Bond Meets Sci-Fi Road Trip as Grant Morrison Announces New POISON PEACH Comic
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPoison Peach, self-published by Grant Morrison, is a classic Morrison comic filled with teenage angst, pulpy action, and ridiculous sci-fi concepts. The comic, featuring art by Liam Sharp, is part of the Xanaduum Presents one-shot series that condenses a complete story into just fifteen pages. With its twisted take on a classic pulp genre and exaggerated artwork, Poison Peach is a bite-sized comic snack that celebrates and annihilates classic genre and comic book form.

item.title: James Bond Reaches a New Level of Ruthlessness with Target Too Edgy for the Movies
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJames Bond 007 #1 arrives in January 2024, celebrating ten years of Dynamite Entertainment publishing Bond comics. Bond will face his greatest challenge yet as he hunts down a former Double-0 agent. The creative team of Garth Ennis and Rafa Lobosco present a ruthless Bond, wiping out an entire crime family, including the elderly matriarch. Literature ReviewJames Bond’s 007 is returning to comics with a brand new series next year, including ruthless violence too extreme for the movies.

item.title: Jango Fett Reveals Jabba Had Something Even Worse Than A Rancor in His Collection
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJabba the Hutt was likely given a collection of pet monsters before his deadly rancor. Someone was collecting monsters to make a living Dejarik holo-chess game, which would make a horrifyingly perfect gift for Jabba After facing a k’lor’slug meant for Jabba, Jango Fett is being hunted by Aurra Sing while searching for a valuable statue (and a showdown is imminent). Literature ReviewThe infamous bounty hunter Jango Fett once discovered that Jabba the Hutt wanted something far worse for his palace pets before his fearsome rancor.

item.title: Japanese Authorities Crackdown On Piracy Will Change The Way Fans Consume Manga
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe arrest of two individuals in Japan for illegally acquiring and distributing manga images leads to the shutdown of major “leaks” accounts and illegal manga distribution sites. Fans may have to change how they consume manga due to a crackdown on piracy and the lack of spoilers. The arrests represent a significant step forward in the fight against manga piracy, potentially impacting the industry as a whole. Literature ReviewThe recent arrest in Japan of professional manga leakers confirms an ongoing effort to fight piracy that will have a huge impact on fans.

item.title: Jaw-Dropping X-Men Cosplay Is a Flawless Team-Up of God-Tier Costumes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe X-Men cosplay community showcases stunning live-action interpretations of characters, who regularly stun with comic-accurate designs. Collaborative effort among talented cosplayers and photographers (such as @ryansimsphotography) leads to the creation of epic images, such as this one showcasing X-Men characters from the 90s comic run. Ryan Sims’ impeccable photo editing skills highlight the best parts of homemade designs, teasing an epic confrontation between the X-Men and Magneto. Literature ReviewThe X-Men have some of the most well-designed character costumes in all of Marvel Comics, with a new cosplay image bringing them to vibrant life.

item.title: Jean Grey Cosplay Unleashes the Full Force of X-Men s Most Unbeatable Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJean Grey’s Phoenix incarnation is one of the most powerful X-Men, a fact fans are reminded of by cosplayer Rebecca Rose’s portrayal of the character’s fiery transformation. Along with Soul Studio’s visual enhancements, Rose’s costume demonstrates the dedication and skill of the cosplay community, as well as pays homage to Jean Grey’s iconic role in X-Men comics. This cosplay exemplifies the evolving art form of cosplay, showcasing how cosplayers bring their favorite characters to life in increasingly incredible ways.

item.title: Jessica Jones Returns as Marvel Embraces WICKER MAN-Style Folk Horror
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJessica Jones ventures to England to investigate a mystery involving creepy and perfect twins, which leads her to a small town called Barton Wallop. “Breaking the Dark” is the first in a series of crime novels featuring street-level Marvel heroes like Jessica, Daredevil, and Luke Cage, all of whom have been influenced by classic pulp novels. The setting of England offers new opportunities for Jessica to encounter British Marvel heroes and elements of the Marvel Universe, as well as draws inspiration from famous British horror and crime stories.

item.title: John Carpenter s Cult Film THEY LIVE Was Based On This Sci-Fi Comic Book
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe comic book adaptation of Ray Nelson’s 1963 short story “Eight O’Clock in the Morning” likely helped bring the story to John Carpenter’s attention, leading to the creation of his cult film They Live. “Eight O’Clock in the Morning,” the comic book story “Nada,” and They Live, all feature a central character who discovers the true nature of the world and sacrifices their life to save humanity. The enduring appeal of They Live lies not only in its portrayal of aliens, but also in the compelling human hero at the center of the story.

item.title: John Carpenter s THEY LIVE Majorly Toned Down the Original Alien Design (& That Means A Remake Is Inevitable)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe aliens in the comic version of John Carpenter’s They Live, “Nada” were truly horrifying, and visually striking, depicted as writhing piles of organic matter, with an almost a Lovecraftian vibe. John Carpenter’s film version intentionally toned down the aliens’ appearance, in part to fit the movie’s anti-capitalism theme, portraying them as hollowed-out humanoids rather than grotesque extraterrestrials. A potential remake of They Live could differentiate itself by embracing the body-horror and sci-fi aspects of the comic, and attempting to bring a version of its the wild design to life.

item.title: John Constantine Hellblazer - Dead in America #1 Just Launched 2024 s Best Comic Series (Review)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn Constantine, Hellblazer: Dead in America is an exceptional comic series with unparalleled artistry and masterful storytelling. The comic captures the eerie and fever-dream-like reading experience of the Sandman comics, blurring the boundaries between reality and the supernatural seamlessly. The new Hellblazer installment exceeds fan expectations, upholding the morbid humor and brilliance that defines the essence of Constantine’s world. Literature ReviewSpurrier and Campbell’s new Hellblazer series is as darkly gorgeous as it is entrancingly entertaining, making it DC’s best ongoing comic run.

item.title: John Constantine s Final Form Just Turned Him into a DC God
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJohn Constantine’s ultimate form is revealed in Batman Beyond: Neo-Gothic #5. He becomes a sick, twisted, and powerful being after death. Constantine now refers to himself as the embodiment of the Green, feeling no pain and surpassing death. He is encased in a shadowy black casing. Despite his dark nature, Constantine still holds heroic qualities and goes out of his way to protect children, showing his true character even in his new form.

item.title: JoJo s Bizarre Adventure Teases a New Member of Jodio s Crew With a Truly Wild Stand Ability
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPaco discovers that their enemy’s bag of cat heads was actually filled with potatoes, revealing that their attacker was trying to avoid combat by intimidating them. The ability to recruit enemies into allies is a classic aspect of Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure, with previous characters like Bucciarati and Foo Fighters starting as enemies turned allies. The new enemy’s Stand ability, which allows them to blend into the background and manipulate illusions, offers unique and valuable stealth and scouting abilities that could benefit the Jodio crew.

item.title: Jojo s Bizarre Adventure Tops Itself With a New Weirdest Stand Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChapter 10 of Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure part 9 introduces a ridiculously unique Stand ability that allows the user to merge into the background. The ability breaks the fourth wall by acknowledging the framing of the manga panels, creating artistic opportunities for the mangaka. Although the Stand is stealthy, it lacks offensive capabilities, leading the user to fight with a knife. Literature ReviewChapter 10 of The JojoLands has introduced a Stand user with what might be the most absurd ability yet in the series, and he’s just an underling.

item.title: JoJo s Stands & Dragon Ball s Fusions Merge In Exciting Shonen Manga
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJiangshi X introduced a fusion technique similar to Dragon Ball Z, allowing daoshi warriors to merge with their spiritual beings, which are similar to the stands from JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure. Jiuli demonstrates this technique by fusing with his Shen Ling, enabling him to defeat a powerful jiangshi with a single swing of his sword. The introduction of fusion techniques hints at the possibility of multiple fusion options and exciting transformations in future chapters of Jiangshi X.

item.title: Joker Cosplay Recreates His JOKER WAR Batsuit in Real Life
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA talented cosplayer brings the Joker War batsuit from DC Comics to life, showcasing what a Joker Batman could look like on the big screen. u/Cosplayben is known for creating accurate cosplay designs, including for DC and Marvel characters, and has perfected the iconic Joker batsuit. The Joker War storyline stripped Bruce Wayne of his wealth and reputation, while showcasing new characters like Harley Quinn and Punchline, making the Joker batsuit a significant part of the narrative.

item.title: Joker Is Gotham s Most Tragic Villain (Because His Madness CAN Be Cured)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Joker can be cured of his madness through a technological procedure, as shown in the Marvel and DC crossover comic Spider-Man and Batman #1. The procedure completely removes the Joker’s homicidal urges, reducing him to a scared child. The Joker is rendered harmless and expresses no interest in harming others. While the Joker has been cured of his insanity multiple times in the past, it is important to find the right circumstances for a successful cure.

item.title: Joker Only Killed Robin to Stop Another Villain Doing It First
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTwo-Face nearly kills Dick Grayson’s Robin before the infamous murder of Jason Todd at the hands of the Joker. Dick Grayson survives a near-death experience at the hands of Two-Face, leading to Batman firing him as Robin. The Joker fulfills his promise to kill Robin by murdering Jason Todd, making him the first villain to claim a Robin. Literature ReviewOne of the Joker’s worst crimes is killing Jason Todd — and it turns out he only did it so another villain wouldn’t beat him to the punch.

item.title: Joker s Entire Origin Was Caused by a Jaw-Dropping Gotham Villain, DC Confirms
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Penguin and Batman unknowingly played a role in creating the Joker, revealing a new origin for the iconic villain. Carmine Falcone, one of Gotham’s biggest criminals, is connected to the creation of the Joker, with the Penguin supplying Batman with information that inadvertently led to it. The Joker’s origins have always been shrouded in mystery, but DC has now shown that both Batman and the Penguin were involved in his creation.

item.title: Joker s Failure to Make Batman Laugh Could Save the Dark Knight s Life
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s lack of humor is what makes him the last survivor in the Joker’s apocalypse. The Joker’s virus is transmitted through laughter, and Batman’s refusal to laugh saves him. The Joker’s final plan is to trap Batman in a world where everyone finds the joke funny, except for Batman. Literature ReviewBatman and the Joker have been fighting for years, and the fact Joker has never gotten Batman to laugh actually ended up saving Batman’s life.

item.title: Joker s Original 1928 Film Inspiration Just Entered Public Domain (& He s Terrifying)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe German Expressionist film “The Man Who Laughs” has entered the public domain. Creators are now free to use elements from “The Man Who Laughs” for their own profit. The Joker’s inspiration, Gwynplaine, is a misunderstood hero and tragic figure, different from the Joker’s villainous nature. Literature ReviewAs 1928’s The Man Who Laughs enters public domain, comic fans just gained ownership of the movie character who inspired Batman’s nemesis the Joker.

item.title: Jubilee Obliterates a Sentinel Army in Cosplay of X-Men s Underrated 90s Powerhouse
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA Jubilee cosplayer wows audiences with their impressive portrayal of the X-Men hero, showcasing their mutant powers and obliterating a Sentinel army. Pat Loika’s digital editing skills elevate HalloReena’s Jubilee cosplay into an epic rendition that authentically portrays the character’s mutant powers. HalloReena’s standout cosplay and the demand for more Jubilee-centric material highlight the desire for additional stories and portrayals of this beloved mutant. Literature ReviewA Jubilee cosplayer steals the spotlight by unleashing a dazzling spectacle, obliterating an entire Sentinel army with flair and mutant prowess.

item.title: Juggernaut Finally Returns for X-Men s Final Battle - With a Brand New Weapon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJuggernaut returns with a new weapon in the X-Men’s final battle against Orchis after being imprisoned and nearly killed. The weapon is stolen from Cable’s armory, which includes powerful and exotic weapons that can even kill the godlike Celestials. Juggernaut’s powers can further enhance the weapon, making him even more unbeatable and capable of taking on Orchis’ formidable forces. Literature ReviewAs the X-Men’s final battle begins, the Juggernaut finally returns to the front lines of the war for mutantkind, now toting a major new weapon.

item.title: Juggernaut Gets the Perfect Ending, as a Member of the 1 Hero Team He Actually Belongs With
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Juggernaut’s destiny was to end up on a team of heroes that better represented his character arc, which is fulfilled when he joins the Starjammers. The Juggernaut has always been a cosmic character, conquering planets, punching holes through dimensions, and wielding magic strong enough to command entire universes. Joining the Starjammers provides the Juggernaut a better ending that addresses his cosmic nature and completes his redemption arc. Literature ReviewThe Juggernaut has been on the path of redemption for some time in X-Men canon, and now he’s finally joined a team that represents his perfect ending.

item.title: Juggernaut Officially Has His Own Version of Kryptonite
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Amulet of Cyttorak can stop the “Unstoppable” Juggernaut and is considered his “Kryptonite.” The Amulet was used successfully against the Juggernaut by the Hulk, but it was accidentally destroyed in the process. The Juggernaut has cut himself off from Cyttorak, making the Amulet useless against him in the current continuity of Earth-616. However, its effectiveness in other realities is seemingly still sound. Literature ReviewThe Juggernaut boasts that he’s unstoppable, but apparently that’s not exactly the case, as one Marvel Comics issue introduces his own ‘Kryptonite’.

item.title: Juggernaut s Friendship with a Founding X-Men Hero Gives New Meaning To Their Darkest Moment
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Juggernaut and Jean Grey have both committed genocide, which forms a dark connection between them. Jean offers support and endorsement to Juggernaut, recognizing his redemption and growth. Marvel Comics has the opportunity to explore the shared pain and redemption of these characters as their friendship develops. Literature ReviewThe Juggernaut has become rather close with one founding member of the X-Men, though there is a hidden, dark undertone to their new-found friendship.

item.title: Juggernaut s Son Proves a Huge Fan Theory About His Powers Is 100% True
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJ2’s existence confirms a fan theory that Juggernaut’s powers can be transferred through non-magical means. Dr. Stasis wanted to steal Juggernaut’s powers for Orchis, which poses a threat to the entire Marvel Universe. J2’s existence proves that Juggernaut’s powers can indeed be transferred through blood and DNA. Literature ReviewWith the last few issues of X-Men comics, one question/theory has been raised in regard to his powers, something which his son, J2, already confirmed.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Already Revealed The Winner Of Its Next Big Fight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYuta vs. Sukuna will be the next big fight in Jujutsu Kaisen, but the winner is likely to be Sukuna according to the author’s statements in the series’ databook. Even though Sukuna is stronger than Rika, Yuta’s abilities and the support of other sorcerers could give him a fighting chance against Sukuna. The outcome of Yuta and Sukuna’s fight may not be straightforward, but it is expected to be suspenseful and overall great.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Creator Confirms the Manga Will End in 2024
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Jujutsu Kaisen manga is nearing its conclusion and will most likely end in 2024, according to the author, after the main villain Sukuna fully awakening and major character deaths. The manga has reached 90 million copies in circulation and is expected to surpass the 100 million mark. A teaser video of upcoming chapters hypes up the incredible battle between Gojo and Sukuna, but fans are saddened by the news of the series coming to an end soon.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Has A Genius Explanation For Why Yuta Can Copy Sukuna s Cursed Technique
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYuta has replicated Sukuna’s Cursed Technique, raising questions about the workings of his own technique. Yuta may have used one of Sukuna’s fingers to copy his technique, potentially giving him the upper hand in battle. If Yuta can copy Sukuna’s technique, it may spell defeat for Sukuna, taking away his only remaining trump card. Literature ReviewJujutsu Kaisen’s Yuta has finally revealed his true strength, copying Sukuna’s Cursed Technique, and it could be the beginning of Sukuna’s defeat.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Has Already Revealed Yuji s Cursed Technique
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYuji’s true Cursed technique could be Blood Manipulation, learned from Choso and Noritoshi Kamo, as hinted in recent chapters. Yuji’s apparent ability to use Flowing Red Scale explains his improved performance against Sukuna and his connection to the Death Painting Wombs. It is strongly implied that Kenjaku gave Yuji the Blood Manipulation Technique, making him one of his experiments like the Death Paintings. Literature ReviewJujutsu Kaisen may have already left all the clues to Yuji’s true Cursed Technique and it may be completely different than fans expected.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Has Given Yuji All The Power-Ups He Needs To Beat Sukuna
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYuji Itadori has learned how to effectively utilize reverse cursed technique, giving him the ability to heal his own wounds and potentially overcome Sukuna. The Executioner’s Sword, a valuable weapon given to Yuji, had no effect on Sukuna, possibly due to its creator’s death. However, Yuji’s proficiency in reverse cursed technique compensates for this setback. There is a mysterious dormant technique within Yuji’s body that even Sukuna perceives as a significant threat.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Has One Power That Can Kill Sukuna Higuruma s Cursed Technique Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHiguruma Hiromi, a Grade 1 Sorcerer, has the potential to kill Sukuna and end his reign of terror. Higuruma’s innate technique uses a domain expansion and a shikigami called Judgeman to determine guilt and deliver justice. While Higuruma’s technique may be a threat to Sukuna, defeating him will not be easy and Sukuna may have a plan to counter it. Literature ReviewWhile the King of Curses must be feeling good after Gojo’s defeat, he faces a more pressing problem in Higuruma Hiromi’s cursed technique.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Is About To Reveal Megumi s Fate
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMegumi’s fate in Jujutsu Kaisen is uncertain, but there are two possible outcomes: he may be alive but incapacitated, or he could already be dead with Sukuna possessing his corpse. Even if Megumi is still alive, he is likely in poor shape emotionally and mentally. The burden he has carried and the deaths he has witnessed will have taken a toll on him. Despite his current condition, Megumi still has a role to play in the story.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Just Teased Sukuna Will Win Again...Because Of Gojo
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChapter #244 of Jujutsu Kaisen teases that Sukuna will again, thanks to a mistake made by Gojo that prevents Higuruma from executing his cursed technique on Sukuna. Gojo’s decision to have the battle on a national holiday unknowingly prevents Higuruma from enacting the death penalty, closing off another path to victory against Sukuna. Even if the death penalty is out, Higuruma’s plan to confiscate Sukuna’s Cursed Technique is uncertain, as it depends on Judgeman successfully convicting Sukuna.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Killed Its Strongest Hero And Biggest Villain In The Same Way
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKenjaku’s defeat in Jujutsu Kaisen #243 mirrored Gojo’s demise, highlighting the unbearable pride of being a master sorcerer. Takaba’s unique cursed technique, coupled with his desire to be a comedian, led to Kenjaku’s downfall in a surprising turn of events. Gojo and Kenjaku’s overconfidence in their cursed techniques caused them to overlook fatal details, resulting in their defeat. Their legacies will continue through their surviving students and associates. Literature ReviewWhile Gojo and Kenjaku are mortal enemies, the mindsets they held during their final battles show why the two have more in common than fans think.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Needed to Kill Its Most Interesting New Character To Give Yuji His Power-Up
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHiguruma passes the torch to Yuji, giving him the power to kill Sukuna in the latest chapter of Jujutsu Kaisen. Higuruma’s fate is ambiguous, but his death opens up the possibility of increasing Yuji’s chances against Sukuna. Yuji may be able to wield the Executioner’s Sword even after Higuruma’s death, which could potentially end up strengthening his technique. Literature ReviewThe battle against Sukuna in Jujutsu Kaisen takes an interesting turn as the series sacrifices a fan-favorite character to redeem its protagonist.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen s Huge Inspiration Is More Evident Than Ever In Its Best Arc
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGege Akutami, the creator of Jujutsu Kaisen, is a huge fan of Tite Kubo’s Bleach and Yoshihiro Togashi’s Hunter X Hunter. The Shibuya Incident arc in Jujutsu Kaisen shows Gege’s appreciation for Hunter X Hunter, with similarities in character design, narration, and the basis of cursed energy. Togashi also loves Jujutsu Kaisen and drew inspiration from it, showing a mutual respect between the two creators and making both series better.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen s Huge Villain Death Brings Back The Series Biggest Mystery
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKenjaku’s unexpected defeat opens up the possibility of finally unraveling the mystery behind Yuji’s mother, Kaori. Kenjaku’s backup plan may involve using Yuji as a vessel for his own return, and it sheds light on his lifelong interest in human-curse hybrids. The death of Kenjaku presents an opportunity for Jujutsu Kaisen to dive deeper into Yuji’s past and origins, which has been a major point of intrigue in the series.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen s New Domain Expansion Pays Homage to the Author s Favorite Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYuta’s Domain Expansion in Jujutsu Kaisen is similar to Shirou Emiya’s Reality Marble from Fate/Stay Night. Yuta and Shirou share similarities in their backstories and abilities, suggesting the influence of the Fate franchise on Jujutsu Kaisen. Gege Akutami, the creator of Jujutsu Kaisen, has expressed his love for the Fate series and has drawn inspiration from it in his own work. Literature ReviewJujutsu Kaisen has revealed Yuta’s Domain Expansion at last and it has an unexpected inspiration from one of Gege Akutami’s favorite series.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen s Sukuna Finally Comments on Yuji s Power Level, & It s Devastating
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSukuna deems Yuji Itadori “boring” and not strong enough to be a worthy opponent. Itadori receives a devastating attack from Sukuna, but he may have learned a new skill to defeat him. Despite Sukuna’s power, Itadori has the potential to surprise him and beat him in the end. Literature ReviewDespite Yuji Itadori’s stunning victories, Jujutsu Kaisen’s most powerful villain has some brutal words concerning the main character’s powers. Summary

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen s Ultimate Villains New Form Makes Him Even More Terrifying
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSukuna’s new form in Jujutsu Kaisen is utterly terrifying, as he now has complete control over Megumi and can use his cursed technique. Sukuna’s new vessel allows him to transform his head into a giant mouth and attempt to eat his enemies, showcasing his full potential as a villain. To defeat Sukuna’s new, more powerful form, the heroes may have to kill Megumi, which could result in a potentially permanent loss for the series.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Season 2 Episode #23 Release Date & Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJujutsu Kaisen Season 2 episode #23 will end the Shibuya Incident arc and establish the series’ status quo. The involvement of a new set of sorcerers and curses may be necessary, as many characters from season 1 are dead or otherwise disposed of. The episode will showcase a battle between Geto’s body and special-grade sorcerer Yuki Tsukumo, potentially ending with explosive revelations and powerful abilities. Literature ReviewJujutsu Kaisen’s Season 2 episode #23 will be the season finale, ending the Shibuya Incident arc on an epic note that will have major consequences.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Shocks Fans With Another Unexpected Death
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChapter #243 of Jujutsu Kaisen delivers an unexpected twist as Yuta successfully cuts off Kenjaku’s head, but his death may not be certain. Kenjaku, being a cunning man, likely has a contingency plan in case of such a situation, raising doubts about Yuta’s victory. Takaba’s fate too remains undecided, with fans hoping he isn’t truly dead. Literature ReviewJujutsu Kaisen’s latest battle has taken an unexpected turn with yet another shocking death in the final pages of its latest chapter.

item.title: Jujutsu Kaisen Teases A Massive Twist In Upcoming Chapter
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJujutsu Kaisen’s upcoming chapters will have shocking twists, according to the series’ editor. Fans are speculating about the direction of the battle against Sukuna and the return of fan-favorite characters. The upcoming twist could be detrimental to Yuji and the sorcerers, potentially resulting in another shocking death. Literature ReviewJujutsu Kaisen’s editor teases plenty of shocking twists in the upcoming chapters, leading to frenzied speculation among fans. The battle against Sukuna has been full of unforeseen twists and turns, and Jujutsu Kaisen has just teased its upcoming chapter may have yet another massive twist in store.

item.title: Justice League Confirms 2 Underrated Heroes Are Strong Enough to Beat Godzilla
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShazam and Supergirl team up to take down Godzilla in Justice League vs. Godzilla vs. Kong #3. The combined strength of the Justice League members is needed to defeat the rampaging Titans. Shazam and Supergirl’s power level surpasses Superman’s and they are strong enough to defeat Godzilla. Literature ReviewGodzilla might have won his first bout with Superman, but two Justice League members team up to successfully get revenge for the Man of Tomorrow.

item.title: Justice League Meets a Star Trek Icon in Official DC Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperstar artist Dan Mora provides a heart-warming variant cover of Captain Kirk joining the Justice League in Batman/Superman: World’s Finest #25. The cover shows a smiling William Shatner surrounded by the League, although Green Arrow seems displeased. Fans have enjoyed previous celebrity appearances on the book’s cover, ensuring more fun covers will be created in the future. Literature ReviewThe Justice League are set to meet one of the biggest icons in the Star Trek universe in a special new variant cover by Dan Mora.

item.title: Justice League s New Romance Gives Fresh Life to a Hugely Underrated Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Red Tornado-centric story, Robots Are Red, Androids Are Blue, is one of the eight rom-com tales in DC’s Valentine’s Day special. Red Tornado finds unexpected love with Batman’s AI program, hinting at a promising new romance in the DC Universe. Batman’s AI program forms an identity of her own, calling herself “Sona.” Literature ReviewValentine’s Day has arrived in the DC Universe, and romance is abound, especially for one Justice League member who just got a surprising girlfriend.

item.title: Justice League s White Martians Can Be Their Best Villains with 1 Change
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDark Knights of Steel reveals the White Martians as the main antagonists and showcases their impressive power and skill at subterfuge. However, their weakness to fire proves to be their downfall, as fire can easily defeat them in both the alternate universe and official DC continuity. While fire as a weakness may seem underwhelming, finding new and creative ways to defeat the White Martians can make them a bigger and more exciting threat to the Justice League.

item.title: Justice League vs. Titans Batman Reveals How Nightwing s Team Has Surpassed His Own
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNightwing and the Titans have surpassed Batman and the Justice League as the top team in the DC Universe. Batman admits that Nightwing’s leadership skills surpass his own, showing the transition of power from mentor to student. Batman’s leadership style, characterized by tough love and solo focus, has rarely worked for his teams, while Nightwing’s more compassionate and inclusive approach has led to the Titans’ success. Literature ReviewAs they assert themselves at the front lines of the DC Universe, Nightwing and the Titans have officially surpassed Batman and his Justice League.

item.title: Justice Titans DC s Absolute Strongest Justice League was a Perfect Fusion of 2 Teams
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Justice Titans, a fusion of the Justice League and the Teen Titans, are an absurdly powerful team in the extended DC Universe. Batman and Superman find themselves in a fusion of Gotham City and Metropolis called “Gothamopolis” and encounter the Justice Titans. The Titans have become their own team fully on par with the Justice League, and the fusion of these two teams in the Justice Titans creates an unstoppable force.

item.title: Kakashi Cosplay Gives Naruto s Sixth Hokage the Relaxing Moment He Always Deserved
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA Naruto cosplayer brings Kakashi to life with accurate costume and physical resemblance, making fans’ imagination come true. Kakashi’s introverted nature and dislike for the Hokage position is highlighted in the cosplay, emphasizing his love for spending time alone. Kakashi’s fondness for ramen is portrayed in the cosplay, capturing his character’s love for the savory dish. Literature ReviewIn an awesome new cosplay, Naruto fan-favorite Kakashi Hatake finally finds time in his busy schedule as Hokage to enjoy a favorite meal.

item.title: Kang Beat the Avengers Worse Than Thanos for 1 Reason - He s a Human
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKang the Conqueror defeated the Avengers in the major “Kang Dynasty” storyline by spreading them too thin and forcing major powers to surrender. Kang humiliated the Avengers by making the Wasp sign the articles of surrender, breaking their spirits in a way Thanos never did. While Thanos has defeated the Avengers in more obvious ways, Kang’s victory is significant because of the human element involved. Literature ReviewThanos may be the Mad Titan, but Kang the Conqueror is ultimately just another human foe for the Avengers - meaning he’s even more dangerous.

item.title: Keanu Reeves First Novel Continues Story of His Best-Selling BRZRKR Comic
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKeanu Reeves is collaborating with author China Mieville on a new novel set in the universe of his successful BRZRKR comic series. BRZRKR has become one of the biggest success stories in 21st-century comics, selling out and becoming a multimedia franchise. The new novel, The Book of Elsewhere, is just the beginning for BRZRKR, with a live-action movie and anime series in development. Literature ReviewKeanu Reeves has joined forces with novelist China Mieville to bring fans the first prose book set in Reeves’ BRZRKR universe.

item.title: Kenjaku s Death In Jujutsu Kaisen Turned Out To Be A Huge Mistake
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKenjaku’s death left Sukuna in charge of his merger plan, making the situation worse for the heroes and humanity. Kenjaku needed Sukuna to carry out his plans and saw him as an essential protection guarantee. Kenjaku’s death guaranteed his ultimate success: killing Kenjaku first allowed him to rely on Sukuna as his backup plan, leaving the heroes to deal with an unbeatable curse. Literature ReviewEven in death, Jujutsu Kaisen’s Kenjaku shows he outsmarted his enemies, and his demise just plunged the world into a much worse scenario.

item.title: Kick-Ass Hit-Girl Just Died in Official Continuity (& Gets an Unexpected Replacement)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHit-Girl is killed in Big Game #5, shot by Wanted protagonist Wesley Gibson, aka the Killer. Hit-Girl used time travel to save every other Millarverse hero, bringing heroes like Kingsman’s Eggsy back to life. She’s replaced by the Mindy McCready of the new timeline in what feels like a betrayal of the character. Literature ReviewKick-Ass’ assassin superhero dies a gory death in Big Game, and Chloë Grace Moretz’s superhero is replaced by an unlikely candidate.

item.title: Kid Venom Art Gives Marvel a Superpowered Take on Blue Eye Samurai
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTaurin Clarke’s variant cover for Kid Venom: Origins #1 presents a visually captivating picture of Kid Venom. The distinctive blue color, anime-esque artistry, and incorporation of Edo-era influences in Clarke’s cover bestow Marvel’s Venom Kid with a look that resonates with the visual aesthetic of Blue Eye Samurai. The release of Kid Venom: Origins #1, along with its behind-the-scenes content, hints at a promising future for Kid Venom and suggests that the character may play a significant role in upcoming Marvel storylines.

item.title: King Kong Should Have Died to Another MonsterVerse Titan Before Ever Fighting Godzilla
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCamazotz, a powerful Titan, nearly prevented the Godzilla vs. Kong battle by being far stronger than Kong. Without Monarch’s G-Team, which saved Kong from Camazotz, the outcome of the film would have been radically altered. If Kong had died, the story could have focused on Godzilla fighting Camazotz, though Godzilla ultimately could have prevailed with the help of Mothra. Literature ReviewWhile Kong and Godzilla eventually did get to fight on the big screen, another contender for Skull Island nearly killed the MonsterVerse hero.

item.title: Kingpin s New Wife is the Perfect Dark Opposite of His MCU Partner
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKingpin’s new wife, Typhoid Mary, is the opposite of his previous wife, serving as a dangerous and chaotic influence. Typhoid Mary intentionally provokes Kingpin to make him a better fighter, in contrast to his previous wife who would calm him down. Typhoid Mary’s presence and actions reveal the tensions between Kingpin and Tombstone, leading to a fight that Kingpin ultimately wins. Literature ReviewBehind every great man is a great woman, as the saying goes.

item.title: Kodansha s December Giveaway Is The Perfect Chance To Check Shonen Jump s Rival
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKodansha Publishing is running a month-long giveaway campaign, offering free digital volumes of its manga series every day for the month of December. This campaign is an effort by Kodansha to promote its manga content, which includes popular titles like Attack on Titan and Vinland Saga, and compete with Shueisha’s dominant position in the international market. Readers can access the free volumes by signing up for Kodansha’s free reader account, and the account also grants access to future giveaway campaigns.

item.title: Legendary Artist Tim Sales Premiere Graphic Novel BILLI 99 Gets A New Full-Color Edition (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYClover Press is reprinting Tim Sale’s premiere graphic novel, BILLI 99 , as a tribute to the late artist. The updated version of BILLI 99 will feature new colors by artist José Villarrubia, enhancing the original artwork while retaining Sale’s vision. The miniseries, which was a mix of action and political commentary, stood out at its release, and deserves more recognition from contemporary readers, for its story, as well as for Tim Sale’s art.

item.title: Legendary Sport Manga Author Announces His Retirement
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe creator of Captain Tsubasa, Takahashi Yoichi, announces his retirement due to age and health reasons. His two ongoing manga will conclude in April. Captain Tsubasa has been a landmark in anime and manga, pioneering the sports genre. The demanding nature of being a mangaka is likely a factor in the choice of retirement. Drafts for a final “World Cup” arc will allow other creators to continue the series. Takahashi’s influence is likely to remain in future Captain Tsubasa projects.

item.title: LGBTQ+ Romance Heartstopper Just Set a Major Record
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHeartstopper Vol. 5 has become the fastest-selling graphic novel ever in the UK, selling over 60,000 copies in just three days. The success of Heartstopper showcases the growing market and popularity of LGBTQ+ stories, despite challenges and censorship attempts. While volume 6 will be the final installment in the series, the record-breaking success of Heartstopper suggests that it could become one of the fastest-selling graphic novels worldwide. Literature ReviewThe worldwide LGBTQ+ sensation Heartstopper has just broken a major record, as the franchise secures its place in pop culture history.

item.title: Like It Or Not, Batman Now Learned to Fight Crime from Santa Claus
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s canonical backstory reveals that Santa Claus was one of his mentors, teaching him skills he still uses today. The addition of Santa Claus to Batman’s training may seem odd, but it fits within the larger, fantastical world of the Dark Knight’s adventures. This unique twist adds a fascinating layer to Batman’s mythos, demonstrating the diverse range of influences on his crime-fighting abilities. Literature ReviewYes, Virginia, Santa Claus is seriously one of the mentors who trained Batman and helped turn Bruce Wayne into the crime-fighter he is today.

item.title: Lilo & Stitch Series Officially Introduces Its New Villain - THE CLUSTER SOVEREIGN
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new Lilo & Stitch comic introduces a brand-new villain, the Cluster Sovereign, who wants to create an army of Stitch. The comic maintains the original movie’s aesthetic, with cute and cuddly yet dangerous giant robots as the new villains. The series will take Lilo and Stitch on an international adventure, with future issues set in New York City and India as the Cluster Sovereign hunts them down globally.

item.title: Lion-O Makes Franchise History as ThunderCats New Series Begins
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLion-O claims the Sword of Omens for the first time in the new Thundercats comic series by Dynamite Entertainment. The previews show Lion-O’s struggle to become a responsible leader and prove his worthiness to use the sword. The new series takes a “year one” approach, showing the Thundercats’ arrival on Third Earth and the events that shaped Lion-O into the character fans know and love. Literature ReviewDynamite Entertainment’s new Thundercats series begins with a bang, showing Lion-O use the Sword of Omens for the first time.

item.title: Lion-O Makes Franchises History as ThunderCats New Series Begins
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLion-O claims the Sword of Omens for the first time in the new Thundercats comic series by Dynamite Entertainment. The previews show Lion-O’s struggle to become a responsible leader and prove his worthiness to use the sword. The new series takes a “year one” approach, showing the Thundercats’ arrival on Third Earth and the events that shaped Lion-O into the character fans know and love. Literature ReviewDynamite Entertainment’s new Thundercats series begins with a bang, showing Lion-O use the Sword of Omens for the first time.

item.title: Lion-O vs Panthro Is Setting Up Thundercats Epic Civil War
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA potential civil war between the Thundercats indicates that Dynamite Entertainment is taking risks and generating buzz with their new series. The “back to basics” approach of this new Thundercats comic allows for more mature and challenging storylines, such as a civil war between Lion-O and Panthro. Calica, the mysterious Thundarian survivor, plays a crucial role in the Thundercats civil war and may be a trap set by the powerful villain, Mumm-Ra.

item.title: LOBO Is Taking Over DC Comics in Early 2024
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLobo, the DC Comics bounty hunter, is experiencing a resurgence in popularity with two team-ups, and a trade paperback. Lobo, who debuted in 1993, has evolved from a villain to a bounty hunter and has occasionally teamed up with DC heroes. In DC’s April solicitations, Lobo will appear in a crossover event with Superman to take down Brainiac’s Lobo army, as well as team up with Guy Gardner in Green Lantern #10 .

item.title: Loid Vs. Yor - SPY x FAMILY Gives Fans the Fight They ve Waited For With One Catch
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSPY x FAMILY Chapter 79 delivers on the anticipation of a fight between Loid and Yor, but with a twist. The fight between Yor and Loid turns out to be all in Yor’s imagination, but the series has built up to this moment. The potential clash between Loid and Yor hints at future conflicts and raises excitement for the series’ direction. Literature ReviewYor and Loid from SPY x FAMILY are certain to clash once they discover each other’s identities and the manga is showing what that may look like.

item.title: Lois Lane s Greatest Moments Prove She s DC s Most Underrated Crime-Fighter - & Always Has Been
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLois Lane proves she’s on-par with the likes of Batman by working with him to stop the Leviathan. Lois Lane single-handedly challenges world powers, interrogates superheroes, and takes on super-villains, all with her journalistic prowess. With every story she’s in, Lois Lane continues to prove that she is the best journalist in DC Comics, and perhaps all comic book fiction. Literature ReviewLois Lane is perhaps the greatest investigative journalist in comic book fiction, and every article she writes cements that fact.

item.title: Loki s Ultimate Form Revealed, as Thor Battles the Terrifying Elder God Utgard-Loki
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThor’s mythic past continues to be explored in Immortal Thor #7, as he and Loki confront the first ever Loki of this multiverse, with Elder Gods returning in the present day. The Immortal Thor series reveals the origins of the Elder Gods, transforming them into the Utgard-Gods and introducing the first Gods of Thunder. Thor’s enemies, including present-day Loki, and the villainous Roxxon Corporation, are trying to rewrite his past and shape his narrative for their own purposes.

item.title: Look Out Blue Lock - New Shonen Sports Manga Was One of 2023 s Most Underrated
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Days of Diamond is a popular sports manga that could surpass Blue Lock as the best sports manga of the year. The manga focuses on the personal and team pressures of being a talented athlete and explores the contemporary youth sports scene. The Days of Diamond has memorable characters, such as Jiro’s supportive mother and teammate Tougou, and features dynamic artwork that brings the baseball action to life.

item.title: Luffy s Gear Fifth Has Only One Weakness In One Piece
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuffy’s new form, Gear Fifth, increases his maneuverability and style of attack. Despite the power of Gear Fifth, Luffy is still vulnerable to slashing attacks. The mention of this weakness sets up potential future villains who could exploit it and create high-stakes conflicts for Luffy. Literature ReviewLuffy’s awakened Devil Fruit form, Gear Fifth, has one massive physical weakness that was pointed out by both Kaido and Kizaru. Monkey D. Luffy made manga history when he awakened his Devil Fruit in One Piece chapter #1044.

item.title: Luffy s New Allies Are His Most Important Ones Yet
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuffy gains new allies, Dorry and Broggy, who have revived the Giant Pirates and come to his aid at Egghead. The Giants may be aware of the legend of Nika and could be loyal to Luffy due to his connection to the Sun God. The Giants’ loyalty to Luffy and the Straw Hats may impact their journey to Elbaf, as it is implied to be Shanks’ territory. Literature ReviewLuffy’s ability to make allies wherever he goes proves useful yet again with the game-changing arrival of Dorry and Broggy at Egghead Island.

item.title: Luke Cage Officially Has the Worst Secret Identity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Cage’s new secret identity is not a secret anymore, as his true identity has been exposed in just two issues. Despite wearing a mask, Luke Cage’s recognizable bald head should have made it easy for people to figure out his secret. It is unclear who exposed Luke Cage’s secret identity, but it was someone who knew that he had become a hero again. Literature ReviewAs a Gang War rages on in the streets of New York City, Mayor Luke Cage returns to his heroic roots with a disguise that shouldn’t fool anyone.

item.title: Luke Cage s New Costume Changes His Character on a Fundamental Level
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Cage’s new masked identity challenges his long-held beliefs against secret identities, signaling a change in mindset. As Mayor of New York, Luke Cage confronts the limitations of his position and adopts a new masked identity to continue his superhero duties. Luke Cage acknowledges the complexities of secret identities and realizes that operating in secret is necessary to protect both himself and other heroes. Literature ReviewAs a gang war kicks off in New York, Mayor Luke Cage dons a mask for the first time in his career, fundamentally changes the character.

item.title: Luke Skywalker s Latest Feat Makes His Force Connection Even More Legendary
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe final issue of Marvel’s Dark Droids crossover finds Luke Skywalker possessed by the Scourge, a viral artificial intelligence, becoming a living conduit between machine intelligence and the Force. The Scourge needed someone with Luke’s power to access, as it seeks to become the Force itself, once more indicating that Luke is the most powerful Force user in the galaxy. Despite Luke’s valiant efforts, he is not the hero of the story, as another character ultimately defeats the Scourge and saves the galaxy.

item.title: Luke Skywalker Technically Wasn t a Jedi Until Long, Long After He Beat Palpatine
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Skywalker didn’t become an official Jedi until years after the fall of the Empire, as a result of the Empire’s anti-Jedi laws. The public perception of the Jedi was shaped by the Empire’s policies of denial, painting them as a mythical and sinister force. In the eyes of the law, Luke Skywalker was considered a criminal and rebel, despite his heroic actions as a Jedi. Literature ReviewLuke Skywalker is one of Star Wars’ most iconic Jedi, but in the eyes of Imperial law, the franchise’s greatest hero was no more than a criminal.

item.title: Mace Windu Becomes A Pirate Hunter In New Star Wars Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMace Windu’s new series is set before the events of The Phantom Menace, showing him as a Jedi Knight. The series will likely reveal more about Windu’s early years before he became an iconic Jedi Master and gained a seat on the council. The story will involve a scientist’s discovery that could threaten the entire Star Wars galaxy. Literature ReviewIn a new preview for Star Wars’ upcoming Mace Windu comic series, the legendary Jedi Master is seen taking to the high seas and hunting down pirates.

item.title: Mace Windu Returns to Star Wars with Andor-Style Prison Break
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMace Windu is returning to Star Wars in an Andor-style prison break storyline, reinforcing his badass reputation. Mace Windu goes undercover as a guard to bust someone out of prison and faces conflict with the prison warden. This new comic effectively merges Mace Windu with the popular Andor storyline, featuring a prison break and utilizing Mace Windu’s Jedi skills to his advantage. Literature ReviewMace Windu is about to return to Star Wars canon in an all-new storyline, one that - based on a preview - looks a lot like Andor’s prison break arc.

item.title: Mad Max Meets Rollerball in Epic New Trailer for I HEART SKULL-CRUSHER (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYI Heart Skull-Crusher! is a new comic series from BOOM! Box that combines a Mad Max -style wasteland with sports, featuring a teenage heroine named Trini. Trini dreams of being like her idol, Skull-Crusher, and will do anything to compete in her favorite sport, Screaming Pain Ball. This genre-blend comic promises an intriguing story of mayhem and misfits, with a focus on Trini’s journey to make her dreams a reality.

item.title: Madripoor Knights Revisiting This Classic Uncanny X-Men One Shot Ahead of Chris Claremont s New Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYUncanny X-Men #268 offered a tantalizing glimpse into Wolverine’s mysterious past, fueling speculation about his origin at a time when it was still unknown, making it a highlight for collectors and fans. Jim Lee’s artwork in Uncanny X-Men #268 is among his very best, showcasing his talent and contributing to his rise to “superstar” status in the comic industry. The story in Uncanny X-Men #268 is being revisited in the new Wolverine: Madripoor Knights series, giving fans a perfect reason to revisit the original one-shot issue from 1990.

item.title: Madripoor Knights Wolverine, Captain America & Black Widow s New Team Officially Assemble in First Look Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlack Widow, Captain America, and Wolverine team up in Chris Claremont’s latest limited series, Madripoor Knights, following up on the story from his Uncanny X-Men #268 one-shot. The series explores the dynamics established in the previous story, and will feature the trio battling against the Hand assassin organization. Madripoor Knights is, in a way, a career retrospective for Claremont, showcasing his signature style and delivering a thrilling adventure for new and old fans of Marvel comics alike.

item.title: Magneto Has a Genius Solution for Dealing with Supervillains
