Literature ReviewThe incredibly talented artist behind the One-Punch Man manga has contributed a stylish tribute to one of Akira Toriyama’s Dragon Ball manga covers.

item.title: One-Punch Man Confirms Saitama s Greatest Pupil, & It Isn t Genos
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSonic’s repeated attacks on Saitama have paid off, as he displays his improved abilities in Chapter #197 of One-Punch Man. Sonic compares his opponents to Saitama and realizes they can’t even compare, motivating him to aim to surpass Saitama in strength. While Genos’ growth depends on his cyborg upgrades, Sonic has only improved through his attacks on Saitama, proving he is actually a better “disciple”. Literature ReviewOne villain’s repeated attempts to challenge Saitama have led to him becoming phenomenally stronger as a result, and Saitama may not even know it.

item.title: One-Punch Man Hints One Villain is the Secret to Fixing the Series Monster Problem
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFlashy Flash discovers two former monsters who have returned to being human, hinting at a possible cure for monsterization. The Hero Association is eager to reverse the monsterization process and studying these two ninjas could be a valuable opportunity. Phoenix Man may hold the key to understanding the reversal of monsterization and could be convinced to help the Hero Association. Literature ReviewThe return of two formerly monsterized villains as ordinary humans offers hope to One-Punch Man’s extremely dire monster situation.

item.title: One-Punch Man Is Rewriting Its Biggest Mystery (And It s A Lot Better Now)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlast’s revelation about his former partner and the Ninja Village ties the current arc to the overarching God storyline, providing a clearer connection to the story. The involvement of Blast and his past battles with his partner add depth to the Ninja Village arc, expanding on the leader’s character and showcasing the corrupting influence of God. These changes create opportunities for further development of the God storyline and Blast as a character, making the One-Punch Man manga’s new take on the arc intriguing.

item.title: One-Punch Man Just Put A Horrific Spin On One Iconic Naruto Technique
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOne-Punch Man ’s latest chapter takes inspiration from Naruto and puts a dark twist on the famous genjutsu technique, the Sharingan. The Ninja Village Leader uses his genjutsu to create horrifying illusions, manipulating his opponents’ fears to gain the upper hand in battle. The level of terror inflicted by One-Punch Man ’s genjutsu exceeds that of Naruto , showcasing the true horror that a skilled illusionist with psychic abilities can unleash.

item.title: One-Punch Man Reveals The Tragic Past Of Its Most Ridiculous Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOne-Punch Man reveals Speed-o’-Sound Sonic’s tragic past at the Ninja Village, showing a more positive and heroic side to the character. Flashy Flash and Sonic connect in a flashback and both share a disdain for the way the Ninja Village is run, with Sonic dreaming of raising future ninjas in a kinder and fairer way. The story adds depth to Sonic’s character, making him more than just an annoying villain, and raises questions about what drove him away from his previous heroic desires.

item.title: One-Punch Man s 10 Strongest Heroes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGenos is a powerful cyborg hero with incredible strength and a wide range of weapons, but his inexperience and drawbacks hold him back. Drive Knight is a robotic hero with advanced technology and tactical intelligence, making him a formidable foe with the ability to adapt to his opponents’ strategies. Saitama, the titular hero, is unparalleled in strength and can defeat any enemy with a single punch, making him the strongest hero in the One-Punch Man universe.

item.title: One-Punch Man s Psychic Sisters Look Absolutely Epic in New Cosplay
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPhotos of cosplayers portraying the psychic sisters from One-Punch Man demonstrate the importance of minor additions and lighting in bringing the characters to life. The cosplayers’ understated designs are contrasted by their powerful psychic powers, which are represented through backlighting and post-production effects. The attention to detail and devotion shown by the cosplayers highlight the enduring popularity and cultural significance of One-Punch Man in the world of cosplay. Literature ReviewTatsumaki and Fubuki are two of One-Punch Man’s most popular characters, proven by this excellent cosplay that showcases both sisters.

item.title: Only 1 Bat-Family Member Can Save the Day Without Using a Single Gadget
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDuke Thomas, also known as the Signal, doesn’t need gadgets like the rest of the Bat-Family due to his metahuman powers of light and dark manipulation. Duke’s abilities, including invisibility and “Ghost Vision,” make him the stealthiest and most powerful member of the Bat-Family. Batman has welcomed Duke into the Bat-Family and relies on his powers as a metahuman, making him the most capable sidekick in the fight against Gotham’s villains.

item.title: Optimus Prime Debuts His Most Deadly Weapon The Energon Axe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOptimus Prime uses his Energon Axe for the first time in the new continuity, paying homage to its classic appearance. Optimus loses his arm in a brutal battle with Skywarp, but fans can expect him to be repaired in the future. Daniel Warren Johnson’s artwork gives Optimus Prime a mythic quality, leaving fans eager to see more of his Energon Axe in action. Literature ReviewOptimus Prime ignites his classic Energon Axe for the first time in the Energon Universe’s new Transformers series, and the results are epic.

item.title: Optimus Prime vs Skywarp Unleashes the Decepticon s Best Forgotten Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSkywarp’s forgotten power of teleportation gives him the upper hand against Optimus Prime. The Autobots struggle to keep up with the revived Decepticons, with Optimus barely surviving his encounters. Transformers #3 is available now from Skybound Entertainment. Literature ReviewAs Optimus Prime battles Skywarp, he gets a nasty surprise when the Decepticon hands out a devastating blow thanks to a little known power. Warning: contains spoilers for Transformers #3!Transformers’ new Energon Universe continuity just made use of a Decepticon’s underutilized power, giving none other than Optimus Prime a run for his money.

item.title: Optimus Primes Newest Weapon Comes From His Greatest Enemy MEGATRON
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOptimus Prime faces a shocking twist in Transformers #4, as is forced to appropriate Megatron’s iconic weapon to survive in the Energon Universe. The issue reveals that Megatron lost his arm and fusion cannon during a battle with the Autobots, and now it’s in the possession of Optimus Prime, who lost his own arm in the previous issue. The decision to replace his arm with his enemy’s could have major ramifications for Prime personally, and could change how the Autobots view him, but it will be especially dramatic when Megatron seeks to reclaim it.

item.title: Original Red Power Ranger Loses His Powers in Jaw-Dropping First Look at Amy Jo Johnson s New Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Return #1 introduces a new mystery villain who steals the original Red Ranger’s powers. The series explores what would happen if the original team never left, showing them still fighting evil and living their personal lives. The preview raises questions about the identity of the villain and their motives for targeting the Rangers. Literature ReviewThe original Red Ranger is set to lose his powers in shocking fashion according to a preview of the new series coming from the original Pink Ranger.

item.title: Original Red Power Ranger s New Costume Is Hiding a Surprise Injury
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new costume of the original Red Ranger in Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Return has a hidden detail that may reveal an important plot point. Jason’s helmet has a permanent slash across the eye, unlike previous Ranger transformations, which could be related to Zordon’s absence in the Rangers’ lives. The story takes place in an alternate timeline where Zordon, Alpha-5, and the Command Center are destroyed, leading all the Rangers to retire except for Jason, who continues as the sole Power Ranger.

item.title: Orville Season 4 Update Confirms How the Franchise Can Continue, Better Than Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYUnfortunately, actor Adrianne Palicki doubts there will be a fourth season of The Orville, citing financial viability and low episode production. The Orville has expanded into tie-in materials, such as a novella and comics, which have explained off-screen developments and could potentially continue the story. If a live-action fourth season doesn’t happen, The Orville could continue through comics, providing a way to resolve unresolved plot threads and explore new stories in the show’s universe.

item.title: Osamu Tezuka s One Hundred Tales Review A Must Read For Any Fan of Classic Manga
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOne Hundred Tales is a beautifully illustrated, one-of-a-kind period story about sacrifices and second chances, showcasing Tezuka’s classic style and sense of humor. Inspired by Faust, this fable reinterprets the events into a lively and humorous tale, weaving in Japanese culture and history for a unique twist. While some references may be lost on younger readers, long-time fans will appreciate Tezuka’s recognizable art style, random cameos, and nods to pop culture icons.

item.title: Outrageous Webcomic The Perry Bible Fellowship Releases Darkly Hilarious Full-Length Story
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Perry Bible Fellowship creator, Nicholas Gurewitch, has released a new comic book called Trauma Trooper that explores generational trauma. The story centers around a man who punishes previous generations for passing down trauma, leading all the way to arresting God for starting the cycle. Gurewitch’s signature style and comedic sensibilities are evident in the comic, as he finds humor in uncomfortable topics and uses his talents to explore and inform the audience about generational abuse.

item.title: Palpatine Tricked His Sequel Era Cult into Wiping Out Rival Sith - Star Wars Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Acolytes of the Beyond were a group that worshipped the dark side and collected corrupted Sith artifacts. The Acolytes believed destroying the artifacts would send them to the afterlife, preventing other Sith from rising to power. Palpatine theoretically formed the Acolytes to ensure no other Sith could take his place while he was gone, and he manipulated them into eliminating potential rivals. Literature ReviewStar Wars’ Palpatine formed a dark side cult that rose to prominence after his supposed death, & now it seems he used them to wipe out rival Sith.

item.title: Paul Reiser Returns to the Alien Franchise to Resurrect His Despicable Movie Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe most despicable villain of the Alien franchise, Carter Burke, is making a return in the What If…? Aliens series. Paul Reiser, the actor who played Burke in the films, is co-writing the series, providing fans with an alternate perspective on the character. This series is part of Marvel’s larger initiative, including Predator and Planet of the Apes comics, to explore alternate paths in iconic movie franchises. Literature ReviewIn Alien’s first What If…?

item.title: Peacemaker Admits He Hates a Surprising Bat-Family Hero, Setting Up a Pitch Perfect Rivalry
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPeacemaker unexpectedly harbors longstanding animosity towards Nightwing. The revelation of Peacemaker’s dislike for Nightwing stems from his perceived smug superiority, despite Nightwing’s celebrated virtues of compassion and humility. The banter battles between Nightwing and Peacemaker hold potential for an entertaining and comedic rivalry, suggesting the need for more page-time together. Literature ReviewPeacemaker has finally gotten his long-overdue confrontation with the one Bat-Family member that he has always hated, setting up the perfect rivalry.

item.title: Peanuts 10 Best Snoopy Alter Egos - From Joe Cool to the World-Famous Attorney
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSnoopy has an overactive imagination and loves to picture himself as different personas, from a World-Famous Author to a pirate. He fully commits to these imaginary roles, even adopting a band of pirates for his pirate alter ego, Blackbeagle. Snoopy’s alter egos, such as the Head Beagle and the World-Famous Astronaut, show America’s fascination with space and exploration during the time of the Apollo 11 Moon landing. Literature ReviewFrom an astronaut to the grinning Cheshire Beagle, Snoopy has had many alter egos in Peanuts history, but these remain his most popular.

item.title: Peanuts 10 Funniest Lucy & Schroeder Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Peanuts , Lucy’s infatuation with Schroeder is both humorous and unrequited. Schroeder’s commitment to music often clashes with Lucy’s romantic fantasies, however she never lets reality get in the way of her plans. Lucy DOES eventually get a kiss from Schroeder, but things still don’t go her way. Literature ReviewWhile Lucy may be a thorn in Schroeder’s side, her affection for the budding musician leads to some of the best Peanuts strips of all time.

item.title: Peanuts 10 Funniest Lucy s Psychiatry Booth Moments Featuring Characters Other Than Charlie Brown
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLucy’s tough love approach doesn’t always lead to happy customers, but she still has no shortage of patients. Lucy’s therapy sessions with the Peanuts gang often lack empathy, but she still charges them for her services. Lucy may not be the most effective counselor, but she has no problem boosting her own self-esteem. Literature ReviewFrom little-known Frieda to the world’s most famous beagle, Lucy has given psychiatric help to more Peanuts characters than just Charlie Brown.

item.title: Peanuts 10 Most Heartwarming Snoopy & Woodstock Best Friend Moments
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewBest friends forever, Snoopy and Woodstock have warmed the hearts of Peanuts fans for decades thanks to their loyal and loving friendship. The two are forever associated with one another. Their friendship would become one of the most enduring in popular culture and also be one of the most profitable, inspiring merchandise that included figurines, stuffed animals, mugs, and basically anything else that could fit an image of Snoopy and Woodstock.

item.title: Penguin Finally Returns to Gotham City, Reborn as Its Ultimate Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Penguin is returning to Gotham City after faking his death and leaving his criminal empire to his children. Recruited by Amanda Waller, Penguin is forced to recommit to a life of murder and treachery. Fans already know Penguin’s plans will destroy Batman, as a flashforward shows him close to death. Literature ReviewThe Penguin is finally returning to Gotham, as Oswald Cobblepot’s makeover into DC’s scariest villain reaches its height - Batman better look out.

item.title: Picard & Tasha Yar s Unseen Backstory Explains Why He Demanded She Join the Enterprise
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTasha Yar’s untimely death in Star Trek: The Next Generation left her character largely undeveloped. Star Trek: Defiant Annual 2024 explores Tasha’s first meeting with Captain Picard, revealing her bravery and the reason he wanted her on the Enterprise. The comic adds depth to Tasha’s backstory and highlights the need for future Star Trek comics to further explore her character. Literature ReviewThe backstory between Picard and Tasha Yar was never explored in her lifetime, but now a new comic shows exactly how they first met.

item.title: Picard s First Act as Captain Finally Proves He s Better Than Kirk
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPicard’s school test turns into a real-life challenge, testing his mettle and showcasing his potential as a better captain than Kirk. Unlike Kirk, Picard seeks to graduate early and prove himself as a captain, but his arrogance and avoidance of teamwork hinder his progress. Picard is forced to unite a team of misfits and face an actual Romulan attack during his final exam, testing his leadership skills and ability to work with others.

item.title: Picard s Starfleet Training Makes His Bond with Guinan Even More Meaningful
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPicard’s prequel comic shows how he learned to overcome his insecurities and rely on others, which later helps him become a great captain. Sharing his fears with Doq and Marty in the comic mirrors Picard’s later relationship with Guinan, where he seeks her counsel and makes important decisions based on her advice. Picard’s days at Starfleet Academy provided him with the emotional growth and knowledge necessary to connect with Guinan as captain, creating one of the most important bonds in all of Star Trek.

item.title: Planet of the Apes Controversial Original Ending Is Actually Available (If You Know Where to Look)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe original ending of Planet of the Apes revealed that Nova was pregnant with Taylor’s child, but this was cut from the film before the scene was shot. Nova’s pregnancy was objected to by Charlton Heston, who played Taylor, causing the scene to be removed from the movie. The inclusion of Nova’s pregnancy could have drastically changed the trajectory of the franchise, had it resulted in a different plot, or at least different ending, for the 1970 sequel Beneath the Planet of the Apes.

item.title: Planet of the Apes New APE WAR ONE Is a Genius Evolution of the Franchise
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBeware the Planet of the Apes #4 reveals a great war brewing in ape society. The comic expands the mythos of the franchise, exploring the unexplored Forbidden Zone. The impending conflict between Ape City and the Hominidae Empire is inevitable. Literature ReviewMarvel continues their genius expansion of the Planet of the Apes lore by teasing a massive war that is on the horizon. Warning: contains potential spoilers for Beware the Planet of the Apes #4!

item.title: Planet of the Apes Comics Have A Prequel Problem (That Marvel Could Totally Fix)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s new Planet of the Apes miniseries is a prequel, but in the future, the company could establish its own continuity separate from the film series. Beware the Planet of the Apes #1 reintroduces Zira, Cornelius, and the ape civilization familiar to fans of the franchise, while setting the stage for conflict with a newly revealed ape settlement. Marvel has the opportunity to break free from the franchise’s fixation on the past and explore the future of the timeline in a new and exciting way.

item.title: Planet of the Apes Lore is Completely Rewritten with Reveal of New Ape Empire
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel is revitalizing the Planet of the Apes franchise with new comics that expand on the mythology and rewrite the lore. The new series, Beware the Planet of the Apes, will be set in the continuity of the original film series and feature iconic characters from those movies. The introduction of a new ape empire in the comics will shake up the existing understanding of the Planet of the Apes world and potentially lead to an impending war.

item.title: Planet of the Apes Officially Disproves a Major Assumption About Humanity s Final Fate (In Original Movie Canon)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBeware the Planet of the Apes is redefining the world seen in the 1968 movie and its sequel, introducing a new ape society. The comic also reveals a new group of mutated humans who recognize the character Nova, suggesting she may once have been one of them. The presence of seemingly rational, sapient humans suggests that humanity has not completely devolved as shown in the movies. Literature ReviewAs Planet of the Apes’ original continuity officially returns, Nova’s backstory reveals a shocking truth: the apes were never alone.

item.title: Poison Ivy Finally Achieves Her Ultimate Form as a Literal God
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHarley Quinn #36 features a back-up story, “Harley the Barbarian,” where Harley envisions Poison Ivy as a goddess, hinting at Ivy’s potential for godhood in the DC Universe. Poison Ivy’s path to godhood has been hinted at before, and “Harley the Barbarian” beautifully depicts Ivy as a giant, shining deity. Poison Ivy’s popularity has grown due to her romantic pairing with Harley Quinn, but more critically, because of how effectively DC has developed her character over the years.

item.title: Poison Ivy s New Origin Redefines Her Supervillain Identity (& Confirms Her 1 True Nemesis)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPoison Ivy’s new origin reveals her tragic backstory and the manipulation she faced, making her even more sympathetic. The Floronic Man, not Batman, is revealed as Poison Ivy’s true nemesis, as he takes advantage of her and plays mind games. The new revelations about Poison Ivy’s origin redefine her villain identity and her relationship with the Floronic Man. Literature ReviewPoison Ivy’s origin is revisited in issue 19 of her series, making some stunning revelations about her villain identity as well as her true foe.

item.title: Pokémon Already Settled Jessie & James Relationship
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn the manga adaptation of Pokémon , Jessie and James are portrayed as a married couple raising a child together, a relationship that was not explored in the anime. The Electric Tale of Pikachu manga was more mature than the anime, and included elements such as sexual content that had to be censored in English releases. Fans were disappointed that the anime did not give a conclusive resolution to Jessie and James’ relationship, leaving them as just friends, but there is debate about whether the anime should introduce a romance between the two.

item.title: Pokémon Gen 10 Games Could Fix A Major Problem With Starters
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe next Generation of Pokémon games, Gen 10, has the opportunity to add missing starter designs, such as a Grass-type crocodile and a Fire-type turtle. The design of starter Pokémon follows a pattern, with each generation featuring Grass-, Fire-, and Water-type starters. However, there are still some missing starter designs. The release of Pokémon Gen 10 games is expected in late 2025, and fans can look forward to the announcement of these new starters much earlier.

item.title: Pokémon s Gym Badge Abilities Are Darker Than They Seem
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGym badges in Pokémon Adventures can be used for evil means when controlled by Team Rocket. The power of gym badges can amplify a Pokémon’s power and allow the badge holder to control any Pokémon. Team Rocket’s use of gym badges can completely change a Pokémon’s personality and force it to obey their commands. Literature ReviewPokémon trainers collect badges during their journeys to help raise their companions and qualify for the Pokémon League - but badges can do more.

item.title: Pokémon s Japanese Voice Actors Shut Down Team Rocket Romance For Good
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJessie and James’ relationship on the Pokémon anime has always been unclear, with no hint of romance between them. The Japanese voice actors for Team Rocket find the idea of romance between Jessie and James laughable. According to the voice actors, Jessie, James, and Meowth form a strong team because of their differences, not because of romantic feelings. Literature ReviewThe Japanese voice actors for Jessie, James and Meowth were once asked about the idea of Jessie/James romance, and their reaction settled the matter.

item.title: Polaris Officially Becomes the New Magneto, as Marvel s Mutants Unleash Hell
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPolaris takes on her late father’s role as a champion and protector of the X-Men, seeking vengeance against Orchis. Polaris shares her father’s powers and perseverance, stepping up to lead the fight against Orchis alongside other mutants. The X-Men, now organized and ready to take action, pose a major threat to Orchis with the combined might of Polaris and the returning Magneto. Literature ReviewLorna Dane has always been her father’s daughter, but now she’s taking it to a new level as Polaris equips her own Magneto helmet to protect mutants.

item.title: Popeye Artist Announces Steamboat Willie Comic That s More Than a Parody (As Mickey Mouse Short Enters Public Domain)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRandy Milholland’s new comic, “Mousetrapped,” is a kid-friendly tribute to Mickey Mouse’s Steamboat Willie era. Unlike other derivative works, Milholland’s comic honors the spirit of the original cartoon rather than mocking the character. Steamboat Willie’s entry into the public domain has led to various projects, but Milholland’s Mousetrapped stands out as an entertaining and respectful homage. Literature ReviewSteamboat Willie is now public domain, and Popeye artist Randy Milholland has created the perfect tribute to Mickey Mouse.

item.title: Power Rangers Corrupted Pink Ranger Just Slaughtered the Franchise s Gods
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Ranger Slayer, Kimberly Hart, proves her skill by killing four corrupted Emissaries, a feat no other human or Ranger has accomplished. Kimberly’s transformation from villain to hero has elevated her abilities, making her one of the best Power Rangers in history. Compared to other legendary Power Rangers like Tommy Oliver, Kimberly’s feat of killing Emissaries sets her apart as a strong contender for the title of the greatest Power Ranger.

item.title: Power Rangers DARKEST HOUR Villain Proves He s Truly the Franchise s Thanos
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAs Ranger Academy #4 reveals, Dark Specter has left a lasting impact on future generations of Rangers, with his name evoking fear even centuries in the future. In Ranger Academy #4, students learn about Dark Specter infiltrating their school years ago, highlighting that his menacing presence lingers along the timeline. Dark Specter has been established as the “Thanos” of the Power Rangers universe, looming over the franchise in a similar way to the Mad Titan in the early phases of the MCU.

item.title: Power Rangers Most Iconic Villain Warned Of DARKEST HOUR S Thanos-Level Antagonists Thousands Of Years Ago
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYInfamous Power Rangers villain Lord Zedd warned about the even greater threat of Dark Specter for centuries, but no one listened. Dark Specter’s presence was foreshadowed in the Power Rangers comics years in advance, and now the cosmic threat is taking center stage in the “Darkest Hour” storyline. Now that Lord Zedd is a Ranger, he must work with the Power Rangers to stop the franchise’s ultimate antagonist. Literature ReviewOne of the Power Rangers franchise’s classic villains has been warning everyone about the universe’s greatest threat, Dark Specter, for centuries.

item.title: Power Rangers RIC 3.0 Unveils the Franchise s Mind-Blowing Future Weaponry
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYR.I.C. 3.0, the upgraded robot dog, helps the Power Rangers defeat Lord Drakkon and his army. This upgrade showcases the future of technology in the Power Rangers franchise. The advancement of Ranger weaponry allows for constant updates and improvements, moving away from relying on ancient weaponry. Literature ReviewThe signature pet (and weapon) of Power Rangers S.P.D. gets an update that nearly takes down the most dastardly villain of the comic series.

item.title: Power Rangers [SPOILERS] Just Died, Completing the Franchise s Most Twisted Redemption Arc
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLord Drakkon meets his demise in Mighty Morphin Power Rangers #116, ending his reign of terror after nearly a decade. Drakkon’s death is presented somberly and almost noble, raising questions about whether he truly deserves redemption. The character of Drakkon is compelling as he straddles the line between good and evil, showing an interest in being good but struggling to act on it. The debate over his redemption will continue.

item.title: Power Rangers 10 Moments That Prove Lord Drakkon Has Become the Franchise s Best Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLord Drakkon, an alternate continuity version of famed Ranger Tommy Oliver who never renounced evil and joined the team, has the Power Rangers’ most persistent and diabolical villain in Boom! Studios ongoing Power Rangers comic series. Drakkon’s key moments include defeating the Rangers’ leader, Red Ranger Jason, destroying the “World of the Coinless” version of Zordon, and even killing main continuity Tommy Oliver. Despite at one point being defeated, Drakkon has subsequently manipulated the Empyreals, become a part of the Omega Ranger squad, and most recently, formed the Drakkon Rangers.

item.title: Power Rangers 10 Ways Billy Cranston Proved He s the Ultimate Blue Ranger (AFTER Mighty Morphin)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBilly Cranston’s ability to think quickly on his feet and use diplomacy to his advantage makes him a valuable member of the Power Rangers team. Despite his lack of confidence, Billy shows continual growth as a Ranger by facing his fears and embracing his unique strengths. Billy’s self-sacrifice to save his friends and his ability to outsmart and dismantle powerful enemies showcase his bravery and genius as the ultimate Blue Ranger.

item.title: Power Rangers Debuts New Dark Ranger Army, as the Franchise s DARKEST HOUR Arrives
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDark Specter has assembled an army of evil, corrupted Power Rangers using dark magic, with his forces now including corrupted Rangers from various teams and timelines. Dark Specter and Mistress Vile imprison Rangers who haven’t joined their army. Their plan is to neutralize the Ranger problem before any intervention occurs. The Rangers’ franchise’s ultimate Big Bad, Dark Specter has returned worse than ever and is building his Ranger army with the help of Mistress Vile, with only a few Rangers remaining to stand in the way of his evil schemes.

item.title: Power Rangers Debuts the Daughter of Original Green & Pink Rangers Meet Olivia Hart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPower Rangers’ new alternate universe introduces Tommy and Kimberly’s daughter, Olivia Hart, as the new Green Ranger. The story explores what would have happened if the original team of Power Rangers never disbanded. Though not much is known about her role in Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Return, Olivia Hart’s character designs pay tribute to her parents’ Ranger colors. Literature ReviewThe Green Power Ranger returns in the form of Tommy and Kimberly’s daughter, Olivia Hart, in a new story by original Pink Ranger actor Amy Jo Johnson.

item.title: Power Rangers Kickstarter Passes $500,000 Mark After Hitting Original Goal in Just 45 Minutes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Return Kickstarter campaign raises $541,480 after being fully funded in just 45 minutes. The comic series explores an alternate universe where the original team never broke up and features new characters and storylines. Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Return #1 is coming February 7 from Boom! Studios Literature ReviewThe Kickstarter for Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Return has reached over ten times its original goal - which fans met in 45 minutes.

item.title: Power Rangers Reveals the Final Fate of a Beloved Omega Ranger
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYale, the four-legged Blue Ranger, is revealed to have a future role as a teacher at Ranger Academy, showcasing his journey of rising from adversity. Yale’s tragic origin as the runt of his litter and his constant loss of loved ones make him an underdog who is constantly underestimated. Yale’s role as a teacher at Ranger Academy proves that he is more than just a pet and highlights his ability to guide the next generation of Power Rangers.

item.title: Power Rangers Reveals the Tragic Final Fate of Green Rangers (Tommy Oliver s Dark Legacy)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Rangers have become extinct in the future depicted in Ranger Academy, potentially due to the lasting stigma of the dark origins of the first Green Ranger, Tommy Oliver. Students and teachers at Ranger Academy speak about Red, Blue, and Pink Rangers, but Green and Orange Rangers are treated as if they never existed. The legacy of Tommy as a Green Ranger may be lost and forgotten over time, and the future of a new Green Power Ranger, Sage, could be put at risk due to the fear and distrust surrounding the role.

item.title: Power Rangers The Original Choice for Green Ranger Confirms Who Should ve Been the Team s Leader
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAs Boom! Studios Mighty Morphin Power Rangers #5 revealed, Tommy Oliver wasn’t Rita’s first choice for the Green Ranger. She originally approached Zack Taylor, the Black Ranger. As the Black Ranger, Zack Taylor displayed strong leadership skills, and was always the team’s second in command. Zack’s leadership qualities were underappreciated early in the franchise’s history, but more recent stories have put more of an emphasis on his role at the forefront of the team.

item.title: Power Rangers The Shockingly Simple Reason Rita Repulsa Puts Up With Her Henchmens Constant Failures
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Go Go Power Rangers #20, Rita Repulsa’s mother claims that she secretly loves her henchmen, suggesting that Rita may be softer than she appears. Boom! Studios Power Rangers comics offer an origin story for Rita Repulsa, revealing that she was raised by her mother to have positive qualities, before being kidnapped by her father and raised to be a villain. The BOOM! Studios incarnation of Power Rangers hints at Rita’s untapped potential for good, and her love for her henchmen serves as proof of her hidden kindness, tying the comics into the TV canon.

item.title: Preacher Every Story in Garth Ennis & Steve Dillon s Groundbreaking Series, Ranked
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPreacher, a classic Vertigo series, is a potent blend of western, horror, and crime genres that broke boundaries. Each Preacher storyline varies in impact, with some feeling like filler, while others offer tragic backstories and emotional conclusions. Gone to Texas kicks off the epic saga, setting up memorable characters and an exciting journey to find God. Literature ReviewGarth Ennis and Steve Dillon’s Vertigo comic series Preacher broke boundaries with its shocking content, and these storylines prove why.

item.title: Predator Confirms Exactly What the Yautja Are Learning from Humans (That Makes Them Even Deadlier)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPredators study and learn from their prey, particularly humans, in order to strengthen their culture and skills. In the crossover series Predator vs Wolverine, the Predator has been hunting Wolverine throughout his long life, learning something new with each attempt. Humans have taught Predators a variety of fighting styles, and the Yautja actively seek out prey to hunt and learn from, specifically selecting humans for their knowledge and techniques.

item.title: Predator Is Done Playing Super Predator vs Ultimate Hunter Promises the Franchise s Most Consequential Fight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe upcoming comic, Predator: The Last Hunt, features the long-awaited matchup between the Super Predator and the Ultimate Hunter, Theta, creating a surge of anticipation among fans. The preview reveals the menacing danger of the Super Predator and its ability to easily slaughter creatures, highlighting the high stakes of the upcoming conflict. The series focuses on Theta’s mission to save thousands of lives held captive by the Predators, driving her to face the Super Predator in a showdown that will determine the fate of countless individuals.

item.title: Predator s New Revelation Transforms the First Film s Meaning
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe lore of the Predator franchise is expanding thanks to Marvel’s new comics, redefining what fans already knew from the first film. Predators are not random trophy hunters, but officially drawn to planets with war or unrest on a global scale. This makes the first Predator film (and Prey) overt political commentary, showcasing humanity’s lust for war attracting cosmic punishment. Literature ReviewThe latest installment in the Predator franchise redefines the first movie’s meaning, as it explains what the Yautja was doing there to begin with.

item.title: Predator s Ultimate Yautja-Killer Is Finally Going Up Against a Super Predator
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Predator series continues with the third launch, featuring heroine Theta Berwick and a new goal of saving more humans from the Predators. Each series has increased the threat level, and the upcoming Predator: The Last Hunt will likely be no exception, with the introduction of a new “Super Predator.” The multi-series approach used in Marvel’s Predator and Alien comics keeps the story arcs linear and easy to follow, although it may be confusing with multiple #1 issues.

item.title: Professor X s New Codename Basically Confirms a Huge X-Men Theory
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDialogue during Doctor Doom’s encounter with the X-Men hints that Charles Xavier, the X-Men’s leader, is poised to increase his powers in an unprecedented way. Xavier’s potential transformation into a Dominion, a being with god-like power and intelligence, could be the catalyst for profound changes in mutantkind – for better or worse. The X-Men’s loss of Krakoa, their unifying force and homeland, creates a need for a new leader; if Xavier becomes a Dominion he could take them places they never imagined…whether they want to go or not.

item.title: Prometheus David Became An Android Messiah After Alien Covenant
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDavid, the android from Prometheus and Alien: Covenant, becomes an android messiah in an Alien comic series. David’s beliefs align with his teachings, making him a philosopher and a messiah to other synthetics. David’s involvement in the events of the original Alien film is hinted at, suggesting he may have played a role in Ripley’s mission. Literature ReviewAfter the events of Prometheus and Alien: Covenant, Alien fans don’t know what happened to the synthetic David, but one comic might hold the answer.

item.title: Quick Stops #1 Reveals Secret Origin of View Askewniverses Mooby (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new comic, Quick Stops Volume 2 #1, reveals the origin story of Mooby the Golden Calf from the View Askewniverse. The story follows Nancy Goldruff, a former kindergarten teacher who created Mooby, as she tells the truth behind Mooby’s creation to a young woman named Kayla Kareem. Mooby’s origin can be traced back to a schoolyard insult in 1989, showing how even prominent characters like Mooby have humble beginnings that fit the style and tone of Kevin Smith’s movies.

item.title: Quicksilver s New Costume Perfectly Updates His Original Avengers Costume
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYQuicksilver’s new costume takes him back to his roots, showcasing his iconic lightning stripe and green color, as he celebrates 60 years since his introduction. Quicksilver’s journey from villain to hero is reflected in his ever-changing costumes, each representing a different phase in his character arc. Quicksilver’s new design honors his turbulent beginnings and highlights his connection with Scarlet Witch, while also hinting at unresolved issues with Magneto. Literature ReviewQuicksilver has undergone plenty of changes over the years, both in his personal life and in his wardrobe.

item.title: Ranger Academy Hints One Power Rangers SPD Member May Be Immortal
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAnubis Cruger, from Rangers SPD, makes an appearance in Ranger Academy, set long after the series, suggests that he may be immortal or have a shockingly long lifespan. Ranger Academy takes place in the far future; though a specific date has not been revealed yet, context clues place its action in the 26th century. Other Power Rangers characters from different time periods also make appearances, hinting at the possibility of longer lifespans or time travel as other potential answers.

item.title: Ranger Academy Preview Reveals the Test Every Ranger Must Pass
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRanger Academy #4 will feature a test that all Power Rangers must pass, pushing their limits as Rangers. The issue takes place on the planet Chromia, where the Ranger cadets must reach Prism Peak in time or risk losing access to the Zeo Chamber. The issue promises a game-changing surprise and will teach important lessons about making tough decisions and working as a team. Literature ReviewSage and her fellow Ranger Academy cadets must face some tough trials in their latest lessons on the step to becoming full Power Rangers.

item.title: Ranking the DAILY BUGLE S Most Outrageous Lies About Spider-Man
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Daily Bugle will label Spider-Man as a “menace” without specifying any specific wrongdoing, fueling their ongoing anti-Spider-Man narrative. The paper published a quote from a villain, Kraven the Hunter, claiming that Spider-Man’s defeat was imminent, showing the Bugle’s unfair bias against the superhero. The Daily Bugle falsely reported that Spider-Man murdered Norman Osborn, committing full-on libel and showing their disregard for the truth. Literature ReviewThe Daily Bugle has been smearing Spider-Man’s name since the first Amazing Spider-Man issue.

item.title: Raven Is Breaking Bad - Titans Most Powerful Member Reacts to Beast Boy s Death with Terrifying Feat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRaven shows her terrifying power by banishing Xand’r to the Phantom Zone, demonstrating a significant power upgrade. The choice to send Xand’r to the Phantom Zone before Beast Boy’s death raises speculation about what Raven might do now that he is dead. Raven’s decision to act without consulting the other Titans suggests a darker path for her, potentially leading her to seek revenge against those who killed Gar. Literature ReviewIf there’s one thing that DC villains need to learn, it’s that you don’t mess with Beast Boy unless you want a very angry Raven coming after you.

item.title: Raven s Ultimate Failure Just Broke the Titans Like Never Before
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRaven’s failure to save Beast Boy’s life in Titans: Beast World #4 may have a profound impact on the Titans, potentially fracturing the team. Raven had the power to prevent Beast Boy’s death. The suggestion that Raven possessed the capability to avert Gar’s tragic demise underscores the immense power she wields. Literature ReviewRaven has just experienced her greatest failure and the greatest loss of her life in one fell swoop, breaking the Titans like never before.

item.title: Red Hood Becomes DC s Most Tragic Hero in Just 5 Words
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed Hood has transformed into a wolf after exposure to Beast Boy’s spores, causing him to reflect on his past and question his role as a vigilante. Despite his growth and attempts to move on, Red Hood feels like his time as a vigilante has been wasted and that he has failed to make a significant difference in Gotham. This introspection has made Red Hood even more tragic, as he wishes he had never come back to life and believes his actions as a hero have had little impact.

item.title: Red Hood Cosplay Gives Jason Todd the Hardcore Weapon Upgrade He Deserves
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA Red Hood cosplay impresses fans with its accurate portrayal of the character’s iconic attire, complete with a distinctive belt and thigh holsters. The addition of a futuristic and unique firearm to Red Hood’s arsenal adds a cool and innovative twist to the character’s weaponry. One of the pictures shared also boasts enhancements by digital artist Wens Universe, who skillfully envisions Red Hood on a rainy street in Gotham.

item.title: Red Hood Demon Hunter - DC Finally Figures Out How to Successfully Reinvent Jason Todd
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJason Todd, aka Red Hood, is finally finding his niche as DC’s newest hunter of the supernatural in a dangerous area of Gotham called the Hill. Red Hood’s strong connection to the supernatural, along with his training and mystical weapons, make him the perfect candidate to fight against demons. Reimagining Red Hood as a demon hunter allows him to play to his strengths and break free from the cycle of Bat-Family drama, setting him apart as a unique hero.

item.title: Red Hood Didnt Just Fail at Being Robin, He Failed at Being Joker Too
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed Hood’s journey is defined by his failures as both Robin and as a potential successor to the Joker, shaping him into the beloved anti-hero he is today. Jason Todd’s failure as Robin stemmed from his ruthless violence against criminals, breaking Batman’s “no killing” rule and ultimately leading to his death at the hands of the Joker. The Jokers believed that Red Hood wasn’t intelligent enough to be the next Joker, resulting in a failure on Jason’s part and preventing the possibility of him becoming the monster he feared most.

item.title: Red Hood s New Team & Territory Prove DC Is Finally Letting Him Outgrow the Bat-Family
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed Hood finally gets his own territory in Gotham City, called the Hill, which is known to be one of the most dangerous parts of the city. This move signifies a major step for Red Hood in stepping out of Batman’s shadow and becoming his own hero with his own supporting cast. Red Hood: The Hill #2 is on sale March 12 from DC Comics! Literature ReviewRed Hood has always struggled to break out from under the Bat-Family, but it seems that DC is finally giving him the solo status quo he deserves.

item.title: Red Hood s New Werewolf Form Proves That In His Heart, He s a Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed Hood’s new beast form reveals his innate killer instincts. The infected characters in the story are reduced to their base instincts, making Red Hood a ruthless predator. Red Hood’s moral complexity is showcased through his struggle with his primal desires and his inability to give up killing. Literature ReviewAs the heroes of the DC Universe transform into animal versions of themselves thanks to Beast World, their truest base instincts are revealed.

item.title: Red Hood Trusts 1 Hero to Help Him Kill Joker (& They re Not in the Bat-Family)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed Hood relies on unexpected allies, including Manhunter, to take down the Joker once and for all. Red Hood’s trust in Manhunter is evident as he shares critical information and tasks her with investigating. The Bat-Family has been unsupportive of Red Hood’s mission to stop the Joker, pushing him to seek help elsewhere. Literature ReviewRed Hood hasn’t always been on the best of terms with the Bat-Family, which is why it’s not too surprising he has another hero he trusts to help him.

item.title: Red Hood Would Have a Totally Different Codename & Mission If He d Been Born in Nightwing s City
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJason Todd’s life could’ve been completely different if he had grown up in Bludhaven instead of Gotham City. Bea became Captain Blud by stealing a superyacht and impressing the previous captain; rather than become an oprhan on the streets of Gotham, growing up in Bludhaven could have set Jason on a different path, potentially leading to a life as a pirate king. Nightwing recognizes the similarities between Jason and Bea, and acknowledges that Jason could’ve had a stable family and a sense of community if he had grown up in Bludhaven.

item.title: Red Skull s MCU Story Can Continue Beyond His Vormir Punishment, Avengers Confirms
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed Skull can continue his story in the MCU beyond his punishment on Vormir, as confirmed in a new comic. Red Skull’s greatest strength is his patience, which has allowed him to build an empire and control the world. Red Skull’s return to the MCU could happen at any time, as he slowly rebuilds himself and lurks in the shadows. Literature ReviewIn Avengers: Twilight #2, a stunning reveal about one of Red Skull’s greatest traits has hinted at how he could make a long-awaited return to the MCU.

item.title: Red X Cosplay Proves Nightwing s Dark Side Is Criminally Underrated
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRed X, the covert identity of Nightwing, is an underrated character in DC Comics continuity. The photographer @nycosplayer showcases talented cosplayers, capturing amazing cosplay designs such as Red X. This Red X cosplay design is one of the best live-action looks for the character and deserves recognition. Literature ReviewNightwing is an overall great guy and hero, but during a dark time he became Red X, with this cosplay giving the character a perfect live-action look.

item.title: Reed Richards Becomes Body Horror Nightmare Fuel, As His Genius Is Turned Against Him
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYReed Richards suffers centuries of torture alongside his daughter as part of Doctor Stasis’ plan to create a Supreme Intelligence. Reed is melded with Marvel’s five smartest characters and forced to devise a way to kill the godlike Dominion AI. The fate of Reed Richards serves as a bold statement about the concerns surrounding AI art and the potential impact on creators and the industry. Literature ReviewAs the X-Men’s villains turn their attention to Marvel’s other heroes, Reed Richards pays a high price for being the smartest man on Earth.

item.title: Resident Evil 3 Every Safe Code and Locker Combination
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewEvery safe and locker you encounter in Resident Evil 3 needs a code or combination for you to open it and gain valuable items to fight undead hordes. Similar to the remake of Resident Evil 2, achieving S-Ranks in Resident Evil 3 is easier when you have more items at your disposal. More ammunition, healing items, or new weapons are incredibly hard to come by, especially on harder difficulties.

item.title: Return to Echo Base Luke & Leia Journey Back to Hoth to Rescue Rebel Survivors
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Skywalker and Princess Leia return to the ice planet Hoth in a new story for Free Comic Book Day, one that revisits the exhilarating opening battle from Empire Strikes Back. The story focuses on their mission to find Rebel survivors stranded on Hoth, but they encounter unexpected dangers and all-out action. This Free Comic Book Day issue is a must-have for fans of the Original Trilogy, as it continues to fill in the story between Empire and Return of the Jedi.

item.title: Reverse-Flash Gets a Terrifying Redesign Worthy of the Movies
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKode Abdo’s redesign of the Reverse-Flash surpasses existing portrayals, setting a new standard for live-action adaptations. The addition of a black gas mask elevates the villain’s aesthetic to unprecedented levels of darkness and ominousness. Fans overwhelmingly support Kode’s design, hoping for a live-action Reverse-Flash that matches the caliber of his digital artistry. Literature ReviewIn a jaw-dropping display of artistic prowess, Reverse-Flash undergoes a spine-chilling redesign that rivals the cinematic masterpieces.

item.title: Revisiting the 1991 & 1992 Royal Rumbles Iconic Comic Book Style Posters
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJoe Jusko’s vintage comic book-style posters for the 1991 and 1992 Royal Rumbles captured the spirit and chaos of pro wrestling. Jusko’s artwork emphasized the kinetic energy and fantastical elements of the WWE wrestlers, who were intentionally reminiscent of superheroes. The 1992 poster featured even more fantastic and eccentric elements, with iconic wrestlers like Hulk Hogan and Ric Flair looking like they could be in a brawl with the Avengers or Justice League.

item.title: Rick & Morty How Morty Keeps Surviving Rick s Adventures (Hint He Doesn t)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMorty’s survival in dangerous adventures is due to Rick giving him 99 lives, ensuring that he can continue to save the day. Morty’s lives are running dangerously low, and he can’t simply die again to rescue his love interest. The revelation of Morty’s 99 lives adds an intriguing element to the expanding lore of Rick and Morty that fans need to know about. Literature ReviewMorty has survived a lot of Rick’s dangerous adventures, with a Rick & Morty comic revealing he technically almost never lives through them at all.

item.title: Rick & Morty Season 7 Just Closed a Major Mr. Goldenfold Plot Hole
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRick and Morty season 7 contains major and minor changes for the franchise…including clarifying a plot question raised by a recent Ricky and Morty comic from Oni Press. In season 7, episode 8, “Rise of the Numbericons: the Movie,” Ice-T seeks help from Mr. Goldenfold to end the war and save his people, revealing C-137 Goldenfold’s hidden genius. Fans of the show should check out the Rick and Morty comics, as they have a big impact on the show, and an upcoming 2024 event called “Finals Week” will change the franchise forever.

item.title: Robert Kirkmans Skybound Entertainment Will Reinvent CREATURE FROM THE BLACK LAGOON Next
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSkybound Entertainment has announced a new comic series, Universal Monsters: Creature From the Black Lagoon Lives, following on the success of its Dracula miniseries. The series will continue the story of the iconic film, bringing the Creature into the contemporary world, while introducing new characters and expanding the franchise’s lore. The series’ new protagonist, journalist Kate Marsden, will face off against the eponymous Creature while hunting a serial killer in the Amazon.

item.title: Robin Bruce Wayne s Son Admits His Deepest Trauma
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne’s encounter with Bat-Mite reveals his deep trauma tied to his mother, Talia al Ghul, resulting in a poignant exploration of his emotions. The scene in Wonderful Toys highlights Damian’s yearning for his mother’s affection, shedding light on the complex relationship defined by betrayal, tragedy, and a longing for maternal love. DC’s Christmas special serves as a pivotal chapter in Damian’s character development, allowing readers to see the vulnerable child beneath his hardened exterior.

item.title: Robin Calls Out the 1 Justice League Hero He Doesn t Respect
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAs revealed in World’s Finest: Teen Titans #5, Robin holds a negative view of his teammate, Speedy due to their similarities to their respective mentors, Batman and Green Arrow. Green Arrow has often been compared to Batman, with similarities in their rich boy origins and vigilante personas. The Teen Titans team depicted in World’s Finest has engaged readers with complex characters, featuring young protagonists who don’t always act heroically, who continue to grapple with trust and identity.

item.title: Robin Just Got REAL With A Brutally Honest Take On Nightwing s 1 Major Flaw
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRobin criticizes Nightwing’s optimism, believing that it led to a misjudgment about the criminals’ capacity for change. Despite the critique, Robin’s remark about Nightwing’s optimism carries a fondness and exasperation rather than outright insult. Nightwing’s competence and ability to substantiate his optimism suggest that it may not be a hindrance but a unique strength. Literature ReviewRobin has never been shy about dishing out criticisms, and it seems that not even Nightwing is safe from Damian Wayne’s brutally honest roasts.

item.title: Robin s Animal Transformation Proves He SHOULDN T Be the Next Dark Knight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne undergoes a shocking transformation into a half-cat creature in Nightwing #109’s backup story “Beast World Prologue.” The transformations in “Beast World” reflect the personalities of those infected, showing Damian is his own person, not a carbon copy of Batman. Damian is urged to forge his own identity instead of feeling pressured to follow in his father’s footsteps, highlighting his individuality and need for his own life. Literature ReviewThe events of “Beast World” finally come for Robin as he gains a new animal form that reveals a surprising inner truth about Damian Wayne.

item.title: Robin s New Codename Just Unleashed His Deadliest Transformation Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRobin, infected by a Garro spore, becomes the Cat Wonder and gives in to his darkest instincts in a deadly competition. Nightwing and Superman Jon Kent search for Robin, who has transformed into a cat hybrid and is now competing in a gladiatorial arena. Damian’s Mr. Mittens form is his most lethal and reflects his unrestrained killer instincts from his past with the League of Assassins. Literature ReviewRobin’s new form may be the cat’s pajamas, but don’t be fooled by his codename.

item.title: Robin s New Power Officially Makes Him Immune to a Classic Superman Weakness
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRobin’s special ability helps him deal with the insidious Black Mercy, something that Superman couldn’t do. Damian and Jon save Trinity from the Black Mercy’s grip by using Damian’s negativity to disarm the plant. Robin’s cynicism gives him an advantage against the Black Mercy, unlike Superman who fell victim to it due to his optimism. Literature ReviewSuperman once fell to the terrifying power of the Black Mercy, but Robin possesses a secret ability that helps him overcome the psychic plant.

item.title: Robin s New Status Quo Not Even Batman Is This Dedicated to Crime-Fighting
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne’s dedication to crime-fighting surpasses even Batman’s, as shown in Batman and Robin #5. Batman enrolls Damian in high school as part of an undercover mission to investigate Shush. Batman wants Damian to have a normal life outside of fighting crime, emphasizing the importance of balance. Literature ReviewBruce Wayne is overly dedicated to his war on crime as Batman, but Damian Wayne’s Robin has him beat when it comes to obsessing over the mission.

item.title: Robin s Perfect Gift Gives Him the Childhood He Always Deserved
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDamian Wayne, the son of Batman, never had a normal childhood due to growing up in the League of Assassins. In Batman/Santa Claus: Silent Knight #4, Santa Claus gives Damian the gift of a true childhood memory by letting him help deliver presents. Damian’s upbringing was filled with training and preparing him to conquer the world, making it a miracle that he even knows who Santa Claus is. Literature ReviewBatman and Robin are the most iconic duo in comic books, but recently Robin has gotten an even better mentor — and with him, a heartwarming gift.

item.title: Rogue & Deadpool s Combined Powers Just Created Marvel s Ultimate Healing Factor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Uncanny Avengers #5, Deadpool and Rogue’s powers combine to show the full potential of a healing factor, saving Rogue’s life and proving Deadpool’s ability to survive a nuclear blast. This instance tests the limitations of Rogue’s powers, by having her absorb Deadpool’s healing abilities through bone-on-bone contact, rather than skin-on-skin. The combined forces of Deadpool and Rogue prove to be incredibly powerful, allowing them to survive and carry on a conversation inside nuclear explosion.

item.title: Rogue Cosplay Proves Why the Avengers HAD to Recruit Her
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRogue cosplay by Janine (@j9lives) perfectly captures the character’s classic look, complete with the iconic green-and-yellow bodysuit and red hair with a white streak. Rogue’s journey from villain to hero in the Marvel Universe is exemplified by her membership in both the X-Men and the Avengers, showcasing her growth and redemption. Janine’s portrayal of Rogue highlights the character’s strength and vitality, with her standing triumphantly on the head of a destroyed Sentinel, symbolizing her power and status as a Marvel icon.

item.title: Saitama s First Huge Mistake Could Change One-Punch Man Forever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn chapter 150 of the One-Punch Man webcomic, Saitama accidentally hits Blast’s son, Blue, in a moment of poor judgment. It’s unclear if there will be serious consequences for Saitama’s actions, as the series often switches tones between comedy and seriousness. Saitama’s attack on Blue could also be framed as a good thing, as it might prevent his battlesuit from brainwashing him. Literature ReviewChapter 150 of the One-Punch Man webcomic has been released, and in it, Saitama makes the biggest mistake of his entire career as a hero.

item.title: Santa Claus Becomes a True DC Hero with a Genuinely Cool Take on the Fortress of Solitude
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSanta Claus has his own version of Superman’s Fortress of Solitude, called The Glacier, where he keeps dangerous creatures he has captured over the years. The release of these creatures by Krampus turns Santa’s Glacier into a menace within the DC universe, raising questions about the potential threat posed by Superman’s zoo in the Fortress of Solitude. Santa’s Glacier puts him on the same level as other A-list DC heroes like Superman and Batman, solidifying his place among the elite heroes in the DC universe.

item.title: Sasquatch Cosplay Brings Hulk s Impossibly Powerful Rival to Life
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAn incredible Sasquatch cosplay brings the powerful rival of the Hulk to life, capturing the character’s distinct orange fur and conveying his size and majesty. Sasquatch, like the Hulk, gained his powers through gamma radiation experiments, but his transformation is through a spirit possession, and he once dragged a naval destroyer ashore. Sasquatch and the Hulk have a long history of fighting, with each showdown being intense and inconclusive, making a true battle between the two incredibly destructive.

item.title: Sasuke s Final Boruto Fight Isn t Just Disrespectful, It s An Insult To Fans
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSasuke’s final battle in Boruto: Two Blue Vortex #5 is an insult to fans who have followed the character for years. Having Sasuke lose against Code, the least intimidating villain in the series, is incredibly unsatisfying. The lack of showing the battle robs both Sasuke and Code of character moments they desperately need. Literature ReviewSasuke’s final stand in the Boruto manga failed to give the character the send-off he deserved or make the villain that took him down intimidating.

item.title: Scotty Names the Star Trek TNG Hero Who Embodies the Spirit of the Original Enterprise
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYScotty praises Doctor Crusher’s fearless nature and recognizes her command qualities and abilities as a physician. Scotty concludes that the spirit of Kirk and his crew is alive in Doctor Crusher, showing that he is not a relic after all. Doctor Crusher’s personal and professional journeys have taken her across the galaxy, and her courage and spirit have admirers like Scotty. Literature ReviewIn Star Trek #15, Scotty confesses that one of his Theseus crewmates best exemplifies the spirit of the original Enterprise.

item.title: SCRAPPER Finale Settles Why You Need to Be Reading Blade Runner with Dogs (Exclusive Preview)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYScrapper #6, the finale of the hit series, reveals more of the villainy of SMITE, an evil organization. The story blends elements of Blade Runner with Disney’s Bolt, creating a unique and mature cyberpunk canine-centered quest for justice. Scrapper is coming to an end but might have a future in multimedia ventures. Literature ReviewScreen Rant has an exclusive preview of Scrapper #6, the conclusion to Image Comics’ hit series that brings dogs to the forefront of sci-fi heroism.

item.title: Screen Rant Captain s Log Our Exclusive Preview of Star Trek s Biggest Stories Coming To IDW Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe debut of “Screen Rant: Captain’s Log” brings Star Trek fans exclusive news, reveals, previews, and insights from the storytellers at IDW Publishing. IDW’s Star Trek series has earned high praise and is just getting started, with unexpected storylines and crossover events. The Star Trek team at IDW is working with intention, telling cohesive and “badass” stories in the finite sandbox between Deep Space Nine and Star Trek: Nemesis.

item.title: See HELEN OF WYNDHORN Brought To Life in Incredible New Process Artwork
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHelen of Wyndhorn, set to release in March 2024, showcases Bilquis Evely’s stunning pencil artwork bringing Wyndhorn Manor to life. Evely’s initial pencil drawings have a flowing, fairy-tale quality that is further refined as she translates them into clean versions for inking. The end result is an exquisitely detailed house atop a hill, commanding awe and respect, as seen in the sneak peek of the interior pages and cover for Helen of Wyndhorn.

item.title: Shang-Chi vs U.S. Agent Gives the MCU a Fight It MUST Adapt in Phase Five
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Shang-Chi vs U.S.Agent fight in Thunderbolts #3 has the potential to be an incredible matchup for the MCU. Shang-Chi’s history of fighting iconic Marvel characters can be adapted into the MCU, making for exciting battles. This is the perfect time for the MCU to adapt the Shang-Chi vs U.S.Agent fight, given the characters’ rising prominence and recent affiliations in the MCU. Literature ReviewShang-Chi and U.S.Agent are trading blows in the new preview for Thunderbolts #3, and it’s a fight so intense, the MCU needs to adapt it for Phase 5!

item.title: Shazam Family Meets E.T. in a Perfect Spielberg Homage Cover
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShazam! #8 variant cover recreates iconic E.T. bike chase scene with Billy Batson and foster siblings, but instead of a friendly alien, he’s accompanied by his nemesis Mister Mind. Variant cover showcases the pure-hearted nature of Billy Batson, as he helps even his greatest foe, highlighting his character’s willingness to lend a hand to those in need. The whimsical homage to E.T. in the Shazam! variant cover captures Billy’s heroic spirit and represents his role as a champion who saves both friends and foes.

item.title: Shazam Is Finally Paying Off the DCU s 2019 Ending Credits Tease
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShazam #8 brings back one of the Captain’s oldest foes, Mister Mind, fulfilling the post-credits scene from the 2019 film. Mister Mind’s absence in Shazam 2 was a missed opportunity in the DCEU, as he would have made an excellent villain. Mister Mind’s return in the comics highlights his vast potential as a mind-controlling villain and a formidable opponent for the DC Universe. Literature ReviewThe end credits scene to 2019’s Shazam film promised big things to come, and now the comics are finally delivering on it five years later.

item.title: Shazam s Version of Kryptonite Turns Him into Justice League s Deadliest Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShazam’s greatest weakness is mind control, which turns him into a living weapon with no one to stop him. This weakness harms others more than Shazam himself, as he is physically invulnerable. If a villain gains control of Shazam, he becomes the deadliest member of the Justice League. Literature ReviewShazam is the World’s Mightiest Mortal, but his historical weakness has proved that Billy Batson’s mind isn’t nearly as mighty as his body.

item.title: Shazam vs Black Adam DC Offers Crucial New Info on Who s Stronger
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShazam acknowledges that he is unsure if he is stronger than Black Adam, despite his confidence in his mortal form. Both Shazam and Black Adam possess the same strengths endowed by the Wizard and have never been able to triumph over each other. It remains uncertain who is stronger between Shazam and Black Adam, but hopefully, a future battle will settle it once and for all. Literature ReviewFans may have wondered if Shazam can truly beat Black Adam in a fight and now thanks to an upgrade, the Earth’s Mightiest Mortal has an honest answer.

item.title: She-Hulk Proves the Avengers Need Her Way More Than Banner
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShe-Hulk’s ability to keep a cool head and act ethically makes her the perfect Hulk for the Avengers, who often struggle with their own egos and impulsiveness. She-Hulk legal knowledge and strong conscience allow her to serve as a moral and ethical compass for the team. Compared to Bruce Banner, She-Hulk is a better choice to be the Avenger’s resident Hulk, as she can hold back the team’s strongest members and prevent their worst impulses from causing disasters.

item.title: She-Hulk s Ex-Fiancé Just Saved the World Without Throwing a Punch
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWyatt Wingfoot proves that peaceful negotiations can stop a world-threatening invasion, showcasing a different approach to superhero storytelling. Despite lacking superpowers, Wyatt’s level-headedness and outstretched hand with a peace offering successfully convinces the villain to consider peace talks with Earth. Sensational She-Hulk #2 highlights the character’s ability to tell unique stories, breaking the mold by exploring non-violent solutions in a typically action-packed genre. Literature ReviewShe-Hulk and the Fantastic Four have an endless array of incredible powers at their disposal; one of their allies just showed them all up.

item.title: She-Hulk s Jealousy of Captain Marvel Reveals the Grossest Part About Being a Hulk
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShe-Hulk points out the downsides of her super strength, namely getting covered in gross substances when fighting. She-Hulk wishes she had long-range powers like Captain Marvel to avoid the grossness of hand-to-hand combat. However, it’s not just about comfort - stories like Empyre have seen Hulks killed or possessed because they have to get up close and personal with bizarre threats. Literature ReviewShe-Hulk may be one of Marvel’s strongest heroes, but she admits her powers have a gross side-effect that makes her envy Captain Marvel.

item.title: She-Hulk, Wolverine & Moon Knight s Official Venomized Forms Revealed as Marvel Rewrites the Symbiote s History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s new series, What If…? Venom, explores what would happen if the symbiote bonded with different Marvel heroes, such as She-Hulk, Wolverine, and Moon Knight. The new Venomized designs of the heroes, including She-Hulk and Wolverine, are visually striking and showcase the epic potential of Marvel’s characters in this limited series. The first issue of What If…? Venom is set to release on February 28, 2024, promising new and exciting stories for fans of the chaotic symbiote.

item.title: Shonen Jump Finally Gives an Epilogue to One of its Most Recent Successes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new Mashle one-shot manga explores the aftermath of Mash’s story and how it has improved the treatment of magic-less individuals. Mash’s success shows that relying solely on magic is not the only way to achieve success in a magic-filled world. The one-shot manga expands the Mashle universe, leaving room for potential future stories with new characters. Literature ReviewMashle’s Mash Burnedead may have turned in his school cape for a pastry chef smock, but he’s still fighting magic in new and unpredictable ways.

item.title: Shonen Jump is The Best It s Been In Years Here s Why
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShonen Jump’s current lineup of manga is the best it has been in years, rivaling the era of the “Big Three”. The magazine has a history of relying on flagship series, but has faced challenges when these series end, and it has to find replacements. Shonen Jump has addressed the issue of canceling series too soon and now allows them more time to develop, resulting in more satisfying endings.

item.title: Shonen Jump Loses Best-Selling Manga Spot For The First Time In 20 Years
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlue Lock is the first manga to dethrone Shonen Jump in two decades; it is the top-selling manga of 2023. The surge in Blue Lock’s popularity can be attributed to the anime adaptation and the manga’s tie-in with the World Cup 2022. Kodansha’s achievement is significant and showcases their potential to compete with Shueisha in the manga industry. Literature ReviewShonen Jump has locked the annual best-selling manga position for the past 20 years, and an unlikely manga just broke the record.

item.title: Shonen Jump May Have Found its Jujutsu Kaisen Replacement With Exciting New Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYShadow Eliminators could be a replacement for Jujutsu Kaisen once it ends, but it needs to meet Shonen Jump’s tough standards. Shadow Eliminators and Jujutsu Kaisen share similarities in terms of cursed spirits and moral-driven protagonists. For Shadow Eliminators to truly replace Jujutsu Kaisen, it needs a complex power system like Cursed Energy or do the unexpected and go for something simpler. Literature ReviewShadow Eliminators is a new Shonen Jump series that’s giving similar vibes to Jujutsu Kaisen, and could replace the hit manga when it ends.

item.title: Shonen Jump Reignites a Controversial Storyline With One Ridiculous Twist
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTurbo Granny takes center stage as the search for the missing jewel resumes in Dandadan chapter #129. The story has been building up to this moment for years, with multiple sidetracks and new characters introduced along the way. Turbo Granny’s role is elevated from comic relief to a more consequential character, and her mission at the police station is sure to bring more comedic and absurd moments. Literature ReviewShonen Jump’s Dandadan keeps getting sidetracked, but chapter #129 continues a controversial storyline that’s the reason why the series is R-Rated.

item.title: Shonen Jump Releases Spinoff of its Next Massive Hit Ahead of Anime Adaptation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKaiju No. 8: B-Side gives secondary characters a chance to shine with their own background stories, enriching the main storyline. The spin-off focuses on Soshiro Hoshina, Kafka’s superior officer, revealing how he came to occupy his position and his connection to Mina. Kaiju No. 8: B-Side adds important context and background information, making Kaiju No. 8 a deeper and more engaging story, perfect for fans to read ahead of the anime’s premiere.

item.title: Shonen Jump s Big Event Will Stream Internationally In English
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJump Festa 2024 will be streamed internationally for the second time with simultaneous English interpretation, allowing non-Japanese-speaking fans to catch the latest news on their favorite manga and anime series. The event will have three stages - Jump Super Stage RED, Jump Super Stage BLUE, and Jump Studio - featuring panels for both popular series and up-and-coming titles.
