It is possible that R2-D2 has access to Rebellion funds or has hacked into Imperial accounts to acquire his substantial amount of credits. R2-D2’s wise use of his funds and the help of these bounty hunters might just enable him to save his friend and end the threat of the Scourge in the Dark Droids crossover.

item.title: Star Wars Reveals How Boba Fett (Accidentally) Helped Free Han in ROTJ
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBoba Fett accidentally helped save Han Solo from Jabba the Hutt. Boba Fett and cyborg Beilert Valance were secretly working together to destroy Jabba’s Megadroid superweapon. Boba Fett didn’t know Valance’s true intentions, and he inadvertently set off a chain of events that led to his greatest defeat in Return of the Jedi. Literature ReviewA new Star Wars comic reveals how Boba Fett inadvertently helped free Han Solo from his carbonite prison in Jabba’s (leading to his own defeat).

item.title: Star Wars Reveals R2-D2 Has A Girlfriend in New Canon (Yes, Really)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYR2-D2 surprisingly has a girlfriend named Qutee, whom he reunites with in the new Dark Droids crossover. Qutee was part of the original D-Squad, a special unit of droids during The Clone Wars, and seemingly shared a lasting bond with R2-D2. Unfortunately, Qutee’s fate is unknown as she was shot during a battle with Imperial droids in the recent issue, possibly leaving R2-D2 without his old flame. Literature ReviewStar Wars’ new Dark Droids crossover has revealed that R2-D2 surprisingly has his very own girlfriend (someone he’s known for quite a long time).

item.title: Star Wars Reveals The Future With Darth Vader s Return To Mustafar
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDarth Vader returns to Mustafar and his castle in Star Wars: Revelations #1, setting up exciting stories for 2024. Revelations will feature tales from all over the Star Wars timeline, including the new series Mace Windu, Jango Fett, and Jabba the Hutt. Marvel’s ongoing Star Wars series and The High Republic are set to continue with new storylines in 2024 as well. Literature Review2023’s Star Wars: Revelations has been revealed with a new preview, one that features Darth Vader’s return to Mustafar, Mace Windu, and more.

item.title: Star Wars Reveals The Original Dark Prototype for Palpatine s Sith Inquisitors
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Wars reveals the dark prototype for Palpatine’s Inquisitors: Jedi who were corrupted and used by the Nihil. The Nihil, like the Empire, recruited fallen Jedi who held actual power and played a significant role in their evil efforts. The fallen Jedi of the High Republic era were a precursor to Palpatine’s Inquisitors, with the same level of authority and skill in the dark side of the Force. Literature ReviewEmperor Palpatine corrupted many Jedi and turned them into his Inquisitors, but another Star Wars villain did the exact same thing centuries before.

item.title: Star Wars Reveals The Origins Of The Sequels Most Ignored Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Darth Vader #42, readers are introduced to Lieutenant Enric Pryde, revealing his more humble origins before his role as a key General in The Rise of Skywalker. Pryde becomes a hostage and bait for Darth Vader in a trap set by elite Rebel soldiers. While Vader initially shows little interest in Pryde, it will be interesting to see if he can prove his value to the Dark Lord in future issues.

item.title: Star Wars Reveals The Truth About Red Sith Crystals (They re Not All The Same)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSith lightsaber crystals are just as unique as normal kyber, defined by the pain and emotions poured into them by their wielders. Healing a Sith’s corrupted kyber requires empathy and understanding of their individual pain. Luke Skywalker faces a new villain from the past as he tries to heal a red kyber, leading to an intriguing storyline that’s only just begun. Literature ReviewAlthough they all share a red color, Star Wars has confirmed the dark truth that no two Sith kyber crystals are the same in the established canon.

item.title: Starfox Harry Styles MCU Hero Returns to Marvel Canon with New Link to Tony Stark
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man enlists the help of controversial Eternal, Starfox, to restore his fortune and assist the X-Men. Tony Stark’s tech and fortune have been stolen by Feilong, and he teams up with Emma Frost and the X-Men to retrieve them. Starfox’s unique power of manipulating emotions makes him a valuable ally, and his recent reintroduction in the MCU has sparked renewed interest in his character. Literature ReviewWith his money gone and everything going wrong, Iron Man is teaming up with the Eternals’ most controversial member Starfox for a mission into space.

item.title: Starscream vs Soundwave Decides the Decepticons Leader in Major Transformers Lore Change
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSoundwave challenges Starscream for Decepticon leadership, potentially changing the continuity and resulting in an epic fight. The issue introduces a new story arc and artist, promising major changes for the Transformers series. The fallout from the previous issue’s shocking ending and the return of Megatron in the Energon Universe add to the suspense and uncertainty surrounding the characters’ fate. Literature ReviewThe solicits for April’s Transformers #7 promise a fight between Starscream and Soundwave to determine once and for all who leads the Decepticons…

item.title: Starscreams Brutality Reaches A New Low In New Transformers Continuity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStarscream becomes increasingly unhinged and brutal as he tries to maintain his leadership of the Decepticons. Starscream and Soundwave cannibalize their wounded comrade Skywarp for Energon, showing their desperation. The true Decepticon leader, Megatron, is expected to return, and the battle for Energon intensifies. Literature ReviewStarscream pushes his brutality to a new limit in the Energon Universe, as the latest issue of Transformers sees the Decepticon pushed to the brink.

item.title: Static s New Costume Is an Eye-Catching Throwback to the Static Shock Animated Classic
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStatic: Shadows of Dakota #7 will debut a new superhero suit for Static, comining elements from his previous outfit with nods to his animated era. The issue will conclude the current run of Static’s adventures and bring the ongoing conflicts to a head. The new suit honors the beloved animated series while staying in continuity with the current story, blending the past and present of Static’s character. Literature ReviewStatic: Shadows of Dakota #7 will conclude the hero’s current adventures, but will segue into his next alongside a suit that blends his history.

item.title: Steve Rogers New Nemesis Combines the Powers of Captain America & The Hulk
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Captain America #3, the Emissary is introduced as one of the most dangerous enemies Captain America has ever faced, with a combination of deadly qualities including a killer mentality, superhuman abilities, and fusion with a demon. Despite being a Captain America’s solo series, he isn’t alone in facing this new threat, as he enlists the help of Misty Knight and Dr. Strange to combat the Emissary. Defeating the Emissary will require all of Captain America’s power and the assistance of his allies, as he strives to survive against this formidable new antagonist.

item.title: Steve Rogers Gets His Own Iron Man Armor in Jaw-Dropping Voice-Activated Cosplay
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCaptain Batmerica’s Iron Man-inspired suit for Captain America impresses fans with its standout design. The suit is voice-activated, with a working JARVIS voice, and includes features like opening the helmet, lighting up the arc reactor and repulsors, and hidden shoulder rockets. Captain America has had his own Iron Man armor in Marvel comics before, but Captain Batmerica’s unique suit showcases the potential for further merging beloved heroes. Literature ReviewA jaw-dropping cosplay has given Steve Rogers’ Captain America his very own voice-activated Iron Man suit that is guaranteed to impress.

item.title: Storm s New Asgardian Look Proves She s Always Been a True Goddess
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStorm has proven her worthiness to hold Mjolnir and has taken on the role of Thor, with a new Thor-inspired costume design. Storm has always been referred to as a goddess and has had previous encounters with divine powers, including wielding her own Asgardian hammer. The Marvel Universe explores the idea that gods are created through worship, suggesting that Storm’s divinity is validated by her followers and supporters. Literature ReviewThor may be the God of Thunder, but the X-Men have a goddess of their own, and she’s proven once and for all that she’s just as worthy of being Thor.

item.title: Storm s New Nickname Proves She Needs to Lead the X-Men in 2024 Reboot
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStorm’s dedication to fighting for the oppressed has been a constant throughout her life, making her the ideal leader for the X-Men. The Genesis War showcases the opposing definitions of “strength” between Storm and Genesis, with Storm advocating for the strength of asking for help and relying on others. With the Krakoan Era ending and mutantkind facing increasing hatred, Storm’s effective leadership and commitment to all mutants make her the perfect candidate to lead the X-Men in their new era.

item.title: Strong As Madara - Rock Lee s Greatest Naruto Powerup Proves How Powerful He Truly Is
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRock Lee, a character known for his hard work, successfully cut Uchiha Madara in half during the Fourth Great Shinobi War. Lee’s utilization of Naruto’s Nine-Tails power-up showcased his exceptional control and effectiveness. Lee’s contribution in severing Madara’s connection to the Ten-Tails was crucial in saving the world from the villain’s scheme. Literature ReviewOne of the Naruto series’ most underrated moments gave Rock Lee chakra, which he used to destroy the franchise’s strongest shinobi with a single kick.

item.title: Stronger Than Naruto - Boruto s New Rasengan Proves He s the Series Most Powerful Shinobi
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBoruto’s new Rasengan showcases his immense power, making him the strongest shinobi in the Naruto franchise. Boruto’s training and natural abilities have surpassed his father’s, making him a formidable opponent. Boruto’s new techniques, such as the Flying Thunder God technique, hint at his untapped potential and raise questions about his future strength as an adult. Literature ReviewThe latest chapter of Boruto: Two Blue Vortex cements Boruto as the strongest ninja in history.

item.title: Suicide Squad Kill the Justice League Cast Who Plays Which Character
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuicide Squad: Kill the Justice League introduces new DC characters to the Arkhamverse, including members of the Justice League. The game features talented voice actors reprising their roles, such as Tara Strong as Harley Quinn and Kevin Conroy as Batman. Other notable actors, like Debra Wilson and Nolan North, portray characters like Amanda Waller and Superman, respectively, enhancing the game’s storytelling. Literature ReviewSuicide Squad: KTJL, has an impressive roster of DC characters, with many actors reprising their roles from previous games.

item.title: Sukuna s Cursed Technique Was Explained In The Jujutsu Kaisen Anime
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSukuna’s cursed technique remains a mystery. While his main attacks are slashing techniques called Dismantle and Cleave, Sukuna has also used a fire-based cursed technique. Where the manga censored a panel of Sukuna’s words before summoning his fire technique, the anime shows his lips moving, possibly pronouncing the word “hako” (box) or “ark”. Fans speculate that Sukuna’s cursed technique involves a “box” or “Ark” where he stores stolen tools and techniques, connecting him to religious themes and the fallen angel Lucifer.

item.title: Sukuna s Victory Over Gojo In Jujutsu Kaisen Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSukuna’s stolen cursed technique, Ten Shadows and Mahoraga, shifted the balance of the fight in his favor by allowing him to adapt to Gojo’s attacks and create openings for himself. Gojo’s critical miscalculation was underestimating Mahoraga’s ability to adapt to the environment, allowing Sukuna to target not Gojo, but the space he was in, thus making Limitless useless. Sukuna still has untapped potential with other cursed techniques, indicating that he ultimately surpassed Gojo in power.

item.title: Super Saiyan Blue Was Created For a Simple Reason Most Dragon Ball Fans Missed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDragon Ball Super’s Super Saiyan Blue transformation was chosen to be blue because its predecessor, Super Saiyan God, was red. The blue color creates a dramatic contrast with the red hue of Super Saiyan God and emphasize the transformation’s difference in appearance. A hypothetical Super Saiyan “White” transformation was considered, but it was ultimately decided against due to its similarity to the plans for the next villain. Literature ReviewThe truth behind the origins of Dragon Ball Super’s Super Saiyan Blue is actually rather simple, according to an interview with Akira Toriyama.

item.title: Superboys Secret Origin Redefines His Greatest Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperboy’s powers are revealed to come from the Chained, a powerful telekinetic villain. The Chained’s telekinetic abilities are far stronger than Superboy’s, and he can level buildings. This revelation adds complexity to Superboy’s already complicated past and puts a weight on his shoulders. Literature ReviewSuperboy’s origin gets a wild update when Lex Luthor reveals that Conner Kent’s powers have a direct connection to Supeman’s new enemy, the Chained. Warning! Spoilers ahead for Superman #8!

item.title: Supergirl Goes Bananas in a Hilarious Twist on One of DC s Most Iconic Covers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC’s Ape-ril Special, featuring a monkey-themed twist on Crisis on Infinite Earths cover, excites fans and prompts speculation about further integration of the iconic narrative. Bernard Chang’s variant cover showcases Monkey Prince cradling a banana peel, paying whimsical homage to the original cover’s Superman and fallen Supergirl. The Ape-ril Special offers a unique departure from the norm, introducing the all-ape superhero team, the Jungle League, in an unforgettable, one-off story that may contain other thematic and narrative elements tied to Crisis on Infinite Earths.

item.title: Supergirl s Dreamer Explains Her New Powers in Official DC Continuity
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDreamer’s powers have evolved and she can now see the future in real-time while awake, causing confusion and uncertainty. Nia Nal, also known as Dreamer, is struggling to navigate her new powers and distinguish between future events and present reality. Titans: Beast World Tour - Metropolis #1 will feature Dreamer’s first official adventure with her updated powers, and it remains to be seen how she will learn to control and use them effectively.

item.title: Supergirl s Dreamer Just Became Essential to DC s 2024 Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe character Dream is set to have a major role in DC Comics’ future, positioning her as a vital player in the company’s upcoming storytelling events. In Action Comics #1060, Dreamer’s true role in the DC Universe, is revealed as she is blackmailed by Amanda Waller to go after a rogue meta-human. Amanda Waller sees Dreamer’s incredible precognitive abilities as a way to make herself even more powerful and intends to manipulate the young hero for her own gain.

item.title: Supergirl vs King Kong Flips the Kaiju Ape s Original Movie Ending
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSupergirl takes on Kong in a battle that puts a twist on a famous movie ending. The Legion of Doom has unleashed kaijus on the DC Universe, including Godzilla and Kong. Supergirl’s Kryptonian powers may give her the edge in her fight against Kong. Literature ReviewAs the MonsterVerse continues to invade the DC Universe, Supergirl steps in to save a fellow hero by picking a fight with the legendary Kong.

item.title: Superman 78 Just Introduced a Jaw-Dropping First to Christopher Reeve Canon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Superman ‘78: The Metal Curtain, Clark introduces Lois Lane to his biological parents, Jor-El and Lara, for the first time in the franchise. This series brings closure to the romance between Lois and Clark, which was stunted in the last two sequels of the original movies. The comic book continuation allows fans to rebuild and explore the Lois and Clark relationship in a way that the final two sequels didn’t.

item.title: Superman 78 Takes a Genius Note from Rocky IV, as Clark Faces His Russian Opposite
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman faces Metallo in a televised battle, paralleling Rocky IV’s iconic fight, symbolizing the tensions between the US and Soviet Union. Metallo’s suit is powered by Kryptonite, making victory likely for him, potentially leading to a major blow for the US if Superman loses. If Superman does lose, he could challenge Metallo to a rematch by figuring out a way to work around Metallo’s weakness, similar to Rocky IV.

item.title: Superman & Batman s Combined Form Unleashes His Extra Powers in Superbat Cosplay
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA Superbat cosplay has brilliantly captured the fusion of Superman and Batman, while also showcasing the extra powers that came with this mashup. Cosplayer TalkNrdy2Me brings comic accuracy to his Superbat cosplay by incorporating Wonder Woman’s Lasso of Truth and Green Lantern’s Power Ring. Superbat may have been short-lived in the official comic storyline, but through captivating cosplay, it continues to thrive and transcend canon boundaries. Literature ReviewBatman and Superman’s most powerful form is back in the form of cosplay, unleashing his extra powers in a stunning tribute to this hero fusion.

item.title: Superman & Wonder Woman s Marriage Turned Them into the Most Toxic Superhero Couple Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn one dark timeline, Superman and Wonder Woman’s marriage is toxic because they loathe each other. Their union was a marriage in name only; they were trying to end a war, but their differences were too great. Despite their natural chemistry, Superman and Wonder Woman are fundamentally opposed and would make a toxic couple. Literature ReviewSuperman and Wonder Woman are two of DC’s greatest heroes, but one dark timeline proves why these legends work much better as friends than lovers.

item.title: Superman Admits a Classic Kryptonian Superpower Is Secretly Nightmare Fuel
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWatch out for spoilers in Titans: Beast World #4! The Earth is in chaos and Superman’s enhanced senses make him experience the carnage and cries of victims, causing him to weep for the dead. Giganta, Wonder Woman’s nemesis, becomes a giant bear after being infected by Beast Boy spores, wreaking havoc on Ivy Town. Superman and the Titans try to stop her but she proves to be stronger than expected.

item.title: Superman Admits a Surprise Justice League Hero is a Major Threat to Him
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Lantern’s power ring can replicate the radiation of kryptonite, making it a potential threat to Superman. Superman suggests focusing on saving civilians while Green Lantern battles Sinestro, as the emotional spectrum’s energies can be harmful. Green Lantern has the power and willpower to potentially take down Superman, making him a formidable hero in the Justice League. Literature ReviewSuperman witnesses a grand display of power and reveals the one member of the Justice League that has a legit chance of taking him down.

item.title: Superman Admits the 1 Secret He Resents Batman for Keeping from Him
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman is hurt that Batman kept Santa Claus’ existence a secret from him, showing a lack of communication and understanding between them. Santa Claus is a real person in the DC Universe and Batman once trained with him. The holiday season is plagued by vampire-like monsters called Draug and DC’s heroes team up with Santa Claus to stop them. Literature ReviewBatman has kept a lot of secrets from his friend Superman, but Clark can’t seem to forgive one surprisingly festive part of Bruce’s past.

item.title: Superman Admits the Sly Tactic He Uses to Beat Villains Before They Even Fight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman turns the tables and defeats his villains using his squeaky clean image and unexpected mind games. His Boy Scout persona gives him an advantage as his opponents never expect him to play dirty. Superman’s ability to use deceit and trickery helps him resolve conflicts with little violence, showcasing his craftiness as a superhero. Literature ReviewSuperman might have an impressive bevy of superpowers, but one thing gives the Man of Tomorrow a surprising advantage over his unsuspecting enemies.

item.title: Superman and Mr. Rogers Have One Heartwarming Habit in Common
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s strength lies in his empathy, showcased through his dedication to responding to every letter he receives, just like Fred Rogers. The act of letter writing highlights the intimacy and personal touch that Superman and Fred Rogers value in their communication. Superman’s extreme empathy and compassion are his greatest strengths, reminding readers of the importance of small acts of kindness. Literature ReviewBoth Superman and Fred Rogers have gone to heroic lengths to respond with kindness and empathy to the people who have reached out to them.

item.title: Superman Declares a Stunning New Meaning for His Symbol
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman and Superman are taken hostage by the Justice League of Earth-22 in Batman/Superman: World’s Finest #22. Superman’s former sidekick, Thunderman, lies to Gog and accuses Superman and Batman of being villains, leading them to be sentenced to imprisonment. Superman expresses disappointment in his Kingdom Come counterpart and says that on Earth-22, the ‘S’ on his chest stands for ‘failure’. Literature ReviewSuperman has his fill of Kingdom Come’s twisted world and declares his variant has corrupted his symbol and given it an awful new meaning.

item.title: Superman Has an Incredibly Effective Contingency Plan to Instantly Beat Wonder Woman
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Batman/Superman: World’s Finest #22, Superman uses his freeze breath power to temporarily incapacitate Wonder Woman. Wonder Woman is difficult to defeat, as she has near-Superman level strength, but none of his obvious weaknesses. Superman’s freezing breath is shown to be an effective way to immobilize and contain Wonder Woman, though only for so long. Literature ReviewWonder Woman is one of the strongest Justice League members, but Superman has a solid plan that takes her out of any potential fight in seconds.

item.title: Superman Hates One Major Marvel Team
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman admits he doesn’t trust or believe in the Avengers’ abilities to protect their world. The Avengers face greater challenges in a darker Marvel Universe, often limited by government involvement. Superman fails to see the Avengers’ true value and skill, underestimating their ability to save the Earth. Literature ReviewThe Avengers are Earth’s Mightiest Heroes, but despite this massive claim to fame, the classic Marvel team has yet to impress DC’s Superman.

item.title: Superman Inherits Doctor Manhattan s Powers in Fanart of DC s Most Powerful Possible Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman inherits Doctor Manhattan’s powers in epic fanart, creating DC’s most powerful hero. Leveraging Henry Cavill’s image, Kode meticulously introduces distinct edits, artfully weaving in Doctor Manhattan’s unmistakable attributes. The fusion raises the possibility of a crisis event where heroes combine into uncontrollable beings. Literature ReviewSuperman ascends to unimaginable heights as he inherits Doctor Manhattan’s powers in epic fanart, becoming what could be DC’s most powerful hero yet. In a breathtaking exploration of fan-driven creativity, an unprecedented piece of fanart envisions a cosmic convergence where Superman inherits Doctor Manhattan’s powers, crafting what promises to be DC’s most powerful possible hero.

item.title: Superman Is Having a Baby... With His Green Lantern Girlfriend
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s estranged Green Lantern girlfriend, Hope, returns and reveals she is pregnant, potentially causing serious trouble in his relationship with Lois Lane. The out-of-continuity story of Superman: Lost depicted Clark’s time in space and his close relationship with Hope, though the nature of their relationship was left vague. While Superman and Lois have overcome many obstacles, having a baby with another woman may be too much for their relationship to handle, causing complications and potential rifts.

item.title: Superman Is Holding Back the Terrifying Full Potential of His Heat Vision, DC Confirms
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s heat vision can be incredibly destructive, capable of burning through entire planets and even cooking someone’s brain from the inside out. Although Superman possesses this power, he never uses it in a cruel or torturous manner, demonstrating his commitment to his values and refusal to cross ethical boundaries. The fact that General Zod and Ursa utilize heat vision for gruesome torture highlights the extent to which Superman restrains his powers and demonstrates his superior moral character.

item.title: Superman Just Destroyed Kingdom Come s Man of Steel with 1 Sentence
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman holds the Kingdom Come version of himself in disdain for failing to protect his friends, as seen in Batman/Superman: World’s Finest #21. The Kingdom Come universe is characterized by a changing world that fell out of love with traditional superheroes, and Superman disapproves of this darker world. Superman’s first impression of Kingdom Come is a graveyard full of superheroes, leading him to believe that the Kingdom Come Superman is incapable of adequately protecting people.

item.title: Superman Just Officially Became a DC Villain, As He Joins a Vicious New Team
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman is being recruited into the Lex Luthor Revenge Squad, forcing him to turn against his partnership with Lex and potentially do something he regrets. The Lex Luthor Revenge Squad is causing problems for Superman’s new partnership with Lex and threatens to destroy the progress they’ve made in improving Metropolis. Graft wields the powerful Kryptonite Klaw, which can manipulate victims’ actions, including turning them into uncontrollable forces of nature. This poses a major threat to Superman’s willpower and may lead to the breaking of his bond with Lex.

item.title: Superman Loses an Essential Kryptonian Power Whenever He s Inside Arkham Asylum
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s X-ray vision is completely useless in Arkham Asylum due to lead pipes, preventing him from seeing dangerous inmates. The tight corridors and odd angles of Arkham pose a threat to Superman, as there are inmates who could seriously harm or even kill him. Dangerous villains like Solomon Grundy and Dr. Phosphorus, who possess unique abilities, could be a serious challenge for Superman in Arkham Asylum. Literature ReviewSuperman relies on his many powers to help him fight crime, but the iconic Arkham Asylum in Gotham removes one of his major Kryptonian powers.

item.title: Superman Officially Reunites with His Long-Lost First Sidekick
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman reunites with his long-lost first sidekick, Boy Thunder, in a bittersweet reunion. The reunion may be short-lived due to the fact that Boy Thunder isn’t part of Superman’s main mythos on Earth-0. Boy Thunder might sacrifice himself to save the day as Superman and his former sidekick face a great threat. Literature ReviewSuperman has been fighting tooth and nail to reunite with the sidekick he thinks of as his son, but their bittersweet reunion may not last long.

item.title: Superman Rewrites His Biggest Weakness, Proving His Limits Aren t That Simple
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDespite Superman’s vulnerabilities to magic, this comic reveals that it’s not an end-all-be-all for him. Superman withstands immense pain while trying to save Bizarro from a powerful magic vortex, showing he can survive magical attacks. Magic may harm Superman, but it doesn’t render him useless as it doesn’t prey on his distinct physiology like kryptonite or red solar rays. Literature ReviewSuperman has several notable Achilles’ heels, but a fight with a powerful and upgraded Bizarro reveals the true extent of one iconic vulnerability.

item.title: Superman s Approval Officially Solidifies 1 Gotham Villain s Hero Status
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCatwoman’s transition from villain to hero earns her approval from Superman, solidifying her place among DC’s best heroes. After sacrificing one of her lives for a noble act, Catwoman’s full turn towards goodness is symbolized by Superman’s admiration. This rare interaction between Superman and Catwoman demonstrates the significant impact of Catwoman’s heroic efforts in a dire moment. Literature ReviewSuperman usually stays out of Gotham business, but he takes some time to give his approval for one famous villain’s turn towards heroics.

item.title: Superman s Biggest Hero Threat Isn t Batman, It s Green Arrow
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn an issue of Adventure Comics from 1959, Green Arrow unknowingly created a massive Kryptonite arsenal by crafting his arrow-tips out material from a mysterious green rock he found, potentially making him a serious threat to Superman. In the story, “The Case of the Vanishing Arrows,” Superman destroyed Green Arrow’s arrows to protect himself from the dangerous Kryptonite tips. This makes it that it is Green Arrow could be a formidable opponent for Superman, despite their seeming power disparity.

item.title: Superman s Corrupted Sidekick Has Officially Become His Greatest Failure
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s failure to save his sidekick Boy Thunder leads to him becoming Magog, one of DC’s most infamous villains. #spoilersahead In Batman/Superman: World’s Finest #22, Gog bestows new powers on Thunderman and renames him Magog, sealing his dark fate. #superherocomics Superman’s inability to save Boy Thunder from becoming Magog indirectly causes the tragedy in the Kingdom Come storyline. #supermansfailure Literature ReviewFate comes full circle as Superman’s former sidekick Boy Thunder becomes the dark hero Magog, a failure the Man of Tomorrow may never get over.

item.title: Superman s Daughter is Being Set up as His Newest Enemy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s daughter, Otho-Ra, has been kidnapped and taken to an alternate Earth by Janan al Ghul, Batman’s daughter from the Dark Multiverse. Janan intends to recruit Otho-Ra by convincing her that there are other versions of her in the multiverse who are conquerors. Otho-Ra’s anger and vulnerability make her susceptible to Sister Shadow’s influence, but Superman is determined to save his daughter from turning evil. Literature ReviewSuperman’s daughter Otho-Ra is in the hands of a villain and she’s in serious danger of abandoning her father’s ways for a life of villainy.

item.title: Superman s Exotic Energy Gun Is the Ultimate Anti-Justice League Weapon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLord Superman of the Justice Lords used an exotic energy gun to eliminate the powers of the entire Justice League, proving its effectiveness as an anti-Justice League weapon. This weapon was stolen from Lex Luthor’s lab and has the power to eliminate superpowers, including magic. While used for evil purposes, the main Superman could potentially use this gun to eliminate his weakness to magic, offering him a fighting chance against magic-users.

item.title: Superman s Family Finally Has a True Dark Opposite in DC Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYZod’s family is a twisted reflection of Superman’s family, lacking love and built on blind obedience. Zod’s relationship with his son is bleak, lacking respect and understanding, unlike Clark and Jon’s loving dynamic. Zod’s banishment of Lor-Zod reflects his lack of love and inability to change, unlike Clark who regretted letting Jon leave. Literature ReviewA bitter moment between General Zod and his son showcases just how his family are the darkest opposite of Superman’s dynamic with his loved ones.

item.title: Superman s Family Finally Proves to Be a Bigger Weakness than Kryptonite
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAs depicted in Action Comics #1060, Superman’s unwavering concern for his family makes him act impulsively, leading him to endanger not only himself but also those around him. His desire to protect his family at times clouds the Man of Steel’s judgment, preventing him from thinking clearly. Superman is willing put the entire DC Universe at risk to save his loved ones, possibly making them a greater weakness for him than Kryptonite.

item.title: Superman s Family Is Officially More Terrifying Than Batman s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s family is shown to be terrifying to criminals in Metropolis, as they have godlike powers that make escape impossible. The Blue Sky group, armed with stolen Kryptonian powers, aim to spread fear throughout the city and make Superman’s reputation even worse. Action Comics #1059 is on sale now from DC Comics. Literature ReviewAs the anti-alien group Blue Sky try to spread fear of Superman, DC fans get to see Metropolis’ hidden fear of the Super-Family.

item.title: Superman s Forgotten Son Has a New Place in the DC Universe - as a Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s forgotten son, Chris Kent, is returning to comics with a darker twist in Sinister Sons #1 by Peter J. Tomasi and David Lafuente. Lor-Zod, who was also known as Chris Kent in DC’s previous continuity, takes a dark turn as an evil counterpart to the Super Sons team. The appearance of a former son as a villain will surprise and challenge Superman, who is no stranger to enemies from his past resurfacing.

item.title: Superman s Forgotten Son Will Return to the DCU in the Saddest Way - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s long-forgotten child, Lor-Zod, may be returning in a sad way as General Zod sees a glimpse of who Lor-Zod once was before DC’s continuity resets. Lor-Zod disobeys Zod and believes his father is growing soft, leading to a heated confrontation between them. While Lor-Zod is currently a villain, there is a possibility for him to become a hero again, just like his adoptive father, Superman. Literature ReviewSuperman’s family has been growing since DC’s Rebirth era, but his pre-New 52 son might just be returning to the DCU in a truly tragic way.

item.title: Superman s Fortress of Solitude Has a Dark Potential that Endangers the DCU
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGeneral Zod’s new ultimate weapon, made of Sunstone, sets him up for a critical role in the future of the DC Universe, as a major antagonist once more. Zod’s knowledge of Kryptonian technology, particularly Sunstone, makes him extremely dangerous to Superman and other Kryptonians, as well as the rest of the galaxy. The versatility of Sunstone leaves the purpose of Zod’s ultimate weapon unclear, but it could be used to remove the powers of Superman or even destroy planets.

item.title: Superman s Greatest Fear is Actually the Same as Lex Luthor s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman fears that his presence on Earth may doom the planet, as dangerous individuals like Zod and Doomsday have come to Earth and threatened it because of him. Lex Luthor believes that Superman weakens humanity, robbing them of the chance to evolve through adversity, making him a threat to the species’ long-term ability to grow and evolve. Superman and Lex Luthor share this same major fear about Superman being a potential threat to Earth, but perceive the reasons very differently.

item.title: Superman s Heat Vision Unlocked the True Power of Spider-Man s Webs
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman helps Spider-Man upgrade his webs, making them as hard as steel - perfect for tougher foes. By using his heat vision, Superman changes the chemical composition of Peter’s webs, significantly hardening them. Spider-Man could alter the chemical composition of his webs on the fly, making this updgrade a permanent addition. Literature ReviewSpider-Man’s webbing is extremely versatile and absolutely iconic, and Superman gave Peter an idea that took the webbing to the next level.

item.title: Superman s Heat Vision vs Godzilla s Atomic Breath Which Is More Powerful, Officially Confirmed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGodzilla’s atomic breath is just as powerful as Superman’s heat vision, proving they are evenly matched in a battle. The Legion of Doom’s Toyman used the Dreamstone to send the Titans to the DC Universe to destroy the Justice League. The DC Universe is in danger as Godzilla, with his Superman-like strength, wreaks havoc and the heroes struggle to pacify him. Literature ReviewGodzilla has come to the DC Universe and only Superman can stop him.

item.title: Superman s Iconic Quick Change Gets Absolutely ROASTED by MAD Magazine
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFree Comic Book Day 2024: Mad Magazine Special Edition delivers a hilarious blend of fan-favorite MAD classics and clever parodies of DC superheroes, promising a delightful read for fans. Kerry Callen’s cover art parodizes Clark Kent’s iconic shirt-rip, adding humor to the classic Superman moment and showcasing the comedic tone of the comic. The inclusion of officially licensed DC parody comics offers a lighthearted break from the darker storylines in the DC universe, making it a worthy addition to any comic lover’s collection.

item.title: Superman s Immortality Is Finally an Official Superpower
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s Chinese counterpart, Super-Man, is brought back to life thanks to Clark Kent’s secret death-defying life force. Superman’s secret identity has caused psychic attacks for anyone who learns it, almost killing Perry White. Superman’s ability to defy death and his extended lifespan suggest that he is virtually unkillable and potentially immortal. Literature ReviewIf it were ever in doubt how powerful Superman is, his ally Super-Man confirms it by using Clark Kent’s power to escape an untimely death.

item.title: Superman s Latest Supernatural Battle Proves Magic Is His Ultimate Weakness
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman becomes possessed by a malevolent supernatural force, rendering him a threat to his fellow heroes and unleashing a horde of deadly creatures. The event highlights the extraordinary menace of magic to Superman, surpassing the threat of Kryptonite by transforming him into an invulnerable and nearly unstoppable force. This comic reshapes the narrative around Superman’s weaknesses, showcasing the multifaceted dangers of mystical forces that go beyond physical harm. Literature ReviewAs Superman battles the supernatural in DC’s holiday special, his vulnerability to magic takes center stage, proving it’s his greatest weakness.

item.title: Superman s Most Disrespected Villain Gets a Dangerous Power Boost
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBizarro returns with shocking strength, surpassing Superman’s limits, making him a greater threat. Bizarro’s new aggression and determination stem from his desperation to find a way back to the Bizarro World. Bizarro’s use of powerful relics and possible enhancement of his abilities could put Superman and the DC Universe in serious danger. Literature ReviewBizarro, Superman’s most perplexing foe, is back with enhanced strength powerful enough to send the Man of Steel flying all across the solar system.

item.title: Superman s Most Iconic Image Actually Belonged to a Different DC Hero First
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Lantern Alan Scott homages Superman’s iconic Action Comics #1 pose. Green Lantern’s pose mirrors the classic cover of Action Comics, emphasizing his role as one of the first superheroes. In the DC Universe, Green Lantern’s debut sparked the heroic age, similar to Superman’s impact on the superhero genre in 1938. Literature ReviewIt turns out that Superman wasn’t the first hero to act out his iconic pose from the Action Comics #1 cover: Green Lantern beat him to it.

item.title: Superman s New Armor Turns His Greatest Weakness into a Powerful Weapon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s new armor uses kryptonite to weaken and defeat the powerful villain, the Chained, showing his willingness to go to great lengths to protect Metropolis. Despite the risks to his own health, Superman resorts to using kryptonite gauntlets as a last resort to save the day and defeat a threat that traditional methods couldn’t handle. The use of kryptonite against the Chained is an innovative move for Superman, who typically avoids the radioactive material due to its deadly effects on him.

item.title: Superman s New Children Have the Perfect Powers to Represent Their Father
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s new children, Otho-Ra and Osul-Ra, display powers that mirror his split personas of Superman Blue and Superman Red. The twins, despite their powers, show personality traits that contradict the typical characteristics associated with their colors. The development of Otho-Ra and Osul-Ra’s personalities may change as they grow older, making them reflections of Superman’s most peculiar phase. Literature ReviewSuperman has had a lot of phases in his life over the years and his new kids oddly represent one of the weirdest periods from his life.

item.title: Superman s New Codename Just Turned Him into a God-Tier Version of the Batman Who Laughs
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s mind has been twisted by Bizarro’s dark magic, causing him to laugh uncontrollably and transform into ‘Bizarro Number One.’ Bizarro has infected Metropolis with his deep hatred for Superman, turning its citizens into rabid enemies. Action Comics #1061 is on sale now from DC Comics! Literature ReviewAs Superman is overtaken by maniacal laughter, Lois Lane, Metropolis, and the Man of Steel are all corrupted by an upgraded villain.

item.title: Superman s New Doomsday-Level Threat Lived Up to the Hype with 1 Major Feat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Chained lives up to the hype as a Doomsday-level threat, pushing Superman to his absolute limits and leaving him on the verge of death. Superman discovers that the Chained’s telekinetic barrier is vulnerable to Kryptonite, resulting in Superman using Kryptonite gauntlets to defeat him. The Chained’s attack leaves Superman on the verge of death, mirroring the situation with Doomsday and leaving a lasting impact on Clark. Literature ReviewSuperman’s fight against an opponent who was said to be a Doomsday-level threat wrapped up in Superman #8, and it definitely lived up to the hype.

item.title: Superman s New Harvester Technology Is the Power Upgrade He s Always Needed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman finally has a tool to regain his power and become virtually unstoppable thanks to Steel’s latest invention. Blue Earth’s leader steals Superman’s power, leaving him weak and injured, but Steel’s new Harvester technology allows him to recharge his strength faster than before. With Steel’s invention, Superman’s recovery time after losing his powers is shorter than ever, minimizing his downtime and allowing him to get back into action faster.

item.title: Superman s New Injury Proves His Latest Villain Really Is Doomsday s Equal
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Chained proves to be a new Doomsday-level threat for Superman, injuring him like no other villain since Doomsday. Superman’s mistake of releasing the Chained from prison leads to a destructive rampage throughout Metropolis. In order to defeat the Chained, Superman must use kryptonite, leaving him badly wounded and on the verge of death. Literature ReviewSuperman is one of the strongest characters in comics, and his greatest defeat came from Doomsday, but now one villain has beaten Superman again.

item.title: Superman s New Nickname Ties Him to a Bizarre Media Franchise
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s nickname “Captain Underpants” is revealed by Fire, but Clark jokes that it’s actually Lois Lane’s personal nickname for him. The nickname references the iconic red trunks that Superman wears, which some interpret as underwear. While it may sound silly, the nickname reflects the playful and comical relationship between Superman and Lois Lane. Literature ReviewSuperman reveals that one of his most embarrassing nicknames just so happens to be the same name of an unexpected, yet appropriate, comic character.

item.title: Superman s New Power Armor Completes His Transformation into the New Lex Luthor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAfter a devastating battle, Superman #9 finds the hero badly wounded and on the verge of death, leading him to use one of Lex Luthor’s robotic suits to continue fighting crime. Clark Kent now oversees SuperCorp, transforming the former LexCorp in his image, showing a role reversal between Superman and Lex Luthor. DC Comics is redefining the dynamic between Superman and Lex Luthor, with Lex showing a willingness to work with Superman and Superman starting to see the value in Lex’s resources.

item.title: Superman s New Role in Metropolis Will Redefine His Relationship with Lex Luthor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman and Lex Luthor switch roles and team up to battle the Lex Luthor Revenge Squad. Lex has been providing advice to Superman, but now he will be out on the field making decisions. The role reversal may lead to a better understanding and perspective between Superman and Lex Luthor. Literature ReviewSuperman and Lex Luthor have been enemies for years, but now they’ll experience a major role reversal, with Superman becoming “the guy in the chair.

item.title: Superman s New Sword & Shield Replace His Powers in the Perfect Way
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s powers have been drained and stolen by villains, so he relies on a new sword and shield to fight crime. The sword and shield perfectly recreate Superman’s powers, allowing him to save civilians and defend against enemies. The new armor and weaponry showcase Superman’s ability to use anything to protect others, embodying peace and hope. Literature ReviewSuperman’s new armor, sword and shield aren’t just good in a fight - they replace his missing powers in some truly surprising ways.

item.title: Superman s Spawn Crossover Revealed His True Codename Outside the DC Universe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s crossover with Spawn showcases his importance in comics as a whole, not just in the DC Universe. The story addresses the issue of creator’s rights in the comics industry, highlighting Superman’s role as a symbol of creators’ fight for their rights. Superman’s appearance in Spawn #10 acknowledges his status as the character who started the superhero craze and influenced the entire industry. Literature ReviewSuperman had an infamous “crossover” with Spawn, one that revealed his true codename outside of the DC Universe.

item.title: Superman s Wife Lois Lane Could Be His Greatest Villain Ever - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s true love, Lois Lane, could actually be his ultimate villain, as hinted in a dark storyline where an evil version of Lois kills superheroes, including the Man of Steel. Lois admitted in the alternate universe story to having fears and thoughts similar to the villainous Lois, raising concerns about her potential for turning evil. Evidence from past events, including being given a gift by Lex Luthor, suggests that there is a dark side to Lois that could lead her to become Superman’s ultimate enemy, if things went the wrong way.

item.title: Superman Thinks Every Superhero Costume Should Serve One Purpose
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman believes superhero costumes should be made to help people, not hurt them. Superman demands modifications to an armored suit made by Lex Luthor to ensure it protects, not harms. Every superhero should strive to be a protector and healer, not stoop to the level of villains. Literature ReviewA superhero’s mission statement should always be to help people — never to hurt. As such, Superman wants his costume to serve that ideology.

item.title: Superman vs Batman Who d Actually Win, According to Wonder Woman
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman believes Superman would defeat Batman in a fight based on their abilities and limitations. Diana has firsthand experience with both allies and knows their strengths and weaknesses. Wonder Woman’s argument that Superman would win is solid and hard to dispute, even though some may disagree. Literature ReviewEveryone’s had their two cents on who would win in a fight between Batman and Superman, but Wonder Woman has the greatest insight of all.

item.title: Superman Vs Goku Settled in Stunning New Death Battle Video
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAfter Dragon Ball Super, Goku has gained new powers that make his rematch against Superman worth a watch. Death Battle settles the age-old debate between Goku and Superman, determining that Superman is the stronger character. Goku may never be able to defeat Superman because he has limits that the Kryptonian lacks. Literature ReviewGoku gained some god-like power-ups during Dragon Ball Super, and a popular YouTube channel tested them to see if they were enough to defeat Superman.

item.title: Superman vs Red Son Cosplay Is the Ultimate Battle of the Kryptonians
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYUgo Anomelechi and Sadie Savoy showcase their exceptional creative artistry and dedication to replicating canon material in their epic Superman cosplay collaboration. Digital artist Soumik’s remarkable photo editing skills bring the powers of these god-like beings to life, elevating the cosplay to extraordinary heights. This captivating cosplay team-up goes beyond costume replication, allowing fans to explore alternate storylines and create their own narratives. Literature ReviewIn a spectacle that transcends the ordinary, a Superman cosplayer collides with his Red Son Superman counterpart, staging an epic battle.

item.title: Superman vs Spider-Man, Darkseid vs Galactus, Punisher vs Batman DC & Marvel Finally Reprint Their Iconic Crossover Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC Comics and Marvel Comics are teaming up to bring their most epic crossovers back into the hands of fans. For the first time in decades, DC and Marvel will release collections containing one-shots and events that haven’t been available for years. Who knows what the success of these omnibuses will do for the DC Universe and the Marvel Universe in the future? Literature ReviewDC Comics and Marvel are coming back together to release two oversized omnibuses that collects some of the greatest crossovers in comic book history.

item.title: Superman vs Superman Just Revealed the Best Way to Beat a Kryptonian (Without Kryptonite)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPrime Superman finds a clever way to defeat his doppelganger using a strategic whistle and collapsing cave. Superman’s sensitive hearing is often overlooked as a weakness that can be exploited to hurt him. Sonic-based attacks could potentially be effective against Superman, highlighting the importance of considering unconventional strategies in battles against him. Literature ReviewSuperman takes on his powerful rival from the Kingdom Come world and reveals there’s a way to defeat the hero by exploiting a surprising weakness.

item.title: Superman vs Thunderman Clark s Former Sidekick Just Found the Ultimate Way to Beat Him
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe best way to defeat Superman is by calling for help from another version of Superman, as shown in Batman/Superman: World’s Finest #21. Boy Thunder, now known as Thunderman, utilizes this strategy when he picks a fight with Superman and summons the Superman from the Kingdom Come reality to come to his aid. This method has been effective in other storylines, such as in Injustice, where Batman brings Superman from Earth Prime to successfully defeat the mad version of Superman.

item.title: Superman vs. Batman Gets a Strange Twist Thanks to Batman s Wolf Form
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s transformation into a violent wolf form after being infected by Garro spores leads to a unique and intense Batman vs. Superman encounter. Nightwing devises a plan to use Starfire’s de-sporing technique to draw out the Garro spore and free Batman from his wolf-hybrid state. Superman easily subdues Wolf-Batman, signaling to the spore that he is the more powerful being and luring it out, reverting Batman to his normal state.

item.title: Superman Watch Out A D-List Villain s Major Power Upgrade Makes Him a Huge Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCount Vertigo has undergone a deadly power upgrade, allowing him to tear apart the minds of his victims. His newfound brain-destroying abilities were successfully used to incapacitate Mary Marvel, raising the possibility of a threat to Superman. Count Vertigo’s rise from a minor inconvenience to a formidable supervillain suggests he may play a more significant role in upcoming comic storylines. Literature ReviewOne D-List villain has just become Superman’s worst nightmare with a power that could completely incapacitate or even kill the Man of Steel.

item.title: Superman, Wonder Woman, Shazam! The Best Dawn of DC Titles that Redefined DC Comics in 2023
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWesley Dodds: The Sandman delivers a tense and engaging mystery that sets it apart from other Dawn of DC books. Birds of Prey brings together a non-traditional yet entertaining team with humor and dynamic fight scenes. Unstoppable Doom Patrol showcases the weird history of the heroes in a surprisingly poignant series full of laughs and growth. Literature Review2023 was billed as the Dawn of DC and promised new and exciting directions for DC icons.

item.title: Supermans Darkest Fate Stopped Climate Change (at a Huge Cost)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Superman: Lost #7, an older Superman warns his younger self that stopping climate change weakened his powers, leading to a devastating end to his superhero career. The story raises the question of whether it’s worth sacrificing Superman to stop climate change and whether there are other heroes who could protect the world. While fixing climate change is important, it poses a moral dilemma as to whether the world would choose a solution to global catastrophe or a hero like Superman.

item.title: Supermans Metropolis Home Base Doesnt Make Sense for His Powers
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s powers are directly tied to sunlight, and his chosen city of Metropolis does not provide enough of it for him to fully utilize his abilities. Leaving Metropolis for a location with more sunlight, like the southwest, would solve this issue and allow Superman to regain his full power. Superman understands the importance of sunlight to his well-being and was not surprised when he regained his powers after spending time in the Wild West.

item.title: SWITCHBLADE SHORTIES Hip Hop Family Tree s Ed Piskor Launches New Daily Comic Strip
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYEd Piskor has launched a new comics project called Switchblade Shorties, releasing a new installment daily in 2024. The comic strip is about the adventures of “the last of the latchkey kids” who solve problems without adult interference. Switchblade Shorties is being released directly on Instagram and is specially formatted to be read on the platform. Literature ReviewHip Hop Family Tree and X-Men: Grand Design creator Ed Piskor has just launched his latest comics project, a daily strip released via Instagram.

item.title: Symbiosis Necrosis Event Confirms the 1 Symbiote Carnage Is Scared of (& It s Not Venom)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Symbiosis Necrosis event brings together Venom, Carnage, and others in an epic crossover bloodbath. The teaser for the crossover confirms a showdown with the one symbiote that even Carnage fears, Anti-Venom. Symbiosis Necrosis promises pulse-pounding battles, shocking revelations, and character-defining moments, making it a must-read for symbiote fans. Literature ReviewMarvel’s Symbiosis Necrosis event brings together Venom, Meridius, and others for a bloodbath that features the one symbiote even Carnage fears.

item.title: T Challa the Vampire Black Panther Gets a Terrifying New Form as He Uncovers Wakanda s Secret History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s “Black Panther: Blood Hunt” features the exiled former king of Wakanda, Black Panther, transformed into a bloodsucking vampire. T’Challa will struggle to balance his thirst for blood with his love for his people while uncovering dark secrets of Wakanda’s past. The series introduces new villains inspired by real African mythology and legends and tests T’Challa’s connection to the Panther God. Literature ReviewMarvel reveals that Black Panther: Blood Hunt will see T’Challa as a vampire, fighting between his urge to protect Wakanda and his new bloodthirst.

item.title: Terrifying Shredder Cosplay Is The Live-Action TMNT Design Fans Never Got
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY@cecilosaurus creates a terrifying and accurate cosplay of Karai as the new Shredder, showcasing her badass nature and honoring the character’s legacy. The detailed and weathered armor, sharp claws, and signature helmet elevate the cosplay and emphasize Karai’s deadly capabilities. This unique take on Karai as Shredder offers fans a glimpse into the scarier side of the character, filling the void until a new live-action version of Shredder is introduced.

item.title: Thanos Love of Death Is Redefined, as Marvel Drops One of Its Biggest Cosmic Lore Reveals Ever
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s afterlife is revealed to have multiple options, including judgement and reincarnation, making it more complex and reflective of different attitudes towards death. Thanos’ love for Death takes on a new layer of meaning, as he continues to choose Death despite other options in the afterlife, making him appear almost cowardly. The Resurrection of Magneto #1 provides a fresh perspective on Thanos’ obsession with Death and adds depth to the character’s motivations.

item.title: Thanos Most Dangerous Weapon Isn t the Infinity Gauntlet - It s His Mind
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThanos proves he’s a formidable adversary even without the Infinity Gauntlet, using his incredible physical strength and exceptional mental durability. Emma Frost, a member of the Illuminati, attempts to stop Thanos with her telepathy, but he proves too powerful for her mind games. This battle highlights Thanos’ physical and mental strength, solidifying his status as a truly formidable threat to even the most powerful heroes. Literature ReviewThanos is a dangerous, brutal villain with or without the Infinity Gauntlet.

item.title: Thanos Strongest Enemy Beat Hulk, Juggernaut & the Thing Without Breaking a Sweat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Champion proves to be the all-time strongest warrior, defeating the Hulk, Juggernaut, and Thing effortlessly. Thanos and the Hulk both outsmart the Champion by using the Power Stone against him. Despite his defeat, the Champion initially displays unparalleled strength, overpowering all who challenge him. Literature ReviewThanos has a plethora of enemies, but none of them can match this one, especially after they beat Hulk, Juggernaut, and the Thing like it was nothing.

item.title: Thanos Very First Marvel Appearance Wasn t When You Think
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThanos’ real first appearance in Marvel Comics was in Captain Marvel #26, not Iron Man #55. Iron Man’s encounter with a robot duplicate of Thanos actually led to a new storyline in the comic Thanos: Death Notes #1. The mislead of Thanos’ debut added an interesting twist to his origin story and posed a personal threat to Tony Stark. Literature ReviewIt’s widely believed that Thanos made his Marvel Comics debut in an Iron Man comic, but that may not actually be the case (and that’s a good thing).

item.title: Thanos Is Responsible For The Birth of Marvel s Deadliest Symbiote
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThanos’ search for the Infinity Stones inadvertantly led to the creation of the Carnage symbiote. In Venom #20, the Maker theorizes that the Venom symbiote reproduced in response to Thanos’ threat, giving birth to Carnage. Carnage evolved into a cosmic threat on the level of Thanos, over time becoming by far the Marvel Universe’s most dangerous symbiote. Literature ReviewThanos is one of the most dangerous aliens in Marvel, and because of him, Earth has to deal with the most deadly serial killer ever known.

item.title: The 90s X-Men Roster Gets Incredible Live-Action Designs In New Marvel Cosplay
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s X-Men come to life in incredible live-action cosplay looks that impress and deserve attention from the MCU. The cosplayers showcased in the photos display some of the best comic-accurate designs in the cosplay community. The 90s versions of the X-Men costumes are beloved by fans, and these cosplay images capture the look and feel of the characters perfectly. Literature ReviewThe X-Men have had tons of different rosters over the years, with its 90s team having iconic designs that cosplayers like these can’t get enough of!

item.title: The 10 Best Alien Arcs From Dark Horse Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDark Horse Comics expanded the Alien mythos in groundbreaking ways, delving into the mystery of the Xenomorph and challenging the perception of them as mere “space bugs.” Dark Horse introduced fascinating storylines such as the worship of Xenomorphs by a cult, the civil war on the Xenomorph homeworld, and alternate versions of the classic Alien film. Dark Horse Comics also established Alien and Predator as a shared universe and created thrilling crossovers with other franchises like The Terminator and even DC’s Superman.

item.title: The 10 Best Comic Books Ever, Ranked
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSin City by Frank Miller is an acclaimed neo-noir comic that showcases Miller’s talent beyond superheroes. It combines pulp and crime-noir influences into a serialized TV/movie crime-drama format. Preacher, written by Garth Ennis and Steve Dillon, is a cult-hit that explores supernatural and religious themes in a small Texas town. It features an engrossing story with a bizarre cast of characters. Batman: The Long Halloween, by Jeph Loeb and Tim Sale, is an influential detective-thriller Batman comic that showcases the superhero’s grounded, street-level side.

item.title: The 10 Best Dark Horse ALIEN One-Shot Stories
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAlien one-shot stories from Dark Horse Comics add depth and richness to the franchise’s lore, featuring unique and creative standalone tales. These stories showcase different aspects of the Alien universe, such as pig-led hive takedowns, Xenomorph hybrids, ancient humans, and kid-led adventures. Dark Horse Comics also delves into unproduced screenplays and provides behind-the-scenes insights, offering a comprehensive guide to H.R. Giger’s brilliance. Literature ReviewSome of the greatest Alien stories ever told were published under Dark Horse Comics, and a great number of those were one-shots.

item.title: The 10 Best Wolverine War Stories (Ranked)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s war experiences range from real-world conflicts to fictional ones, showcasing his role as a soldier throughout history. Some of Wolverine’s war stories, while notable, may not have as much significance for him personally compared to other events in his life. Wolverine’s involvement in wars includes fighting alongside iconic Marvel characters, surviving a nuclear detonation, and even becoming the new Apocalypse in an alternate reality. Literature ReviewWolverine is more than just an X-Man, he’s also a soldier who has fought in every war during the course of his life.

item.title: The 10 Most Shocking Spawn Villains (& How Al Simmons Defeated Them)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpawn defeats the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles in a short but action-packed battle in the sewers. Spawn and Batman start off as enemies but come to a peaceful resolution after Spawn gets hit in the face with a batarang. Spawn teams up with other Image Comics characters to fight and defeat the Mars Attacks aliens - and those are just three of the 10 most shocking enemies Spawn defeats.

item.title: The 11 Best Covers From Grant Morrison s New X-Men Run (Ranked)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNew X-Men was a groundbreaking refresh of the franchise for the new millennium, something attested to by its series of iconic covers. Covers by artists like Frank Quitely, Phil Jiminez, and others, often featuring single characters in model-like poses, helped define the series during its successful three-year run. New X-Men covers often offer insightful, if subtle, commentary on the story inside, making them essential to the overall narrative of the book.

item.title: The 25 Greatest Batman Villains Of All Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman villains represent the diabolical best of Gotham City, standing in perfect opposition to the crime-fighting Caped Crusader. Deadshot, Punchline, and other Batman villains have complex relationships with Batman, often balancing a code of honor with their criminal activities. Each Batman villain has their own unique backstory and motivations, adding depth and complexity to the Dark Knight’s rogues gallery. Literature ReviewThe owner of the greatest rogues’ gallery in comics, The Dark Knight has dealt with a rough crowd over the years.

item.title: The 5 Original X-Men End 2023 Changed Forever - Three Dead, One Corrupted, One Depowered
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe original five X-Men face their lowest point as 2023 ends, with three dead, one a villain, and one heading for execution. Jean Grey was stabbed to death, Iceman melted by Nimrod, and Angel blown to pieces by Gambit. Meanwhile, Beast made a permanent move to villainy, while Cyclops was tortured and had his powers stolen through a grotesque injury. Literature Review2023 was a dark year for every member of the X-Men, but the five founding heroes suffered worse than anyone else - from death to R-rated torture.

item.title: The 8 Paths Beyond Death Marvel Spills the Secrets of Its Afterlife, & the Huge Choice Superheroes Make After Death
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel reveals the eight paths beyond death, including death, judgment, and reincarnation, in The Resurrection of Magneto #1. Al Ewing redefines Marvel’s afterlife, making it more complicated and compelling than ever before. Marvel’s heroes face difficult decisions upon death, including judgment and reincarnation, making the afterlife more complex. Literature ReviewMarvel has significantly overhauled its vision of the afterlife, presenting eight different paths for the newly deceased in the Marvel Universe.

item.title: The A24 of Comics DSTLRY s Latest Cover Art for GONE & SOMNA Deserves to Be Framed (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDSTLRY’s first two series, Gone and Somna, are distinct in style and story, pushing the boundaries of genre storytelling. The publisher is well on its way to becoming an “indie darling” in the comics world with its innovative publishing model and talented founding creators. The incentive variant covers for Gone #3 and Somna #3 feature the work of superstar artists and can be purchased through comic book retailers. Literature ReviewNew publisher DSTLRY continues to impress with a series of jaw-dropping incentive variant covers for its first two series, Gone and Somna.

item.title: The Addams Family Tortures Two Thieves in Delightful Twist on Home Alone
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Addams Family: Charlatan’s Web #1 features two burglars breaking into the Addams mansion and subsequently realizing they’ve bit off more than they can chew, in a direct homage to the classic film Home Alone. The Addams Family’s humor lies in their obliviousness to how frightening their home is to the thieves, who they believe are excited, rather than terrified, by the many torture devices the family show off. The story ends on a cliffhanger, with Wednesday and Pugsley enticing the thieves to stay longer by promising to lead them to their parents’ jewels.

item.title: The All-New, Cyberpunk Spawn Faces A Dangerous Future In RAT CITY
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe upcoming Rat City series, a spin-off of Image Comics’ long-running Spawn franchise, introduces Peter Cairn, a new cyberpunk iteration of Spawn, who is an ex-soldier and amputee. Peter Cairn receives demonic powers from nanites in his prosthetic legs, thanks to blood donation from classic Spawn, Al Simmons. Rat City promises to be a unique blend of hi-tech sci-fi and supernatural horror, with an exciting creative team behind it.

item.title: The Avengers Best Team-Up Move is Playing Musical Chairs
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Avengers reveal a new tag team move called “musical chairs” to throw off their opponents and gain an edge in battle. #Avengers #TeamStrategy The tactic proves successful in evening the playing field and tripping up the villains, showing how a super-team can produce effective results. #CreativeTeamManeuvers The musical chairs maneuver involves every member of the team and guarantees success, making it a smart tactic to switch opponents and surprise the villains.

item.title: The Avengers Most Overlooked Member Could Be Their Most Effective
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlue Marvel proves his worth as a powerful and efficient member of the Avengers. He demonstrates the full extent of his abilities in a battle against Thanos, showcasing his power to manipulate matter and energy. This story highlights the potential and freshness of Blue Marvel as a character, making a case for his inclusion in future Avengers stories. Literature ReviewOne of the most overlooked members of the Avengers - maybe even one of Marvel’s most overlooked heroes period - is their most effective as well.

item.title: The Avengers Next Threat Is So Big They re Recruiting Their Greatest Villains
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNightmare’s attack on the Avengers was actually a cry for help, revealing a looming threat to the Marvel Universe. Nightmare’s power over sleep and dreams makes him a formidable opponent for even the most powerful superheroes. The Avengers are faced with a threat unlike anything they’ve encountered before, forcing heroes and villains to unite against it. Literature ReviewA pattern is emerging from a series of seemingly random brawls across the Marvel Universe: the Avengers’ enemies keep choosing to help them.

item.title: The Baroness Debuts In New G.I. Joe Continuity As Dukes Shocking Ally
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe recently released Duke #2 introduces the iconic villain, Baroness, who surprisingly starts out working with future G.I. Joe leader Duke towards a common goal. The issue hints at a possible prison break collaboration between Duke and Baroness in Duke #3, but raises questions about whether Duke can trust his newfound ally, or for how long. Fans can expect twists and turns in the Energon Universe storyline, as previously established continuity is being played around with, leading to many characters potentially having different allegiances than expected.

item.title: The Batman of China Just Debuted the Ultimate Anti-Superman Contingency Weapon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBat-Man of China returns to the DC Universe and reveals a surprisingly effective weapon that can harm Superman. Bat-Man’s magic batarang, made from the scales of a magic snake, proves to be a lethal anti-Superman weapon. The use of magic in Bat-Man’s batarangs highlights its effectiveness as an alternative to Kryptonite in countering Kryptonian strength. Literature ReviewForget about kryptonite. A misunderstanding causes Batman’s ally to reveal an improved batarang that uses magic to take down Kryptonians.

item.title: The Batmobile That Laughs DC s Darkest Batmobile Puts A Horrifying Twist On A Classic Design
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Batmobile That Laughs, driven by the twisted version of Batman known as the Batman Who Laughs, is one of the most sinister and intimidating creations in the DC Universe. This version of the Batmobile is visually striking, with flame vents, spiked wheels, a captive container, and a maniacal smiling grill that reflects the Joker’s sadism. With the expectation that the Batman Who Laughs will continue to be a central antagonist, future storylines should feature the Batmobile That Laughs more prominently, emphasizing its deadly gadgets and accessories.

item.title: The Best of Us Spider-Man s New Title Cements His Status as Marvel s Top Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man is consistently referred to as “the best of us” by multiple Marvel heroes, including Daredevil and Captain America. Spider-Man’s selflessness, good nature, and pure heart make him the definitive hero in the Marvel Universe. Spider-Man’s impact on those around him is often forgotten, but Avengers: Twilight #1 serves as a reminder of his importance to the Marvel heroes. Literature ReviewA recurring phrase that many have used to describe Spider-Man lately has solidified his reputation as the most important hero in the Marvel Universe.

item.title: The Best-Selling Manga Of 2023 Proves the Surprising New Genre Dominating Shonen
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSports manga have always had a cultural impact, with series like Slam Dunk and Haikyuu!! influencing the popularity of basketball and volleyball in Japan and neighboring countries. Despite the rise in dark fantasy shōnen in recent years, the success of Blue Lock and other sports manga shows that the genre is getting attention once again. New sports manga are incorporating other genres like coming-of-age and romance, making them even more appealing to a wider range of readers.

item.title: The Boys Crossover With DC Unleashed Its Most R-Rated Superhero Injury
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Boys’ unofficial crossover with Marvel and DC characters pushes the limits of what is acceptable, even in their universe, known for its gruesome violence. The “crossover” was produced by Boys creators Garth Ennis for a fundraiser in support of the Comic Book Legal Defense Fund. This rare and exclusive story, by the hit series’ original creative team, only appeared in the 2008 fundraiser issue, and has not been collected in The Boys trade paperbacks.

item.title: The Boys Staggering Success Proves Another R-Rated Franchise Is Going to Waste
