item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLeaving Megalopolis is a zombie superhero story, where corrupted superhumans have been quarantined within a single city. The series follows the normal people trying to escape. It has many similarities to The Walking Dead and The Boys, and could be the next big pop culture sensation. But Leaving Megalopolis isn’t just Walking Dead with superheroes or The Boys with zombies - it has a lot to say, and vast potential that still needs to be explored.

item.title: The Boys Subtlest Comic Reference Exposes Compound V s Surprising Inspiration
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCompound V in The Boys is seemingly inspired by Asterix the Gaul, a French comic from the ’60s, where a character gains superhuman strength from a potion. The origin story of The Boys’ Female mirrors that of Asterix, with her accidentally consuming a synthetic version of Compound V. The connection is further solidified by the fact that the scientist who created the synthetic Compound V shares a name with the co-creator of Asterix, Albert Uderzo.

item.title: The Boys Tek Knight Originally Had the Franchise s Most R-Rated Codename
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe hero character Tek Knight from The Boys was originally called “the F****er” in Garth Ennis’ series pitch. Tek Knight’s compulsion to commit sexual acts with random objects is revealed to be caused by a brain tumor. Tek Knight was one of the first characters created for the series, though he was adapted to be far more menacing for the Amazon adaptation. Literature ReviewSharing his original pitch for the series, The Boys creator reveals that Tek Knight originally had an R-rated codename that ultimately went too far.

item.title: The Boys Was Originally Set in the DC Universe (with Justice League Crossovers)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Boys was originally published by DC Comics under the WildStorm imprint before moving to Dynamite Entertainment. There were plans for an official Justice League crossover, with DC editors excited about the crossover potential. However, Garth Ennis thought the idea was a “very bad idea”, a sentiment that was eventually shared by DC Comics. Literature ReviewThe Boys was originally published by DC Comics under the WildStorm imprint, and the initial idea was that it would crossover with the Justice League.

item.title: The Brotherhood of Injustice DC s Most Iconic Villains Combined Bodies in This Twisted Team
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman and Superman find themselves in a fused world called Gothamopolis, where they must face the Brotherhood of Injustice, a fusion of their worst villains. The Brotherhood of Injustice is made up of terrifying mash-ups of familiar Batman and Superman characters, including Jimmy Two-Face, the Ventrilomaker, Brainycat, Doomstroke, Penguello, and Lana Quinn. Despite their efforts and the help of fused allies, Batman and Superman are overpowered and defeated by the Brotherhood of Injustice, and they only manage to escape when they realize the fusion was caused by Dr.

item.title: The Chained, Doctor Hate, Sovereign These Terrifying New Villains REALLY Challenged DC s Heroes in 2023
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCyborg Superboy: Conner Kent faces his most dangerous enemy yet in the form of Cyborg Superboy, a malevolent clone with cybernetic enhancements. The Uncoiled: The Flash encounters an intimidating extra-dimensional creature called the Uncoiled, which possesses the ability to step in and out of reality, making it a difficult opponent to defeat. Red Mask: Batman battles Red Mask, a Joker variant who creates alternate Earths filled with Jokers, posing a serious threat to Gotham and its inhabitants.

item.title: The Classic G.I. Joe H.Q. Is Back, But Theres A Catch
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDuke #2 introduces the Pit, an old base that serves as a safe house for high-risk prisoners, the Energon Universe incarnation of the Joes’ classic base. The classic G.I. Joe team may eventually form and move into the Pit in the Energon continuity, but for now, readers will have to wait to find out what happens, as Duke and Baroness team up to break out of the decommissioned facility Duke #3.

item.title: The DCU s Greatest Antagonist Is Sending Peacemaker After This Forgotten Flash Family Friend
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Titans: Beast World #4, Amanda Waller sends Peacemaker after Flash Family friend Chester P. Runk, as the latest step in her grand plan to rid the world of superheroes. Preview pages for the issue indicate Waller has “twisted” plans for Runk, that could have dire consequences for the DC Universe as a whole. With the heroes preoccupied, Waller continues her villainous agenda unopposed, making her the most urgent threat in the DC Universe.

item.title: The Evil Dead BOTH Army of Darkness Endings are Canon (Theory Explained)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBoth the theatrical and alternate endings of Army of Darkness might be canon in the Evil Dead universe. The new comic series reveals that Evil Ash is the one responsible for causing the apocalypse in the original ending. The storylines depicting the different endings are actually part of the same universe, connecting the Evil Dead trilogy into one story. Literature ReviewA new theory based on an Evil Dead comic suggests that both the theatrical ending and the alternate ending of Army of Darkness are canon.

item.title: The Expanse Reinvents the Rings Powers in Game-Changing New Twist
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStrange occurrences in The Expanse: Dragon Tooth #6 suggest that people “die” when they go through the Rings, supporting Dr. Okoye’s theory. The ghostly voices and locked rooms experienced by the Rocinante crew indicate that the protomolecule may be reaching out for help once more, as depicted previously on the TV series. The situation is scarier than Holden’s encounter with Miller, as the protomolecule can now seemingly take over the ship’s systems, posing a greater threat than it did previously.

item.title: The Fantastic Four s Fifth Member Saves The Team With A Heartfelt Tribute
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAlicia Masters-Grimm is a crucial member of the Fantastic Four, without whom the team would have been defeated by Kang the Conqueror. The Fantastic Four recognizes Alicia’s talents and treats her as an equal, involving her in battles and relying on her skills. The love and support among the Fantastic Five, including Alicia, make them a formidable force against even the greatest challenges, like Kang. Literature ReviewAlicia Masters may not have any superpowers, but she’s shown time and time again that she’s as much a member of the Fantastic Four as her husband is.

item.title: The Far Side 10 Funniest Comics Set in the Old West
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Far Side comics brilliantly infuse silliness into the American Old West, creating hilarious scenarios in a stock setting. The 10 funniest Far Side comics set in the Wild West mock the over-idealization of cowboys, gunfights, and cattle in American culture. The comics highlight absurd and comical situations, such as gunfights over ping-pong paddles, trivia quizzes during showdowns, and heroes who clean up towns. Literature ReviewThe Wild West was a lawless place full of criminals, cowboys and conflict, but classic cartoon The Far Side always saw the lighter side of things.

item.title: The Far Side 10 Weirdest Holiday Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Far Side’s holiday strips are strange and memorable, adding its quirky humor to Valentine’s Day, St. Patrick’s Day, Halloween, Thanksgiving, and Christmas. The comic deconstructs holiday tropes in unique and often bizarre ways, using anthropomorphized animals and evocative visuals to present off-kilter looks at human traditions. The strip’s humor comes from presenting the mundane from a surreal perspective, and turning familiar traditions and stories on their heads to create hilarious and unexpected scenarios.

item.title: The Fate of Prometheus First Xenomorph Was Too Gruesome For The Movie
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Deacon, also known as the Proto-Xenomorph, made its debut in the movie Prometheus and was surgically removed from its host, growing into a mountain-like creature. The Prometheus ship was located inside this mountain, leading the human survivors to believe it was buried inside, when it was actually consumed by the Deacon. The fate of the Deacon as a motionless mountain is tragic and underwhelming, as it will likely never be explored again in the Alien canon.

item.title: The First 10 Classic Superheroes Of All Time
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewThese are the first classic superheroes to appear in comics and eventually spark a phenomenon that has taken the world by storm. Comic books introduced a superhero for the first time in 1936 and changed pop culture forever. Nobody could have predicted the successful and powerful industry that superheroes would eventually become, but 86 years later they are more relevant than ever. The Phantom (1936) First appearance: King Features Syndicate on February 17, 1936

item.title: The Flash DC Calls Out the Biggest Problem with the Long-Running TV Show
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC acknowledges and criticizes The Flash’s repeated use of evil speedsters as primary villains in the show. The Flash had other big bads that weren’t speedsters, but the show kept falling into the pattern of using villainous speedsters, which was a detriment. While The Flash is well-loved, the repeated use of evil speedster villains is a glaring problem that fans may continue to resonate with. Literature ReviewThe Flash’s live-action show may be a fan-favorite, but DC Comics is calling out one of the biggest issues with the beloved CW adaptation.

item.title: The Gardener Poison Ivy s Ex-Girlfriend Returns in a Brand New Origin Story
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe upcoming Poison Ivy #20 will introduce Bella Garten as the Gardener, Poison Ivy’s ex and a major player in her origin story. The Gardener’s role in the story hints at a possible major character shift for Poison Ivy, with Garten potentially becoming a toxic force. The issue will serve as a perfect entry point for new fans, offering a glimpse into Poison Ivy’s past and a refreshing update for her character.

item.title: The Green Goblin Returns Marvel Confirms Norman Osborn s Hero Days are Over
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNorman Osborn returns to his villainous role as the Green Goblin, marking the end of his redemption arc as a hero. The upcoming Free Comic Book Day issue will set up Osborn’s return and hint at what’s to come in The Amazing Spider-Man. Peter Parker will undoubtedly feel guilt and face major character potential as he realizes his friendship with Norman has drastically changed. Literature ReviewNorman Osborn will don the iconic Green Goblin costume once again, putting an end to the Spider-Man villain’s stint as Marvel’s latest hero.

item.title: The HELLVERINE Returns Wolverine s Flaming Form is Getting Its Own Marvel Comic
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s fiery alter ego, Hellverine, returns in a thrilling new solo series that promises to ignite both hell and comic stores alike. Fans who were captivated by the initial introduction of Hellverine needed more Ghost Rider Wolverine, and their wish has been granted with Benjamin Percy leading the charge. The debut of the all-new Hellfire Warriors adds an extra layer of excitement, as fans eagerly await to see if other Marvel heroes will adopt infernal forms.

item.title: The High Republic s Jedi Have Finally Reclaimed Their Epic Flagship
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJedi Master Keeve Trennis successfully reclaims the stolen Jedi flagship, the Ataraxia, from ex-Nihil Tempest Runner Lourna Dee. The victory can renew hope in the Jedi’s ability to overcome the new darkness covering the galaxy. Keeve plans to use the Ataraxia to stage a rescue mission in the Occlusion Zone and rally stranded Jedi. Literature ReviewStar Wars’ latest High Republic comic series sees the Jedi reclaiming their impressive flagship, though the mission has only just begun.

item.title: The Hulk Has Outgrown Banner In Disturbing New Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHulk’s demand for control and violent transformations highlight the strained relationship between Hulk and Bruce Banner. The Hulk brutally tears his way out from beneath Banner’s skin, symbolizing his refusal to be contained. The transformations demonstrate the complete separation between Hulk and Banner, with Hulk tormenting Banner and casting aside his weak human form. Literature ReviewAs the divide between Bruce Banner and the Hulk continues to widen, the transformations between the two grow even more gruesome and horrific.

item.title: The Invisible Woman Is Body-Horror Nightmare Fuel as Her Powers Finally Go Haywire
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYInvisible Woman’s powers go haywire, revealing the liquefaction of her skeleton and internal organs. Peach Momoko is turning Marvel’s superheroes into ‘Nightmare’ creatures over December. The Fantastic Four often star in body horror stories, made even creepier by their family-friendly status. Literature ReviewInvisible Woman is perhaps the Fantastic Four’s most powerful hero, able to even hurt Celestials. But what happens when her powers turn against her? Summary Invisible Woman’s powers go haywire, revealing the liquefaction of her skeleton and internal organs.

item.title: The Iron Cops Tony Stark s Legacy Just Created Marvel s Most Despicable Team of Heroes
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Iron Cops, from Avengers: Twilight #1, tarnish Tony Stark’s heroic legacy by making Stark tech an integral part of enforcing a fascist future. The Iron Cops are a symptom of a larger problem, existing only as the enforcers of a totalitarian state. The Defenders and a newly re-powered Captain America must not only fight the Iron Cops, but also address the insidious changes in American society and government that led to their existence.

item.title: The Jedi s New Villains Are So Overpowered, They re Breaking the Skywalker Saga
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Nihil, the Jedi’s primary villains in the High Republic Era, continue to gain more powerful weapons and technology. The Nihil’s technology, such as lightsaber deactivators and Stormwalls, raises questions about their absence during the future Skywalker saga. The ultimate fate and legacy of the Nihil, as well as the potential banning of their technology, remains to be revealed in the High Republic publishing initiative. Literature ReviewThe Nihil marauders of the High Republic keep getting stronger, and it’s raising some problematic questions regarding the future Skywalker saga.

item.title: The Joker Calls Out the Biggest Secret About Batmans Origin
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Joker has set up macabre tableaus of the deaths of Batman’s loved ones, suggesting that those close to him are destined for tragedy. Batman’s recent behavior, driven by his alter ego, Batman of Zur-En-Arrh, has reinforced the idea that his loved ones hold him back. The Joker believes that Batman’s darkest side actually enjoys the tragedies that keep him alone, allowing him to focus on his mission to fight crime.

item.title: The Justice League Beat a Major Superman Villain with Their Own Version of a Megazord
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Justice League defeats Mongol by using their own version of the Power Rangers’ Megazord. Batman realizes that the machines created by Toyman are meant to help them escape, not kill them. The Justice League’s giant robot impressively humiliates Mongol and leaves a lasting impact. Literature ReviewThe Justice League have fought countless enemies over the years, but few villains have been humiliated as badly as one iconic Superman villain.

item.title: The Justice League Just Fired Green Arrow in the Darkest Way
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGreen Arrow discovers he was technically fired from the Justice League after being lost in time and space. Following the events of Dark Crisis, the Justice League officially disbanded without Green Arrow’s knowledge. Green Arrow replaces the disbanded Justice League with his family, as the DC Universe sees a lot of change. Literature ReviewGreen Arrow is a staple member of the Justice League, but after a recent crisis, he’s technically been fired from DC’s once-biggest team.

item.title: The Justice League s New Role in the DCU Makes Them Even More Heroic
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Justice League has taken on a new role as supporters rather than leaders in Beast World, with Batman, Superman, and Wonder Woman deferring to the Titans’ decisions. Batman’s willingness to accept a support role and actively volunteer for such responsibilities exemplifies significant character growth and could positively impact his strained relationship with Nightwing. This shift in roles for the Justice League showcases their selfless commitment to the greater good and offers a fresh perspective on these iconic characters typically known for their leadership positions.

item.title: The Justice League s Parents Form Their Own Team in Genius Fanart DC Can t Afford to Ignore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWintersink’s art imagines a Justice League roster made up of the traditional heroes’ parents. Many Justice League heroes had adventurer parents, and some have encountered vigilante versions of their mothers and fathers in alternate realities. The concept of a League of Super-Parents would fit perfectly with DC’s relaunch of its Elseworlds line. Literature ReviewMany Justice League heroes have adventurer parents, so what if they’d banded together? This art proves an official Elseworlds series would be genius.

item.title: The Justice League Unite in Bruno Redondo s God-Tier Art for DC s Official Holiday Card
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLegendary artist Bruno Redondo delights fans with a detailed and humorous Justice League holiday card, creating a festive keepsake. The DC holiday card, featuring beloved heroes and anti-heroes, receives overwhelming positive reception from fans. Redondo’s holiday masterpiece showcases warmth, camaraderie, and playful chaos, with intricate details that captivate fans. Literature Review‘Tis the season for superhero splendor as Bruno Redondo dons the cape of creativity and unites the Justice League for DC’s official holiday card.

item.title: The Marvel Universe Needs a New Incarnation of This Early 2000s X-Team
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe X-Treme Sanctions Executive (X.S.E.) were a mutant peacekeeping task force that operated with legal authority to intervene in human mutant conflicts worldwide. The X.S.E. served as a major milestone in improving mutant/human relations and combating anti-mutant bigotry. Reviving the X.S.E. could have a significant impact on the dynamic between humans and mutants, whether they work for or against the mutant cause. Literature ReviewThere have been countless X-Men iterations over the years, but these days, mutantkind has a desperate need for their their most X-Treme heroes.

item.title: The MCU s Most Powerful Weapons Were Just Scattered Across the Universe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIronheart’s decision to cast the Ten Rings out into space is likely to have major implications for her and the Marvel Universe. It may have saved her for now, but it puts the entire universe in danger in the long-term. Ironheart discovered unknown powers of the Ten Rings, which caused a rift between her and Iron Man. She wanted to uncover its full potential to save the world, while he wanted to destroy them.

item.title: The Most Dangerous Versions of the Justice League s Iconic Enemies Unite for a Brutal Battle
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Justice League faces their biggest threat yet as a team of godlike villains from the Fifth Dimension emerges to challenge them. The Fifth Dimension is a realm of unimaginable power and its residents, including Bat-Mite and Mr. Mxyzptlk, often interfere with Earth’s heroes. The evil Legion of Doom, led by the enigmatic Doom-Mite, has defeated the Just-Us League and now sets its sights on the Justice League, posing a serious challenge for the heroes.

item.title: The Most Iconic Green Lantern is Recruited in Picture-Perfect Cosplay
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWWE superstar Zelina Vega brings iconic Green Lantern Jessica Cruz to life in an epic cosplay shot. The cosplay perfectly captures the moment when Jessica Cruz conquered fear and became a true Green Lantern. The photographer used digital imaging to stunningly bring the cosplay to life and recreate the impactful scene. Literature ReviewJessica Cruz’s recruitment to the Green Lantern Corps was an epic scene, and now WWE supestar Zelina Vega has brought it to life.

item.title: The Most Powerful Version of the Justice League in DC s Entire History Just Assembled - & It s Not Close
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC has revealed the most powerful Justice League ever, consisting of fifth-dimensional imps capable of warping reality. Fifth-dimensional imps are some of the strongest beings in the DC Universe, with power that exceeds Darkseid. The fifth-dimensional Justice League has likely been assembled to combat the threat of Doom-Mite, an imp version of Doomsday with reality-warping powers. Literature ReviewThe Justice League is one of the most powerful teams in any comic universe, and DC has just revealed the strongest version of the team ever seen.

item.title: The Most Unsettling Far Side Comics Ever Are As Hilarious As They Are Disturbing
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGary Larson combines the unsettling and the absurd in his Far Side comic strips, creating a unique sense of humor that can turn disturbing subjects into something amusing. Larson’s skill in comedy extends to suspense, as he expertly builds tension in his strips through unexpected and disturbing plot twists. The Far Side strips often incorporate dark and unsettling themes, such as murderous animals, historical tragedies, and cannibalism, while still managing to find humor in these subjects.

item.title: The New Captain America Is Officially a Disgrace to Steve Rogers Legacy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new Captain America in Avengers: Twilight is a dark example of how heroes have fallen in the future. The world has turned its back on the real Captain America, with untrustworthy businessmen and corrupt protectors taking over the mantle. Steve Rogers is determined to return as Captain America and bring together the old heroes to save the world from corruption. Literature ReviewAvengers: Twilight centers around an elderly Captain America, who is forced to retire and watch while a new kid dons his classic shield and colors.

item.title: The New Daredevil s No-Kill Rule Shows How Different She is From Matt Murdock
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYElektra is starting to embrace Matt Murdock’s no-kill rule as Daredevil, prioritizing saving lives over her assassin instincts. As the main Daredevil in Matt’s absence, Elektra is learning to adopt Matt’s code because she genuinely wants to, not just out of respect for him. Elektra’s hesitance towards killing may hinder her in certain fights, but it shows her growth as she prioritizes saving lives like Matt would. Literature ReviewElektra struggled to adhere to Matt Murdock’s no-kill rule when she took over as Daredevil, but she may finally be coming around to the principle.

item.title: The New Ninja Turtles Have Arrived, as Last Ronin Re-Evolution Sparks a Bold New Future for The TMNT Universe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYScreen Rant has an exclusive first look at TMNT: The Last Ronin II - Re-Evolution #1 for this SPOILER FREE review. TMNT: The Last Ronin II - Re-Evolution is a gritty and hardcore take on the TMNT franchise, allowing the all-new Turtles to become battle-ready warriors in a wasteland setting. The new Ninja Turtles: Yi, Uno, Moja, and Odyn, have the opportunity to become the definitive TMNT for the next generation.

item.title: The New Sentry Marvel Officially Names Its New Most Powerful Hero (With 1 Dark Catch)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel introduces a new Sentry, but with a twist - the powers have been passed on to a young woman named Mallory. Mallory is not the only one who will receive the Sentry’s powers - others will also become Sentries, creating a new challenge for heroes like Misty Knight and Jessica Jones. The Sentry is a powerful and complex character, with a troubled past and a history of being both a threat and a hero.

item.title: The New Ultimate Spider-Man Officially Debuts a Classic Costume (But Its Not The One Fans Expected)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPeter Parker starts his career as Spider-Man in a new costume: his black Spider-Man suit. The new series explores a different take on Spider-Man where Peter chose to receive his powers and was given a costume by Tony Stark. This version of Peter Parker hasn’t earned the classic red and blue colors, highlighting his lack of tragedy and commitment so far in the series. Literature ReviewA preview for Ultimate Spider-Man #2 (2024) gives fans a full look at Spidey’s new costume, but it’s not the classic uniform readers expected.

item.title: The New Ultimates Marvel s Heroes Assemble in New Ultimate Universe Team
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel Comics has revitalized the Ultimate Universe with Earth-6160, a new and largely unexplored corner of the Marvel Universe. The new Ultimates, consisting of Iron Lad, Doctor Doom, Thor, Lady Sif, and Captain America, are uniting to put this twisted universe shaped by the Maker back on track towards a hopeful future. The upcoming Free Comic Book Day issue will continue the storyline from 2023’s Ultimate Universe, answering questions about the fate of the heroes, Captain America’s status, and the involvement of other characters/storylines including Ultimate Spider-Man, Ultimate Black Panther, and Ultimate X-Men.

item.title: The New Wolverine X-Men Announces Kitty Pryde s New Codename Alongside Stunning Redesign
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKate ‘Kitty’ Pryde has undergone a drastic evolution and transformed into a towering hero known as Shadow Tiger. Kate’s transformation into Shadow Tiger may be a result of unlocking the ability to increase her density, making her superstrong and durable. The X-Men face their final battle in Rise of the Powers of X #1, coming January 10. Literature ReviewAs the final X-Men team unite to battle the ultimate threat, Kate Pryde is leaving her ‘Shadowkat’ identity behind for something darker.

item.title: THE OMEGA ELEVEN History s Greatest Thieves Unite Across Time for One Impossible Heist (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY“The Omega Eleven” Kickstarter campaign is now live! Don’t miss out on this thrilling sci-fi comic series featuring a time-heist with classic characters. Award-winning creative team James Aquilone and Zac Atkinson bring readers this five-issue epic, with stunning covers by various artists. Monstrous Books, known for their horror works, is publishing “The Omega Eleven,” showcasing their focus on science fiction and adventure. Support the campaign now! Literature ReviewScreen Rant is excited to exclusively announce the start of the Kickstarter campaign for Monstrous Book’s The Omega Eleven, featuring a time-heist.

item.title: The Origin of Wolverine s Most Iconic Catchphrase Is Finally Revealed
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY“Predator vs. Wolverine #3” reveals that Wolverine’s iconic catchphrase was earned during his time training under Muramasa. The comic explores Wolverine’s unique relationship with the infamous swordsmith and his intense training regimen. Wolverine’s battle with the Predator could earn him Muramasa’s acknowledgment and solidify his status as “the best there is” at hunting and killing. Literature ReviewPredator vs. Wolverine #3 gives an origin to Logan’s iconic “I’m the best there is at what I do…” catchphrase for the first time in Marvel history.

item.title: The Original Codename for Kong Is Way Cooler Than Godzilla s King of the Monsters
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKong’s original MonsterVerse codename is ‘The-Mountain-Who-Thunders-Death’, illustrating his wrath and power as an untouchable god. Kong’s backstory reveals his role as the ruthless protector of Skull Island, with his roar signialing the death of any creature he desires. Comparatively, Godzilla’s title as ‘King of the Monsters’ suggests his strength, but Kong’s codename is way cooler, portraying him as a supernatural force of impending doom. Literature ReviewGodzilla is famously called the King of the Monsters within MonsterVerse continuity, and while that title is cool, it’s nothing compared to Kong’s!

item.title: The Original Super Mario Bros. Movie s Sequel Was Exactly What Fans Wanted
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuper Mario Bros. 2: The Comic is a fan-made sequel to the original Super Mario Bros. movie, created with the support of one of the movie’s original writers. The comic follows the Mario Bros. in a new adventure set directly after the movie, and features a clash with the villain Wart. The comic explores the aftermath of the movie and its impact on both worlds, but unfortunately ends before the final battle with Wart, building to an epic showdown in a full movie trilogy.

item.title: The Perfect Callback - Luffy s Biggest One Piece Moment Returns With an Epic Twist
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChapter #1103 of One Piece hints at a deliberate callback to Luffy’s iconic punch on Saint Charlos, this time featuring Kuma and Saint Saturn. The similarities in Kuma’s posture to Luffy’s when he punched Saint Charlos suggest a deliberate reference by the story. This callback would be thematically appropriate and provide catharsis, especially considering the tragedy Kuma has endured due to the actions of Saturn. It has the potential to make chapter #1104 one of the most satisfying in the series.

item.title: The Phantom Menace s Most Controversial Anakin Story Just Saved Vader s Life
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Darth Vader #41, the former Anakin Skywalker uses his skills as a droid-builder to rebuild an army of droids under his control, saving himself from an attack by the Empire and buying him time against the Scourge. The controversial retcon from Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace, which made Darth Vader C3PO’s “maker,” has been justified several times by Marvel’s current Star Wars comics. The “Dark Droids” crossover event emphasizes the relationship between Vader and droids, highlighting his connection to machines from even before he became part-machine himself.

item.title: The Predator Franchise Is Bringing Back Danny Glover s Mike Harrigan - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s Predator series has made an impact on the franchise by exploring new aspects of Yautja lore. The upcoming Predator: The Last Hunt comic continues the story of human hunter Theta, who is on a quest to liberate captive humans from the recently revealed “Predator Stasis Farms.” While fans hope for the return of Danny Glover’s character, Detective Harrigan, in the comic, there may be other surprises in store for readers.

item.title: The Ranger Slayer Returns in New Mighty Morphin Power Rangers Preview (Exclusive)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe “Darkest Hour” storyline has been the ambitious entry in the Boom! Studios Power Rangers era, which has spent years elevating the franchise, proving comics are the perfect medium for the Rangers. The dangerous Ranger Slayer, an alternate version of original Pink Ranger Kimberly Hart, returns in the Power Rangers Unlimited: The Morphin’ Masters one-shot, seaking to find the elusive Morphin’ Masters and unravel the origins of the Morphin’ Grid.

item.title: The Sinestro Corps Falls Green Lantern Is Rewriting Its Entire Cosmic Hierarchy
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe destruction of the Central Power Batteries is causing severe effects on the Lanterns’ abilities to wield the various lights. Someone is actively trying to destroy the other lights of the Emotional Spectrum, but the question is who has the power to do so and why? The Green Lantern needs to uncover the mystery and find out what’s happening before all of the lights are permanently snuffed out. Literature ReviewA devastating change comes to the Green Lantern mythos when an attack on the Sinestro Corps turns out to be the prelude to a bigger mystery.

item.title: The Thor Corps Thor s Ultimate Team Assemble in Jaw-Dropping Cosplay
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA group cosplay has immortalized the Thor Corps, featuring various cosplayers portraying Thor and other characters who have wielded Mjolnir. The Thor Corps first appeared in the Secret Wars comics as Doctor Doom’s enforcers, showcasing the idea that multiple people are worthy of wielding Mjolnir. The Thor Corps has recently returned to Marvel Comics, consisting of characters like Odinson, Jane Foster, Beta Ray Bill, Loki, and Storm, symbolizing the qualities that make one worthy of Thor’s power.

item.title: The Titans Contingency Plan for Starfire & Donna Troy Is Weirdly Heartwarming
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNightwing’s contingency plans for Donna Troy and Starfire in Titans: Beast World #6 are heartwarming and contribute to their already amazing dynamic. By entrusting Kori and Donna with each other’s contingency plans, Nightwing recognizes the growing bond between Starfire and Donna and the importance of trust in team dynamics. The interconnectedness of Starfire and Donna Troy’s storylines in Tom Taylor’s run creates anticipation for future developments between the two Titans.

item.title: The Titans New Anti-Superman Armor Has the Perfect Wielder
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOne of the Titans gains a powerful suit of armor that can protect against spore infection and potentially defeat Superman. The Titans need to be prepared for any potential threat, including powerful heroes under mental control. The new armor allows Donna Troy to take down powerful enemies like Power Girl and rogue Kryptonians. Literature ReviewThe Titans are determined to save the animal-human hybrids of “Beast World” and one new set of armor gives one worthy hero the power to do so.

item.title: The Titans Newest Villain is Beast Boy s Worst Nightmare
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYApex Ava, the new villain in Nightwing #110, has a dark connection to Gar Logan and mirrors his love for animals. Ava, a dying hunter with Sakutia, kills a Garro spore and consumes it, gaining new powers and escaping from Arkham Tower. Apex Ava poses a threat to the animal kingdom, as she sees animals as trophies and may have acquired shape-shifting abilities like Beast Boy. Literature ReviewMore information about the Titans’ villain Apex Ava comes out as her secret origin is revealed, showing the similarities she shares with Beast Boy.

item.title: The Titans Unexpected New Member Gives the Team a Huge Power Boost
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTitans #5 introduces Swamp Thing as a surprise new member of the team, significantly boosting the team’s power and making them even more powerful. Levi Kamei, the new Swamp Thing, is a relatively new hero in the DC Universe and serves as the guardian and voice of Earth’s plant life. The Titans invite Swamp Thing to join them as part of their initiative to make the world a better place, solidifying their mission to actively fix the planet’s problems rather than just fighting villains.

item.title: The Titans Just Proved They Should Stay Earth s Protectors - Even When the Justice League Return
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTitans prove their worth as the Justice League’s replacements by actively working to repair the world. Titans and Swamp Thing combine efforts to restore the Borneo rainforest, seeing it as a first step towards greater ecological protection. The Titans should continue as the leading superhero team, thinking about the future, even when the Justice League reform in the future. Literature ReviewThe Justice League is likely to return one day, but the Titans’ latest mission is the best example of why the League should stay on the sidelines.

item.title: The TMNT Have Crossed Over with an Endless List of Franchises - Their Sonic Cameo Reveals How & Why
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtles have crossed over with numerous franchises and their many appearances in different worlds are explained by their connection to sewers. A Sonic the Hedgehog comic from 1994 reveals that the Turtles are aware of being in the wrong sewers, indicating their ability to move across dimensions. The Turtles’ ability to travel between realities could be attributed to their resourcefulness, use of technology, and knowledge gained from their previous crossovers.

item.title: The US Government Reveals Its Anti-Justice League Contingency Plan (& Answers a Major Question About the Future)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe U.S. government’s plan to take down the Justice League backfires, revealing their lack of understanding in dealing with super-powered beings like Wonder Woman. The embarrassing defeat may pave the way for Amanda Waller, an anti-Justice League expert, to rise to power and provide the government with better strategies for dealing with the superheroes. This failure highlights the larger scope of the current Dawn of DC storyline and sets the stage for a potentially grim future in the DC Universe.

item.title: The Villains Who Ran Batman Out of Gotham Set Their Sights on a DC Villain
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Orgham family has forced Batman out of Gotham and set their sights on controlling Two-Face. Two-Face, furious at the Orgham family, is moving to actively oppose them and save Gotham. With Batman gone, Two-Face is the city’s only hope against the Orgham family’s control. Literature ReviewBatman has finally been run out of Gotham by the Orghams in Detective Comics, and now the villainous family is turning their attention to Two-Face.

item.title: The Winter Soldier s Greatest Victory Gave Rise to an Even Bigger Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBucky’s destruction of the Outer Circle inadvertently helped the Red Skull rise to power. Joining the Outer Circle was a ruse to destroy them from within, but the consequences are bittersweet. Bucky’s success in defeating the Outer Circle ultimately ends in failure as a bigger threat emerges. Literature ReviewOne of Bucky Barnes’ most impressive feats has come back to haunt him, raising the possibility that it could have been his biggest mistake.

item.title: The Witcher Gets a Western Sequel as Geralt Fights to Retire
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA new The Witcher comic series is expanding on Geralt’s story and his struggle to retire while facing new challenges. Dark Horse Comics is partnering with CD Projekt Red for a new five-issue miniseries. The Witcher: Corvo Bianco will blend western and fantasy genres, providing a unique twist within The Witcher franchise. Literature ReviewDark Horse Comics delivers a new adventure for Geralt in the upcoming miniseries, The Witcher: Corvo Bianco, set to release in May 2024.

item.title: The World s Most Successful Manga App Shows Who Can Be The Next Industry King
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPiccoma, a manga app, has become one of the most successful platforms of 2023, beating even Shueisha and Kodansha’s official apps. Piccoma is the top-grossing comic app, making about $600 million and ranking 17th globally in sales. Solo Leveling, the most-viewed series on Piccoma, is set to be the next king of the industry and is driving the app’s success. Literature ReviewShonen Jump and Kodansha have been beaten by another manga app, and the most-viewed series on there is a sign of manga’s future.

item.title: The X-Men s Most Trusted Member is a Mutant Fans Would Never Expect
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMutant Firestar seemingly betrayed her people in order to side with the villainous Orchis – only for it to be revealed that she is, in fact, deep undercover. Firestar’s position in Orchis was implanted in everyone’s memories by Jean Grey in her dying moments; at least, that is, according to Firestar. Firestar’s real superpower seems to be her ability to gain unquestionable trust from people, as she has exhibited with both the X-Men and Orchis.

item.title: Themyscira DC Reveals the Dark Origins of Wonder Woman s Home
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC has retconned Themyscira’s origins, revealing a darker history for Wonder Woman’s home, impacting ongoing storylines. The revelation about Themyscira’s origin deviates from previous canon surrounding Paradise Island. The ongoing conflict between Amazons and humans in the Amazons Attack storyline mirrors past events, potentially leading to the creation of a new Amazon territory born from fear and hate. Literature ReviewDC reshapes fans’ understanding of Wonder Woman’s home, unveiling a facet that adds a layer of complexity to the Amazonian paradise, Themyscira.

item.title: These 1990s Spawn Storylines Cemented The Enduring Popularity Of Todd McFarlane s Creation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY“Questions” establishes Spawn’s origin and powers, setting the stage for the entire series. “Justice” sets the dark and gritty tone of the Spawn franchise, exploring the depths of human depravity. “Payback” expands the Spawn universe by subtly merging with another Image Comics series, Youngblood - and those are just three of the 10 ’90s storylines that cemented Spawn’s current popularity. Literature ReviewToday, Todd McFarlane’s Spawn is a major franchise, but it wasn’t always that way.

item.title: These DC Comics Retcons Gave Fans Exactly What They Wanted
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStephanie Brown’s death as Robin was revealed to be fake, protecting her from being a victim trope. Superboy’s DNA was revealed to have come from Lex Luthor, creating an internal conflict for the character. Jason Todd’s new origin differentiated him from Dick Grayson and made him a more unique character. Literature ReviewRetcons in the DC Universe aren’t always a bad thing. Discover 10 changes to DC history that gave fans exactly what they were looking for.

item.title: These Spectacular Greg Capullo Batman Covers Helped Define The Dark Knight For DC s New 52 Era (And Beyond)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCapullo’s covers for Batman display his versatility and willingness to experiment, pushing the boundaries of what a Batman comic could look like. His artwork played a significant role in defining Batman for DC’s New 52 relaunch, at times using bright colors, and unique character positioning, to create remarkable, memorable visuals. Capullo’s covers often use silhouettes, intense shading, and bold colors to depict powerful and iconic moments, including Batman’s fights, his relationship with the Joker, the Joker’s relationship with himself, and his encounters with other villains.

item.title: These Unexpected Heroes Served Superman s Most Terrifying Villain a Humiliating Defeat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDoomsday may be terrifying, but his humiliating defeat at the hands of multiple Kryptonians proves that he’s not as scary as he seems. Superman considers Doomsday his scariest villain because Doomsday physically overpowered him and beat him to death. Doomsday’s defeat by a group of Kryptonians shows that he is only truly scary when facing opponents who can’t stand against him. Literature ReviewSuperman has fought many terrifying villains over the years, and Doomsday is the scariest — but he also suffered the most humiliating defeat.

item.title: Theta s 10 Best Kills (So Far) From Marvel s Predator
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTheta is the greatest Yautja-killer in the Predator franchise, with a kill-count that puts all others to shame. Theta’s origin story is unique and tragic, as her family was murdered by a Predator, driving her cosmic conflict with the universe’s ultimate hunters. Throughout the Predator comics, Theta has displayed incredible skills, including decapitating a Predator, keeping its armor, melting one with her spaceship, and avenging her family’s deaths. Literature ReviewTheta is the ultimate protagonist in the Predator series, both in terms of her intriguing backstory and unparalleled kill-count.

item.title: Theyre About to Face Me” A Fan-Favorite Titan Has Just Become the DCU s Biggest Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRaven’s dark side, Doctor Hate, is now running free and has taken over her life, leaving the true Raven trapped in a gem. The Titans are in danger as Doctor Hate, working for Amanda Waller, plans to destroy them one by one. The team must discover the truth behind the swapped Raven or they could be in serious danger. Literature ReviewThe Titans might have survived “Beast World” but the team has an unexpected threat in their midst as an ally is replaced by an evil doppelganger.

item.title: This Batman Optical Illusion Is Breaking the Internet - But Fans Have a Hilarious Solution
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman fans are debating whether Frank Miller’s iconic cover for The Dark Knight Returns shows Batman facing towards or away from the reader. There’s evidence for both sides. Creative explanations and parodies of the pose have emerged, including Batman being upside-down. Original sketches indicate Batman is intended to be facing towards the reader, but the silhouette allows for interpretation. Literature ReviewFrank Miller’s lightning bolt cover for The Dark Knight Returns is iconic, but what is Batman actually doing in the famous silhouette?

item.title: This Batman vs Deathstroke Cosplay Battle Is Destined to Go Viral
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman and Deathstroke engage in a unique cosplay battle of wits, playing chess instead of fighting with fists and weapons. @batmateo and @cosplaycaitlin have put together the perfect take on this iconic DC feud. This cosplay showcases a new and hilarious twist on the rivalry between Batman and Deathstroke, highlighting the creativity of talented cosplayers. Literature ReviewBatman and Deathstroke have been going at it for decades, and in a unique cosplay team-up, the pair show off their brains instead of their brawn.

item.title: This Ben Grimm Time Travel Adventure Proves Why Marvel Should Revive A Classic Anthology Series (With A Twist)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel should consider bringing back the anthology series Marvel Two-In-One, with a Multiverse-twist, and using as a testing ground for fresh ideas by new creative talents. The original Two-In-One series paired various Marvel characters with the Thing; but the series’ most memorable issues teamed Ben Grimm up with a version of himself. A rebooted version of Two-In-One with a multiversal focus could capitalize on the success of team-up stories featuring different versions of the same character.

item.title: This Character Survived 1981 s Halloween II (But Not For Long)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe character of Jimmy’s ambiguous fate in Halloween II is clarified in the comic, revealing that he survived but suffered severe injuries, only to be killed by Michael Myers a year later. The comic provides a more impactful and appropriate death for Jimmy, correcting his original ending, which fans of the franchise have often criticized over the years. Michael Myers kills Jimmy in the comic, fixing a missed opportunity from the film, and making his death significant to Laurie’s storyline.

item.title: This Dark TMNT Redesign Will Have You Begging for a LAST RONIN Style Spin-Off
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles get a new redesign in fanart by comic industry artist Eric Canete, inspired by the Last Ronin series. The new design features a more muscular build, longer necks, sharp beaks, spiky shells, and warrior-like clothing, deviating from their iconic bandanas. The Turtles’ weapons are also enhanced, with additional swords and a bow and arrow, giving them a grittier and more badass look. Literature ReviewThe Last Ronin gave the TMNT a gritty future where Mikey was the last hero standing, with new fanart giving them a redesign that deserves a spin-off.

item.title: This DC Villain Faced Off Against Captain Kirk On Star Trek The Original Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Trek/Legion of Super Heroes #5 revealed Vandal Savage and Flint to be alternate versions of the same immortal character. Emperor Vandar, a third version of the character, is the central threat in the crossover, having used the power of Q to become a galactic conqueror in his timeline. The disparity between Flint’s peaceful nature and Savage’s desire for power is explored, highlighting the contrast between the two characters, as well as their similar stories, creating a meaningful climax to the story as a result.

item.title: This Enduring Non-Mutant X-Men Character Could Be a Pivotal Ally In the Fall of X (Or the Team s Final Undoing)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDanger, the sentient incarnation of the Danger Room, is currently working against the mutant nation of Krakoa due to their ban on artificial intelligence. Danger has the potential to be a gamechanging character in the upcoming climax of the Krakoan era, as she possesses valuable knowledge about the strengths and weaknesses of the X-Men. The X-Men have the opportunity to either make amends with Danger and convince her to join their cause, or she could be crucial to Orchis’s annihilation of mutantkind, allying herself with other dangerous artificial intelligences inside the villainous organization.

item.title: This Forgotten Halloween Comic Gave Michael Myers The Costume He Almost Wore in the Movies
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYForgotten Halloween comics show an alternate outfit for Michael Myers: a sad clown persona inspired by Emmett Kelly. Halloween: The First Death of Laurie Strode explores Laurie’s post-traumatic life, encountering Michael disguised as the sad clown. The unpublished third issue leaves readers longing for more of this unsettling alternate version of Michael Myers in a clown costume. Literature ReviewHalloween horror Michael Myers’ mask is a spinoff of William Shatner, but what if the Halloween franchise opted for a different mask for The Shape?

item.title: This Iconic Avenger Got A Major Power Boost In the DC Universe
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn the JLA/Avengers crossover, Scarlet Witch taps into DC’s chaos magic, experiencing a power boost that surpasses her already immense abilities. DC’s magic is described by Wanda as “wild and powerful,” elevating Scarlet Witch to a new level of power in comparison to the Marvel Universe. Regardless of the universe she inhabits, Scarlet Witch remains one of the most formidable magic users, capable of rewriting reality and sensing powerful artifacts.

item.title: This Overlooked Manga Is Better Than Any YouTube Make-Up Tutorial
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA manga titled Makeup Is Not (Just) Magic provides detailed steps and visuals for beginners and advanced makeup users. The manga is an accessible resource for the LGBTQ+ community who may not feel comfortable seeking help or experimenting with makeup due to societal pressures. Makeup Is Not (Just) Magic offers an educational and enjoyable alternative to YouTube makeup tutorials, allowing for creative expression and serving as a refresher for experienced individuals.

item.title: This Record-Breaking SPAWN Issue Set Up the Franchise s Rat City Spin-Off Half A Decade Ago
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRat City, the upcoming spin-off series in the Spawn universe, focuses on the adventures of ex-soldier Peter Cairn as he becomes the latest Hellspawn hero. Cairn’s powers come from Al Simmons’ explosion of necroplasm in Spawn #301, which affects the nanites in his prosthetic legs and transforms him into a Hellspawn. Unlike previous Hellspawns, Cairn is a living character and has no connection to Hell, giving him a unique origin story in the franchise.

item.title: This X-TREME X-MEN Villain is Long Overdue To Return (With a Twist)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOne early 2000s X-Men villain’s potential for a return lies in a small but significant update to his motivations, which would open up a wide range of storytelling possibilities. Vargas’ debut in X-Treme X-Men made him a major antagonist at the time; his killing of Psylocke in the series second issue etched his name in readers’ memories forever. If resurrected, Vargas’ character would be completely different, with the potential to become an ally to the X-Men, or return as an even stronger and more determined villain.

item.title: Thor & Storm Confirm Their Seemingly Similar Powers Are Totally Different
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThor and Storm have similar powers, but different ways of controlling them. Thor commands thunder and lightning as a king, while Storm treats the weather as an equal. Thor asserts dominance over lightning, while Storm works in unison with the weather instead of forcing it to her will. The distinction between Thor and Storm’s approach to thunder may seem subtle, but it significantly affects their relationship with the weather, and their relationship with each other, as two of Marvel’s most powerful heroes, with a similar power set.

item.title: Thor Battles His Elder God Mother in God-Tier Alex Ross Art - & She s Way More Powerful
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThor battles his more powerful Elder God mother in The Immortal Thor #8, as shown in the stunning Alex Ross cover. Al Ewing and Martin Coccolo have revitalized Thor by grounding the character in Norse mythology and the rich Marvel Universe. The Elder Gods, including Thor’s mother Gaea, will make his life miserable in upcoming issues, setting up a showdown with his toughest opponent yet. Literature ReviewIn Alex Ross’ god-tier cover for The Immortal Thor #8, the Odinson faces his most powerful opponent yet: his Elder God mother Gaea.

item.title: Thor Confirms Who the Real Goddess of Thunder is (Even If She Isn t an Actual Goddess)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn a recent issue of Immortal Thor, the God of Thunder acknowledges Storm as the Goddess of Thunder, giving her a major compliment, considering she is not actually a deity in the strictest sense. Thor respects Storm as an equal, and honors her by elevating her to his status. Storm’s role as a pivotal character in the X-franchise is emphasized by Thor’s need for her in the newly reformed Thor Corps.

item.title: Thor Finally Learns a Valuable Lesson Odin Tried to Teach Him 61 Years Ago
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThor has finally learned the lesson of humility that Odin tried to teach him, as shown in The Avengers #8. Thor’s humbling experience has allowed him to cast his pride aside when faced with bigger challenges. Thor showcases his newfound humility by submitting to Nightmare on behalf of his trapped teammates to save the world. Literature ReviewThor finally understands a hard lesson about humility that his father tried to teach him dating back to the God of Thunder’s origin story.

item.title: Thor Gets His Own Iron Man Armor in Jaw-Dropping Cosplay
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThor gets an Iron Man upgrade in a new series of cosplay images, combining his iconic look with Tony Stark’s tech-savvy style. Canadian-based cosplayer Audrey Pelletier creates an authentic Iron Thor armor using 3D printing technology and personal creativity. The cosplay costume features a unique blend of Iron Man aesthetic and Asgardian fashion, making it a distinctive and impressive creation. Literature ReviewIron Man and Thor are powerful characters on their own, with a new set of cosplay images uniting the two to form the hybrid hero known as Iron Thor!

item.title: Thor Just Proved He Should Lead the Avengers (Not Captain Marvel)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThor demonstrates strong leadership by recognizing when not to fight and prioritizing the safety of his teammates. Captain Marvel’s confrontational mindset and focus on direct action may not always be the most efficient approach. Captain Marvel can learn from Thor’s example and adapt her leadership style to consider alternative solutions and strategies. Literature ReviewWhile Captain Marvel would fight forever, Thor is wise enough to know when to walk away - a vital skill for someone who would lead the Avengers.

item.title: Thor Knows Exactly How He s Destined to Die (And He Doesn t Care)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThor’s refusal to accept his own destiny, including his inevitable death, is prevalent in The Avengers #7. Despite knowing that he will live to see the end of the world and his own demise, Thor has never come to peace with this knowledge. Thor’s approach to death showcases the kind of hero he is, as he refuses to remain idle and actively fights against the unstoppable. Literature ReviewThor is fully aware of the day he is going to die and how it will happen, but that won’t stop him from being the hero he is destined to be.

item.title: Thor Names the 1 Marvel Villain Who s Actually Worthy of Mjolnir
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMore characters in the Marvel Universe are worthy of lifting Mjolnir than initially thought, including villains like Toranos. Thor assembled a team of Mjolnir-worthy warriors called the Thor Corp to battle Toranos, an elder god. Thor manipulated the enchantment on Mjolnir to allow him to choose who he deemed worthy, leading Toranos to wield the hammer temporarily as part of Thor’s larger plan to defeat him. Literature ReviewWhile other Marvel Comics characters have proven themselves worthy of Mjolnir in the past, Thor names the one villain who can also lift the hammer.

item.title: Thor Names the 5 Qualities That Make Someone Worthy of Mjolnir (Why Captain America Could Lift It in Endgame)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWielders of Thor’s hammer, Mjolnir, must possess compassion, restraint, nobility, wisdom, and humility. The MCU version of Captain America embodies these qualities, making him worthy of Mjolnir’s power. Mjolnir’s power can rewrite one’s spirit, potentially leading to dire consequences for its wielder. Literature ReviewThor clearly spells out what makes someone worthy of his hammer Mjolnir, which perfectly explains how the MCU’s Captain America could lift it. Warning! Spoilers for The Immortal Thor #5 ahead!

item.title: Thor s Mjolnir Enchantment Has an R-Rated Loophole - Tearing Out His Heart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTerror’s use of a worthy hero’s heart allows him to wield the Stormbreaker hammer, contradicting existing lore. The possession of a worthy hero’s heart alone is enough to enable someone to wield Stormbreaker, but the advantage is temporary. Mjolnir has a lethal new loophole, potentially allowing the worst of Thor’s enemies to become worthy through heart transplants. Literature ReviewA terrifying foe returns to challenge Miguel O’Hara, bearing an unorthodox solution for being unworthy to wield the mighty Stormbreaker weapon.

item.title: Thor s Most Underrated Villain Is Back to Kill Cyclops Son
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCable #2 sees Nathan Summers take on Thor villain Grey Gargoyle, raising the stakes for Cable and potentially leading to a major Marvel crossover. The clash between Cable and Grey Gargoyle threatens the existence of a fan-favorite X-Man, adding intensity to the narrative. The inclusion of Grey Gargoyle as an X-Men villain hints at a possible crossover between the Avengers and X-Men, creating excitement for fans and potential narrative shifts for Cable and the Marvel Universe.

item.title: Thor s New Power Confirms He s Surpassed Galactus as Marvel s Most Powerful God
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThor’s latest feat proves that he is one of the most powerful entities in the Marvel Comics universe, surpassing even Galactus himself. Thor’s ability to break free from Nightmare’s control shows his adaptability and confirms his status as the mightiest god. Thor’s ascension as the King of Asgard has granted him greater power than ever before, making him a formidable opponent for any adversary. Literature ReviewThor has always been one of Marvel Comics’ strongest heroes, but his latest feat of strength proves that he’s now also it’s most powerful god.

item.title: Thrawn s Secret History with Anakin Skywalker Exposed in First Look at New Series
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStar Wars: Thrawn Alliances #1 will concurrently tell the story of Thrawn’s mission with Anakin Skywalker during the Clone Wars, and his mission with Darth Vader during the Galactic Civil War - and the two will mirror each other. If the original 2018 novel is any indication, the missions involve discovering a secret Seperatist facility that produces Clone Trooper armor impervious to lightsabers, which was planned to be used during Order 66.

item.title: ThunderCats New Hero CALICA Revealed, As Blockbuster Series Expands Franchise Lore
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)

item.title: Thundercats #1 Deserves the Hype, Honoring the Franchise While Telling a Fresh Story
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThundercats #1 lives up to the hype, delivering a story that honors the franchise while introducing new elements. The issue recounts the classic origin of the Thundercats but adds depth to the characters and introduces new story elements. Dynamite’s Thundercats reboot could be the one fans have been waiting for, appealing to both old and new fans and enriching the franchise’s mythos. Literature ReviewAfter months of hype, Dynamite’s new Thundercats title has arrived, and it makes good on its promise, delivering a story both fresh and classic.

item.title: Thundercats #1 Passes 170k Sales, Approaching Biggest Launch in The Decade
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDynamite Entertainment’s upcoming Thundercats title is expected to debut with over 170,000 copies sold, making it one of the biggest launches of the decade. Previous attempts to revive the Thundercats franchise through comics and reboots have struggled to connect with audiences, but the new “back to basics” approach has generated buzz and excitement. The new Thundercats title offers a “Year One” approach, allowing new fans to get in on the ground floor and the preview pages have already helped make it one of the best-selling comics of the decade.

item.title: Thundercats Lore Changes Forever With Confirmation of Another Thundarian Survivor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThundercats lore changes forever as a new Thunderian survivor is introduced, potentially adding a fresh dynamic to the team’s battle against Mumm-Ra. The addition of new Thunderian(s) could tip the odds in favor of the Thundercats in their fight against Mumm-Ra and the Evil Mutants. The new Thunderian survivor could be one of the previously introduced characters like Lynx-O, Bengali, or Pumyra, altering the Thundercats lore in unexpected ways.

item.title: Titans [SPOILER] Just Pulled Off a Strength Feat Even Kryptonians Can t Match
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSwamp Thing’s abilty to use The Green to prevent skyscrapers from collapsing demonstrates his exceptional and unparalleled strength, surpassing even Superman. Swamp Thing’s unique abilities prove indispensable in crisis situations, showcasing his efficiency and effectiveness. Swamp Thing’s inclusion in the Titans is a brilliant move, introducing a fresh character with a unique skill set and giving him a deserving spotlight in the DC Universe. Literature ReviewSuperman may be strong, but this Titan hero just pulled off a strength feat that the Last Son of Krypton could only dream of matching one day.

item.title: Titans Beast World #1 Proves 2023 Still Has Must-Read Stories Left to Tell (Review)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTitans: Beast World #1 brings excitement and emotion with action-packed battles and compelling emotional scenes between Beast Boy and Raven. The stunning art by Ivan Reis adds to the comic’s appeal, with thrilling battles and disturbing yet delightful moments of body horror. This promising first issue sets up a powerful finish for DC’s 2023, offering cosmic fights, intense emotions, and eye-pleasing art for an entertaining and thrilling read. Literature ReviewDC Comics’ last event for 2023 begins in earnest with Titans: Beast World #1, a nail-biting calamity with action and surprisingly touching moments.

item.title: Titans Confirms 1 Underrated Hero Could Wipe Out Life on Earth in Seconds
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCyborg reveals his ability to hack into the military’s system to stop drone strikes, making him the Titans’ most dangerous member. Cyborg’s recent actions show his potential to hack into the strongest computer systems and activate every warhead, making him a terrifying threat if he ever goes rogue. While all the Titans have immense power, Cyborg’s advanced tech capabilities make him capable of nuking the planet if he were to turn to the dark side.

item.title: Titans Confirms the 1 Hero Who Can Effortlessly Shut Down Batman (& It s Not Nightwing)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatman’s blunt approach during a critical moment causes Raven to stand up to him, asserting her equality and pushing for her teammate, Beast Boy, to have the chance to speak. Batman’s reluctance to consider new ideas highlights his stubbornness, but he respects those who stand for good. Raven’s ability to understand and communicate the perspectives of both Beast Boy and Batman helps her navigate the situation and advocate for her teammate in a high-stress situation.

item.title: Titans Lore Changes Forever With a Dark Secret From Starfire s Past
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTitans #7 will reveal a secret about Starfire’s tragic past, one that promises to change everything about her life. The Titans face off against the deceitful Xand’r in the midst of the “Beast World” chaos caused by their mind-controlled teammate, Garth. Xand’r’s treachery has devastating consequences for Starfire, endangering her future and shedding light on her past. Literature ReviewStarfire discovers that the Titans’ newest enemy is a blast from her past and someone secretly responsible for the worst moments of her life.

item.title: Titans Permanently Kills a Beloved Hero with an Incredibly Cruel Weapon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBeast Boy’s death in Titans: Beast World #4 is depicted in a brutal and agonizing manner, making it one of the most merciless deaths in DC history. Amanda Waller and Lex Luthor join forces to eliminate Beast Boy by using Chester Runk’s black hole ability to tear him apart from the inside. Despite the graphic depiction of Beast Boy’s demise, there is still a glimmer of hope for his survival, as a part of him remains intact.

item.title: TMNT 10 Changes to Mutant Canon That Will Shock 90s Turtles Fans
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTMNT’s iconic villains, Bebop and Rocksteady, have transformed from goofy goons to brutal killers in IDW Publishing’s comic book series. They beat Donatello to death. Slash, the genius cyborg turtle from the ’90s cartoon, has become a hulking brute capable of taking down all four Turtle brothers in IDW Publishing’s TMNT continuity. Venus, the fifth turtle from the ’90s live-action series, has been given a twisted evolution in IDW Publishing’s TMNT canon.

item.title: TMNT Artist Reveals Their Dream Crossover With Surprise Marvel Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTMNT artist Gavin Smith dreams of a crossover with Marvel’s Daredevil. The similarities between the Turtles and Daredevil make a crossover storyline a perfect fit. TMNT co-creator Kevin Eastman also wants to see the Turtles and Daredevil team up in an official comic series. Literature ReviewThe Ninja Turtles enjoy a new crossover every week, with TMNT artist Gavin Smith naming which Marvel hero he’d like to bring into their universe.

item.title: TMNT Confirms Which Sibling Is Destined to Become a Badass Cyborg
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles #147, Donatello and Venus encounter a future version of their sibling, Jennika, who has become a cyborg. The future timeline they arrive in is one of cybernetic enhancement and liberation for mutanimals, called Mutant City. It remains to be seen whether Cyborg Jennika will be a friend or foe to the Turtles in their mission to defeat Armaggon. Literature ReviewThe Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles comic series teased that one Turtle sibling would become a cyborg, and now, the series has revealed which one it is.

item.title: TMNT Interview Sophie Campbell Shares Her Proudest Addition to Turtle Lore & Scrapped Plans to Corrupt Donatello
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWriter/artist Sophie Campbell’s TMNT run has breathed new life into the series, pushing boundaries and staying true to the lore. Arguably, Campbell’s greatest accomplishment has been revamping the forgettable villain Armaggon into the Turtles’ ultimate threat. As her current 50 issue run approaches its end, Campbell reflects on her proudest contributions and upcoming plans to continue telling TMNT stories. Literature ReviewSophie Campbell is a writer/artist for IDW Publishing’s Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.

item.title: TMNT Kickstarter Officially Ends with Surprise Gift to Fans (After Raising Over $1,000,000)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPalladium Books’ Kickstarter for TMNT & Other Strangeness ends with $1,277,496 in funding, exceeding its original goal by more than five times. Backers will receive a remastered version of the 1985 classic game, complete with new art, updated rules, and additional content. As a gift to backers, all stretch goals have been unlocked, allowing fans to access extras such as miniatures, custom rulesets, and artwork prints. Literature ReviewSurpassing its original $250,000 goal, the Kickstarter for Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles & Other Strangeness is a major success story.

item.title: TMNT Kickstarter Officially Passes $1,000,000 Mark (As Fan Support Obliterates Original Goal)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Kickstarter for Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles and Other Strangeness has exceeded its original goal of $250,000 and has reached over $1,000,000 in funding. Fans have unlocked bonuses and stretch goals, including playing cards with art from the game and a new miniature of the Fugitoid character. There are still stretch goals to be unlocked, with the potential to reach $1,400,000 and introduce an April O’Neil miniature and new rules for a “mystery mutant” chosen by fans.

item.title: TMNT Last Ronin Claims Title as Best-Selling Comic Collection of The Year
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Last Ronin ranks second in the top 20 adult graphic novels of 2023, beating out several notable manga titles. TMNT: The Last Ronin stands out as one of the only three non-manga comics in the ranking, making it the only Western comic to make the top 10. The Last Ronin’s unique storytelling, separate comic universe, and upcoming video game have made it a fan-favorite TMNT comic series and a must-read for fans.

item.title: TMNT Reveals New Era s Dream Team of Artists Giving Each Turtle a Unique Spotlight
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJason Aaron is launching a new era for the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles with a fresh coat of paint and a star-studded lineup of artists. Each issue in the first arc will focus on one of the four Turtles, with Joëlle Jones on Raphael, Rafael Albuquerque on Michelangelo, Cliff Chiang on Leonardo, and Chris Burnham on Donatello. The artists are all excited to contribute to the TMNT franchise and add their names to the impressive list of creators who have worked on the series over the years.

item.title: TMNT Reveals Raphael s Heart-Breaking Final Fate
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRaphael’s final fate in Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles #147 is heartbreaking, as his mind deteriorates from time travel. Raphael carries around the mask of his deceased best friend, Casey Jones, and speaks to it regularly, haunted by his death. While Raphael’s end is marked by sadness, he gets one final shot at dying a warrior’s death as Armaggon consumes him in the Timestress’ Citadel. Literature ReviewRaphael is a proud warrior and perhaps the most hardcore member of the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, which is why his final fate is so heartbreaking.

item.title: TMNT s New Cyborg Turtle Is a Redesign 90s Fans Will Love
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles face a new cosmic threat called Armaggon, leading to encounters with their future selves featuring interesting futuristic designs. The preview page reveals a cyborg Turtle in purple lighting, suggesting it could be Donatello, paying homage to his original role on the team as the one who “does machines.” The new cyborg Turtle brings the hardcore ’90s aesthetic to life, reflecting the popular style of that era in comic book and cartoon media that ’90s fans are sure to love.

item.title: TMNT Transforms Donatello, As the Smartest Turtle Chooses Magic Over Science
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is changing Donatello from a scientific inventor to a magical sorcerer. Donatello’s transition began in The Armageddon Game when he learned kuji-kiri, which he’s since mastered, using the magical ability to travel through time. Donatello is seemingly destined to complete his transition from scientist to sorcerer after meeting his future self, who’s totally dedicated to the mystic arts. Literature ReviewTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtles canon is changing Donatello forever, as the ‘Road to 150’ seemingly reveals he’s destined to choose magic over science.

item.title: TMNT vs Street Fighter Is Ending with the Epic Shredder vs M. Bison Fight 90s Kids Always Wanted
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe final issue of Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles vs Street Fighter delivers an incredibly satisfying fight scene between Shredder and M. Bison. The limited series offers a variety of iconic mash-ups, with memorable moments such as Raphael punching Guile and Michelangelo facing off against Chun-Li. The crossover between these two beloved franchises fulfills the arcade dreams of ’90s kids, bringing together the characters that gamers have always wanted to see battle it out.

item.title: Today s Connections Answers & Hints For February 9, 2024 (Puzzle #243)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARY Literature ReviewAnother new Connections is up and ready to be solved. If today’s puzzle is causing you trouble we’ve got hints, and spoilers, for today’s game. With the popularity of daily games like Wordle, the world has found a nice respite with little relaxing one-a-day puzzle games and Connections fits perfectly in that category. Whether you’re drinking coffee in the morning, or taking a mid-day break, there is a quick game out there that will appeal to anyone’s interests.

item.title: Todd McFarlane Shares New Insight Into The Spawn Movie, Comics & Upcoming Toy Releases
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIssue 350 of Spawn is a perfect jumping-on point for new readers, as it wraps up a storyline that began in issue 100.
