The vacant throne in Spawn’s story will finally be filled in issue 350, which will have significant repercussions for the Earth and other comic books in the Spawn universe. Artist Brett Booth will be taking over Spawn, while Carlo Barberi will be moving to Gunslinger, in order to bring fresh perspectives to the characters and keep the artists engaged.

item.title: Toga s Death Proves My Hero Academia s Hero World Is Broken
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHimiko Toga’s sacrifice in My Hero Academia highlights the broken justice system in the series. The system categorizes individuals as villains or criminals based on whether their crimes involve Quirks. The lack of rehabilitation programs and harsh punishments push individuals like Toga to extreme measures. Literature ReviewWhile Himiko Toga’s sacrifice for Ochacho Uraraka will go down as one of MHA’s most memorable moments, it still proves how broken their world is.

item.title: Tokyo Revengers Prove How Romance & Action Can Work Together
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTokyo Revengers is not just a delinquent manga; it is a wholesome and positive story that revolves around love and redemption. The protagonist, Takemichi, is willing to go through extreme hardships to change the future and save his lost love, Hinata. Despite its outward appearance as a gritty gang story, Tokyo Revengers is ultimately a romance manga that can compete with other popular genres. Literature ReviewWhile Tokyo Revengers’ hard-boiled street gang story might attract attention, its deeper heartfelt story is what keeps fans coming back for more.

item.title: Tony Stark Becomes Body Horror Nightmare Fuel as He s Turned into the Reverse-Iron Man
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark’s fate in Avengers: Twilight #1 confirms that his mind is his greatest asset, but also that this is what sealed his tragic destiny. The dark future depicted in the comic tarnishes Iron Man’s legacy, with Tony’s technological innovations being used for nefarious purposes by his son, James. Tony Stark’s dystopian fate reflects the themes of his history, leaving his future in the Avengers: Twilight continuity uncertain, while leaving hope for a better outcome for the Eartg-616 version of Iron Man.

item.title: Tony Stark Canonically Spent the Time Between Iron Man 1 & 2 Fighting Shang-Chi s Father
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man’s identity reveal makes him a prime target for the Ten Rings and the U.S. Army. Tony’s carelessness with his secret identity puts him in danger and creates distrust among potential allies. Tony’s lone wolf attitude angers the Mandarin, reminding him of what he could have had access to. Literature ReviewIn between the events of the MCU’s Iron Man and Iron Man 2, Tony Stark spent his time taking down the Ten Rings led by the REAL Mandarin.

item.title: Tony Stark Names the 1 MCU Villain Iron Man Is Truly Afraid Of
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIron Man reveals that Kingpin is the one villain he truly fears. Iron Man and Kingpin form an unlikely alliance as allies of mutantkind. Although both successful businessmen, Kingpin’s ruthlessness surpasses Iron Man’s, making him a genuinely terrifying villain. Literature ReviewIron Man has faced some of the worst villains Marvel has, but there is one surprise MCU foe that truly scares him. Warning: contains spoilers for The Invincible Iron Man #12!

item.title: Tony Stark s Last Words to His Father Totally Explain His MCU Personality
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTony Stark’s personality in the MCU was shaped by his last conversation with his father, as revealed in an official tie-in comic. Howard Stark’s comment about Tony being brilliant but immature became Tony’s default personality as an adult. The conversation also hides a major easter egg, as Tony fulfills his father’s unfinished work in Iron Man 2, giving him closure. Literature ReviewThe last words Tony Stark ever said to his father were revealed in 1 MCU tie-in comic, and that conversation completely explains his MCU personality.

item.title: Top 10 Most Horrific Deaths Spider-Man Has Suffered in Marvel Canon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSpider-Man’s deaths have been some of the most brutal and horrific in the Marvel universe, despite being a beloved superhero. Spider-Man’s vulnerability as a street-level hero makes him susceptible to well-placed attacks, as he lacks the invulnerability of other Marvel heroes. From having his life force drained by the symbiote to being murdered by various enemies, Spider-Man has suffered multiple gruesome deaths throughout the Marvel multiverse. Literature ReviewSpider-Man is one of the greatest heroes that Marvel has to offer, which makes it all the more disturbing how many horrifying deaths he’s experienced.

item.title: Top 10 Most Powerful Birds of Prey Members in DC History (Ranked Weakest to Strongest)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Birds of Prey, led by genius hacker Oracle and secret agent Black Canary, tackle street-level crime and often align with useful villains. The team calls on ultra-skilled martial artists and stealth operatives, including master assassin Lady Shiva and alien warrior Zealot. However, the most powerful members are the New God Big Barda and the mystic power thief Black Alice. Literature ReviewThe Birds of Prey are at home bringing justice to the streets, but they can call on immortal aliens, warrior gods, and DC’s most powerful magic user.

item.title: Top 10 Superhero Debuts from Image Comics in the 1990s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYImage Comics emerged in the 1990s and quickly dominated the industry with their superhero titles, including Spawn and Savage Dragon. Many iconic superheroes were introduced by Image Comics in the 1990s, such as Prophet, Zealot, Grifter, and Gen 13. Some of these characters, like Angela and Spawn, have had a lasting impact and have made the transition to other media, solidifying their place in comic book history. Literature ReviewSuperheroes built the foundation of Image Comics in the 1990s, gifting the world numerous characters.

item.title: Transformers Latest Brutal Optimus Prime Move Was Inspired by a Surprise Anime
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTransformers writer/artist Daniel Warren Johnson acknowledges the influence of Mobile Suit Gundam on his reboot of the Transformers series for Skybound Entertainment. In Transformers #4, Johnson pays homage to the scene in Mobile Suit Gundam: The 08th MS Team where a Gundam pilot uses the severed arm of his mech as a weapon. Johnson also cites the Mobile Suit Gundam: The Origin manga as a major inspiration for his dynamic artistic depiction of giant robots in action in Transformers.

item.title: Transformers New Continuity Brings Back A Fan Favorite Autobot From the 86 Movie
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAutobot Springer makes his debut in Void Rivals #9, as Skybound Entertainment continues to expand the Energon Universe in exciting new ways. Void Rivals was the launch title for Skybound’s Energon Universe, an original series meant to weave together with the new Transformers and G.I. Joe stories being crafted in the shared Energon continuity. Springer’s appearance in Void Rivals hints at future big events and more potential crossover between Void Rivals, Transformers, G.

item.title: Transformers New Energon Universe Teases the Return of 1 Powerful Autobot
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTransformers #4, set to release in January 2024, will feature the return of a powerful Autobot as the Energon Universe expands. Optimus Prime, along with the wounded Spike and Sparkplug Witwicky, seeks help from Ratchet after a devastating encounter with the Decepticon Skywarp. The identity of the Autobot that Ratchet will revive remains unknown, but Arcee is a top contender due to her expertise in sharpshooting and combat skills.

item.title: Transformers Debuts a G1 Icon, as Starscream Assembles a True Decepticon Army
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe new Transformers comic series in the Energon Universe is introducing classic character Devastator. Devastator’s return poses a significant threat to the Autobots and gives the Decepticons a decisive advantage. The war between Autobots and Decepticons intensifies as Starscream gears up for a major battle with the arrival of Devastator. Literature ReviewSkybound’s Transformers series has followed a reimagining of franchise lore. Starscream is set to resurrect a classic G1 Decepticon to gain power.

item.title: Transformers New Continuity Teases the Return of 1 Major Decepticon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTransformers #5 hints at the return of a major Decepticon, possibly Megatron, as Starscream resurrects a powerful warrior to eliminate the Autobots. Despite the appearance of Megatron’s fusion cannon on the cover, there are doubts about his actual return, as Starscream has taken over as the Decepticon leader. If not Megatron, other possibilities for the resurrected Decepticon include Thundercracker, Scorponok, Blitzwing, or Devastator. Fans will have to keep reading to find out.

item.title: Transformers Reveals Megatron s Fate in New Continuity - & His Shocking Jailer
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCobra Commander #1 reveals that Megatron is being kept prisoner by Cobra Commander in the Energon Universe. The lore of the Energon Universe gets deeper with the reveal of Cobra Commander’s connection to the hidden civilization of Cobra-La. Cobra Commander’s new weaponry is a result of experiments conducted on Megatron, setting up an intriguing storyline for the future. Literature ReviewFans finally learn where Megatron has been the last few centuries with the release of Cobra Commander #1, as the Decepticon leader makes his debut…

item.title: Transformers, G.I. Joe, Void Rivals 10 Moments That Defined the Energon Universe in 2023
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSkybound’s Energon Universe has successfully revitalized the Transformers and G.I. Joe franchises, attracting new fans while delighting old ones by merging them into a single shared continuity. The inclusion of surprise appearances and the interconnectedness of the Energon Universe has made both iconic franchises feel more complete and immersive. The shocking moments so far, such as Optimus Prime suplexing Starscream and future G.I. Joe leader Duke’s first encounter with the Transformers have raised the stakes, generated major fan excitement for the Energon Universe.

item.title: Twas the Mite Before Christmas #1 Shows Why DC s Holiday Comics Are Appointment Reading (Review)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC’s ‘Twas the Mite Before Christmas #1 is an epic holiday extravaganza featuring fan-favorite characters, offering eight spectacular holiday tales. Each narrative in this Christmas special takes a unique DC twist, drawing inspiration from classic Christmas tales and injecting the iconic characters with a familiar holiday spirit that’s both familiar and exceptionally entertaining. This extraordinary holiday special showcases the top-notch talent of over 25 writers, artists, colorists, and letterers, resulting in a collection that captures the magic of the holidays within the DC Universe.

item.title: Two Ridiculous Sonic Foes Step Up to Take Eggman s Place (& Fail Miserably)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCubot and Orbot, who usually serve as comic relief, play a major role in Sonic the Hedgehog: Winter Jam from IDW Publishing. The two silly Badniks’ desire to do less work influences their efforts to defeat Sonic and his friends. The Winter Jam plan, stolen from Dr. Eggman, is a horrible idea, but Cubot and Orbot’s failure saves him from embarrassment. Literature ReviewThe last two Badniks that fans would ever expect to be the center of anything in IDW’s Sonic the Hedgehog series are the main villains in Winter Jam.

item.title: Two Shonen Jump Mega Hits Are Officially United By One Incredibly Dark Reference
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYChainsaw Man chapter #144 features a character who strongly resembles Nobara Kugisaki from Jujutsu Kaisen, adding to the existing connection between the two manga. Chainsaw Man often includes pop culture references, so it’s possible that the Nail Fiend is an intentional homage to Nobara. The introduction of the Nail Fiend in Chainsaw Man can be seen as a way to make up for the criticism of Nobara’s treatment in Jujutsu Kaisen, giving fans a chance to see a similar character in a different context.

item.title: Two Titans Prove Their Strength By Taking Down The One Villain Superman Can t
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Titans: Beast World #3, Starfire and Donna Troy easily subdue Black Adam, a foe that even Superman struggles with, thanks to their immense physical strength and lack of overt weaknesses. Black Adam’s transformation into a feral beast removes his constraints while maintaining his power, making him nearly unbeatable, but still vulnerable to these two powerful Titans. In Titans: Beast World #3, Starfire and Donna prove to be among the strongest Titans as they defeat Black Adam, showcasing that they are capable of getting the job done even when Superman cannot.

item.title: Tyler Durden Betrays His Fight Club Message In Distant Future ‘Sequel
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFight Club’s Tyler Durden betrays his anti-consumerism beliefs by being involved in advertising and running a demolition company in the Tranmetropolitan. Transmetropolitan hints at a shared continuity with Fight Club, suggesting that Tyler Durden exists within the body of the Narrator’s descendant in the 23rd century. Tyler Durden’s involvement in advertising and running a demolition company shows that he is the ultimate traitor to his own cause of anti-capitalism in this distant future “sequel”.

item.title: Ultimates Bryan Hitch - A Major Inspiration for the MCU - Is Done Working with Marvel & DC
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBryan Hitch, known for his influential work on the Ultimates series that inspired the MCU, will no longer be working with DC and Marvel Comics but will continue to create comics where he owns the rights to his content. Hitch has had a significant impact on the comic book industry and beyond, including designing the Tardis interior for Doctor Who and working on the Star Trek reboot movie. While Hitch’s departure from Marvel and DC may not directly impact the DC movie universe, it remains to be seen if his work will influence the current revamping of the DC movie universe by James Gunn.

item.title: Ultron Confirms Which Avenger Is Truly the Strongest
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYUltron confirms that the Hulk is the strongest Avenger, based on his ability to cause destruction when he loses control. The Hulk’s potential for destruction is why Ultron sees him as a valuable ally in achieving his goals. The whereabouts of the Hulk after the attack in Boston are unknown, but it is possible that he is being studied for his power. Literature ReviewFans have debated for years who the strongest Avenger is, and Ultron just answered that question in the absolute worst way for the team.

item.title: Ultron Officially Joins the Avengers, as New Thor-Strength Hero Reveals His Origin & Codename
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA new version of Ultron, named Mark Twelve, has joined the Avengers and has proven to be a powerful addition who can rival anyone else on the team. Mark Twelve’s true identity as Ultron has been a mystery until now, as he has been appearing as “Victor Shade” throughout Avengers Inc. Mark Twelve is actually based on Ultron-12’s code and has taken on a new, more human form. The Avengers are excited about this new member.

item.title: Ultron Returns The Avengers Villain is Back, in a New Identity Nobody Saw Coming
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Avengers, Inc. #4, Victor Shade is revealed to be Ultron in disguise, and he has returned to the Marvel Universe with a vengeance. Henry Pym, the former Ant-Man, is seeming,y dead again after being momentarily brought back to life. Ultron’s return poses a major threat to the Marvel Universe, and it will likely take the combined firepower of the Avengers to stop him. Literature ReviewThe classic Avengers MCU villain is back in the Marvel Universe, reappearing under a new identity that none of the world’s heroes saw coming.

item.title: Ultron Would Lose His Mind Over Wolverine s New Adamantium Weapon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine seeks adrenaline through extreme sports, leading him to ask Forge to craft an adamantium surfboard. The surfboard provides Wolverine with a near-death experience, showcasing his signature style and love for danger. The recreational use of adamantium may exasperate villains like Ultron, but Wolverine chooses the thrill of surfing over creating another weapon. Literature ReviewAs a death-defying member of Marvel’s X-Force, Wolverine has Forge make him a new weapon out of adamantium (and the MCU’s Ultron would be furious).

item.title: Undead Unluck Every Under Negator & Their Abilities Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Union and Under are two opposing organizations in Undead Unluck , with the Union fighting to protect the world and Under working for selfish reasons. Billy Alfred, the founder of Under, has the ability to copy the Negator abilities of anyone who hates him, while Rip Tristan can inflict injuries that cannot be healed. Latla Mirah warps reality with her Negator ability, and Tella’s ability prevents physical communication but can create sound barriers.

item.title: Underrated Delinquent Manga is the Best Series More Fans Should Be Reading
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYOUT embodies the essence of delinquent manga with its rebellious and freedom-seeking characters. The unique plot of OUT follows the life of a former delinquent trying to escape his past and avoid returning to jail. The stunning artwork sets OUT apart from other delinquent series, making it a must-read for genre fans. Literature ReviewOUT is the best example of delinquent trope done right, and it is criminally underrated. Despite how niche the genre may seem, delinquent manga has long been popular in the community, and one of the best titles available, OUT, is still criminally underrated.

item.title: Underrated Isekai Series Uses Cuteness to Hide How Unsettling it Really Is
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLeave Me Alone - I Want to Enjoy Cheat Life with My Familiar is an isekai manga that initially appears cute and relaxing, but subtle moments hint at a darker side to the new world. Unlike other isekai series, the protagonist in this manga is reluctant to go on adventures and wishes for a slow life. The story takes a more serious tone rather than relying on comedy. The manga creates an unsettling atmosphere by hinting at potential danger surrounding the protagonist’s powers, subverting the typical cozy isekai trope.

item.title: Underrated Villainess Manhwa Is Great Because It Rejects Isekai s Premise
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHow to Survive a Romance Fantasy breaks the mold of formulaic isekai series, standing out as a blatantly subversive manga. The series combines the villainess convention and the “slow life” trope in a unique way, with characters running away from their destined roles. The manga focuses on a unique plot line where the characters work together without knowing each other’s true identities, setting it apart from other isekai series.

item.title: Upcoming Sonic Miniseries Rewrites Lore with Rumored Eighth Chaos Emerald
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSonic the Hedgehog: Fang the Hunter introduces the possibility of an eighth Chaos Emerald, which could potentially change the franchise lore forever. The four-issue miniseries features Fang, Bark, and Bean on a quest to find the rumored eighth Chaos Emerald, encountering familiar characters along the way. While it’s unlikely that an eighth Chaos Emerald will actually be found in the miniseries, the prospect of its existence excites fans and leaves room for future changes in the Sonic the Hedgehog comic.

item.title: V for Vendetta Gets Cyberpunk Redesign in Jaw-Dropping Fanart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYV for Vendetta, a landmark comic in the 1980s, is hailed as a masterpiece and a vision of a bleak future. Cyberpunk, a new genre at the time, showcased high-tech yet decadent worlds with societal collapse. Its influence is still present today. BossLogic’s fan art perfectly combines the themes of V for Vendetta and cyberpunk, highlighting the consequences of losing empathy and embracing greed. Literature ReviewV for Vendetta and the cyberpunk genre rose at the same time, and now artist BossLogic deftly mixes the two together.

item.title: Venom and Carnage s Rivalry Changes Forever With One Heart-Breaking Death
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCarnage’s killing of Dylan, Venom’s son, changes their intense rivalry forever. Venom has become more heroic while Carnage remains evil, which only intensifies the issues between them. Venom will stop at nothing to avenge his son’s death by killing Carnage, meaning Cletus may have doomed himself already. Literature ReviewVenom and Carnage’s already bitter rivalry is changed forever with the heart-breaking death of someone close to Eddie Brock. Warning: contains spoilers for Venom #30!

item.title: Venom Just Got Called Out for the Grossest Part of His Costume
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVenom is a powerful alien symbiote that grants incredible strength to its host, but certain elements are also pretty gross when you think about it. Howard the Duck asks Venom if he wears clothes under the symbiote, a question many fans might also wonder about. Symbiotes can take on any form, including clothing, and characters like Eddie Brock and Cletus Kasady have been seen without clothes when separated from their symbiotes.

item.title: Venom Lacks 1 Major Spider-Man Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVenom’s original bond with Spider-Man gave him many of Spidey’s abilities, except for his crucial Spider-Sense. Venom’s lack of Spider-Sense leaves him vulnerable to sneak attacks, as shown when Black Cat was able to follow and strike him without detection in Venom Annual (2018) #1, Despite Venom’s strength and other powers, the absence of Spider-Sense is a major weakness in his defense, making him susceptible to being caught off guard.

item.title: Venom Names the 1 Symbiote Who Can Match His Strength (Not Carnage)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRascal, a young symbiote, is quickly proving to be one of the most powerful and dangerous symbiotes in the Marvel Universe. Despite Venom’s history of taking down formidable opponents like Spider-Man, Carnage, and Juggernaut, Rascal’s ferocity and combat skills make Venom wary. Rascal’s ability to absorb other symbiotes is just an added bonus to its absurd strength-level, and contributes to making it a symbiote that Venom truly fears. Literature ReviewIn Red Goblin #10, the Venom symbiote declared the eponymous character to be the one symbiote that can match its strength, moreso even than Carnage.

item.title: Venom s Death Gave Rise to the Ultimate Symbiote Hellscape
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWithout Eddie Brock, Knull the King in Black conquers the world through Eddie’s son Dylan, resulting in a dark alternate future. Eddie Brock’s presence is crucial in preventing Knull from physically invading Earth and taking over Dylan’s mind. Dylan Brock needs his father to guide him and prevent him from becoming the worst villain Earth has ever seen. Literature ReviewVenom is one of the darker heroes in the Marvel Universe, but in a timeline where Eddie Brock died early, the world becomes much darker without him.

item.title: Venom vs Juggernaut Settled Hulk s True Competitor as Marvel s Strongest Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Venom Annual (2018) #1, Marvel’s symbiote anti-hero easily defeats Juggernaut, showing off his incredible strength against one of the X-franchise’s most formidable fighters. Venom’s agility and ability to redirect Juggernaut’s strength gave him an advantage in the fight between the two opponents. By outsmarting Juggernaut and disrupting his abilities, Venom eventually overcomes him, proving himself to be the stronger fighter, and giving him the opportunity to display his strength-level by tossing the massive Juggernaut around with ease.

item.title: Venom vs. Carnage Unleashes A God-Tier New Symbiote Design
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYVenom and Carnage are about to have their bloodiest fight yet in the new story Symbiosis Necrosis, with Carnage trying to become a god-like version of himself. Carnage’s new design suggests that he may succeed in his quest for godhood, which would give him unimaginable power and the ability to cause unprecedented death and destruction. The upcoming storyline will explore the complicated family dynamics between Carnage, Venom, Eddie Brock, and Dylan, with Carnage seeking to harm Eddie through revealing Venom’s villainous acts to Dylan.

item.title: Venomized Miles Morales Is The Spider-Verse Cosplay The Movies Need To Introduce
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMiles Morales’ Venomized cosplay design deserves a comic debut and attention from Marvel. The talented cosplayers behind the design, Mark and Lorenzo, consistently impress with their cosplay skills. It would be intriguing to see the unique powers of Venomized Miles Morales and his potential inclusion in future Spider-Man projects. Literature ReviewMiles Morales has fought against Venom on more than one occasion, with this Venomized cosplay marrying Miles’ and Venom’s character designs perfectly.

item.title: Voting Now Open DC Writer Tom Taylor s Dark Knights of Steel Nominated For 2024 Excelsior Award
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDark Knights of Steel, the collaborative work of Tom Taylor and Yasmine Putri, has been nominated for the 2024 Excelsior Award, a prestigious recognition of excellence in graphic novels and manga. Fans have the chance to cast their votes and actively participate in supporting and honoring the creative brilliance of Dark Knights of Steel. Tom Taylor’s nomination for the Excelsior Award is not surprising given his impressive track record of winning awards for his works, showcasing his exceptional storytelling prowess.

item.title: Walking Dead Creator Offers Hope for Alternate Timeline Where Glenn Lives
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe deluxe reissues of The Walking Dead provide new insights into the series, and in the letters page for the latest issue, even contains a possible hint at the possibility of a reboot. One of the highlights of The Walking Dead Deluxe has been Robert Kirkman’s engagement with fans in the letters section, which has involved revealing subtle details about the series, as well alternate story ideas. The inclusion of a fan theory about a new alternate Walking Dead continuity, and Kirkman’s coy response, raises speculation about the series’ future, and highlights the enduring popularity of the franchise.

item.title: Walking Dead Foreshadowed Rick s Biggest Injury Ridiculously Early in the Franchise
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Walking Dead #3 foreshadowed Rick losing his hand to the Governor, which occurred in Walking Dead #28, and proved to be one of the most pivotal moments of the series’ early run. The loss of Rick’s hand elevated the Governor as a major villain, and in the process, laid a foundation for the excessive brutalities of subsequent antagonists in the series. Rick’s adversity, with the loss of his hand being just one of many tragedies he suffered throughout the series, defined his character, and in many ways, Walking Dead as a whole.

item.title: Walking Dead Negan s Original Backstory Would Have Made Him Rick s Perfect Dark Opposite
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYNegan could have been a completely different character named Davidson, who was the exiled former leader of Alexandria Safe Zone. Robert Kirkman considered making Negan and Davidson the same character but ultimately decided against it, allowing Negan to become a distinct and iconic character. By not tying Negan to any previous story, Kirkman allowed the character to flourish and become a foundational character in the franchise. Literature ReviewRobert Kirkman revealed that iconic Walking Dead character Negan almost had a different backstory, tying into scrapped plans for an earlier villain.

item.title: Walking Dead s Carol Originally Had One of Its Darkest Deaths
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYComic book Carol suffered a tragic death and didn’t experience the same transformation as The Walking Dead TV show character did. The comic character’s story was buuilt on struggling to find her place among the survivors, eventually allowing a walker to kill her. The TV show deviated from the comic book storyline because the actor portraying Carol brought depth to the character’s development. Literature ReviewWhile Carol underwent inspiring character development in The Walking Dead TV series, she originally had one of the story’s darkest deaths.

item.title: Walking Dead s Creator Recommends 3 Obscure Zombie Movies Fans Need to See
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRob Kirkman, creator of The Walking Dead, recommends three zombie movies that are not typically associated with the genre. The movies recommended by Kirkman, including Zombie, Stacy: Attack of the Schoolgirl Zombies, and Undead, diverge significantly from traditional zombie mythology. These movies seem to have influenced Kirkman’s storytelling in The Walking Dead, as elements of them can be found throughout the comic series. Literature ReviewThe Walking Dead co-creator Robert Kirkman reveals three underrated zombie movie classics that every fan of the genre should check out.

item.title: War Looms in Epic Trailer for Zack Snyder s REBEL MOON Prequel HOUSE OF THE BLOODAXE
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYRebel Moon: House of the Bloodaxe is a four-part miniseries that explores the origin of the Bloodaxe family and the events leading up to the galactic war shown in Rebel Moon: A Child of Fire. The official video trailer and preview pages of the series reveal the cosmic scale of the storyline, featuring planetary nomads and seemingly cosmic beings, adding mystique and excitement to the established world. The prequel will explain the reasons behind the Bloodaxe family’s high standing in the rebellion against the Imperium, showing how they were thrust into their roles as rebels and the pressure they face to defeat the Imperium.

item.title: Watchmen Cosplay Brings Back the Costume Too Disturbing for the Movie
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYZack Snyder’s 2009 Watchmen film largely stayed faithful to the source material, though omit the Comedian’s leather mask, which an expert cosplayer recently recreated. Batsturd’s cosplay of the Comedian is a perfect homage the character in the comic, with the leather mask being a significant detail. Batsturd’s cosplay craftsmanship is unparalleled, capturing the essence of the Comedian and emphasizing the disturbing nature of the character’s leather mask. Literature ReviewZack Snyder’s Watchmen omitted an aspect of the Comedian’s costume design; elite cosplayer @batsturd perfectly recreates the character, mask included.

item.title: What Fuels Wolverine s Healing Factor (& Makes It So Powerful), Finally Confirmed by Marvel
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s healing factor requires him to consume a significant amount of calories to function properly. The efficiency and effectiveness of Wolverine’s healing factor makes him stand out among other characters with similar powers. Constant intake of food and drink is crucial for Wolverine to maintain his unbeatable healing ability and stay at the top of his game. Literature ReviewWolverine’s healing factor has been shown to help him recover from deadly injuries, with Marvel finally confirming what it needs to work properly.

item.title: What Marvel s New Ultimate Universe Can Learn From the Original s Darkest Moment
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYUltimate X-Men #41, featuring Wolverine on a solo mission to kill a dangerous mutant, remains controversial, but is one of the most memorable issues of the series. Ultimate Marvel offers opportunities to take characters into unfamiliar territory and tell truly novel stories with familiar Marvel heroes and villains. The new incarnation of the Ultimate Universe should push the boundaries of what Marvel stories can be, and offer concrete alternatives to the current main Marvel continuity.

item.title: Where The Body Was Review Brubaker & Phillips Sly Murder Mystery Is a Domestic Epic in Disguise
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYEd Brubaker and Sean Phillips deliver an ambitious and wide-ranging murder mystery in Where The Body Was, which peels back the layers of suburban violence. The creators subvert expectations and explore the interconnectivity of characters, examining society in microcosm. Where The Body Was is a gripping and emotional graphic novel that solidifies Brubaker and Phillips’ legacy as masters of crime/noir comics. Literature ReviewEd Brubaker and Sean Phillips tackle the well-worn whodunit genre, but flip it on its ear in their approach to sex, lies and attempted murder…

item.title: White Adam s Justice Lords Need to Return as Justice League s Coolest Rivals
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Justice Lords, an alternate version of the Justice League, could still pose a threat to the DC Universe; or the reformed version, under White Adam, could be a cooler heroic alternative to the traditional League, who are currently disbanded. While White Adam has taken over control and the threat of Lord Superman is seemingly gone, there is potential for the Justice Lords to return as either heroes or antagonists.

item.title: Why Batman Killed Darkseid - DC Confirms the 1 Reason He ll Break His No Kill Vow
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAn alternate dimension reveals that Batman is willing to kill one person to save many. Batman’s traumatic past shaped his aversion to death and led to his strict no-kill rule. Although Batman is known for his no-kill policy, he has broken it before, such as when he killed Darkseid to save the universe. Literature ReviewOne of the most well-known Batman concepts is his infamous no-kill rule — but the Dark Knight has revealed the one reason he’ll make an exception.

item.title: Why Black Widow Is So Scared of Hulk in 2012 s Avengers - Their Secret MCU History Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBlack Widow was terrified of Bruce Banner in 2012’s The Avengers because she’d already met the Hulk. Tie-in materials reveal she was tailing Hulk during the events of 2008’s The Incredible Hulk. Natasha was injured in the Hulk vs Abomination fight, explaining her deep fear of Banner. Literature ReviewWhen Black Widow meets Bruce Banner in The Avengers, she’s terrified - because she already faced the Hulk earlier in MCU continuity.

item.title: Why Captain Kirk Accepted the Promotion to Admiral After TOS (Despite Not Wanting the Job)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKirk accepted a promotion to admiral despite not wanting the job, in order to prevent unethical situations like the one on Archernar IV from happening again. Kirk’s decision to become an admiral was driven by his moral compass and a desire to make a difference within Starfleet and the Federation. While those close to Kirk believed it was a mistake, his promotion was motivated by good intentions, even though it ultimately led him away from his true calling as a starship captain.

item.title: Why DC s Justice Lords Are the Best Evil Justice League
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Justice Lords are not simply evil opposites of the Justice League, but rather they were corrupted by their own choices. Unlike the Crime Syndicate, the Justice Lords hold the same beliefs and act similarly to the Justice League until they kill Lex Luthor, making them a true cautionary tale. The Justice Lords are the greatest evil version of the Justice League because they are, in fact, the Justice League themselves.

item.title: Why Iron Man Doesn t Use Adamantium in His Armor (Because He Discovered Its Weakness)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAdamantium, one of the strongest materials in the Marvel Universe, is not invincible and can be destroyed by Antarctic Vibranium. Even the most well-designed adamantium armor would be no match for the effects of Antarctic Vibranium, which can destabilize metal molecules. Antarctic Vibranium, while difficult to acquire, has the potential to destroy entire cities if weaponized, making it a dangerous material to be used against adamantium. Literature ReviewAdamantium seems like a natural choice for armor, but Tony Stark knows too much about its biggest weakness to ever rely on it as Iron Man.

item.title: Why JoJo s Bizarre Adventure Was Rebooted After Part 6
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYStone Ocean marked the end of Jojo’s Bizarre Adventure’s original continuity and signaled the need for a reboot. The rebooted Steel Ball Run and JoJolion brought new life to the series through revamped pacing, art style, and character-driven storytelling. While fans are eager for an animated adaptation of Steel Ball Run, it may be a while before it happens due to its length and technical challenges with animating horses.

item.title: Why Kong Is So Dedicated to Protecting Humans in MonsterVerse Canon (Not Because They Worship Him)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKong’s empathetic nature drives his commitment to protecting humans, even those who don’t worship him. Kong’s tragic origin story, witnessing his parents’ death, fuels his desire to prevent humans from experiencing the same loss. Unlike other monsters, Kong’s empathy allows him to understand and connect with humans, motivating him to fight on their behalf in the MonsterVerse. Literature ReviewKong is humanity’s true champion in the MonsterVerse, as he always tries to save people when fighting monsters.

item.title: Why Luke Cage s New Hero Team is So Much Better Than Spider-Man s
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYLuke Cage’s team displays better chemistry and respect for their leader than Spider-Man’s team, leading to more effective results. The conflict or cooperation between Luke Cage and Spider-Man’s teams will define the “Gang War” event. Luke Cage succeeds as a leader where Spider-Man fails, as he carefully selects teammates who are cohesive, cooperative, and hold respect for him. Literature ReviewBoth all-star superheroes have teams going into Marvel’s Gang War, but between Spider-Man and Luke Cage, the latter’s squad is superior.

item.title: Why PREY s Yautja Are Deadlier Than the Modern Day Species - Predator Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAdvanced technology makes the Predators worse hunters, as it lessens their skills and instincts. In Predator vs Wolverine, Logan notes, “The fancier the tech, the cockier you get, and the more detached you are from the musk and bloodbeat of the thing you want dead.” As stories like Prey move away from the modern day, Predators actually get deadlier because they have to rely on their instincts, not tech.

item.title: Why Spider-Man & Captain America Aren t Close in the MCU - 1 Quote Solves This Change from the Comics
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYPeter Parker admires Steve Rogers because he recognizes similarities between the fabled Avengers leader and his late Uncle Ben. Without Uncle Ben in the MCU, Peter doesn’t have a reason to look up to Steve Rogers as much as he does in the comics. Peter’s affiliation with Iron Man in the MCU is influenced by the absence of Uncle Ben and his admiration for Tony Stark’s scientific interests, rather than the deeper respect he has for Captain America in the comics.

item.title: Why Spider-Man & Wolverine Aren t on the Avengers New All-Star Roster
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine and Spider-Man weren’t included in the latest Avengers run because the creative team wanted to focus on iconic, big-name Avengers characters, who are most familiar to readers as members of the team. The current Avengers team represents “the most iconic characters [writer Jed McKay] can handle,” while still, “ensuring that everyone gets the spotlight.” Wolverine and Spider-Man would bring their own baggage to the Avengers, wgile their absence doesn’t affect the balance of the series.

item.title: Why Thanos Became a Farmer After His Infinity Gauntlet Snap
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThanos initially became a farmer as a form of self-punishment in the comics after his ultimate defeat in Infinity Gauntlet . However, Thanos then found beauty in a simple life and realized the significance of tending the crops compared to his previous acts of destruction. In both the comics and the MCU, Thanos ends up becoming a farmer, seeking a fulfilling and accomplished life through peaceful quiet and reflective solitude, regardless of victory or defeat.

item.title: Why Thrawn Was the 1 Imperial Who Could Defy Darth Vader (Without Being Executed)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThrawn risks Vader’s wrath by defying his orders, but is spared due to his value to the Empire and Palpatine’s favor. Thrawn’s past with Anakin Skywalker affects Vader’s decision to spare him, despite his defiance. Thrawn’s unique knowledge of the Unknown Regions and his success as a tactician make him a vital asset to the Empire. Literature ReviewGrand Admiral Thrawn was one of the Empire’s boldest leaders due to his willingness to defy Darth Vader’s orders (which was often to risk death).

item.title: Why Wolverine & Spider-Man Are Bumping Fists in That Iconic Meme
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Wolverine/Spider-Man fist-bumping meme template highlights the contrast between two different subjects sharing a trait. The image originated in Amazing Spider-Man #595 in 2010, where Wolverine and Spider-Man fist-bump to display their mutual dislike of former President George W. Bush. This meme format becoming popular is unexpected and shows how political commentary in comic books can resonate with a wider audience. Literature ReviewA popular meme template has been circulating the internet for more than a decade of Wolverine & Spider-Man fist-bumping.

item.title: Why Wolverine Isn t a Millionaire (Despite 150 Years of Adventures) - Marvel Settles the Fan Debate
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAccording to writer Benjamin Percy, between his vices and his charitable instincts, Wolverine has spent every cent he ever earned. Logan is uninterested in wealth and living a sedentary lifestyle, instead embodying a countercultural ethos. Despite coming from a well-off family, Wolverine has always rejected luxury and strives to live a simple existence. Literature ReviewWolverine’s long life could have been devoted to making him a wealthy man; instead, he has eschewed financial security in favor of a humble life.

item.title: Wiccan Cosplay Showcases the Superhero Destiny of Scarlet Witch s MCU Son
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYCosplayer Marc Scherwin’s Omega-level Wiccan cosplay showcases what an adult version of Scarlet Witch’s son could look like in the MCU. The photo, featuring Wiccan levitating with his majestic red cape, demonstrates Scherwin’s perfect embodiment of Wiccan’s style. Wiccan and Hulkling, Marvel’s iconic queer couple, should play a central role in the MCU’s long-term cinematic plans, given their impact on fans and their ties to existing storylines and characters.

item.title: Witcher 3 The Best Order to Play Quests (& Why)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYFollowing a specific quest order in The Witcher 3 allows for a more satisfying narrative experience. The four chapters of the game each have a recommended order of quests to follow. After completing the main story in The Witcher 3, players can start the DLCs. Literature ReviewPlayers should complete The Witcher 3’s main story and side quests in a specific order that is best for enjoying the full narrative.

item.title: With 1 New Feat, DC Icon Donna Troy Makes Green Lantern Look Weak
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Girl Donna Troy’s display of willpower surpasses that of the Green Lanterns, solidifying her as one of the strongest heroes. Donna Troy’s ability to single-handedly restrain Garro proves her unparalleled strength and shakes the hierarchy of DC superheroes. Donna Troy’s exceptional feat makes her a potential candidate to become the next Green Lantern, considering her unprecedented level of willpower. Literature ReviewIn a display of unmatched willpower, Wonder Girl Donna Troy outshines Green Lantern’s abilities with a single feat, proving she’s worthy of a Ring.

item.title: With 1 Secret Revealed, the Teen Titans Prove Why They Replaced the Justice League
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAs World’s Finest: Teen Titans makes clear, revealing their secret identities to one another fosters trust and leads to success for the Teen Titans. Trusting each other with secret identities is crucial for superteam cohesion, something Dick Grayson has come to realize over the first several issues of World’s Finest. Sharing secret identities is a trust exercise that builds friendships, and their eventual family-like trust in one another is what goes on to separate the Titans from the Justice League.

item.title: With New Armor, Superman Has Officially Become a Better Version of Lex Luthor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman, forced into Lex Luthor’s role in Metropolis, fights super-powered enemies on his own turf in a suit of armor, experiencing a surprising role reversal. The Blue Earth movement steals Superman’s powers and runs rampant across Metropolis, forcing Superman to resort to armor to protect the city. With Superman in charge of Supercorp and wearing an armored suit, he finally sees things from Lex Luthor’s perspective and understands him better than ever.

item.title: Without Captain Kirk, Worf Would Have Become One of Star Trek s Darkest Villains
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWorf, usually an honorable man, becomes a vicious and cruel villain in the alternate timeline of Star Trek: The Last Generation. Worf’s corruption and evil are expressed through his physical appearance and his brutal actions. Captain Kirk’s failure to negotiate peace with the Klingons leads to Worf’s transformation into one of the franchise’s darkest villains. Literature ReviewCaptain Kirk can take credit for many things, including saving the Earth from the rule of Worf, who would’ve become a bloodthirsty villain.

item.title: Without His Crown, Black Panther is Officially Becoming a New Kind of Marvel Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYIn Black Panther #7, the former Wakandan king struggles to transition into fighting street-level justice in the city of Birnin T’Chaka. N’Yobi, T’Challa’s ally in Birnin T’Chaka, advises Black Panther to embrace the city during the day in order to truly protect it at night. Black Panther learns the importance of observing and understanding the city before he can effectively combat street-level crime. Literature ReviewAfter giving up the Wakandan throne, Marvel’s Black Panther is finally on the right path to becoming the street-level hero he’s destined to be.

item.title: Without the Iron Fist, Danny Rand Might Be Marvel s New Batman
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDanny Rand has access to advanced technology and resources without relying on the Iron Fist. His tech division at Rand Corporation could give him a new superhero identity or second calling as a hero. The potential for Danny to create or already have advanced tech sets him up as a strong contender for Marvel’s Batman. Literature ReviewDanny Rand may not be the Iron Fist anymore, but his superhero ambitions are not over, as he claims the role of Marvel’s Batman for himself.

item.title: Wolverine & Cyclops Cosplay Gives Fans the X-Men vs Ultron Fight of Their Dreams
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine and Cyclops face a life-or-death battle against Ultron in an epic new cosplay. The cosplay image features @zack_attack_cosplay as Wolverine and @supermancfl as Cyclops, with Ryan Sims as the digital artist and photographer. The image showcases impressive costumes and an awesome battle scene, raising the bar for creative cosplay in the community. Literature ReviewThe X-Men and Ultron don’t cross paths often in comics, but in a new cosplay image, both Wolverine and Cyclops give it their all to take Ultron down.

item.title: Wolverine and Gambit Cosplay Reunites X-Men s Most Underrated Duo
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA trio of talented cosplayers bring iconic X-Men Wolverine, Gambit, and Sabretooth to life, in a visually striking showdown. The attention to detail and comic-accurate attire elevate this cosplay to extraordinary heights, making it an Omega-level representation of all three characters. The cosplay highlights the underrated friendship between Wolverine and Gambit, leaving fans eager for more team-ups featuring the mutant duo. Literature ReviewIn a display of cosplay artistry, the reunion of Wolverine and Gambit takes center stage as they confront a classic villain in an epic showdown.

item.title: Wolverine Calls Out How Krakoa Destroys Professor X s Original Mission
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAccording to Logan in Wolverine #40, Krakoa fell because Professor X neglected his mission of bringing mutants and humans together, causing the mutant nation to become isolated and vulnerable. Emma Frost and Doctor Doom predicted Krakoa’s downfall from the start, recognizing the flaws in isolating mutants from the rest of society. Wolverine realizes the importance of teamwork and the support of others, as he reflects on his own journey and the failures of Krakoa.

item.title: Wolverine Canonically Became Venom Way Before Spider-Man
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine was the first Marvel hero to wear a symbiote, encountering the dangerous alien species alongside Nick Fury during the Vietnam War, making him the first to experience its powers and dangers. This revelation adds an interesting context to Wolverine’s past encounters with Symbiotes, including his epic confrontations with Venom. While Spider-Man may be known for wearing the Venom symbiote, Wolverine holds the distinction of chronologically being the first superhero to wear a symbiote in the Marvel Universe.

item.title: Wolverine Confirms a Beloved X-Men Hero Is Permanently Dead, With No Chance of Return
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s son, Akihiro (aka Fang), is killed by Sabretooth, and his body parts are scattered in the snow. Wolverine’s extreme ferocity is ineffective against Sabretooth and his army. Wolverine is tied up and witnesses the deaths of nearly everyone inside the fortress. Akihiro’s death is confirmed to be permanent, with no chance of return in X-Men canon. The fall of Krakoa and the neutralization of mutant resurrection protocols and cloning make his resurrection impossible.

item.title: Wolverine Cosplay Gives Fans A Jaw-Dropping Live-Action Design Ahead of Deadpool 3
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYHugh Jackman’s Wolverine will finally wear a comic-accurate yellow and blue costume in Deadpool 3. A Marvel fan’s cosplay brings Wolverine’s upcoming movie costume to life and impresses with attention to detail. The cosplay substitutes the blue for black, giving Wolverine a Hollywood-ready look and capturing the character’s essence. Literature ReviewWolverine is finally getting the live-action look he deserves in next year’s Deadpool 3, but until then, this cosplay design is the next best thing!

item.title: Wolverine Cosplay Is the Perfect Reinvention of His Very First Costume
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBatsturd’s Wolverine cosplay resurrects the character’s original costume with precision and homage, capturing the essence of Logan’s debut in an incredible display of fandom and craftsmanship. Fans and the cosplay community are praising Batsturd’s classic Wolverine portrayal, recognizing it as nothing short of amazing and the best in the game. Batsturd’s unique appreciation for Wolverine’s humble beginnings and ability to transform the once-goofy original costume into a badass rendition showcases his artistic prowess and invites fellow fans to rediscover and revel in the coolness of Wolverine’s roots.

item.title: Wolverine Cosplay Recreates 1 of His Most Extreme Comic Covers in Real Life
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYA cosplayer recreates a badass Wolverine comic cover with unparalleled precision, showcasing the deep appreciation fans have for the character. Through collaboration with a digital artist, the cosplayer captures the intense pose and details of Wolverine, matching the visual extreme of the comic cover. The Wolverine cosplay pays homage to a significant comic cover and highlights the way fans immortalize their favorite characters through artistic transformation and shared enthusiasm.

item.title: Wolverine Cosplay Unleashes Logan s OTHER Crime-Fighting Codename
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s Patch persona showcases the character’s versatility and ability to fit into different tones and genres, making it one of Logan’s most memorable alternate identities. Cosplayer Batsturd perfectly captures the look of Patch, with the eyepatch, slicked hair, and white suit. Logan’s Patch disguise is a humorous take on superhero identity, and Batsturd offers an excellent tribute to this enduring character design. Literature ReviewA new cosplay celebrates Patch, the mysterious eyepatch wearing hero of Madripoor who absolutely isn’t a famous Mutant superhero in disguise

item.title: Wolverine Debuts a Grotesque (But Genius) New Use for His Healing Factor
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s healing factor not only heals him, but also allows the creation of gruesome distractions in combat, giving him an edge against the Predator. The conflict between Wolverine and the Predator in Predator vs. Wolverine #3 showcases the titular hero’s tactical fighting style. Wolverine’s healing factor makes him virtually indestructible and adaptable to different situations. Literature ReviewWolverine’s fight continues against the Predator in the third issue of the crossover series, with a disgusting new use for the hero’s abilities.

item.title: Wolverine Just Confirmed That Professor X Failed Him
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAccording to Predator vs. Wolverine #3, Wolverine’s time studying under Muramasa in Japan provided him with the closest thing to peace he has ever known. Charles Xavier’s influence on Wolverine has been both positive and negative, but ultimately he failed to help Wolverine find true peace. Logan’s role as a member of the X-Men has prevented him from finding the peace he craves, as he is constantly fighting for survival.

item.title: Wolverine Just Solved Every Inconsistency with His Healing Factor in 1 Sentence
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s incredible healing factor has been a subject of confusion and inconsistency, but X-Men #29 finally reveals the secret behind his healing feats. Wolverine’s healing rate is directly linked to his caloric intake, which explains why his healing factor has varied so much throughout the years. The simple explanation of Wolverine’s healing being fueled by calories conveniently retcons any discrepancies in his abilities, making him truly unkillable as long as he eats enough.

item.title: Wolverine Just Unleashed 2 of the Most R-Rated Deaths in Marvel History
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSabretooth ruthlessly murders Wolverine’s loved ones, including his son Akihiro, in a savage display of violence and brutality in Wolverine #41. The deaths of Quentin and Akihiro deeply devastate Wolverine, as they were both important figures in his life, with Quentin being considered an adopted son and the relationship with Akihiro evolving from hatred to a loving father-son dynamic. The Sabretooth War, a 10-part event, marks the culmination of Wolverine’s ongoing rivalry with Sabretooth and promises to escalate into a violent and brutal showdown between the two feral fighters.

item.title: Wolverine Mentored a Surprising MCU Hero, Setting Up the Perfect Marvel Movie Connection
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYYelena Belova, Black Widow’s “sister,” looks up to Wolverine and takes his advice seriously, potentially setting up a connection between the X-Men and the MCU. In the White Widow comic series, Yelena has become an assassin consultant and mentor, using her skills to train the next generation while also fighting against a nefarious corporation. Yelena’s strong confidence, support for other women, and snarky personality could potentially tie the X-Men characters to the existing Avengers in future MCU films, especially with Deadpool 3 in production.

item.title: Wolverine Pushes His Healing Factor to the Limit with R-Rated Claws (Warning They re Extreme)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYAfter being tied up with adamantium coils, Wolverine removes his hands and feet to fight Sabretooth. Sabretooth’s new army have killed several of Wolverine’s children, and now he’s fighting to save his daughter Laura. Wolverine’s gory move confirms some major facts about his biology, while also setting up huge consequences like having his adamantium stolen. Literature ReviewAs Wolverine’s family fall one by one to a terrifying villain, Logan brutally exploits his healing factor to get his claws back in the fight.

item.title: Wolverine Reveals His Greatest Weapon as the Ultra-Bloody SABRETOOTH WAR Begins
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s greatest weapon against Sabretooth is patience, but it may not be enough to defeat him in the upcoming Sabretooth War. Wolverine is seemingly recruiting his son, Daken, to help him in his war against Sabretooth and his army. Building a team and practicing patience in delivering strikes at the perfect time may be the key to Wolverine winning the Sabretooth War. Literature ReviewWolverine has no shortage of weapons in his arsenal, especially when he’s fighting Sabretooth, and he’s finally revealing the greatest of them all.

item.title: Wolverine s Daughter Officially Faces Her R-Rated Opposite
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYMarvel’s ongoing “Sabretooth War” storyline reaches new levels, as different versions of Sabretooth unite to seek vengeance on Wolverine and those close to him. Laura Kinney, Wolverine’s clone daughter, will face off against “Savage Sabretooth” in a bloody battle where she must tap into her fierce skills and primal rage. The “Sabretooth War” is not a typical fight - it is a plot dismantle Wolverine’s life and strip him of everything he loves; having already cost the lives of several heroes close to him, Laura is now in incredible danger.

item.title: Wolverine s Healing Factor Is Powerless Against 1 MCU Villain, Marvel Officially Confirms
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s daughter Laura Kinney is killed by the High Evolutionary, proving that even Wolverine’s healing factor is no match for the villain’s godlike technology. Laura shares Wolverine’s healing, but she’s still killed with a gesture in X-Men #30. The death matches Wolverine’s limits as seen in other stories, and proves the High Evolutionary is way out of his league. Literature ReviewWhile Wolverine has survived for over a century thanks to his incredible healing factor, he’s not unbeatable - as a major MCU villain just proved.

item.title: Wolverine s Nemesis Gets New Codename to Honor His Unprecedented Upgrade
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine faces his prime nemesis, Sabretooth, and his army of multiversal variants in Wolverine #42. Sabretooth and his army, now collectively known as Sabreteeth, is as vicious as the name suggests and operates under his orders. Sabreteeth allows Sabretooth to be more cruel than ever before, posing a significant threat to mutantkind. Literature ReviewWolverine’s all-time greatest X-Men nemesis just got a new codename to match his unprecedented upgrade, making him more terrifying that he was before!

item.title: Wolverine s Son Was Just Brutally Killed Off in Marvel Canon
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s rival, Sabretooth, launches a brutal attack on Wolverine’s son, Akihiro, in the “Sabretooth War” story arc. This is not the first time Sabretooth has caused harm to Wolverine’s family, but the savagery of Akihiro’s death will have a lasting impact on Wolverine. Akihiro’s resurrection may be uncertain due to the Krakoan dream being shattered and the mutants’ Resurrection Protocols being offline, leaving Wolverine to deal with the tragedy.

item.title: Wolverine To Lead His Own Across The Spider-Verse Team of Variants
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine is getting his own multiverse adventure in a new miniseries, similar to Spider-Man’s Spider-Verse franchise. The upcoming series will feature multiple Wolverines from different dimensions teaming up to face a powerful enemy. The cover art reveals appearances from familiar Wolverine variants, as well as a brand-new character making her Marvel debut. Literature ReviewX-Men mainstay Wolverine is the latest Marvel character to get his own Across the Spider-Verse as he teams up with multiversal variants of himself.

item.title: Wolverine Unleashes His Ghost Rider Claws in Photo-Real Fanart
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine’s Ghost Rider claws are brought to life in stunning fanart, capturing the essence of his Hellverine form with intricate detail. The artwork pays homage to a visually striking storyline where Wolverine’s mutant abilities and Ghost Rider’s hellfire merged. A separate Wolverine fanart, inspired by Spider-Man Across the Spiderverse, showcases the love and dedication fans have for the character, reflecting his enduring impact. Literature ReviewA creative fan has brought to life the Weapons of Vengence storyline by recreating the iconic Ghost Rider and Wolverine mashup–Hellverine!

item.title: Wolverine vs Weapon VIII Proves Logan s Successor Had Objectively Better Claws
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWolverine faces off against the spider-themed Weapon VIII, getting brutally injured by their sharp limbs and flamethrower. Weapon VIII is the official debut of the mainstream Weapon Plus’ “greatest previous success” before Wolverine, equipped with deadly weapons and an Iron Spider costume. The story hints at future plans for Weapon VIII, as Marvel often connects beloved heroes and villains to the Weapon Plus program. Literature ReviewAs Wolverine takes on Weapon VIII, the Weapon X program’s biggest success lashes out with deadly claws, flamethrowers, and more.

item.title: Wonder Girl Cosplay Spotlights Titans Most Underrated Hero
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYJanine’s Wonder Girl cosplay pays tribute to Donna Troy’s classic red outfit, capturing the iconic gold stars and gold bracelets. Fans have responded enthusiastically to Janine’s cosplay, praising her authenticity and the impressive visual effects added by Ryan Sims. The vibrant portrayal of Donna Troy’s red costume serves as a compelling argument for DC to reintroduce it and infuse some freshness into Wonder Girl’s aesthetic. Literature ReviewWonder Girl Donna Troy’s classic Teen Titans red outfit makes a return in a stunning cosplay that is sure to leave fans’ jaws on the floor.

item.title: Wonder Woman Fanart Recreates Iconic DCEU Moment with Her Original Comic Costume
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYKerry Callen’s fanart of Wonder Woman’s iconic shield scene from the DCEU movie pays homage to the character’s first solo film in a clever and beautifully executed way. Callen’s classic comic art style and the use of Wonder Woman’s initial costume adds to the nostalgic charm of the piece, capturing the essence of the Golden Era of comics. The unique and timeless quality of Callen’s artwork has the potential to inspire a new viral art trend, where other artists reinterpret contemporary media scenes in their original comic-style form.

item.title: Wonder Woman Just Canonized Lynda Carter s Iconic 70s Transformation
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman’s iconic spin move costume change is officially part of her canon, as confirmed in a preview of Wonder Woman #6. The spin move was popularized by Lynda Carter in the 1977 Wonder Woman show and has become a well-known part of Wonder Woman’s history. The ongoing Wonder Woman series is honoring all aspects of her canon, including her original origin story, and the return of the spin move raises excitement about what else may come next for the character.

item.title: Wonder Woman Names the Biggest Culture Shock of Living in Man s World (That She Still Hates)
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman’s biggest culture shock in man’s world was experiencing Valentine’s Day for the first time, and she continues to hate it despite having years to adapt. Diana finds herself at the center of chaos on Valentine’s Day, often becoming the unintended target of others’ unwanted affections. It would be intriguing for DC to expand on Wonder Woman’s opinions regarding other holidays and cultural traditions of the world of men.

item.title: Wonder Woman s Best Battle Suit Returns in This Stunning Variant Cover
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman #8 features the return of her iconic Kingdom Come battle armor, which is considered her best costume. The creative team for this issue includes Tom King and Daniel Sempere, with a variant cover by Julian Totino Tedesco. The storyline involves Wonder Woman facing off against the Sovereign, a formidable foe on par with villains like the Joker or Lex Luthor. Literature ReviewA variant cover for the upcoming issue Wonder Woman #8 brings back Diana’s iconic gold armor, which was introduced on Earth-22 in Kingdom Come.

item.title: Wonder Woman s Brutal New Injury Is a Batman Callback 90s Fans Will Love
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman gets attacked by Big Barda, who nearly breaks her back in a move reminiscent of Batman’s iconic back-breaking in Knightfall. Unlike Batman, Wonder Woman quickly recovers and gets back up to continue fighting. This demonstrates Wonder Woman’s incredible strength and resilience, as she easily shakes off an attack that left Batman out of commission for months. Literature ReviewBatman and Wonder Woman have gone through some major injuries as superheroes, but Wonder Woman just experienced Batman’s greatest injury.

item.title: Wonder Woman s Daughter to Literally Change the Future in New Time Travel Tale
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTrinity’s time-traveling escapades will alter the future of the DC Universe. Superman Jon Kent, and Batman Damian Wayne will likely play important roles in the time-traveling tale. Trinity #8 holds the promise of bridging the gap between Lizzie’s storylines and Wonder Woman’s ongoing narrative, allowing Lizzie to make a substantial impact on the main continuity. Literature ReviewWonder Woman’s daughter, Trinity, will be changing the future of the DC Universe in an upcoming comic.

item.title: Wonder Woman s Most Heroic Trait Completely Separates Her from the Amazons
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman’s willingness to forgive sets her apart from the rest of the Amazons in Birds of Prey #5. The Amazons have been brutalized by Zealot and the Birds, and only Wonder Woman is likely to forgive them. Forgiveness is a consistent and heroic trait of Wonder Woman, although she can also tap into her more ruthless side as an Amazon. Literature ReviewWonder Woman holds a tight-knit relationship with her sisters among the Amazons, but one distinction in her character sets her apart even from them.

item.title: Wonder Woman s Most Underrated Villain Just Became Beast World s Deadliest Threat
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYGiganta steals the spotlight in Titans: Beast World #4 with her jaw-dropping metamorphosis into a colossal and lethal bear. Doris tries to help save Ivy Town but instead becomes its biggest threat. Giganta’s transformation into a giant bear wreaks havoc on Ivy Town, leading to significant casualties and property damage. Literature ReviewBlack Adam may be the King of the Jungle in his lion form, but one Wonder Woman villain just transformed into an infinitely bigger and deadlier beast.

item.title: Wonder Woman s New Daughter Trinity Is Adopted - DC Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTrinity, Wonder Woman’s daughter, may not be biologically related to Diana, raising the possibility that she is adopted. A revelation from Sarge Steel casts doubt on Trinity’s lineage, as it is revealed that Wonder Woman’s rival, Emelie, is potentially Trinity’s birth mother. Wonder Woman may be lying to Trinity about her true origins, possibly to protect her from a painful chapter in Amazonian history. Literature ReviewThe parentage of Wonder Woman’s future daughter Trinity comes into question when its hinted that another Amazon could be Elizabeth’s birth mother.

item.title: Wonder Woman s New Enemy Is Secretly Controlling Amanda Waller - Theory Explained
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYTheory: Amanda Waller is being manipulated by the Sovereign, Wonder Woman’s latest villain; alternatively, she could be working for, or alongside him to destroy the superhero community. In Titans: Beast World #4, Sargent Steel reveals the successful activation of the Bureau of Sovereignty, an agency committed to using lethal force against the threat of Garro and his spores, as the Beast World event continues to spiral out of control. Amanda Waller’s goal in the Beast World outbreak is to make superheroes feared by the public, showing similarities to the Sovereign’s manipulation of public opinion.

item.title: Wonder Woman s Regal New Costume Gives Fans a Glimpse into Her Future
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman’s new outfit and title in Trinity Special #1 offer a glimpse into the future of the Amazon Princess. In the story Mothers and Daughters , Wonder Woman is depicted as a regal queen, marking a significant shift in her role. Wonder Woman’s new title raises questions about the fate of the current Queen of the Amazons, Nubia, and what has happened to her. Literature ReviewTom King has treated fans to a glimpse of Wonder Woman’s future, including a new outfit and title that will forever alter Diana Prince’s character.

item.title: Wonder Woman s Secret Failsafe Makes Superman Seem Even More Dangerous
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYSuperman’s natural strength makes him dangerous when possessed, highlighting the true danger he poses to the innocent people of the DC Universe. A possessed Wonder Woman is not as powerful as a Wonder Woman with her full mental faculties intact. Wonder Woman’s skill and willpower make her a tougher nut to crack when possessed, compared to Superman. Literature ReviewOne of the biggest thing that separates Wonder Woman from Superman is that the former has a secret and foolproof failsafe that wards off possession.

item.title: Wonder Woman s Son with the Evil Superman Unlocked a New Kryptonian Power
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYZod, the son of Wonder Woman and the Justice Lord Superman, is a powerful Kryptonian/Amazonian hybrid with the ability to control Kryptonian technology. Zod’s control of Kryptonian tech is so strong that he can use it from within the Phantom Zone, a prison dimension that nullifies most superpowers. This version of Zod has the potential to be as heroic as his mother, Wonder Woman, and is even more powerful than Superman himself.

item.title: Wonder Woman s Worst Nightmare Is the Last DC Hero Anyone Would Expect
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYThe Amazons are in trouble as they are banned from American soil and targeted by Peacemaker. Peacemaker may not seem like a major threat to the Amazons, but with the backing of Amanda Waller and new anti-Amazon weaponry, he becomes more dangerous. Wonder Woman and the Amazons must fight to protect themselves and their sisters from Peacemaker’s deadly intentions. Literature ReviewWonder Woman and the Amazons have enough on their plate to worry about, now they’re about to face off with Peacemaker and his deadly new weaponry.

item.title: Wonder Woman vs Shazam DC Finally Settles Who s Actually Stronger
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman’s recent arm-wrestling match against Wonder Girl proves that she is stronger, even without the aid of Zeus’ power. Wonder Woman’s power level surpasses that of Shazam, despite his gifts from the gods. While an arm-wrestling match may not be the definitive test of their abilities, this showdown suggests that Wonder Woman would likely defeat Shazam. Literature ReviewWhen Wonder Woman is challenged to a show of strength, she accidentally proves how a fight between her the the magical hero Shazam would go.

item.title: Wonder Woman vs. [SPOILER] Is DC s Most Thrilling Justice League Fight in Years
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYBig Barda vs. Wonder Woman in DC’s Birds of Prey is an epic battle that is considered one of the best fight scenes of 2023. Big Barda rises to the challenge and dominates the fight with Wonder Woman until Diana delivers a massive punch that turns the tide. Big Barda’s impressive performance in the fight suggests she could be a worthy successor to Wonder Woman and deserves recognition for pushing Diana to her limits.

item.title: Wonder Woman, Power Girl, Poison Ivy DC s Iconic Women Reshaped the DC Universe in 2023
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYDC Comics has made a commitment to centering women in leading and co-leading roles throughout the DC Universe. In 2023, there was a significant emphasis on female characters in major team and solo books, even in books with men in leading roles. Many of the titles featuring female characters will continue to play major roles in the DCU in 2024, with Wonder Woman’s story just beginning to take shape.

item.title: Wonder Womans Controversial ‘90s Biker Costume Returns in Official Art
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWonder Woman #7 features Diana’s controversial ’90s biker outfit as a variant cover, leaving fans questioning if it will appear in the comic’s storyline. The revival of Wonder Woman’s biker outfit sparks discussions about its historical significance and potential impact on the character’s modern storyline. The biker look is better suited for Wonder Girl Donna Troy, as it aligns better with her personal style. Literature ReviewDiana Prince’s bold and controversial ’90s biker outfit makes a powerful comeback in official variant cover art for an upcoming Wonder Woman comic.

item.title: Worf and Deanna Troi s Romance Almost Ended in a Shocking Murder
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
item.description: SUMMARYWorf and Troi’s romance was controversial and poorly-received by fans in the Star Trek universe. In the alternate timeline of Star Trek: The Lost Generation, Worf kills Troi, who had been secretly working for the rebellion. Their relationship in the prime timeline had its share of struggles, but all traces of love are gone in this alternate timeline, replaced by lust and envy, leading to murder. Literature ReviewWorf and Troi’s relationship was never popular with Star Trek fans, and in an alternate timeline, it ended in cold-blooded murder.

item.title: Worf vs Sulu Shouldn t Be One of Star Trek s Coolest Fights - & Yet It Absolutely Is
item.author: orangemonkey001@outlook (Ella)
